Basically, you can walk over to the parking lot, hop on a free bus and get dropped off in front of the parks. Likewise, you would take the same bus to get back to the hotel ‚Äî no charge.

Such a nice hotel, with great staff. Also within walking distance to Disney and lots of restaurants.  Always love staying here. And Hyatt staff are the absolute best! Breakfast had enough options for everyone. Piol and hot tub were a nice bonus.

Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was included in our stay which was very nice as well as 2 free bottles of water per day.  Close walking distance to Disneyland as well as the Shuttle bus. Would definitely recommend staying here

This is a little older hotel but it was very nice and comfortable. It was clean and we slept well. The walls were not very soundproof so we could hear the people next door yelling at their kids early in the morning. However breakfast was good and the check in and out were easy. There is a high parking fee and a bit of a musty smell but it smelled like the Pirates of the Caribbean Ride so we didn‚Äôt mind. Overall I liked this hotel and I would stay there again.

Summary Heading: Michelle your the best! From my kids
Summary: Nice clean and family friendly. It was a wonderful experience that my kids and I had. Great staff like Michelle, she is a nice, kind and a humble person. She went out her way to accommodate us to the fullest. We need more people like her. Thank you so much for the wonderful experience and God bless you.

I stayed here for my Birthday celebration to the Disneyland parks. The walking distance to Toy Story parking is literally a 3-5min walk. The walk to the park was not bad at all. For sure less than 15-20min. I did stop and grab coffee. My room was spacious and very comfortable. The front desk was always pleasant whenever I needed or asked for anything. I‚Äôd definitely stay here again in the future if I am ever in the Anaheim area for anything!

The person that checked us in at the front desk was severely incompetent. He first told me that I didn‚Äôt have a reservation, then when I gave him my Conformation code he said I only had 1 room (instead of 2), which was wrong and he kept trying to make me feel like I was wrong. Then when he finally found the other room he gave us both room keys that didn‚Äôt work.  Then when we came back to get working room keys he was on a 30 minute break and there was no one there to help us. This was the worst check In experience of my life.

Wonderful stay! Friendly staff, clean rooms, and wonderful breakfast. It is a quick 6 minute walk to Toy Story parking lot to take a free shuttle to Disneyland. Highly recommend this beautiful hotel for a family stay.

Summary Heading: Not the best experience at all
Summary: 1- I had a working desk in the room, but there was only a dim spot light in the room were I couldn‚Äôt even work. A table lamp would be a great simple idea.  2- The swimming pool‚Äôs location and cleanliness, not what I expect from a ‚ÄúHyatt‚Äù hotel.   3- Room service walks into your room without even knocking the door?  4- There is no mini-bar? To get water bottles, you need to take the elevator to the front desk to get your ‚Äútwo‚Äù complimentary water bottles a day/room. Calling the operator didn‚Äôt help because they were not picking up the phone.  5- As a loyal member of the (World of Hyatt), they made me pay $27/day for parking throughout my stay. Worth to mention that all my previous stays in other Hyatt hotels, parking fees were waived in respect for my loyalty to the Hyatt.   6-

Summary Heading: Large rooms, great breakfast, good value, nice pool, hot jacuzzi, friendly staff
Summary: Large rooms, great breakfast, good value, nice pool, hot jacuzzi, friendly staff, no noise, good sleep, nice confortable beds. Everything seemed perfect. Five minute walk to Disneyland's Toy Story parking lot, to take shuttle to Disneyland. Uber to Disneyland was just $10.

Summary Heading: This took me far too long to review.
Summary: We visited Disneyland June of 2021 when covid restrictions were still in place. Things were a bit chaotic to say the least but KEN that worked the front desk at night was hands down the best part of our stay! He handled all our requests, made our stay as relaxing as it could be, worked the desk better by himself than I saw 3 workers running around like chickens with their heads cut off on the day we checked in. Uber and Lyft were scarce and expensive yet he booked us a pick up and ride to LAX the night before we checked out. KEN is the reason I would stay here again!

Great for families and parents that want a semi-separate room (pocket doors in between). Walking distance to Disneyland parking too (saves $ on parking)! Close to restaurants. The bunk beds are great for kiddos with an extra pull out bed (we didn‚Äôt use it) however there should be a light over the desk.

Room was clean and neat.  Bathroom was less than clean: gnats flying around, clumps of hair in the towels.  The complimentary breakfast was stellar!  The gym was very clean and nice!  Hallways and elevator seemed worn and old.  The parking was confusing and paying separately was odd!

Summary Heading: A great value and location place to stay
Summary: Would recommend this hotel for any one as the hotel was clean and easily accessible with very spacious rooms and comfortable bed.   The only thing I could recommend is a upgrade of the shower as water pressure was not great but overall the room was clean, the water was hot and the location to Disney is a easy walk.   Oh and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

Very friendly staff, clean, comfy bed & free good breakfast included I would definitely choose Hyatt Hotel again it's also very convenient it's about 1 mile away from Disneyland you can even walk there

Very nice and clean place to stay excelente service and delicious breakfast I definitely highly recommend this place For family or business  The location is perfect for have fun in Disney and the staff is super friendly  Everything is there stores pharmacy freeways restaurants and easy to go to the LAX

Will recommend !!!  Clean rooms, accommodating staff, close to everything!! Can walk around the area. Close to food, establishment. Parking a little  expensive but safe!! Will definitely come back!! Visit the hotel

This is my second time coming for a Disneyland trip and it did not disappoint! I will be coming back again for my next Disney trip. Great location, clean rooms, amazing breakfast that‚Äôs included with your stay puts the icing on the cake. Not to mention the amazing staff, especially Jessica from the front desk. She made sure that my mom and I enjoyed our stay. Thank you Jessica!

Summary Heading: Convenient location but no cleaning of rooms during your stay
Summary: I‚Äôm rating this a one star because as we checked in they told us that there is no daily cleaning for the length of our stay. They mentioned COVID as the reason but no one is wearing masks anymore here, so don‚Äôt understand the reasoning behind this. I‚Äôm looking to move to another hotel that does daily cleaning.

Stayed one night at this hotel before we switched to a Disneyland hotel. It was a very nice stay, with helpful staff, clean rooms and about a mile walk from Disneyland. Would recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of staying in this area of Anaheim

Staff was very nice during the visit. The room was perfect for 5 people. Everything was clean. Only real problem was there were water issues during our stay but that was not the hotels fault the city seems to be having water problems.

The Hyatt Place hotel was just down the street from Disneyland. It was easy to take the parking lot tram and then walk across the street. The room was roomy and very clean. The staff were efficient and friendly. We wish their breakfast hours were a bit later until at least 9:30 or 10. The parking is also quite expensive.

Excellent employee service friendly helpful  Clean modern rooms  Spacious sleeping area & bathroom  Delicious breakfast & coffee  Great location  Always my first choice in hotels Highly recommend for families

I was there almost 1 week and everyone was so friendly and nice.  Room was clean and neat, clean bathroom.      Breakfast was nice and lobby always clean.  Easy walking distance to the Anaheim Convention Center as well as Disney.  Many nice restaurants in area.  Easy access to other areas of LA, Hollywood, etc. if needed.  Adequate parking and Walgreens/CVS for any small things you may need.

Price was low and needed the nights for credit so booked a room with hesitation. Front desk seemed aloof and non helpful at first when asking about room locations. She was giving very nondescript and evasive answers. Checkin took more 40 mins.   Rooms and beds were large and comfortable. Each floor was  key carded. Breakfast was good. Garage on basement floor was large and clean. Entry to parking lot and lower garage parking was key carded. Each night they walk the garage making sure you had a current pass in your window. They will leave a note on your car with possible tow if you have not  paid or charged parking to your room. This is good as it actually leaves ample space for guests of the hotel.   The entry to hotel is off Harbor and right behind the Clarion. The web stated

A clean and comfortable room at a reasonable price. The hotel is just about one mile from the entrance to Disneyland. The bed was comfortable and the hotel was quiet, so we got a good night‚Äôs sleep. They offered us free breakfast and 2 free bottles of water. Parking is on the lower level, so it was easy to get from our car to our room.

Everything was great, except the room above us was extremely loud all night banging / jumping up and down. Location to Disneyland was great, used the Disney shuttle service parking lot directing across from the hotel at no cost.

Super close to the park, we walked 5 min to toy story parking lot and then took the free bus. Awesome  people at front desk.  Food was super good  My family enjoyed the stay. They provide FREE water every day !!!!!

The staff were friendly and the hotel is located about 2 blocks from the Toy Story Shuttle that drops you off at the Disneyland entrance. It was convenient to have breakfast included.  The room was clean, but housekeeping was not included for the three nights we were there. I did not like that my floors were never vacuumed, and I loathe dirty floors. At the price charged, I would expect at least some housekeeping services. That is the one thing that may keep me from staying there in the future.

The room was clean and the staff was very helpful... the breakfast was nasty and a very limited selection..  be aware that parking is $30 a night... I enjoyed my stay I would consider staying again ...  I would‚Äôve given the hotel four stars if breakfast was more enjoyable

Thought my stay was going to be great! It was far from that. Check in problem and room problem. They said no manager on duty. My son and I suffered but called the 800 number for customer service and they helped me and understood me. Thank you

A very busy place with a mix of business and vacation clientele but staff kept it cleaned and were very professional in all their interactions with us. If we were to return to the area this would be our choice of hotel.

We were in a road trip and stopped and stayed at this wonderful establishment. It was so nice the staff was great and I felt safe and taken care of. I highly recommend staying at the Hyatt Place! You won‚Äôt regret it!

Summary Heading: Perfect when on a budget, but a bit of a walk
Summary: We were a party of 4 in a standard room. Hotel was clean, staff had excellent customer service, the place felt safe  and there was a small breakfast buffet in the mornings. They have pay to use shuttles, but with what little budget we had after booking, walking was our goto. The walk is a bit far from the Disney parks, about 15-20 minute walk. Not horrible, but after a long day it can feel quite far. If you're tired, expect the longer walk time.   You can also keep your car parked till midnight on the day you checked out. Which was great! We checked out before noon, and left the car till our leaving time of 3pm with no worries.   Overall, the hotel was amazing, and given the chance I would definitely stay here again.

Had a great stay for a quick Disneyland trip. Love the friendly welcoming staff, breakfast was really good as well. Clean rooms and amenities. Thank you Gigi and Denise at the front desk for great customer service.

Stayed here for 2 nights in April for a Disneyland trip. The room was very clean and in good condition. We spent very little in the room, but it was spacious and we had plenty of room to spread out. The hotel was also pretty quiet. It's a little over a mile to Disneyland, straight up the street-an easy walk-although definitely felt considerably longer and painful on the way back!  Parking was  $26/night and underground. Not cheap but expected for the area.

Summary Heading: VERY Clean room, free breakfast included
Summary: The rooms were impressively clean. We are very picky with the cleanliness of a hotel and it was noticeably cleaner than other hotels we have stayed at in the past.   Free breakfast is included. You can quickly run downstairs, grab food, and start your plants for the day. The IHOP down the street had a line out the door so that would have taken much more time and money to have breakfast.   The hotel is walking distance to Disneyland, about 1 mile away. On the way back, we took the toy story shuttle to the parking lot across the street and walked the rest of the way to the hotel. This was only  a 0.5 mile walk.   I was surprised how quiet the hotel was. I was expecting a lot of kids making noise since it's close to Disneyland

This place was great. We got a double queen with a pullout. Plenty of room for me, my wife, and two teen children. It was walking distance to Wondercon at the convention center and Disneyland.  The hotel was clean and quiet. The staff was knowledgeable and courteous. The restrooms were clean and looked to be renovated.  There was a basic continental breakfast included. I will be staying here again. Would recommend.

After having a horrible overnight stay at another Hyatt location in Cypress, this location at the Anaheim Convention Center was super clean and relaxing. As a long time Hyatt member that is what‚Äôs expected! The two queen bedroom plus living room was enough space for myself and 3 little ones. Clean, spotless and updated. Had a slight issue with paying for early check-in because they overbooked but the issue was resolved by the wonderful staff. All the staff on our 3 night stay was delightful! Breakfast was good, nice options for free. Plus the free Disneyland shuttle was the cherry on top, very safe at night! Booked another room for SneakerCon in May. Thanks staff!!!

We came for Disney and booked two rooms. Everything was so clean and the staff was absolutely amazing. The pool was clean. The food was good and there was plenty of space to sit and eat. We will be booking again for our next family trip. It‚Äôs a 20 minutes walk to Disney but it also provides a free bus that‚Äôs within walking distance.

Summary Heading: Blanket is yellowish, not clean and wear out
Summary: When we arrived, we noticed the beds are not tidy up nicely per hotel standard. Furthermore, the blankets/comforter are not clean. I always think hyatt is a quality  brand like marriott . But after this incident, very disappointed.  Our 3 days stay was not comfortable.

It was close to the Toy Story lot. Complimentary breakfast was perfect. Rooms were great. Staff was very nice and helpful. Ihad a room with 2 queens and a sofa bed. It fit my family of 6 comfortably. Will stay again.

This is our fourth stay at Hyatt Place and we have been very happy with the quality of the rooms, and the excellent staff. Everything felt clean and safe during the height of COVID with single family group in the elevators and relaxed appropriately now.

This is a basic hotel with basic necessities. It was clean and decent. Breakfast was basic as well, but enough. You have to pay for parking a daily rate of $26. Receptionists we‚Äôre very pleasant. Toiletries for a family suite are a joke really.

Summary Heading: Quality Property Near Highways, Attractions, Restaurants and Shopping
Summary: This is one of the better Hyatt properties I've stayed at in California.  The staff is friendly, grounds are clean, rooms are clean and comfortable, and most of all I feel safe there.  Parking is $26 nightly, but all of the Disneyland area major chain hotels charge for parking.  There is a complimentary breakfast with a variety of choices, and free WiFi.  The hotel is just down the street from Disneyland, near many restaurants, easy highway access, and near shopping.  I travel extensively for business, and I will stay here again. This hotel is family and business traveler friendly.

Experience at this hotel was fantastic. The hotel is very clean and new feeling and the staff was all wonderful. Michelle from the front desk was especially nice and really helpful throughout my stay. The one request I had from housekeeping was taken care of right away as well. You also can‚Äôt beat the location it‚Äôs a quick walk or bus / Uber ride to Disneyland and right by the convention center. I‚Äôll definitely stay again when I come back to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Great visit! Close to the Toy Story parking lot!
Summary: Loved our stay here. Staff was super friendly and everything was clean! Breakfast was decent (pancakes and eggs one day, tater tots and eggs another day).   For families, the only bad part is there is no microwave in the rooms. Also, the bar is nice but only bottled beers are served.   Parking is $29 a night.   Overall, we would definitely stay here again!

Free Breakfast time was a zoo. I got charged parking when I had no car. Refrigerator was broken. No microwave in my room.  The free shuttle to Disneyland was far.  Better to Uber.  I had to wait 45 minutes to get toilet paper.

Nice and clean. Got what was promised. 2 details, they didn‚Äôt clean the room between nights( but I guess thats the norm) and breakfast picks up too early at 9am promptly.  As far as the employees they were all courteous and helpful, kudos to them

I am a business traveler and prefer staying at the Hyatt hotels. This location is conveniently located in the heart of Anaheim near restaurants, shopping, and of course Disneyland. There are many hotels in the area to choose from but Hyatt continues delivering top-notch customer service and comfortable accommodations. This location is conveniently close to the highway, and just down the street from Disneyland. Parking is $26 nightly, and there is free WiFi and free breakfast.  Friendly staff and it‚Äôs a clean hotel.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, Short Walk to Disney Shuttle Buses
Summary: We love this hotel. It's always clean, the staff is very friendly and professional, and the breakfast is a great way to start the day. They also serve Starbucks coffee at the bar next to the breakfast area, so if you need an iced latte in the morning you don't have to go searching. We usually walk to the parks in the morning and ride the Disney shuttle buses back to the Toy Story parking lot, which is then just a short walk back to the hotel.

There were 24 people in our group in 12 rooms checking in the hotel at the same time on one credit card.  The front desk personnel (Michelle) was very helpful and efficient.  She handled the 22 college students and my staff with grace and professionalism.  Kudos to Michelle and the Hyatt Place for accommodating our group.

Pleased with our stay. Check in was smooth. Super close to the Toy Story parking lot with access to shuttles so found it easier to just park at the hotel and walk to the parking lot. Our room was clean and big for our big family.   Everyone was super welcoming.

The hotel was perfect for our Spring Break stay while visiting Disneyland.   PROS -We walked right across the street to catch the Toy Story bus to the parks which was very convenient  -our room fit our family of five perfectly (my 9 and 7 year old said the pull out couch was comfy) -The room was clean and black out curtain was really nice to have -Breakfast each morning was a great start to the day (Either pancakes/waffles/tater tots with eggs and sausage. Bananas/Oranges. Three kinds of cereal. Toast with cream cheese, jelly, peanut butter. Orange or Apple juice, milk, coffee.)  -If you are a Hyatt member you get two complimentary bottles of water each day so that was really nice. - The entire hotel staff were kind and quick to resolve any questions or needs we had during our

It‚Äôs been a few years since we‚Äôve stayed at Hyatt Place, but it‚Äôs just as great as I remembered. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and spacious. Staff is always friendly and helpful. I know that I‚Äôll never go wrong booking a stay at a Hyatt hotel.

Great hotel. Very clean and pleasant. Breakfast was not as good as it used to be.  Basically just cereal and sausage and eggs. Eggs were not that good. They used to have yogurt and fruit and oatmeal. Otherwise everything was perfect.

Great staff. Super friendly. Walking distance to Disneyland and restaurants. Price is fair. I‚Äôll stay again. Free continental breakfast in the morning is convenient for families that want something fast before you get your day started.

This is our third time staying at the Hyatt Pl., Hotel Anaheim. Our family loves to frequent Disneyland and this is one of our favorite places to stay. The service is very good and employees are very nice. The warm breakfast in the morning is very nice for a long day.

This is a great hotel!  Convenient to the Disneyland parks, clean, staff was super friendly and kind, breakfast was a great addition.  We didn't use the pool but it looked very nice.  Should we ever go back to the area we would stay again.

Overall the hotel was clean and well maintained. Be prepared to pay about $30 per night for parking. The pool is shallow, about 4 feet at the deepest, so it's good for non-swimmers. Covid restrictions at this time limited daily room servicing to once every three days, unless you called for something special.

We are season pass holders and usually stay a night or two when we visit Disney. We typically stay at the Hyatt House closer to Disneyland but chose to try the Hyatt Place and save a little money. Everyone was friendly and location was clean. It is a little bit of a walk. Took us 25 mins to walk from the hotel to the gate. Breakfast was pretty mediocre and limited. Definitely more choices at the Hyatt House. It was also more congested in the breakfast area in comparison. It was fine for the night.

The staff was very helpful and kind. We were greeted promptly and answer any questions that we have about the shuttle service to Disneyland. Disneyland was very close in several restaurants nearby which me and R stay even nicer.Your staff is top notch. Would definitely recommend 100%

Summary Heading: Super convenient to the Anaheim Convention Center
Summary: Super convenient location of the hotel. We were here at the time of Expo West when traffic as well parking is a nightmare at/around the convention center. This hotel was literally a 8 minute walk to the convention center. Besides it also has several dining options within a walkable distance.

The staff was courteous, friendly and very accommodating. Want to give a shout out to Denise for her awesome customer service. If you are planning a trip to Disneyland, great place to stay. Rooms were clean, houskeeping readily available if you needed something, and went the extra mile to help you find whatever it was you were looking for,

They charge an extra $50 a day service fee when you check in (that is on top of what you already paid for the hotel) plus $30 a day in parking.  A travel agent booked our stay, on the picture when she booked the room it had a picture of 2 sets of bunk beds (4 kid beds), on the hotel stay it said 2 bunk beds (which made us think 4 beds because a bunk bed is 2 beds) When we arrived there was just one bunk bed. She told us they didn't have a room with 2 sets.   We were told the room would be cleaned after 2 days but then when we asked for the service on day 2 they told us they wouldn't come in until day 3.  They said they would at least bring us towel and that didn't happen.   Grungy water was coming up in our sink when we were not using the sink, the pipe under the sink leaked all

The hotel is a pretty location for a Disneyland walk. But for the amount of money spent, I would not stay here again. Kids were running around and screaming all hours of the night. The elevator is incredibly loud and slow. No water pressure in the shower and shower tile was not not clean.

Needs improvements with room cleanliness, It was no attention to detail, breakfast was mediocre. The parking charge was a bit too much, I know you must make money, but you are already charging peoples for the rooms don't over do it in the parking.

We‚Äôre from the Midwest, but grew up in California and love to visit Disneyland. This was our first time at a Hyatt and we were very impressed with this hotel. Staff was extremely friendly, we were quickly given amenities when we asked for them, it was clean and comfortable, and the breakfast was great! It‚Äôs also walking distance to the parks, which was critical as we didn‚Äôt bring a car.

Summary Heading: Staff is awesome, breakfast is disappointing
Summary: We stayed for 5 nights. The staff was fantastic and helpful. The rooms were nice but the bed was too hard for my taste. The breakfast was bland and didn‚Äôt change the whole time we were there. It was very disappointing.

Great place for a family trip stay when visiting Disneyland. The staff is friendly, the hotel is clean and safe, and the breakfast is great. The hotel itself is about a ten-minute walk to the free Disney shuttle at the Toy Story parking lot. It's also convenient to the ART bus.

The friendliest staff, super accommodating. Clean rooms and amazing stay.   I think the friendly staff just topped off the whole trip. We had a few issues and the staff accommodated us. Asked multiple questions and they were super patient!! Will def recommend and come back!!

Summary Heading: Loved this hotel. Super nice staff. Clean hotel and rooms
Summary: This hotel was great. We usually stay at a different hotel but decided to try this one for this Disney visit. The walk was about 15 minutes. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Rooms were clean. Breakfast was good! Overall, would highly recommend and stay again for our next Disney stay

This is an amazing hotel!!  The staff was super helpful and welcoming!  I called ahead and mentioned we were celebrating my daughter's birthday and there were balloons and goodies in the room when we arrived.   It's an easy walk to the free ToyStory bus pickup for Disneyland.  If you have an electric scooter,  it's an easy ride directly to the park.   Some people walked directly to the park,  but considering how much walking you do at the park,  that walk  might be a bit far.  We rented an electric scooter and it was waiting for us at the hotel when we arrived.   The hotel staff took care of delivery and return for us.   They also accepted grocery delivery for us one day when we had not made it back from the park yet.   The rooms were clean and spacious.   The breakfast was

We have stayed there a few times in the past few years.  It is always welcoming, clean, and a convenient place to stay when visiting the convention center.  The breakfast buffet is currently more of a grab and go style but  still lots of options including hot food.

It was just okay. We were not able to check in till 5:30 pm. Breakfast was very disappointing. Very minimal with lack of variety for kids. We like to load the kids up with a big breakfast before going into Disneyland but there was not a lot of good options for them. Our last 2 visits we stayed at Hyatt house but decided to try Hyatt place because it‚Äôs cheaper and we never really used the kitchen. We were much happier with Hyatt House over all. Breakfast options were much better. Location was much better. And rooms were much more spacious.

Clean, renewed and very comfortable hotel. We travel to Disneyland with our kids and the hotel was very near by the toy story parking so we just walked trough and got the disney bus. Highly recommended.

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel and excellent staff. Everything was super clean. Upon arrival, the staff was very kind and professional.
Summary: Everything was in excellent condition. So close to Disneyland, just walking distance to the Disneyland bus location. Highly recommend this hotel! The beds were very comfortable and the couch also turns out into a bed.

Great location near Disneyland.  You can walk there but we scheduled ride shares. The in/out privileges for parking was great, which we utilized many times.  VERY friendly staff.  Everything was clean and we had a great stay.  The breakfast just looked okay.

My family and I went on a Disney trip and spent one night in a king/bunkbed room.  The room is very clean and had a sliding door between the king and the bunk beds. The beds were very comfortable and cozy.  There was a TV in each section of the room so everyone was happy. I was a little disappointed with their breakfast, crumbly scrambled eggs,  tater tots, and sausages that all looked and tasted microwaved. This aside,  I would stay here again because it was quiet, guest service was friendly, and all of us got a peaceful nights rest.

This Hyatt Place is easy for Disneyland. There is a shuttle across the street but we found Uber to be easy and $10 trip each way. The front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was a little light on offerings compared to other Hyatt properties. However the breakfast was good and easy for grabbing a quick meal before heading to the resort. We would gladly stay here again.

Highly recommend great location and the  ladies are wonderful at the front desk!!! It seems they search for ways to make your stay better intentionally and it really is a great feeling.  Great value!! Hotel was very clean. Lobby and halls- outstanding. Even the restrooms in the lobby was super clean.

My boyfriend and I celebrated Valentine‚Äôs day at the Hyatt Place. The staff and room exceeded our expectations. A great hotel if you‚Äôre visiting Disneyland too. The Pho spot and Joe‚Äôs Ice are down the street too.

Gave us the wrong room, my kids walked into someone else‚Äôs room with people inside. Wasnt expecting this after a very long day of driving. Talked to the manager and they played it down like its nothing, had to contact hyatt corporate.

I stayed here (and had) an excellent vacation. I returned home without realizing I left my passport and other identification in the room. The staff found my items, called me, and returned them. I am extremely happy with the staff and hotel!

Stayed here for four nights during our recent trip to Disneyland. Was concerned when I realized we were on the ground floor right on Harbor but quickly shocked how well the noise insulation was. We could barely hear anything. Not from neighbors, and certainly not from the street that was just right  outside our window.   Room is good sized and couch is nice. Bathroom bright and clean. The only thing that could be improved is breakfast, but it certainly wasn‚Äôt terrible. Employees were great.

Very nice hotel. Walking distance to Disneyland about 15 minutes or you can take the bus across the street from the hotel. Limited breakfast because if the covid but very good nevertheless, enough to get you going in the morning and all the ladies and young men working the breakfast room were A+. The last night we were there we had very loud neighbors till 12:30 AM, had a connecting room and door with poor soundproofing. No room cleaning because of covid. Room very spacious and bed was very comfy.

The front desk staff was not friendly and the bathroom smelled of old mildewed towels. The hotel was extremely close to Disneyland and was super convenient for our stay. However, there are cheaper hotels that are the same distance that have far better customer service and nicer rooms.

Summary Heading: Nice, clean and spacious rooms close to parks
Summary: We enjoyed our recent stay at Hyatt Place. We used ART to get to and from the parks. It was so convenient and worth getting the day pass to get us around. The staff is very friendly and helpful and responded quickly to our needs. We would definitely stay again. The room was comfortable and spacious.

It was my first time staying at a Hyatt Hotel and Hyatt Place did not disappoint! My room was on a high floor. The room was very clean and airy. Also a nice view of the area from my window with shade. Breakfast was good and close to major restaurants, shopping, and Disneyland. Would love to stay here again if I ever come back to Anaheim.

Much needed family vacation! Absolutely love this hotel! The staff was all very friendly & helped us with whatever we needed. The room was clean & very spacious for my family! Definitely would stay here again!

Hotel is in great location. Right across from Toy Story lot with shuttle. Staff was super kind and housekeeping went out of their way to help us when my daughter was sick. Very pleased. Recommend and will stay again. We had a room with bunk beds that worked perfect

Summary Heading: Decent stay, unfriendly staff, poor check in & parking experience
Summary: This hotel is fine - it‚Äôs clean, close enough to Disney to walk.  But because it‚Äôs next to Disney, you‚Äôll be woken by kids screaming in the hallways in the early morning. The breakfast is a nice gesture, but much of it is inedible - other than the bananas, toast, and coffee. I‚Äôm not even sure how one would make such intentionally rubbery eggs - lol. The service here is not up to the Hyatt standard - I felt unwelcome by the front desk staff which made for an uncomfortable stay, even as a Hyatt Globalist. Michele and Jessica - avoid them at all costs; so rude! This hotel has potential, but the service is very lacking - I had to follow up several times to get them to respond to my texts about issues during my stay. Also, after check in, you must go back down to your car to put a

My stay last week was amazing, from the great greeting by Michele at the front desk to the multiple status checks by Richard, the Manager, to ascertain if we needed anything. Richard and his staff also had a gift basket delivered upon arrived which included a bottle of wine and snacks, great touch guys!!!! Also the Front Desk Supervisor, Melisa was awesome, putting up with me changing my reservation multiple times. This was by far the best experience I have had at a Hyatt property in a long time. Great job Michele, Richard, & Melissa and the rest of your team! See you soon!

The entire staff was fantastic. The room was very clean which post Covid is not a given. A special shout out to Michelle who went above and beyond. The proximity to the Disney bus is also a huge plus.

Summary Heading: Good location, friendly staff and overall great hotel
Summary: For the cost, I considered our 3-room stay a good value.  The staff was very friendly and check in was easy.  The hotel is clean and comfortable.  The only drawback: the selection at the complimentary breakfast was scarce.  Please bring back the oatmeal and yogurt.  And leave the coffee and hot tea station open until noon or bring back at early eve.  Overall, I would recommend to friends and family and stay again.

It was not consumer friendly. Checking in was a pain. I was not told that I had to call down for towels and cleanup. No trash bags in trash cans. I was double charged and still HAVE NOT SEEN THE CREDIT. I was comped parking but was still charged. I decided to stay an extra day and it didn't get better. You can call me for more details. Your staff was pleasant and calming. The only reason I stayed there was because the club teams were staying there. I might encourage them to try another hotel. We usually book 40 to 45 rooms.

My husband and I stayed at Hyatt Place while my son was playing in a volleyball tournament at the Anaheim convention center. The hotel was very clean and rooms were spacious. We loved the little separate living room area. Great location as it was easy to walk to the Convention Center.

Summary Heading: Rated 4 star but was a 1 star experience
Summary: First room assignment was occupied with another guests personal items, second room wasn‚Äôt clean. Hair in the shower type of stuff. Put in a special needs room even though not special needs- Not the described view and experience thought I was paying for. Location near Disneyland but go elsewhere.

The Hyatt place, Anaheim is FANTASTIC!  The staff is beyond accommodating!  Especially Richard, the Assistant GM and Michelle, the General Manager. They both went above and beyond to accommodate an early check in and late check out, due to my work schedule. I arrived just on time for their Covid friendly breakfast buffet. I must say that it was the best I‚Äôve seen and I travel 4-5 days a week, all over the United States for work. When I arrived to my room, Richard and Michelle made me feel so special with a lovely , HAND WRITTEN NOTE along with a very thoughtful basket of goodies. The room itself was immaculate! Not a flick of dust or an area that wasn‚Äôt noticeably sanitized. Now let‚Äôs talk about the bed. It may have been the most comfortable hotel bed I‚Äôve slept in.  It was

We love that all the rooms have a pullout bed option which easily allows 5-6 people to stay in them. The breakfast is complimentary and very good. The ladies at the desk were very sweet and helpful! I wish they had a working shuttle like most Hyatts offer but hopefully that will change soon!

Avoid this hotel. The rooms were clean and the staff was nice enough but the breakfast was horrible. The food was always cold and there was no variety whatsoever. It is pretty close to Disneyland which is why we went.

Summary Heading: Hyatt is my hotel of choice.
Summary: Wherever I travel. I always look for any Hyatt hotels first. I‚Äôve been to three Hyatt locations so far and each one has their own unique perks to them with their wonderful staff and environment but I still feel welcomed and ‚Äúat home‚Äù no matter where I stay.

Our room was lovely and spacious and very comfortable. Hyatt beds are about the most comfortable I have ever slept in. I appreciated that they are still serving a hot breakfast. My only complaints are really minor, but for the record, they are:  1. We understood that we could request housekeeping after 2 days. We didn't really want it, but they came in anyway, made up the beds, etc . I wish we had requested that they NOT come in, since we were not expecting it. I did like the fresh towels, but having someone come in and touch my stuff always feels a little creepy to me.  2. Hyatt seems to have a policy of not using trash bags in their waste baskets. Perhaps this is an economical and ecological issue, but it feels unclean to me. We used our own trash bags, but of course when

Summary Heading: Excellent Hotel to stay if you are going to Disneyland park
Summary: Excellent hotel with excellent location extremely clean & comfortable, within walking distance from the parks. Upon arrival we were warmly welcomed by the friendly reception staff Melisa and Richard they makes our trip more interesting with their advices . Would definetely recommend this hotel to everybody! It's a true sample of excellent hospitality. Thank you again Melisa and Richard for going just that little step extra for the guests!!!

Summary Heading: Good Breakfast, Long Walk back from Disneyland
Summary: My family stayed in a King Family Room for 3 nights while visiting Disneyland. I booked it because I thought the 1 mile walk would be fine and the accommodations included breakfast. Well I am here to tell you that 1 mile is like 3 miles after a long day at the park!! This was my 5th time at Disneyland and my first off resort stay. If I do stay off site I think I will look at something much much closer. Breakfast was plated for you (eggs, sausage, French toast sticks or tots-depending on the day), they had bananas or oranges, toast, juices. Nothing crazy fancy but you could get seconds if you really needed to power up for the day. No microwave in the room. The King family room had a bunk bed in the room with pocket doors separating it from the king bed. There was only one outlet

The Hotel is perfect.  15-20 minute walk from the park. Big rooms. We had 2 Q and 1 sofa which is great for our family with 2 big teenagers who don‚Äôt like to share a bed.  Included Breakfast is a plus‚Äîhearty and good. Offerings were scrambled eggs, sausage, and one day potatoes, the other French toast. All juices and mills and coffees teas, toast, cereal, fruit available.  Started our day off quick and easy.  The employees are all so nice and friendly.  Rooms are very updated and clean. Beds are comfortable.

Breakfast included.  Clean and covid compliant.  The room was greats.  Hospitality was awesome.  We called for more towels and they were at our room within ten minutes.  The breakfast was full breakfast which my kids loved.  Coffee every morning in the lobby.  Keurig machine and fridge in the room.  Bathroom was great and shower head was awesome (cuz that's important)  Girls that worked there were super friendly.  We will only stay  here when we go back to Disneyland this summer.

This trip experience was great. The hotel was nice, conveniently located in Anaheim, totally clean, staff is friendly, breakfast is awesome, and customer service is top notch! I would definitely recommend staying here if you find yourself in the area.

We stayed for one night before going to Disneyland on New Years Day. Our room was spacious and clean, the included breakfast was good, and we appreciated being able to keep our car on site until we returned from Disneyland at 10pm while only being charged for one day. Solid experience.

We recently stayed here for a family Disneyland trip. We had a very nice experience. The rooms were comfortable and clean and the staff was very friendly.   It is a little bit of a walk to the main gate but not too far. It took us about 20 minutes at a nice comfortable pace.   One employee who went above and beyond during our stay was Jessica. She was VERY polite and helpful.    We will stay here again in the future.

Summary Heading: Hyatt is STILL the favorite for my family and business needs.
Summary: I want to thank Michelle R. For helping during the check in process. She was extremely courteous and willing to answer several questions.  The room was great. Very clean and up to par. The bathroom was especially clean and GREAT water pressure in the shower!!!! All in all, a great stay.

We spent 2nights at Hyatt Place Anaheim. We had a great experience at this hotel. Room was clean and beds were comfortable. When we arrived there was happy birthday balloon and some candies in the basket for my son‚Äôs birthday. That was very thoughtful and made my son smile soon as we walked in. Breakfast was just ok. There were no buffet like normally they do due to Covid which is understandable. Everything was good but one thing I was very unhappy about was my neighbor was very loud at night talking and slamming their door around midnight and woke us up. I called the front desk and they took care of the situation and they stopped talking. Overall it was a great stay. We will recommend if you want to stay at clean and professional hotel near Disneyland

Summary Heading: nice location but poor condition and service
Summary: The location is nice but very poor room condition and sound isolation. the outside trafffic is very busy and loud, I can clearly here the water running noise from other rooms and waked me up early in the morning, the central air and fan is noisy too

Our stay was great! Awesome customer service and the location was perfect for our family. Close to many different restaurants, shopping, and most importantly Disneyland. The hotel staff was welcoming and very helpful. We felt safe and secure at this hotel and will be staying here again!

Excellent location, the attention of the staff was super,  the room was super clean, walking distance from the only free Disneyland  ART shuttle, definetly would recommend this  hotel for a family trip to disneyland

My family and I had a pleasant stay at Hyatt Place in Anaheim. Room was clean and spacious. Had to pay for parking, but my car was safe and dry (it was raining pretty hard at times). The front counter staff were very helpful and nice. The only thing that bothered us was the room doors would slam shut when they closed, other than that I recommend staying there.

The place was clean. The room so spacious! I have a family of five and it is usually difficult to sleep confortably since most hotels offer two beds in a room. It was my husband and I and our 3 young girls. The room had 3 queen sized beds! The breakfast was good too. Will def. stay here again!

We didn‚Äôt go to Disney during this stay but the team made sure to give an awesome Disney welcome with some snacks, stickers, magnet, and balloons for the kids. Another staff member even gave my daughter a Christmas forky doll once she discovered she had an obsession with Toy Story! The level of customer service and care at this Hyatt was so awesome. Rooms are big and have a separate sitting area for the kids to play. The included breakfast was also a nice perk and convenient to roll the kids out of bed and get them some breakfast downstairs. Definitely recommend for families and anyone visiting Disney!

The hotel was so clean and well taken care of. It was very accommodating. We loved them breakfast each morning. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We got complimentary water bottles every day and that was one of my favorite parts!

This hotel is very nicely kept with well appointed rooms.  It is very clean and new feeling although a couple things are beginning to show its age.  I would highly recommend this hotel for seniors as well as families with children.

This hotel is among newer hotels in the area.  You can walk to Disneyland, but it's about 20-25 minutes.  You can walk 10 minutes & ride a free Disneyland shuttle or walk about 2 minutes & use a paid bus shuttle.  Rooms are clean & in good order.  Good covid protocol and hot breakfast every morning is a plus.  Only downside is that the walls are paper thin.  It's loud.  We could hear peoples conversations in the room next to us and in the hallway.  That being said, we have stayed here many, many times and will return.

Convenient location. Shuttle to Disneyland a 5 minute walk. Free breakfast, decent restaurants in close proximity. Did not like all the parking fees and taxes associated with staying at this hotel.  Otherwise I would have given it a higher rating.

Stayed here for a Disneyland trip and I absolutely loves it!! Room was so clean and nice, breakfast was eggs and French-toast the first day and eggs and breakfast potatoes the second morning.. I would definitely stay here again! Front desk was really attentive..

We were here back in 2018 Christmas, the stay was really good. We decided to comeback this year 2021 for Thanksgiving. Everything was still very good, the only bad experience is with the valet parking crews. We were forced to valet when we got back to the hotel after our concert past midnight.  We refused due to Covid ( are the crews really going to sanitize our car before giving it back to us?) but was given hard time. 1/3 of the parking was empty but blocked for valet parking only. In the morning, the crews refused to open the gate for us when we were leaving the hotel.  I had to reverse my car, ran back into the hotel to get help from the receptionist who was very understanding. We weren‚Äôt aware during checking about the valet parking service.  And I was shocked when I saw 6

Awesome stay this hotel fairly close to the shuttle bus only 4mins walk to the toy story buss after then zip to from of the park. The staff are awesome very kind and very helpful. Would definitely come back and stay here again

Great quality overall. The room was spacious and had great features like a mini fridge and tv. Breakfast was for a long time (6-9am) and it was very good.Close to Disneyland, we walked there in 15-20 min. Only neg was a little loud but fan helped

It was an awesome experience staying at the hotel, especially  MELISA made us feel like very important persons.  It was very comfortable to stay at the hotel, and provided an authentic hospitality and made a difference in our lives and stay.

Staff was very friendly, room was clean and cozy. Breakfast was good. I would have liked more fruit but besides that I was pleased with the selection. This was my 2nd stay here and we will be back in December!

Our family decided to take a fall trip to Disney during school break. Long story short, there was a miscommunication with Hyatt's general reservation department and we discovered we had no reservation days before our trip during a busy week in Anaheim. Our reservation was complicated involving points/award nights. We reached out to the hotel directly in a last ditch effort. We ended up speaking with John R who went extremely above and beyond moving all kinds of things around and getting creative to make our reservation happen. After a scary flight and shuttle ride, we arrived at the hotel only to be warmly greeted by reception. We then walked into our room to discover what seemed to be a room upgrade with balloons, treats, Disney  stuff and a card signed by multiple members of

Summary Heading: A quick but wonderful stay before a long journey
Summary: I am a frequent traveler and a globalist with Hyatt Rewards. I stayed one night prior to beginning a long journey from Los Angeles area to Austin Texas at Hyatt Place/Anaheim convention center. I can‚Äôt say enough about the top notch customer service and personal greeting and gift that I was given by the management and front desk associates everything was perfect about the state the property was clean and comfortable and again the best part of the state was a stellar customer service from the staff.  I highly recommend this property if you‚Äôre ever in the area although I did not visit Disneyland it is absolutely super convenient to the park.

all good except  breakfast and you cant make reservation for dinner at closest  steakhouse block away   found it could only eat at bar . monday night empty and tuesday was full very pricey  was able to spit plates and plenty of food .

Everything was great! The staff was really helpful, especially Jocelyn at the front desk. The location is amazing as it‚Äôs only 4 minute walking distance from the Toy Story parking lot. Breakfast could‚Äôve been better.

Close to Disneyland. Neat and Clean. Breakfast is not worth mentioning but they do have Starbucks and Bar. Room was large enough. I didn‚Äôt like them not having a fan/vent in the bathroom. But not a big deal. Overall I am satisfied and would recommend staying there. Good for families.

Pretty basic. Room trash cans were gross with stains of some sorta food stuck on. Outlets next to bed were loose. Ended up unplugging the clock under the night stand just to charge. Mattresses okay but pillows really unpleasant. Not enough blankets, our children got chilly. Pullout bed was blown out and only had one pillow with a sheet. I called front desk to request more blankets and they never came. No room service because of covid. So trash piled up in the tiny dirty can they gave us, ended up using a target bag we acquired.  When we first checked in I was lucky enough to grab a few extra towels from the cart when they were cleaning a room close to ours. They did have included breakfast (eggs, sausage, toast, basic) on styrofoam plates that you grab from a heat lamp. Room

Would be nice if they could keep a box of Instant oatmeal for Celiacs.  They offer free breakfast but nothing gluten free. Location was very close to the Toy Story Shuttle to Disney which was very nice.

Excellent customer service! The ladies at the front desk were exceptional. The room was clean, fairly quiet and my son said that was the best sofa bed he‚Äôs been forced to sleep on in a year‚Ä¶ The Disney shuttle is across the street in the large public parking lot. The best feature of the hotel is, the now open breakfast bar! No more grab-n-go!

Hyatt Place at Anaheim is definitely a go-to spot if you are going to the parks! I have stayed at several locations around the area, and nothing really beats this one. Location, amenities, up-to-date rooms, and friendly staff members.  I want to give a huge shout out to Ken. My fianc√© and I were in town to visit the parks and booked a stay at a different hotel nearby. We had a terrible experience within our first few hours there, so I quickly made a call to Hyatt Place at Anaheim. Ken was on the receiving end and went above and beyond to see if he can squeeze us in for a room. Mind you, it was 1AM.  Upon arrival, Ken was extremely welcoming. He is humorous, personable, and kind-hearted. He empathized with our bad experience at the other hotel, and made sure that our needs were

I had work nearby, and stayed at this hotel.  Super easy to get in and out.  Parking was easy.  Rooms are very nice, clean, spacious, and up to date.  I had a room to myself, but could easily have held 4 people comfortably.  Employees are nice.

Fuind the cheapest hotel and just stay there. The amenities here are nonexisting. Also the beds are the same as the floor with humps in the middle. Horrible hotel. They are useless up front don't bother asking for anything it's broken or forgotten.

Great stay! Friendly service, great room setup with fridge and coffee maker.complimentary breakfast was minimalist but great to start the day. Staff was great. Close to toy story parking and easy to get to park.

I had to compare this place to Las Vegas that cleans the rooms everyday. This one after 4 days did not clean & the trash was overflowing. The floor became dirty as the toddler feet became dirty. Should at least do housekeeping every other day if not everyday.

Due to COVID, room cleaning services weren‚Äôt as often but staff was very helpful and friendly. Not too far from Disneyland but still exhausting to walk, I‚Äôm just out of shape, lol. Overall fantastic, great staff and customer service.

Very clean.  Super nice and courteous staff, especially during check in process.  Breakfast was more organized than expected, especially during Covid.  Parking costs $24 per day.  Usable free WiFi.  Walk to Disney is a comfortable 20 minutes, beets waiting for the shuttle.  Rooms are surprisingly quiet.

A little farther from Disneyland than expected. Free breakfast was a plus, but the offerings were very limited. Everything else was average. For the price (about $200/night including taxes and fees), it was more expensive than I would be willing to pay. We stayed at Suncoast last month ($145/night) and I would probably choose that place again as I liked the proximity to Disneyland and the overall look of the lobby and rooms.

Summary Heading: Hyatt Place - Another place to stay when going to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed at this hotel because we were in Anaheim for our Disneyland trip.  The room accommodates families with a bigger room and breakfast.  Unfortunately, you need to pay for parking if you have a car.  The Disney Toy Story parking lot is across the street from this hotel so you don't have to deal with the long security lines at the Disneyland park itself.  The shuttle will drop you off right at the entrance.  Perfect hotel for any Disneyland trip!

Nice, clean hotel. If you are planning to visit Disney and don‚Äôt mind about a mile walk to the park, this hotel is a good option. Our kids loved the bunk beds. The rooms were spacious and comfortable.

Great location, bunk beds for kids awesome. Rooms nice a cool, room service limited to every four days but housekeeping very attentive. Close to Disneyland and Garden Grove Walk. We would stay again..

Wonderful stay. Beds and pillows were very comfy. Great breakfast. It was fast for those of us in a hurry. And it was a real breakfast with scrambled eggs, potatoes and sausage.  Very nice staff. Room was very spacious and clean. Very easy to get to Disneyland for those that like to walk. It was about a 15 minute walk to the Disney parking lot.

Summary Heading: Great family hotel within walking distance to Disney
Summary: Rooms - nice Overall hotel - nice Perfect distance - walkable to all things Disney.  Bad - the COVID protocols mean no room service (only every 5th day of reservation).  Family of 4+ and it gets annoying having to hunt down housekeeping to request clean towels.  Did call and request these items but two hours later and nothing.

Rude staff, even ruder valet. Everything dingy. Nothing sanitized. Over priced and not worth it. Don‚Äôt waste your money at this place, they share the parking lot with 2 other low end motels, the parking lot is just as dirty as the rooms. Plus there are countless building code violations all throughout the building. Not recommend

It was a comfortable and safe stay at the hotel.  It was spacious room as standard room.  I wish they had a microwave in the room.  I had to go down to the lobby to use a microwave.  Customer service was very nice and polite to us. We definitely want to come back and stay at Hyatt place in Anaheim/Resort convention center.

Jocelyn was amazing, she went out her way to make our family feel comfortable and appreciated. She was patient and kind and made the beginning of our stay amazing already. What a wonderful woman and worker. She deserves a raise !

If you want to sleep at all, do not stay here. The staff will hand you ear plugs and make it your problem they allow people to make crazy noises all night for the 2 nights I was there. I don't get it, why wouldn't the staff simple ask the crazy others to simply take it easy on the noise ALL NIGHT.. I guess they are all woke and don't want to offend the disrespectful people by asking them to be respectful of the other PAYING guests. GHETTO.

This place was excellent! Spotlessly clean and comfortable. Easy contactless check in and check out, I used my phone as the key to access the elevator and the room very easily. We are a couple who came to stay for one night before going to Disney. We walked to Disney in the morning and back at night, it took about 15 min each way. We were able to stay parked at the hotel the next day without additional parking fees.

I recently stayed at Hyatt Place while visiting Disneyland. The hotel is about 0.75 m (according to my GPS watch) away from the shuttle dropoff area at the Disneyland parks entrance. We had no issues walking to and from the parks daily. For bigger families or those who have trouble walking, the hotel is located across the street from a Disney parking lot, right on the Toy Story shuttle line. So, as far as park access, I think this location is great!   Hyatt Place offers free breakfast daily. The breakfast consisted of pre-made plates of sausage, scrambled eggs, and tater tots. In addition, they had some toast, cereal, and hard-boiled eggs. Milk, coffee, water, and fruit juice were also available. Even though it wasn't a large selection, I enjoyed the breakfast. The cook was very

Had a great stay at the Hyatt Place at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center. The staff was great. Gigi at the front desk was outstanding. The breakfast was very good considering the Covid protocols. Rooms were clean and well maintained. We highly recommend staying.

Summary Heading: Very clean and affordable hotel near Disneyland
Summary: The Disney hotels have completely priced most middle class families from staying there so we are now members of Hyatt and sought out one of their hotels. This hotel is modern, clean and in a safe area. They have very comfortable beds and large rooms. The only downside is there is not a shuttle to Disneyland so it's a one mile walk to the parks which in the morning was ok but after a long day at the park it would be nice to have a shuttle to take you back. The rate though was really great compared to other good neighbor hotels near the parks.

The welcome was Great and the room was larger then expected. The shuttle for Disney across the street, But walking to Disney is a straight way. The hotel staff was very helpful. Best place to stay for the area restaurants many to choices. I would stay again.

This is a wonderful place to stay! Will stay there again. Able to catch a shuttle to Disney. Grate staff and breakfast. The hotel is clean and have plenty of parking. Very safe place to stay. 5 stars!!!

We came in for just 2 nights, doing a day at Disney as the start of our road trip. The room was clean and check in was a breeze. I recommend checking in and getting the parking pass for the underground parking before trying to find a spot in the lot, it's worth it. Check out was super easy and the staff helpful. No complaints.

The rooms are very nice and clean, bed was comfortable, and the hot breakfast was very nice.  You could tell that the staff went out of their way to make the whole experience very delightful.  We loved being able to purchase snack food in the front lobby. It's a bit of a walk to the Disney park from hotel, but there are some options available to get there by bus.

Poor front desk receptionist, didn‚Äôt help me with my room change request. BATHROOM SINK was clogged, bad quality towels in the bathroom, no hot drinking water facility, not even regular water. I wasn‚Äôt able to find parking around 11pm, valet parking lady sounded rude and was‚Äônt interested to answer my questions. Very rude customer service.

This hotel is a good distance from Disneyland and was only about a 15 minute walk for my family and I. There are 2 Tesla chargers and one generic charger in the garage below, but good luck actually using one. As you can imagine, Teslas are in great supply at all times in the hotel. The staff at this location is absolutely amazing though. They are super friendly and went above and beyond ot make sure our stay was a pleasant one. If you are going to Disneyland I would definitely recommend this hotel, but be prepared to eat breakfast elsewhere as the free breakfast is pretty rough.

Amazing staff, booked a room with stand up shower only called the front desk and was giving a room with a tub so my 1 year old can bathe comfortable. Everything was clean, breakfast was great definitely will be back again!!

Hotel staff was excellent.  Property was fairly clean.  Hotel room is clean and quiet except for an occasional door slamming.  Free wifi.  Walkable to Disney transportation center.  Hot breakfast was decent because if COVID restriction.  Ask for a room not facing busy street if street noise bothers you at night.  Pool is small, and not really in a desirable location.

Clean, friendly and overall good stay!! Nice area and easy access to all freeways. Staff was courteous. The parking was available unlike most hotels and the vicinity worked out perfectly to where our business meetings took place.

Walking distance from Disneyland. Clean, comfortable rooms. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Definitely would recommend for families - especially the rooms with bunk beds! My kids loved those! Breakfast left a lot to be desired, but my family isn't big on breakfast anyway so that was okay for us.

Summary Heading: Friendly Staff and Rooms were clean and spacious!!
Summary: We went to Downtown Disney to purchase Halloween Merchandise which we found and decided to stay the night. The staff was friendly, knowledgable and very helpful. The room was very clean and spacious. Would totally stay again!!

Summary Heading: I will try another hotel next time
Summary: The room had a funny smell and the windows were super dirty, taking away the view. The breakfast was not so good, we ate one time and the other days we went somewhere else. We will try another hotel next tune for our family.

The staff was amazing, very welcoming and helpful. Ken was especially helpful with his recommendations. We were able to have a fun and productive trip in great part thanks to Ken's suggestions. The hotel is a short walk from the shuttle parking. Overall a great hotel experience

So first there‚Äôs a $22 a night parking fee, no housekeeping if stay is less then 5 days, you have to request cleaning. Beds are sunken in from having been used a lot, lamp in room hanging from ceiling didn‚Äôt stay on and looked about like it was going to fall. Breakfast was crazy and a little wait. Dissatisfied that a 4 day stay ended up $760 with fee, parking and room. At least staff was nice.your really just paying for location.

I had a last-minute meeting , fluency for jet lag Richard and Ken we‚Äôre just so amazing as soon as I got there they managed to get me a room walked up it was so clean so organized great customer service/ that was so comfortable very quiet and peaceful waking up very fresh a huge thank you to Ken for his amazing job in assisting me super last minute with promptness-   Highly recommend this place for booking and for last minute they are wonderful if I could give them more stars 10 is my review

No one at the hotel mentioned that the parking was over $25 per night. I checked the website, and had to search to find this info. This is part of the cost when deciding where to stay, and should be mentioned in the description of the hotel amenities. Additionally, this is a very noisy hotel, people wandering up and down the halls until 1am.

We took a trip to CA Adventures and Disneyland. It was our daughters 11th Birthday and she ADORES Marvel. So, we took her to Avengers Campus. I was trying to get in line for the new Spider-Man ride. I asked where the best ‚ÄúWiFi‚Äù was and explained it was my daughters birthday. The manager, Richard Rosales, overheard and wanted to send a special birthday surprise. Of course, I said ‚Äúyes please‚Äù.  We came back and found 3 helium balloons, a basket full of special treats (including a domino set, Cheesecake Factory Cheesecake, and LOTS OF TREATS!!). But Allison‚Äôs fav gift? A card signed for the entire staff!!! That meant the most to her, and I saved it as a keepsake!!!   Hyatt Place, Anaheim‚Ä¶ you didn‚Äôt have to do this, but you have NO IDEA how much this meant to us! We are referring

It's a great location and love the free breakfast daily. Parking is extra but they have plenty of parking space in the underground garage. Desk staff is amazing. Very helpful and friendly. They have free computers and a printer for use.

Summary Heading: Great location, excellent customer service, spacious and decent room
Summary: The staff was very professional and provided excellent customer service - friendly, courteous and did their best to accommodate the guests' needs. Hot breakfast was a nice touch. One improvement: parking should be free.

I had a great time during this trip. Front desk  Service was nice and quick. Hotel is very clean (Thank you Housekeeping Team), neat and quiet. When i checked out front desk also gave me a couple of water bottle It was a pleasant to stay. I will definitely go back to this place again for my next trip.

Great property with amazing staff, clean rooms, comfortable beds, free hot/cold breakfast, coffee and tea bar, hot tub and pool.  People who work here are extremely helpful and kind.  They even had a full bar open all day.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay close to Disney Parks
Summary: My daughter and I were on a road trip to visit our family when we had quick change of plans and decided last minute to book this hotel for our California Adventure Park. Upon our arrival Kevin greeted us at the front desk, gave us all the information that we needed and even printed out best of for the park that we were going to. This was very helpful. This hotel is with in a walking distance to the parks, so no Disney parking fees. I think it took us about 10 min to walk there. We would definitely going to keep this hotel in mind for next time we visit

Staff is awesome. Very friendly and hospitable. I do not like the extra charge for parking and the worst part is it is hard to look for parking at night even though they charge per night for parking. I think parking should be included in the per night stay so people don't get confused that you are getting a good deal per night when looking online for hotels in the area. After 3 nights of stay, I had to pay an additional $75 for parking.

I love this hotel All of the staff I‚Äôve come across has been nothing but friendly and helpful. Location is perfect And the breakfast is amazing. I come here every time we go to Disneyland. The beds are comfortable even the pull out bed everyone loves this hotel the youngest to the oldest. Will definitely be back again And I recommend it to anyone reading this review

We stayed at this hotel for a last-minute trip to Disneyland and we were very happy with our experience there.  We booked one of the family suites for our family of four.  Our room was clean and relatively spacious.  The kids loved the bunk beds.  We all loved that there were stores and restaurants within walking distance.  One of the Disneyland parking lots is basically across the street from the hotel, which is super convenient.  We chose to drive to the parks each time we went but there are shuttle bus stops near the hotel and walking to the main entrance is less than a mile away.

Stayed for 6 nights and it was nice! They did offer breakfast every morning. Front desk people were very friendly and helpful. I would stay again because of the friendly staff and because the hotel was very clean.

Booked 8 nights and 9 days. On our 3rd day of staying, we requested room service after towels got dirty, trash can full, and no toilet or tissue paper left. Was told that the next day at 2pm our room will be cleaned and refreshed. We came back from Disneyland just to see that nothing has been done. Trash full, no clean towels left, room is messy after 3 days with 3 kids. We called the front office that night and they apologized and told us they will clean our room the first thing tomorrow. Here comes tomorrow, nothing, trash stacking, no clean towels, room getting dirty. Called again, they apologized, again, nothing. Then 4th day of promises, nothing. I had to go down directly to the front office and told them that I don't want to sound like a Karen, but I have requested service

The hotel was nice and clean. The staff was friendly. There is a free shuttle service to Disneyland from the Toy Story parking lot (provided by Disneyland not the hotel) which is a little over a quarter mile from the hotel. Breakfast was provided but the first day it was in a bag with a muffin, yogurt, apple juice and an apple. The second day they did have scrambled eggs, sausage and country potatoes. There is no microwave in the rooms or a laundry room in the building.

The room was clean and sufficient for our needs.  Easy walk to the parks (same side of the street). We arrived late and Gabriella arranged for a driver ahead of time. All in all a very good experience.

We stayed for two nights and because of covid was not eligible for daily housekeeping. That was ok we are pretty clean and organized. The room was clean and the customer service is great. Espere valet staff. There not many self parking spots but we used Valet parking and it was worth it.

The location was good for Disneyland travelers. The room and property itself were average. The room we had was not very clean. The pool area is not anything like the pictures on the site, a really small pool area. The hot tub and outdoor shower were not working. We would not stay here again.

Not at all satisfied, could hear noise outside even if the door is closed and people above our room were too noisy we could hear them their footsteps no sound proof and the room has bad smell. We had to pay parking when it‚Äôs supposed to be complimentary.

Summary Heading: Nice stay parking could be better
Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights. We had a great stay but the parking on Saturday night was a nightmare. They had no more self parking available when we returned at about 10:30 from getting ice cream. So we had to do valet parking and my husband waiting an hour to get a valet attendant to help him they were so busy and not enough spaces. They must have over booked or something. My husband looked out the window at 1am and our car was still not parked it was still in the lobby entrance. They charge 22 dollars a day for parking, but with that experience I feel like they should charge. Other than that it was good. No warm breakfast and no shuttles to the Disney parks.

Uncomfortable and slow service, low quality service. COVID and Understaffed was the reason given, response time was slow for service requests. Value for money is low. Equipment provided in room were broken.

Excellent service  Richard Rosales thank you.  Service, clean rooms  Free parking  This hotel is close to restaurants, malls  very well situated  Good coffee  Close to parks  Totally can recommend  Rooms rates are affordable

Summary Heading: Great place for a family vacationing
Summary: Better rate than most. Room was nice and clean. Easily slept 6 of us (king bed, bunk bed, sofa bed). Staff was very polite and helpful. Not too far of a walk to Disneyland. Easy parking. Had bagels out one day for breakfast in addition to the grab-n-go bags which was nice.

Walking distance to toy story shuttle parking lot , spacious rooms , nice staff . Breakfast bags were convenient came with a fruit muffin and drink . Good room for a family with kids . Couch turns into a bed

Room was clean, had enough towels, quiet, beds were comfortable only complaint was free breakfast!  Seriously, tiny apply, small apple juice, stale muffin and Luke warm yogurt with an option die hard boiled egg - soo disappointed - for the rare breakfast should have options!

Was so happy with this stay. Was curious how clean the room would be as the hotels around Disneyland are very used and often show a lot of wear and tear. This was a great, very clean room with very nice finishes and the staff was helpful and friendly.

The room was amazing.  The staff was amazing and the hotel is very clean.  Will stay there again in the future.  Great location in relation to Disneyland, walking distance about 10 maybe 15 minutes.  Great price for the hotel.

We always try to stay at either the Hyatt place or the one down the street because it always feels like we are at home. The stay is always so nice and we always feel welcomed. If you‚Äôre going to stay in Anaheim for Disney, stay here. The shutters are across the street! Perfect for any family visit.

Our trip to Disneyland was made easy esp since we stayed at Hyatt Place on South Harbor Blvd, which is less than a mile away from Disneyland. Their staff was very friendly and accommodating. There were 6 of us and we stayed in a suite that was spacious and clean. Pool and gym amenities were also convenient. Best of all, they provided a quick and easy breakfast during our stay!

Summary Heading: breakfast is a joke. loud and noisy
Summary: they advertise breakfast, but, it is more like cafeteria food - 1 pre-packaged muffin (barely edible), one small apple, one small carboard carton juice box. Breakfast should not be advertised this, big disappointment.   our room was 337, close to the elevator. it was loud and noisy all night and we had difficulty sleeping. our room also made strange noises. it sounded like someone was knocking on our window for 2 nights straight but noone was there when we checked (these were not footstomp noises but more like crickling and crackling randomly and LOUD.  The garage ceiling was leaking water from the actually ceiling and my car was wet with what I hope was water.  considering this is a Hyatt, it was a big disappointment

Summary Heading: Awful experience and will not come back
Summary: Very disappointed in the experience I had a Hyatt Place, as I used to frequent this hotel whenever I visited Disneyland. This hotel is located in a convenient spot near the Toy Story Parking lot and the staff were always very nice to us.    This time, I was infuriated by multiple issues and lack of care or support for a frequent customer. First, there are only 2 elevators for the entire hotel and 1 of them was broken. Since this is the only way to and from guest rooms, lobby, and the parking garage it was impossible to get around in a timely manner. There was a constant line of people that had to wait for 1 elevator to make multiple trips until their turn.   We were also placed in a room next to a very noisy neighbor who slammed their doors every 10 mins and their kids screamed

I can say this was our best stay we experienced in our vacation. We stayed at 4 different locations and unfortunately not all were good. But this one was definitely the best of our vacation trip. Everything was so clean, outside and inside our rooms. Not one dust bunny. Everything was working and the staff was so helpful and friendly. We travel with our children and they loved it. Definitely will be coming back.

We reserved a room with Bunk beds and sliding doors which was perfect to create a separate space for kids who like to stay up later at night.  Downside was the light switch for that space was at the front door and there was no other lighting option. Rooms could use more plugs for devices.  Room was clean, 5th floor was surprisingly quiet considering how many other people were staying there. They only offer housekeeping every 4th day and breakfast is in a bag.  We stopped getting them after day 1 and ate out.  Their coffee was good and all staff were very nice. Its a hike to Disneyland, but you can walk, Uber or get a private car.  The Toy Story shuttle is overrun and mot worth the extra time, particularly when the park closes.

I thought this hotel was an excellent choice for our Disneyland stay.  It was only a 10-15 minute walk to the parks, and there's a CVS along the way which was perfect for stopping to get water, wine, snacks, etc.  The room was so nice and clean and the AC worked all day and night (some hotels control it overnight).  The staff was incredibly polite, professional, and caring.  Some services are not available as they can back up and running from the pandemic, but that's totally understandable.  It did not deter from a great Disney trip!

Overall a very good place to stay, staff was very friendly,  the beds were comfortable,  rooms clean. The elevator situation was not the best. Wish the breakfast was better,  but it was better than another hotel we stayed.

This property has been my family‚Äôs favorite place to stay in the past. However, our most recent stay was lacking that Hyatt quality. The rooms were out dated, dark, smelled awful, and moderately clean. The 5th floor smelled like a sewer, so we let the front desk know. It just felt old and dirty. I understand COVID has changed a lot of protocols, but the pre-packaged breakfast was not very good and the coffee was terrible. The only highlight of this stay was the staff at the front desk!
