Breakfast had a slight variation every day and was normally pretty busy.   Food options were not huge but adequate.   Walking to Disney is pretty simple.  Just turn left out of the gates and 15-20mins you are there, otherwise walk over to the disney parking and get the free bus.  Staff were awesome at the hotel and were always made to feel welcome.   Good experience!

We were very disappointed with this recent stay. The bed and pillows were very uncomfortable. There was a strange light on the roof right outside our window that lit up the room at night even through the shade and blackout shade. For some reason the bathroom door has frosted glass and that also lit up the room at night if someone turned on the light with the bathroom door closed. Our room was close to the elevator and was very loud. Someone was running up and down the halls for a long time one night. The breakfast is below average with a limited selection. The front desk staff seemed disinterested. The only good things I can say are the room was clean and it was fairly close to Disney.

We stayed at Hyatt Place for our Disneyland family vacation and it was wonderful!  We are Hyatt credit card holders and used points to pay for half of our week long stay with no problems.  Everyone was very accomodating, to helping us get a great room with our points and quickly bringing up a crib when we forgot to request one at check in.  Breakfast was a great spread EVERY morning! Included with our stay because we were Hyatt members.  It was a long walk to Disneyland every day for the little kids (15 minutes) but the free shuttle was available in the Woody parking lot across the street.   Same amount of time to get to the park as walking, just saved your legs for Disneyland.  Overall great stay!
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review. We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us! We hope you and your family come back soon!

Summary: We just got home from staying a week here and I have to say, I‚Äôm impressed. First off, the staff at the front desk was very friendly and helpful (One girl in particular was so sweet, I can‚Äôt remember her name but she has a 10-month old at home and recently moved back to Anaheim from the Boston area). We arrived very early in the morning and wanted to get to the park and were able to pre-check in and store our bags.   The person who checked us in upgraded us to a room with a separate living area and it was large and comfortable. There were 5 of us (2 adults and 3 kids) staying there and we had plenty of room to stretch out. The beds were comfortable (they are firm) but the pillows left a lot to be desired. I never asked for a different one so I‚Äôm not sure if there are other
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to review our hotel. Your kind words will be shared with our staff! We hope you and your family stay with us next time you are in town!

Summary: Great hotel, everything is clean and modern, very nice hot breakfast , About 8-10 minutes walk to free Disney shuttle that runs every 5-10 minutes.... will definitely come back on our next Disney trip..
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review! We are so happy that you enjoyed your stay. We can't wait to see you on your next trip!

Summary: We had a nice time at this hotel. It was relatively inexpensive. We ended up walking to Disneyland most of the time as the rides for the Disney shuttle were long. The rooms were quiet and comfortable.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay! Please come back and stay with us soon!

Summary: Great hotel like you would expect from Hyatt. A little far from Disneyland to walk frequently.  Breakfast was super Had a great variety in the seating area was big and clean. The family room that we requested was perfect for our situation. The rooms however were noisy

Hyatt Hotels never disappoint, we loved our stay! The hotel room was very clean. Breakfast was delicious, with many options. Wish the hotel was just a smidge closer to Disneyland. We opted to walk to and from the  park because the walk to the parking lot shuttle pickup was pretty far off the road, and the line for the shuttle at the end of the day wasn't worth the wait. But it is walkable, and could be worse. Other than that this hotel was great, we definitely found our go to hotel for Disneyland!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review! We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay! We look forward to your next visit!

Summary Heading: Great Family Hotel in Disney District
Summary: Great room configuration, clean, large rooms and bathrooms. The beds were like heaven after long days on your feet at the Disney Parks. Breakfast was great and staff were lovely. Had a great stay with our family and highly recommend it!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are pleased to hear that you and your family enjoyed your stay with us! We hope you stay with us next time you are in town!

Summary: Everything was far above my most positive expectations!  It is exciting to see this kind of personal attention given to the customer base.  I love the spirit portrayed by the staff.  They were always eager to go the extra mile!!!
Manager Response: We are so glad to hear you enjoyed your stay with us! We hope you come back and stay with us next time you are in town!

Summary: Great service big rooms and very friendly staff and 15 minute walk to Disneyland no turns just a straight walk or cross the street to Disney‚Äôs toy story lot hop on the bus and drops you at entrance awesome

Got a reservation at the last minute after the hotel we had reservations at was horrible.  Got a great room.  Breakfast was a nice extra.  Did have to pay for parking- but that is everywhere by Disney.  Very close to Disneyland.  Rooms were great.

Had a great time.Excellent staff who handled all our requirements.Great food.Need more vegetarian dishes.Overall a pleasant stay.They need to have room service.Comfortable beds. They should have more staff to handle work.

Summary Heading: Surpassed My Expectations! Can't wait to be back!
Summary: We had never stayed with Hyatt, I chose this hotel for 1. closeness to Disneyland & 2. the breakfast included (no lines or wasting time). The price was fantastic, we went through AAA & I was a little leary, but boy did I score with my choice. It said .8miles to Disneyland well all we did was cross the street and go into the Disney parking lot & were taken right to the gate on the Disney shuttle (information provided to us by the Hyatt Place staff‚ô•)! The Breakfast provided at the hotel was delicious! We were there two nights, the first morning we had pancakes & ham (amongst other delightful usuals) and the second morning we had french toast & sausages. Some delicious usuals of course were fresh fruits, steal cut oatmeal (lots of toppings to choose from), variety of breads to
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are so thrilled to hear you had such a great experience! I will share your kind words with our staff. Please come back and stay with us next time you are in town!

Summary: A trip to Disneyland to be with grandkids that are older now so we could run around and really have fun.  They live in San Diego, but I wanted a nearby hotel to sleep at the end of a long fun day and this Hyatt was great.  The only drawback is the breakfast eggs are terrible!

The hotel is a wonderful surprise! Near Disneyland parks, around 20 minutes walking or you can take a bus at the disneyland parking lot (around 5 minutes walking) and it takes you to the Disneyland. The breakfast has good hot meals choices as well as fresh fruits. The rooms are cozy and modern.

All of the employees were very kind, nice, and took of our needs quickly. Room was very spacious which is rare to find in a hotel. We requested a connecting room and was able to get it. Location is ideal and very close to Toy Story Parking where you can take a free shuttle to Disneyland. Recommend staying here and we will come back in the future.
Manager Response: We are so pleased to hear about your experience with us. We hope to see you the next time you are in town! Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel!

Summary Heading: Always a nice place to stay when visiting Disneyland
Summary: We are Hyatt members and stay at Hyatt's whenever we travel.  We stayed at the Hyatt Place at Anaheim Resort/ Convention Center to celebrate our anniversary at Disneyland.  We like this Hyatt Place because it is within walking distance of the Toy Story Lot so we can take the buses to the parks which is very convenient.  The room was nice, clean and quiet.  We didn't have breakfast since we decided to sleep in but we did have dinner.  The food was good, service was friendly and prices were reasonable.  I would recommend this hotel to families or couples.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel for a great price
Summary: We stayed at the Hyatt Place hotel so we could go to Disneyland for 2 days in a row.  The hotel was on Harbor right past the entrance to the Toy Story Parking.  It was an easy walk to either the Toy Story Parking buses (almost across the street) or all the way to the park (about a 15 minute walk).  The room was clean, the staff was helpful and the bed was comfortable.  Everything I needed for a good vacation.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are so pleased to hear that we met all of your expectations for your vacation. We hope that you will stay with us next time you are in the area!

Summary: The hotel was nice. The location was very close to the attraction we were attending. The staff were really friendly and nice I recommend this hotel to friends and family. The breakfast was fresh and hot.

Has a reservation at the Marriott Suites- when we got to the room it was horrible.  Makeup on the sheets and holes in the sheets.  Food on the floor and hair in the sink.  Checked right out and made a last minute reservations here.  It was wonderful.  So glad we made the change- our new favorite hotel in Anaheim
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review! We are so happy to hear that we made your stay in Anaheim better. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary Heading: Thin floors mean no sleep if people upstairs aren't sleeping
Summary: On my last night I tried to get to sleep at 11pm. The people upstairs kept walking back and forth and there were loud thumps I could feel in the bed, with 15-20 second pauses before they started again, so earplugs weren't helping. I thought they were just packing at first or getting ready for bed. It didn't stop, so at midnight I called down to the front desk and was told they would get a courtesy call. It kept going until 1am when I was finally able to get to sleep after an exhausting day walking over 11 miles at Disney. I had to wake up at 6:30 the next morning to get ready and meet my family back at Disney, so I was sleep deprived, and then had to drive back down to San Diego after not getting the good night's rest I had hoped for at Hyatt House. I mentioned this at checkout

We've stayed at this hotel twice and both times were great!  I love that there's two beds and a pullout!  Lots of space for families and a great location for Disneyland.  You can't beat the free breakfast before you go spend the day at the parks too.  This is our go to hotel when we're in the area!
Manager Response: Thank  you for your kind review! We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary Heading: An excellent place to relax and rest after a day at Disney
Summary: Recommended by our travel agent and we weren't disappointed.  Free movies on a large screen TV in the room.  Large rooms that fit a family of 5.  At other hotels we needed to pay double for two rooms. Great water pressure for the bath/shower. Comfortable beds.  Great included buffet breakfast. Down to earth and friendly staff - thank you to all of you.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We will share your kind words with our staff. We look forward to your next visit with us!

Summary: Hotel personnel welcomed me by name when I returned and wished me a good day when I left (every time) they payed attention to me when we spoke and they took care of my need immediately. I had a great experience here and recommend this hotel to other travelers. I travel about 46 weeks out of the year so the hotels I stay at are very important to me - this is a definite thumbs up.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are very pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us at Hyatt Place at Anaheim Resort/ Convention Center. Please come back to stay with us next time you are in the area!

Summary: Great location close to everything. Spacious rooms. Staff was great and accommodating. The carpets are starting to show wear but overall Would stay again. The weather was too cold but the pool was open

One really can't go wrong here! The staff here is extremely efficient and very welcoming from the front desk to housekeeping. The breakfast buffet is ample and the staff there is so friendly and warm - Jesus is a rockstar! The rooms are spacious and clean. The location, as far as Disneyland goes, is really convenient and a block away from the Disney shuttle bus stop. So, if you're looking for a no nonsense, clean, nicely-priced, friendly and homely place to stay, look no further!
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review! We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us! We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: We planned an overnight stay at Disneyland. This hotel was perfect. First Hyatt is always great. Not Disney resort prices. Across street from free shuttle to park. Hotel was very clean with upgraded or new feel. The breakfast in the morning was a good start to our day. The rooms were clean and comfy. The beds... ahh felt great after long day at the park.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Please come back soon!

Summary: We enjoyed the rather large room for the price. There was a king size bed a pull out couch and a bunk bed. Perfect for our family of 7.  We notified them of an issue with a sign hanging down in the lower parking that accidentally scratched the top of our car, and we noticed them fixing it the next morning. Thank you.

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel and good rates on rooms
Summary: Stayed here for two nights to visit Disneyland. Absolutely clean and beautiful. The room was welcoming and clean. We loved that there was a couch for lounging. Definitely made us feel at home away from our own home. Just be aware of the cities taxes that you are taxed just for staying in a hotel close to Disneyland. There must have been $50 extra in several different taxes for Travelers, or what they call ‚Äútransient‚Äù. It also costs $18 a day to park at this hotel so also be aware of that. When they offer you a good rate it is never just that much. However, we would stay here again, just have to save up our money to pay for the taxes! The city is very clean so you get what you pay for. We saw people power washing the streets early in the morning. I appreciate that.

Second stay two years after my first stay and I'm pleased to report the hotel was as good as I remembered it.  Excellent rooms and facilities, helpful staff and a great complimentary breakfast consisting of various selections including fresh fruit, oatmeal, pancakes and bacon and sausage.  I'd happily stay again and recommend to others.

We took the kids for a short trip to Disneyland and stayed at the Hyatt Place that was two miles away. Our check-in and check-out process was seamless. Hotel was very clean, spacious, and modern-looking. My boys loved the bunk beds that were in our room. Staff was very friendly when we had questions or needed something! We ordered food from the Gallery Market for dinner for a few nights and food was good. Overall, excellent service! Will be staying there again next year when we head back to Disneyland again!

Rooms are nicely furnished, building is very new. Breakfast is sufficient since it has eggs, omelette, oatmeal, cereals, hams, cooked meat, bread,coffee with different flavors such as vanilla, caramel, hazelnut, etc.   Hotel staffs could have been a lot better though, not very helpful most of the times, treating customers with attitude! Will not return here although I am a loyal Hyatt members for years.

Summary Heading: Home Base for a Disneyland Vacation
Summary: Party of 4 with a late check in. After our flight into John Wayne we caught a LYFT to the Hyatt Place. They have parking ticket gate in the front. I appreciate this little detail because it makes the parking area feel more safe. After you enter through the front door the service desk is right in the front. We checked in quickly and the desk staff were friendly. We walked to a small mexican restaurant nearby that I highly recommend (Mi Casa Mexicana). After dinner we walked to CVS and bought all of the toiletries that we forgot. Our room felt a little dated. It had nice touches like a big closet and a kurig coffee maker. Unfortunately the bed is on a very noisy metal box frame that squeaked loudly anytime you turned or got up. This is not the best when you are sharing a room and

Bathroom caulking around the fixtures shower specifically needs attention cabinet door for mini fridge needs adjustment the door rubs at the bottom the entry door latch needs alignment I couldn‚Äôt latch the security latch I was not going to spend time to have someone try and fix it on my vacation other than that our stay was great thank you .

The staff and management at Hyatt Place Anaheim were exceptional, outstanding and knowledgeable..They bent over backwards for us from the moment we arrived till the day we left. They gave restaurant suggestions, arranged affordable travel options, excellent local knowledge of area and attractions. The Hyatt Place made our trip a success, they provided a safe, quiet, friendly place to come back to each night where we were greeted like VIPs every coming and going.

We had a family suite that was laid out well with ample space. The coffee was excellent but I cannot say the same for the breakfast. Yes, it is a full menu but the food left much to b desired. Toasters warm, not toast, food was not hot. Potatoes were unappealing as were the scrambled eggs and meat of the day different each morning. For some that may b great, for kids that r pickey eaters, not so great. After our first morning, we did not eat there again. The staff were very professional but almost too much so. A more warm and welcoming approach would have made us country folk feel more relaxed. We had to make a lot of inquiries. Be aware that one must get a parking pass to enter property. This was not made clear and caused confusion upon arrival. All in all, it was a good

Being a family of 5 , we took the room with two queen beds and a separate living area with a pullout sofa bed. The checkin time was 3 pm . We came at 2 pm and we deposited our bags and went for lunch . Came back at 315 pm and room was still not ready . Had to wait for another 15-20 min before the room was ready .  Parking was at US$18 per nite plus plus . There is an open air parking and underground parking . You enter and exchange your ticket with the receptionist for a multi day pass.  The room was very clean and new and with plenty of space to move around. Wifi was adequate to watch YouTube . What I felt was lacking was that toiletries were inadequate with only one small tube of conditioner and shampoo supplied for the five of us . Water pressure was hot and adequate

We stayed at the Hyatt Place Anaheim for 3 nights. Being a family of 11 we had 3 rooms.  The greeting at the front desk was WOW service and the employee should be commended.  The rooms were very quiet.  We ate 2 days at the breakfast bar and it was excellent with great choices.  Check out was easy at  5 am and the errors on the bill were corrected promptly.  The clerk at checkout was attentive and acknowledged the early hour and even offered fruit to the children as breakfast was not yet available. The location is close to the Disney Parking Lot and shuttle to Disney.  We used Uber which we found more convenient for the price as my husband was on crutches.  If you do not need room service or a hotel shuttle then this is a great hotel for a family going to Disney.

Would recommend a precheck of the room to include checking the toilet flushing, and heat of the room, to prevent folks from checking in to rooms with problems.  The computers were good for checking local information.  The exercise room can be improved with a weight lifting machine containing a bench press, and a pull down machine with 250 lbs. weight.  Would recommend at least one set of 60lb, 70lb, and 80lb dumbells. Also an upright bicycle trainer would be a great improvement.  The Taxi Service was very good.  Would recommend a laundry room and then I would be able to stay longer.  The breakfast was very good and would add pancakes and sausages.  The coffee was very good.  The location was good very close to the convention center.  I was thinking of staying at the Hyatt

Not friendly or informative at front desk.  The location is a good 20 minute walk to Disneyland. It was pouring rain, so we weren't happy. Parking underground is ok. Lobby is small, bad lighting.  If more than three people are checking in, it's crowded.

a girlfriends getaway to dland! We had one day/night to get away to do some Christmas shopping and enjoying the decorations at DLand. Our stay was great but the beds were clearly old and not the quality we expect from Hyatt. Other then that the property was great! Will stay again but ask for a room with new mattresses!

Summary Heading: Very quiet hotel within walking discount to convention center and close to Disney
Summary: Very quiet hotel despite being sold out. Free breakfast that should meet all of your dietary needs. Includes hot and cold beverages, pastries, eggs, meats, lots of fruit, cereal, oatmeal, potatoes, and other breakfast items. There is no gift shop so purchase your Disney gifts before leaving the parks. Hotel workers were very helpful and courteous. Rooms are very large and includes a sofa bed. All the amenities of most name brand hotels.

This is what Hyatt really is. Stayed at a King room , very spacious , clean and quiet . The beds are extremely comfortable and the furnitures are relatively new. We particulary liked the shower room and their signature sofa bed !

Summary Heading: Always a pleasure- repeat guests forever!
Summary: We love this hotel! We have stayed here a total of three times now as we visit Disneyland once a year. I decided it was time to tell the world what a GEM this place is! The staff is always friendly, the rates competitive, the rooms AMAZINGLY clean and comfortable, breakfast yummy, location ideal- checks all the boxes! We have a family of four and we love the hot breakfast; it really starts our day off on the right foot. Its a quick 5 minute walk to the Toy Story Parking lot where you can pick up a shuttle to the parks and a 5 minute walk to a CVS for any essentials you may have forgotten to pack or not anticipated needing. We love this hotel and anticipate staying many times in the future!

Waffles tasted funny. Eggs and sausage didn't seem fresh. Everything else was fine. No direct shuttle service to Disneyland but shuttle available about 7 minutes away.  Rooms updated and trendy. Very clean. Nice pool and jacuzzi that is open until 9 pm.

I think it is a good property, very clean, located about 0.5 miles from disney (walk about 2 blocks to free shuttle to disney) and has free breakfast. But it is not cheap. Costed about $200 per night during long weekend. Parking is $18 per night. Breakfast is ok, not how it is hyped, too crowded if you go after 8:00 and not much for vegetarians.

One of the best hotels to stay at if you're not wanting to shell out for a Disney property.   LOCATION: Super close to parks.  FOOD: Ample breakfast buffet with 24-hour snack bar. POOL: Has one, but tiny and dingy. Wish it was better. ROOM & BATH: Very large, clean and modern.  BED: Comfortable. PARKING: Large underground lot competitively priced.   The only cons would be the lackluster pool and the VERY LOUD air conditioner. I've stayed at this hotel quite a few times, and it has a 50/50 track record of keeping me up at night.

Summary Heading: Great Value, Great Location, Great Service, Great Hotel
Summary: If you're looking for place to stay that is welcoming to families for your Disney trip, this place is great. The parks are a quick bus ride away or a 15 minute walk. The convention center is just a block or so away as well. Hotel is clean and the staff is top tier. From top to bottom.

Our stay at the Hyatt Place was amazing. All staff is very nice and welcoming. Our room featured a king bed and bunk bed which our kids LOVED. Not too far from Disney parks. We will definitely be back

The hotel was very clean and the room was spacious. We have two teenage kids and the room with the bunks and king sized bed was perfect. It was wonderful having the extra space. The best part is you could close the door between the two sleeping areas so that way the kids could watch what they wanted on their TV and so can you. üòä We would definitely stay where again.

Very friendly staff, nice to get a early check in! Good location to walk or Uber to Disney. Clean and comfy room. Extra blankets and towels were nice to have available. Nice variety for breakfast too!

Very pleased with this hotel. Breakfast was good. Easy walk to Disneyland or jump on a shuttle bus at the near by Toy Story lot. Rooms were spacious and the queen beds were surprisingly comfy! The sofa bed was also quite handy with kids along. We will definitely stay here again.

A family of five fit nicely in the bunk bed family suite. Breakfast was great, hot and provided a nice variety. All hotel staff was welcoming, friendly and genuinely cared for our family and it‚Äôs needs! Hotel was situated within great walking distance of the Disneyland theme parks.

Summary Heading: Had a great stay at Hyatt Place.  Great bunk bed hotel for the kids.
Summary: Breakfast is great and hotel is located close to bus shuttles to Disney or a 20 min walk.Wish that there were closer restaurants for dinner options.  Ruth Chris's is supposed to be excellent but not really a economical family restaurant.  Starting to need updates and definitely new pillows.

Had a wonderful two night stay here.  Very close to Disneyland, and could walk to the Toy Story free shuttle.  All staff were very courteous.  My room was near the elevator, so it was quite noisy early in the morning, but overall was a great stay.

This place really needs an overhaul. The walls are paper thin. I heard kids running and screaming theough the halls all hours of the night. The bathroom door caught on the floor so every time we closed it there was the awful scraping metal sound. One out of the three days had good breakfast. But good luck getting a table. We had to sit half our party outside and the other half inside. The elevator takes about 5 minutes to reach the third floor. So if your kids are excited it feels like hours. Then it's so crowded when it does come that you have to wait for the next. We chose this from a travel site that has it included in their Disney "good neighbor" program. You get what you pay for. Wish I had payed to stay at Disney or somewhere nicer. The only pro was that my in-laws fit in

The only good thing about this hotel is the staff.  The staff was kind and did their best to help us.The King w/ Bunk beds room that we booked was not available.Had to move rooms because the shower in the first room had only scalding hot water.The room that we moved to was next to the ice machine.  It woke us up at 2 AM.The HVAC unit was loud.

Everything was perfect.  Convenient to restaurants, drug stores, and Disney. Great breakfast with an extensive selection. Very comfortable room.  Perfect for my 2 night stay.  Take uber vs a taxi.. $25 difference.

When we visit Disney we always try and get a hotel that has a family suite with bunk beds and a separate room that can be closed off.  This was the first time we got a room like this at the Hyatt. It worked out well for us. The room was very spacious and accommodating and did not disappoint.  The bunk beds we comfortable (I tried the top bunk myself). The queen bed was good as well.  We did request a Veiw on the upper floor but only got the second floor with not much of a view of anything.  This hotel is just on the edge of too far to walk. Our kids are old enough (10 & 8) and enough energy that we were able to most of the time. Other wise was a $6 Uber ride. The pool was a bit small but not busy when ever we went.  The hot tub was nice but too many chemicals like most hotel hot

Liked the location was very close to theme parks, did not know about the parking fees until arrival which I was not planning on it my budget. Arrived on mine and my daughters birthday and no one wished us happy birthday. The breakfast was great each morning. We stayed for 4 days total and liked the fact of the bar in lobby to be able to grab a drink after a long day at the theme parks. The bed was way too hard and woke up with my back hurting each morning. Overall it was a good experience but was a little expensive at 190 per night with parking.

My husband and I recently stayed at the Hyatt Place and had a wonderful time. We were there with our business partner for the Mega Success 14 conference and were thoroughly pleased with our experience. The hotel was wonderful, the staff friendly, and overall we were happy! Breakfast was wonderful and made everything go smoothly. We would definitely recommend the hotel.

Hotel was terrific for a family of 5.  Loved that there was a bedroom and a living room/kitchen.  Hotel staff very friendly and helpful.  Breakfast buffet was large with many options.  Short walk to Disneyland. The pool was refreshing after a long day at Disneyland.

Summary Heading: I'm impressed. My lost & found story.
Summary: We left behind a watch. Hotel told us to contact Housekeeping. I wasn't hopeful. Housekeeping employee Blanca Cruz took care of us over the phone even followed up with UPS who had botched the return. She got me a tracking number. I don't think I've ever had an employee so darn pleasant and helpful.   Hotel breakfast room was great. Self serve but good food including sausage links and eggs. Our specialty room was quite big with lots of kitchen cabinet space. We hated the bathroom "barn door" but that's not the hotel's fault just bad design.  The location is a short walk to the convention center.  We would definitely stay here again.

Hospitality outstanding. From day one Bre at the front desk acknowledged us everyday with warm greetings. The outstanding free breakfasts were waited on timely by Gabriel and his staff. Will rate 5 star and the place to be for a Disneyland vacation.

Summary Heading: I really love the Hyatt Place!  Their breakfast is great.  Hotel is clean.  Nice staff. Generous with late check outs.
Summary: I switched from having my family stay at Hilton Embassy Suites to Hyatt Place because these hotel rooms are cleaner and better maintained.  The staff is friendly and know my room accommodation preferences. They are great with allowing late check outs.  Room prices are reasonable if you just want to get away for a weekend locally.  Only thing I recommend is that you bring your own pillows as theirs are really hard.

Summary Heading: Clean, quality hotel with lackluster service
Summary: We stayed for a family trip to Disney. The rooms and breakfast were excellent. However, I was extremely disappointed by the service. I called the front desk several times from our room to request a few extra pillows, and there was no response after about five different tries. I finally went downstairs to the lobby myself and saw a couple of staff members just hanging around! Also, after requesting the pillows, they weren‚Äôt brought up until three hours later, when we had already gone to bed.They also quoted me for $18 for parking, but conveniently left out that a parking tax and fee would be added to that total. And the location is a bit far to walk back and forth. It‚Äôs doable, but I don‚Äôt think we will stay here again.

Summary Heading: A super clean stay with an incredibly kind staff.
Summary: From my experience the whole property was super clean and just as the previous reviews had mentioned the staff is wonderful! I'm not sure on value so I'll put excellent m, this was a worktripns insure on cost.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We are happy to hear you enjoyed your experience with us, and your comments will be celebrated with the staff! We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Excellent hotel. Clean rooms, friendly staff. I would definitely recommend it to anyone traveling for business and to families going on vacation. The staff really tries their best to make everyone feel welcome and comfortable.

Summary Heading: Large room with 3 beds, a hearty breakfast and late checkout

The room was perfect because it had two beds (plus a sofa bed), which meant that we were able to fit 5 people comfortably. It was also lovely because the breakfast was tasty and filling (oatmeal, eggs, bacon, potatoes, waffles, cereal, yogurt and lots of FRESH FRUIT, including strawberries and blueberries!). The breakfast area was not too crowded, because it was only free for Hyatt members, which people could choose to sign up on the spot on the greeter's iPad.  The Hyatt Place sent out of their way to make our stay special. They gave us free drinks and a "prize" if you spin a wheel-of-fortune like device at the check-in desk. Then when my daughter (age 5) went down for breakfast, the staff
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We are happy to hear you enjoyed your experience with us, and your comments will be celebrated with the staff! We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: The Hyatt Place is clean comfortable and very quiet. The breakfast was great the rooms were very clean check-in was a breeze and the staff is very friendly. It is very convenient for Disneyland just a few minute walk to Disney's Woody parking lot it is a free ride to Disneyland.A few blocks The Garden Walk where you will find many restaurants. This hotel is Affordable safe and very clean we're glad you chose the Hyatt Place.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We are happy to hear you enjoyed your experience with us, and your comments will be celebrated with the staff! We look forward to your next visit!

The room was big enough for all 5 of us. 2 queen beds and a sofa bed. Room smell fresh, sheets was crisp, bed was comfortable and clean, most of all room was dust free..... thank you Housekeeping! It would have been nice if the hot tub was open later than 10:00 pm and breakfast had more choices. However I would go back and I would recommend this hotel to all!  Thank to Sales department for giving me a great deal!

Summary Heading: Good Stay - but changes are happening. "It's the little things"..
Summary: We returned again to the Hyatt Place after many previous positive experiences.  The rooms are good sized. Not cramped or difficult to move around in. Our room was a 2 Queen with a pull out sofa. We didn't use the sofa but, historically, it is a typical pull out sofa mattress. The Queens were relatively comfortable but not as much as the King we had last visit. Only two pillows per bed this trip, but the front desk was more than happy to provide extras as needed. There was not an extra blanket in the room. Because I have a dislike for the overweight "x-ray blanket" duvets they put on the beds, a regular blanket is a must. Again, they were quick in getting me a regular blanket upon request.   There is a flat screen tv on the desk / chest of drawers with plenty of channel options,

Summary: The Hyatt place is located  about 2 large  blocks  from Disneyland which is OK on the way to the park but seems a long way after walking  around  Disneyland  all day. The buffet  breakfast  before going into the park was great so we didn't to queue in long lines for food.  Would definitely  recommend  the Hyatt

I came for business trip and will probably be back here 10 times in the coming months but even as a loyal Hyatt member I don't think I would come back until I heard the WiFi had been upgraded.

Summary: This hotel was booked as part of a package holiday. Upon arriving the staff member at the desk was extremely friendly and answered all of our questions. The hotel looks very grand as you approach it and the lobby is equally attractive. The rooms were clean and big, the only let down was the very dated bathroom. The only other gripe I have is that the bed sheets felt cheap. The TV had some great channels for the short periods of time we were in the room. There is a small shop in the lobby to grab some snacks/water, but it is extremely over priced. There is also a Starbucks on site, but it can get very busy in the mornings. The fitness room was great. Great location for all the attractions, particularly the Disney parks.

Summary: This was a clean attractive hotel within walking distance (0.7 mi) of Disneyland resort. I recommend Ubering to parks for under $7/trip. The hotel needs to improve breakfast service--food so so/only available to 9am. Bed comfy/pillows hard. Only outlet near room desk didn't work. No desk light. Thin walls--can hear kids shouting/adults talking in hallway at 7am. Bath towels vary from rough and thin to fluffy and comfy. Good water pressure. Called to confirm my room the morning of check in and was told a quiet room top floor (away from elevator) was reserved for me. At check in, was assigned top floor but right next to elevator. Of course, no other family room was available. I did get a decent AAA rate on this hotel so overall would still recommend with some reservations listed

Summary Heading: Perfect spot for a Disneyland princess visit
Summary: Took our 7 year old goddaughter to Disney for a long weekend by herself with godparents and hotel worked out perfectly. Her first time overnight away from home and 6 siblings. Warm welcome, even gave her stickers at front desk for her autograph book. And when they learned that she was spending her own money for her daily chocolate cupcake fix, they just gave it to her. Room with 2 QN beds spacious. Local restaurant recommendations from front desk spot on and figured out a new trick to keep everyone happy -- head to the pool and have dinner delivered. Less hassle to get everyone out of the pool, dressed, walk to dinner and reverse process for tired bodies and feet; just meet delivery person in lobby and discretely have dinner poolside. Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We are happy to hear you enjoyed your experience with us, and your comments will be celebrated with the staff! We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: Very disappointing accommodations. Wifi was never strong enough to allow my tablet to work, so I had to burn data time on my phone to be connected. No movie channels. No "quiet rooms" available with a single king, because they're all on the top floor next to the constant hum of machinery on the roof. Ice machine is very noisy and the room has no door to cover access from the hallway. Staff was VERY pleasant with us, but not very on top of their duties with other guests that had difficulty registering. We watched in horror as a family of six was turned away at the end of a day at the park, because of some miscommunication with other family members that made the reservation. They were unable to provide an answer as to why their wifi wouldn't provide enough boost to operate devices

Summary Heading: Convenient, clean place for Disney trip with very friendly staff
Summary: This was our first stay at the location.  I bought ART shuttle passes but we never used them as this was only an easy 10 minute walk to the park.  We stayed in the room that had a separate area with bunk beds & a pull out couch with pocket doors separating it from the rest of the room.  It even had another TV in there which was great for the kids.  Full breakfast was included, with varied offerings including waffles, eggs, oatmeal, cereals, fruit.. Everyone found something they liked to eat.  Check in & out was quick and every single staff member I encountered was friendly and helpful.  The only reason I deducted on the rating for sleep is that both the bed and pillows were harder than I like so I had a hard time getting good sleep, but that is a personal preference so just FYI.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us despite the inconvenience with the bed and pillows.. We hope you give us another chance to exceed your expectations soon!

Breakfast crew attentive, clean, hard workers Lety pleasant especially catering to hoards of hungry peopleBoth of the women who work breakfast are hard workers. Summary: Our family of four (2 adults and 2 teens) stayed for five nights in an over sized double queen suite. The room was spacious and clean. There are no laundry facilities on the property (they only offer dry clean service).  We were told that we could use the laundry facilities in the adjacent property, but they only had 2 washing machines and they were being used when we went there.  I think that a place that caters mostly to families with children (since it is so close to Disneyland) should have laundry facilities on site!  Also, the breakfast area does not have enough tables. Summary: The door lock was misaligned so it did not work on my room unless I lifted the whole door.  My room did not have working internet, or a working phone.  My dry cleaning was a day later than promised. They tried to make up for it and the staff was very helpful, but it was a painful experience and certainly the worst hotel experience I've ever had in years of business travel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback on your recent stay. We apologize for the inconveniences you experienced during your stay. We will look into your concerns and have them addressed right away. If you would like to discuss further, please contact the hotel. It is very important that our guests have an exceptional experience with us and we are sorry we dropped the ball.

Summary: We were a family of ten and loved every minute of our stay.  The staff were fantastic, greeted us with a smile every time we entered the lobby, knew our names and went out of their way to make our stay most enjoyable.  Any problems we had were sorted immediately. The breakfast was great and set us up for the day.  The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. An easy  walk to Disney from this hotel.  Thank you for a great stay, we would highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of your recent stay with us. We are so glad you enjoyed our beautiful property and amazing team. We hope you visit again soon!

Summary Heading: Perfect for our trip to Disney Land
Summary: The breakfast and happy hour made us happy. It is close to Disney Land and very comfortable. We took the bus from the hotel to Disney and that was very convenient.  There isn't really view of the fireworks, it is too far away, so I wouldn't upgrade to that. .. not worth it.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments. We are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay. Please visit again soon!

Summary: Great location for Disneyland. Daily breakfast was super Convenient although the options were essentially the same every day.  Clean and updated hotel with welcoming and excellent staff.  The pool isn‚Äôt anything to write home about but it was nice to have.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We are happy to hear you enjoyed your experience with us. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: We had a very nice stay at this hotel. Rooms are nice, staff is very good, serves complimentary breakfast, has a bar, nice eating/social area, underground parking, close enough to Disneyland to walk or take the complimentary Disneyland parking bus across the street .
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your comments . We are so glad you enjoyed your stay with us. We hope you come to visit again soon!

Summary: Hyatt Place is in a fantastic location. A quick walk to Disney, the Convention Center and tons of fine dining and family restaurants. A great choice whether you are in town for business, pleasure or both!
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback on your recent stay. We are glad you enjoyed our great location. We look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary: Wondering experience would definitely stay again!!! The room was clean and spacious. The staff was prompt and friendly not to mention they offered free complementary breakfast buffet prefect for our family stay!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments on your recent stay. Our team is happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us. We hope you visit again soon!

Summary: Anaheim Hyatt Place was amazing! Under extreme conditions with a 3 block city  electrical outage they did an excellent job. Not only going out 3 times for flashlights but offered food, drinks and the best customer service
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words. It was a very challenging time for our team and they did everything they could to take care of our guests. We truly appreciate your feedback. I will share your comments with our team.

Summary: Excellent stay, close to everything. We had a wonderful time. Just didn't like paying for parking. I would recommend this Hyatt  to all my friends.  If you are looking for a great place to stay this is the place for you.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments. We are glad you enjoyed your stay with us. We hope you have the opportunity to visit us again!

Summary Heading: Nice place for vacation or business
Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Place last week for a few days. We loved our room, the hotel was very clean and the pool was really nice! The hotel offered a great breakfast everyday which was one of the best breakfasts we‚Äôve ever had at a hotel (its usually cereal and fruit), we had waffles, egg bowls, fresh fruit and sausage! It‚Äôs at a great location being close to the convention center and Disneyland, but the only thing we would have liked was a shuttle. I can understand not offering one to Disneyland since those buses run often, but if you‚Äôre going somewhere else within a mile radius it would be appreciated without using the private driver or Uber. We would recommend the hotel and seemed really nice for families as well.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback on your recent stay with us. We are very happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us. I will share your feedback with our team. We hope you visit again soon!

Summary: We had a great stay, I have absolutely no complaints.  The pool was very basic, but the hot tub was HOT, which I love.  The breakfast was full of options.  Housekeeping staff were great, came back to a clean room after a long day at Disney.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your comments on your recent stay! We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us. We hope you visit again soon!

Summary: My husband and I stayed here recently for a quick getaway (Sun. thru Tues.) The hotel, lobby, guestroom and dining areas were very clean, well lit, and inviting. Our room had two queen beds, a large sofa sleeper, mini-fridge, coffee maker and plenty of room. I was impressed with the size. The AC/Heater worked great. The noise level was very minimal during our stay (though I could hear our neighbors showering, and footsteps above us...... but not too bothersome). The beds and pillows are very firm. I brought my own pillow, my husband did not (he regretted that decision). The front desk staff was so friendly, always greeting us as we came and went. Nice to be acknowledged. The dining staff was spot-on during breakfast to keep the food items well stocked and the coffee fresh. (the
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments on your recent stay. We are so glad you enjoyed your stay with us. We hope you visit again soon!

Summary: I took students down to a conference and stayed at Hyatt for our duration. One of the best and friendliest hotels I have ever stayed at and the treated my students well. The free breakfast was great and all the staff were awesome help.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback on your recent stay. It is very important to us that our guests have an amazing experience. We are happy to hear you and your students enjoyed your stay. I will share your kind words with our team. We hope you visit us again soon!

Summary Heading: Good Size for our Family of 5
Summary: It's hard to find one hotel room that will fit our family of 5 comfortably, but the Hyatt Place did just that. We had 2 Queen Size beds and a sofa bed that was actually quite comfortable! Free breakfast was included, which was okay, but we've had better. A very good location though and enjoyable stay.

This was a really nice hotel for a quick trip.  Hotel staff is nice to interact with.  The rooms are really spacious, though the beds and pillows are firm, probably from the updated decor.  Great location.  Bar and food are good.

I visited this hotel due to a conference I was attending.  Overall, it was clean and filled all the basic requirements of a hotel.  They have breakfast which was good.  The coffee is also good and they have apples in the lobby all day.

Woken by housekeeping early (after a late night at Disneyland), and breakfast is very average. Family rooms were great and very clean, which makes the remainder of the experience all the more disapppointing.

The room was small. Charges for parking, water bottles, shuttle, and wifi were high. Pool was a little cold. Honestly,  felt like we paid too much for what we got. We liked the fire pit/s'mores and the walking distance to restaurants.

Summary Heading: Best Place to stay in Anaheim
Summary: Want to be close to Disneyland but not have to deal with the cost of staying in a 'Disney' hotel- Hyatt Place is the place to be. From the exceptionally large rooms, cleanest bathroom and the short walk to the Disney carpark for the free shuttle to the main gate, it was everything that I needed when I was staying at Anaheim. The buffet breakfast was next level- not just cold and continental but hot options that made me smile, and filled me right up for a solid Disney day! The staff were friendly, engaging and accommodating- I shall be back!

Summary Heading: Good Disneyland and Convention Center Hotel
Summary: We had a good experience staying at the Hyatt Place. The staff was helpful and courteous. The room was a good size (2 Queen beds). The breakfast was good, and kept stocked. The walk to the convention center was easy, and the free shuttle bus to Disney was very close, if you didn't want to walk there. We took the shuttle to Disney, and walked to the convention center for the cheer competition. We would stay here again.

Staying at the hotel right now. Have been here two nights. Sheets were stained from day one. Had to get pillows replaced immediately. After two unrestful nights feeling itchy, I finally called to have all sheets and blankets replaced. They told me in the morning that they would replace them. Just came back in the evening and they were not replaced. In addition, I have already noticed two ants in my room. No apologies from the hotel and only offered to spray toxic chemical in the room while I'm staying here.  No thanks!  On the plus side, hotel staff seems pleasant and parking though expensive (nature of the area), is bright and convenient. Breakfast is also descent and I love that they have nondairy milk.   With so many hotels in the area, this would not be my choice of place to

Hotel is very close to the free Disney shuttle bus.  Room was great, really designed for kids. I will be back to this hotel.  They put out fresh fruit during breakfast that you can take with you to Disney, kids loved that.

Summary Heading: In town for a NHL game
Summary: A few friends and I went down to California from Las Vegas to see the Vegas Golden Knights beat up on the LA Kings. This hotel was a little away from LA but well worth the extra travel time. It was walking distance from Disneyland which we went to while in town. We had in and out privileges with parking ($18). The hotel was beautiful. Well maintained. Very Comfortable. Easy to get in and out of. The staff was very friendly and assisted us with everything we needed. I would give them all a shout out but I am horrible with names. so *high five* to every staff member, (insert names here) that I came in contact with! You Rock!! Will we be back to see you again!

Summary Heading: The Staff Makes the Difference at Hyatt Place
Summary: There are plenty of clean, safe, good-value places at which one can stay while on business travel, but it's the quality of the staff, the 24-hour good food, and in-hotel beverage service that makes the difference at this chain.  I don't know how they train and recruit their personnel, but it beats almost all of the other major chain hotels at which I stay.

My family and I had decided to stay at the Hyatt, which was recommended as great hotel, it had a 4.9 out of 5 star rating, during a weekend trip to Disneyland for my son's 5th birthday. Initially when we had booked the hotel, my husband had called and asked about their early check-ins because we would be arriving to Anaheim from our location at about 4 AM because it is a 6 hour drive and we wanted the kiddos to sleep the way up there, and we were told if there were rooms available when we arrived it'd be no extra cost to check in. Well, we got there at 4 AM, we were charged half the price of the suite we had booked because the guy was only authorized to discount that much, and he told us to contact the manager in the morning to waive the price. When we got to our rooms, we were

Great service and a very pleasant stay. Great location to the Disney shuttle and the con enience if snacks and drinks is nice. The Sangria was really good. Great stay. We have stayed here several times and never a problem.

We stayed at Hyatt Place at Anaheim while visiting Disney Land.  Our room had bunk beds a large corner couch, two flat screen tv's and in a room separated by slider doors was a queen bed.  Excellent space for a family of 4.  The room was great, the breakfast was very good and the service was excellent.  Overall, a great experience.

Summary Heading: Would recommend for anyone looking for a good rate while staying in Anaheim
Summary: We booked this and plane tickets from Priceline, was our second choice since the first hotel was sold out when we went to select. I'm glad we ended up staying here. Check-in and check-out were both a breeze, and the staff was exceptional even helping in getting us some delivery menus since we got in a lot later than anticipated.   The rooms themselves were solid. We were in a king sized bed with pull-out sofa. Shower and no tub, but decent sized shower. Had a mini-fridge, single serve coffee maker, and a small safe to hold valuables in while you're out and about. The room we were in happened to be at the intersection to the elevators, so we did get some noise after-hours from groups headed back in and being a little loud, but otherwise no real issues.   They have a complimentary

Stayed here for a convention, the hotel was very crowded, but the staff was always very nice. The rooms were clean, the bed was a little hard, but even staying right next to the elevator, the room was mostly quiet. I would stay here again because of the friendly staff, clean rooms, and safe area.

We had a wonderful time and this hotel is a trusted go to in Anaheim.  Always can expect a great time, good breakfast, and very clean spacious room. Friendly staff as well. I'll stay here every time I am in the area.

Just recently stayed a short one night stay. Extremely clean, staff welcoming - upon arrival greeted with a smile and given an upgrade upon arrival.   The parking garage  under the hotel was clean and accessible and had good lighting.  Room and furniture was in great shape and bathroom was very clean. I would stay at this hotel again.

The hotel is within easy walking distance to Disneyland and the hot breakfast bar was great. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was of good size and clean. I will definitely stay at this hotel the next time I come back.

The room was clean and fresh!  Size of room was great for our family - didn't feel like we were on-top of each other.  Staff was kind and caring and helpful! The breakfast had a great variety - everyone in our family found food that they were willing to eat ;)!

Summary Heading: Fine, but wouldn‚Äôt stay here with my family again.
Summary: We traveled from Northern California with our 4 kids to go to Disneyland. We are world of Hyatt members and have always had the best experience with Hyatt place, and trusted that this would be a good hotel. We were disappointed in the service, and comfort of the room/breakfast/service. I won‚Äôt stay at this location again.

Summary Heading: Poor Place for Vacation (for food lovers)
Summary: Hotel is clean, staff is nice, well located but it has fundamental problem. They do not have restaurant. They have limited selection of food (I think kind of ready made food) which is too poor. Worst of all they told me that they do not have snacks for my drinks.. I do not think it is a good place for holiday makers who consider eating and drinking good food inside hotel is important to feel good. There is no close by restaurants (or at least I did not notice any popular name brand restaurant around it).  I think in the same price range (or probably lesser) there are better choices available in Anaheim such as Ayres. My last experience in Ayres was better than this hotel.    Special Note : Vivian (front desk girl) was very kind to me to ensure that I have best upgraded room

The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. They helped me arrange airport transportation, going as far as finding me the cheapest rate. The rooms were large,clean and comfortable. I especially enjoyed the soft bath towels,that smelled fresh. We were on the 3rd floor and could hear kids running above us and people talking next to us. Not so loud as to keep us awake though. The free full breakfast was great. It had pancakes one day znd waffles the next. Disney parking lot is a block away. We walked to it and got on a bus there free of charge and rode it back at night. A tip from hotel staff. This hotel charges for parking, but there is plenty of spaces to park. We would definitely stay again.

This was a good place for the money. I'd stay there again for the location and cost. The breakfast could use a meat every day but other than that and the fact that the hot tub looked like it had too many chemicals in it, it was a good place in a good location.

I would have liked this closer to Disneyland.  I had the impression from all the travel info that it was closer to Disneyland, but it was quite a hike to walk.  The shuttles that run on the street  in front of the hotel were confusing to figure out, and the hotel staff were not clear on the cost.

Summary Heading: Good hotel for visit to Disneyland
Summary: My family and I stayed at this Disneyland Good Neighbor hotel in March 2018 during a visit to Disneyland and California Adventure.  The hotel looks fairly new.  The rooms and public areas were clean.  The room setup is like that of other Hyatt Places I have stayed at: a divider separated the seating area from the bed.  There was a L-shaped couch which pulled out into a sofa bed.   There was a small fridge but no microwave in the room.  However, there was a microwave in the lobby for guest use.  We took a shuttle from John Wayne Airport to the hotel.  It was about a 30 minute trip.  Pros:  We picked this hotel in part because it offered a breakfast buffet as part of the room rate.  Breakfast service began at 6:30 a.m. on weekdays.  The selections were just okay.  But I liked that

We stayed here for two nights to spend a day at Disney. We always love staying at a Hyatt Place since it comes with breakfast and has a pullout couch for the kids. The staff were helpful and the room was very clean.

Summary Heading: Great for famlies! Quick breakfast/more disney time
Summary: This is a great place for families traveling to Disneyland. Plenty of space with separate living room and free breakfast. The breakfast saves you a ton of time (don't have to go out to eat breakfast, no extra cost, and you get to head to Disney with not a time wasted. It's about 20 min walk (pretty long with kids or older folks) instead walk 5 min to Toy Story parking lot at the corner of the street and you can take the free Disney shuttle to main gate. It's so easy! You can also buy park tickets at hotel counter saving you a ton of time from waiting in line at Disney ticket counters. Will definitely stay with them our next Disney trip.

This is a typical Hyatt Place setup.    Rooms were spacious for a family of 4. Two children.  Room had a weird humming noise due to possible electrical or heating and air set up.  Can be drowned out by white noise.   Breakfast was adequate and tasty.   FYI - Parking car was easy in below deck parking. Could keep car parked for full day and walk to Disneyland about 15 min walk.  No biggie.   Special thanks to Mike and his breakfast staff.  I had looked at breakfast time on Hyatt app and there was a mistake as they listed breakfast ending at 9:30.  Breakfast actually ends at 9.  I called the front desk to confirm and Mike took the the time to contact me back and say he could whip something up for us.  5 star Mike!!!!   I don‚Äôt think I even get this type of service from Park Hyatt.

The room is clean and spacious. The beds are very small, listed as queens but definitely closer to a full size. The breakfast was a terrible experience each morning so we opted for Starbucks to avoid the circus. The walls are very thin and we were woken up at 1:00 a.m. to screaming crying toddlers. That were taking a bath from what I could gather. I have kids myself so I wasn‚Äôt upset just shocked at how much you can hear through the walls.

Our family has stayed here many times for sports tournaments - we like the large rooms and proximity to the convention center. The hotel is clean and front desk staff are helpful and friendly.  Competitive rate with AAA.  Only complaint, elevators are sometimes slow.

Summary Heading: Convenient for Disney, modern and clean
Summary: Our group of 6 stayed at this hotel.  The room had two queens and a pull out couch, with plenty of room to walk about. No balcony, but that was ok for us. The room was modern, clean and in good condition.  The beds, as others mention, are so-so and the pillows awful. Our room was near the main road and noisy.  I think we just had a poorly located room. The pool area is small but I think most are in the area. Aside from that, the staff were very helpful, the breakfast was excellent (and I am pretty picky!). I would stay here again, but request a room away from the road.

This is a well run hotel, newer, nicely decorated and convenient for Disneyland. The staff are well trained and from the front desk to food service, room cleaners and maintenance all we encountered were more than helpful and friendly. It is obvious they have been well trained by the hotel chain, and could easily move over and work at Disneyland - they were that good. They appear to have the authority to make decisions to assist guests with and issue without needing to check with a supervisor or manager. This is unusual, and much appreciated and is textbook management 101!  The only issue with the room was the blackout blind was not in the track, but I forgot to mention this on checkout. The breakfast was excellent however the setup could be better as cutlery was not available

This is the best Hyatt Place I have stayed at. I usually stay at a Hyatt Place because of the spacious rooms. This one was very clean, nothing was breaking. Bed was comfortable. Nice view. The free wifi was surprisingly great. The free breakfast was decent. You can easily walk to many restaurants. The only bad thing is that the doors slam extremely loud and it will scare the crap out of you when your neighbor slams their door. Also, the parking fees are the highest I've ever paid in any city.

There is no shortage of places to stay when you go anywhere near Disneyland, but I can assure you, stop looking and just stay here! From the moment we arrived, we experienced excellent customer service and convenience around every corner. Heck, I was even given a complimentary glass of wine after they discovered it was my birthday the next day! They have well-lit, easy underground parking with an elevator that takes you directly up to the lobby or your room. It is $18 to park, but that's what you pay for most Disneyland lots, and I enjoyed the security and ease of the hotel parking. We stayed in a double queen and it was incredibly spacious and very clean. I loved how we had space for our luggage and the kids had room to lounge in the couch area having a snack ... no eating in

My wife and I travel a lot and I can honestly say that the Hyatt Place has the worst bedding I have ever experienced. The mattresses and the pillows were so hard that I could not sleep well the two nights we were here. The hotel itself is nice and clean and the staff was great but the poor quality of the bedding would stop me from staying here again.

The staff was very nice and accomodating, but the beds were ROCK HARD AND SO UNCOMFORTABLE that neither guest in my party was able to sleep much for the few nights we stayed here. We could also hear every noise coming from outside our room including the entire conversation of the family inn the next room at 6AM! This hotel is too expensive to experience the level of discomfort we experienced staying here. Unfortunately, I do not recommend this hotel.

Hyatt Place Anaheim I am awake itching terribly after being awoken by the terrible sounds of the AC/heat unit which literally has been sounding like a large truck idling outside my window. I got up to take video and recording of the awful sound, got back in bed and felt something biting me.  Went into the bathroom to try and put something on to calm the itching but nothing is making it better. I was already prepared to say something to the front desk about the noise from the unit and the terrible bedding. Oh, did I mention the bedspread and the pillows crinkle like plastic bedding for bed wetters. Yeah that‚Äôs comforting.   I literally love Hyatt Place. It is my favorite and I always recommend my friends to stay at my favorites like PDX. This is the first time I have felt the

The staff is what makes this hotel so great clean delicious breakfast clean rooms inviting lobby every worker curteous helpful and very professional Kudos to Sancho Brittany Lillie Berta Jocelyn Debbie Vivian Dominique  Leticia Ashley Samantha and many other hard workers I did not get their names Special shout out to Shainah for her helpfulness and beautiful Lani who embodies the aloha spirit So good to see Lani still there always servicing the guest with aloha and remembering us from hawaii. The workers here do their job really well housekeeping to kitchen to front desk. Nothing negative about this property must have a good manager for auch a great staff and crew.

We stayed here for an overnight trip to Disneyland for our anniversary.  We chose the Hyatt Place because of it's location across the street from Disney's Toy Story parking lot.  It's just a short walk to the Toy Story lot and nice to take the bus into the Disney resort area instead of walking to the parks, especially at the end of the night when you're super tired.  We drove up so we parked in the Hyatt Place's underground parking garage.  It was well lit and felt safe.  The elevator from the parking garage goes to the lobby and through to the floors of the hotel.  You don't have to take a separate elevator to get you your room.  The staff at the Hyatt Place was very friendly and they had a room available for us at check-in which was great.  The room was spacious and clean and

Everything was Great even borderline exemplary, except for the Breakfast.  To start they only give you a three hour window anyday of the week, that wouldn't have been so bad had the dining room not been so small that there was usually a wait during mid operating hours.  Once you got yourself a table, the offerings are only three different types of fruits, yogurt, scrambled eggs, white bread, wheat bread, and an alternating bacon or sausage along with orange juice, apple juice, milk, water, and coffee.  That's all folks.  I'm thinking who's ever running this place thinks its Lent everyday of the year, since other properties by other brands that I won't name here offers a wider variety of hot foods not to mention more varieties of breads like;  muffins, danish, croissants, etc.

Summary Heading: We were attending a conference that was at the Convention Center.
Summary: The location to the Convention Center was very close. If we were going to Disneyland it would have been a perfect location for that as well (didn't go on this trip). The room was very clean and had a small sitting area with a coach which was nice so we didn't have to watch TV on our bed. The breakfast was FREE and it was very nice with several selections to choose from. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Great Location.  The staff was very thoughtful!  Free, huge breakfast, which makes such a difference with a family vacation!  New, clean room. And the room was spacious!  Check in and check out was so easy.

I stayed at this particular Hyatt Place as it was close to the Disneyland Park.  We stayed here for a total of three nights and I think it was a great choice!  The hotel and rooms are updated compared to other Hyatt Place hotels that I have stayed in previously.  They do provide complimentary breakfast in the morning, but it does end at 9:00a and as people have noted, there is not a massive amount of tables/chairs to sit at (so get their early!).  The walk to the Disneyland Parks is a bit further than some of the other hotels in the area, so be prepared for that (about 15-20 minutes).  We were greeted by the Front Desk staff every time that we came and left, even if they were with other guests which is a nice touch.  We definitely appreciated the underground parking too.  If

Stayed here when we visited Disneyland for a couple of days and were very satisfied with the comfort and location.  It‚Äôs really not too far from Disneyland, about 15-20 min walk to the entrance of Disneyland.  It‚Äôs also about less than 5 min walk to Toy Story parking lot across the street where you can catch the complementary Disney shuttle which leaves and arrives every 5 minutes. You don‚Äôt have to park there to catch a ride. Super convenient.  Our room was really clean and spacious - got a room with 2 queen beds for the family.  The room even has a nice sitting area with comfortable sofa and love seat and a coffee table.  Beds were very comfortable. Slept really well.  My only minor complain was the free WiFi was kinda weak and took a while to connect during our stay.  The

Summary Heading: Nice but pretty far away from Disneyland
Summary: Went to Disney for 2 nights, the rooms was nice but $18 plus tax for parking was steep especially when the hotel is so far away from the park.  We Uber often but had a large group so we walked.  Despite the listing on their website, it is a tiresome walk when you go both ways, plus the 8 miles in the park.  Breakfast was decent but the seating area needs to double in size. Check Inn and Check out were great. There are no vending machines on site so no late night bag of chips.

Nice, fairly large rooms and quite clean. Right by the convention center and Disneyland area is walkable for many (20-25 minutes) if you want to skip shuttle/Uber. Staff was friendly and helpful.   While I like this property overall, the pillows are TERRIBLE. I don't understand why they are so bad but they are. There are also homeless people in the area who seem harmless but might be an issue for some folks, as it doesn't seem there is any real security.

I stayed at this hotel for a work conference. I thought that the property was well maintained and clean. The rooms i stayed in were spacious. I had originally booked a one bedroom with a king bed, but they were out of those rooms. So they upgraded me to a a larger room with a seperate sleeping area for children (which I didn't need). The staff was very considerate and helpful. The grounds were nice and the property wasn't far from Disney Land.

Summary Heading: Great Place to stay with the family.
Summary: The rooms are kept well and the staff are very accommodating and helpful. It is what customer service should really be. The breakfast buffet is Fantastic! Hopefully they would  include the mini bar in their rates.

Hyatt Recency with beautiful atrium at amazing price with king bed. They get you back with self park for $28/36 for valet, beer is  $9/ in atrium but nice. Food is good if you eat there. Service is very good as they hire good people.

I have stayed here twice and both times it was great!! The room has so much space and I loved the gym and breakfast!! It was a bit noisey but that‚Äôs not the hotels fault at all. I would stay here again

Excellent location! Clean, modern rooms. Plenty of power outlets. Quiet and and comfortable ... nice bed and sitting / TV area. Breakfast included. Pool and hot tub are fine but not special (no slides or waterfalls etc. ... I only mention this because it is so near Disney and many Disney hotels and even others have ‚Äúfeature‚Äù pools). Overall it‚Äôs a hotel I would return to. Many choices of good restaurants within walking distance and Disney is very close too.

We stayed in this hotel because it was at a walking distance from Disney Land. We arrived very early and new our room wasn't gonna be ready, so we left our luggage at the Hotel and off we went to the Disneyland, unfortuantelly my daugther got sick, so I took her back to the hotel hoping that our room would be ready (this was still before check-in time), so the room was not ready. The nice lady at the front desk, gave my daughter a blanket and after a short while she gave us a room that was available earlier and she had offered to me that was more expensive and I had rejected for the same price of my original one. For that I was so greatful. Later the Chef that was from Chile prepared special food for her. They both went out of their ways to make our life easier. Thanks for that.

Loved our room, bunk bed for the kids, pull out couch. King bed was like sleeping on a cloud. The staff was amazing. Breakfast was better than any complimentary breakfast ive ever had at a property. The price was great, the stay was great, and I will be back again!

We stayed here for a family vacation to Disneyland. The staff were very welcoming upon check-in. The room was nice and clean. It was exactly what we expected. Their complementary morning breakfast was great!

Nice place, friendly staff, great breakfast, clean rooms, can walk to Disneyland or Uber it for a reasonable price. Property is a little older and could use an update but it's still a great place to stay.

Spacious room, TVs had capability of connecting HDMI or other devices (such as laptops). Complimentary breakfast was average, though the dining room was busy with kids in the morning after about 8-9. Breakfast ends early on the weekdays so take note the time when checking in.  Parking was $18/night, high but pretty typical for any hotel on this street; worth it if walking to disneyland. Feels like a long walk from deep inside disneyland to the hotel, esp. during late night chilly temps. Room on the 5th floor was quiet. AC/heater vents, no physical AC unit in the room. Bunk beds (single size) were comfortable. Stayed 3 nights; housekeeping forgot to replace bath towels one day and I had to ask for them later that evening, but quickly received them. All in all I would definitely

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel - Great Value and Welcoming - 100% Recommended
Summary: We stayed 5 nights at this property - Thursday to Tuesday so experience weekends as well as mid week. Starting from an attentive and helpful front desk staff we were always treated very well by the staff. We arrived at 7am and they gave priority to getting us into our room, which was achieved around 9.30am.   The included breakfast is well presented and provides a good selection of hot and cold dishes. The park is an easy walk to Disney‚Äôs parks - about 10 minutes, I guess if you had a push chair and several kids it might be a bit of a challenge.  Rooms were spacious, super clean and well appointed. Great shower and handy to have a fridge.  There is a Walgreens downstairs that allows you to pick up supplies - there is also a Starbucks and a Pizza restaurant. Lots of other

Summary Heading: close to disney parking lot and shuttle
Summary: It's close to disney parking lot and shuttle.  This is a big benefit for there is always crowd for busy season and it's hard to find a parking.  The nearby shuttle (Free) service from disney's parking lot would help you.   Morning breakfast is crowd but they provide extra space.

We stayed one night and everything turned out perfect.  We arrived early at 9 am and our room was ready.  After dropping off our luggage we walked across the street to the Disney parking lot and caught the Toy Story shuttle which brought us straight to the front entrance of Disney.  After a long day, we caught the shuttle back. In the morning, the complimentary  breakfast was great! We were able to print out our Universal tickets for free at their computers.  An enjoyable experience!

Summary Heading: Great Hotel , Great Location, Fair Price
Summary: Spent 4 Nights at the Hyatt Place at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center.  Room was large, well appointed, and clean.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Buffet Breakfast was well prepared, tasty, and plentiful.  If you don't want to make the 15 - 20 minute walk to Disneyland, the city bus stops about a 2 minute walk from the hotel.  I would definitely stay there again. . . .

Summary Heading: Disappointing Place for Family Visiting Disneyland
Summary: Lackluster customer service, no shuttle service to Disneyland (unless you walk to a nearby hotel and pay about $17 for a family of 5). Breakfast was not very good but it‚Äôs free.  Do yourself a favor and book the Hyatt Regency Anaheim down the street and you‚Äôll have a far better experience for basically the same price.

I was in Anaheim for a convention. I am glad I booked my stay at the Hyatt Place. The hotels immediately next to the convention center were full and ended bumping guests to their alternate locations that week (my friends had to move back and forth from hotels). Hyatt Place provides a hot and cold breakfast so it was great to have something to eat before heading over to the convention center each day!
