As expected from a breakfast buffet, I wouldn't say the breakfast was spectacular but it did provide options and never ran out of food throughout the breakfast hours. I wasn't there for the pool but if you are visiting and want a large pool, this isn't the place for you. The Hyatt Place is walking distance to the Convention Center. I had an extremely late flight and didn't have time

Loved nearly everything except lousy wifi.  Ritney was amazing and so helpful.  The beds were super comfortable and the layout for a family room were awesome.  The bunk beds and room divider were great for families. Breakfast was good.  Highlight being that bit further away from the maddening Disneyland crowds.  Hot Tub and Pool a bonus too.

Summary Heading: Comfortable beds and close to fun.
Summary: Very clean and comfortable. Friendly staff. Took a Lyft to disneyland for $5. Could‚Äôve walked but hotel was a little further than I thought it would be and wanted to save my feet for all the walking in the park. Slept so well in the beds. They were very comfortable!

Summary Heading: disneyland visit with family and friends
Summary: i mistakenly made reservation at Hyatt Place instead of Hyatt Regency...BIG difference.  Hyatt Place doesn't really have a bar or restaurant and they do not allow you to pay with cash.  Strange rule.  This is a self serve hotel.  I will not rebook at the facility.  Absolutely upgrade to Hyatt Regency where service is 5 stars...Regency is just about 3 blocks away.

Room was big but curtain fell down and the light shined in from outside.  The decoration were limited.  Ok room but cost should be lower. Need to make it feel like the price we paid. Only one night so it worked okay.

Summary Heading: Decent family hotel close to Disneyland
Summary: Spent two nights here during a staycation at Disneyland for the holidays. We are a couple in our early 50s, and we often spend a couple nights in this area visiting Disneyland. At this stay, we were given a room directly outside the elevator entrance which was unexpected as we are discoverist level members. We were also not given free waters as you would expect at this level. Lots of kids at this hotel common which is not unexpected at Disneyland area lodgings. However if you are a Hyatt rewards member you may be disappointed at their lack of recognition. We did not try the buffet as so many people were sick and sneezing all around so we decided to eat elsewhere. Not a problem with the hotel,  just what was going on. This hotel does not have its own shuttle or even its own

The room was comfortable and walking distance to Disney. The king suite with bunk beds was perfect for our family. The included hot breakfast buffet needed improvement and we ended up eating out most days because of the poor quality of the food.

My friends and I are going to Disneyland and we find this place on line. It is close to Disneyland. It is a good place to stay. We really enjoy the breakfast. It has all kinds of food and you can eat whatever you want.

We didn't go to Disney but wanted to be close to the amenities.  It's located far enough from the crazy crowds but close enough if you just want to drive over to downtown Disney.  Breakfast is included and an added convenience. Great stay!

Hotel is older, not worth the money. Needs massive upgrades. Overall feel of everything is old and dirty. Bathroom tile, paint, beds, pillows, rooms etc. Does not match the online marketing your paying for.

Place was very neat and very spacious. Its about 15 min walking distance from Disneyland resort. It has a gym and outdoor heated pool. Staff was very courteous. Breakfast was OK. I did not try any food or beverages. I felt home, coming back after walking so much in Disneyland. TV options were good with most channels.

Everyone was super nice and accommodating!  Rooms were comfortable and clean!!!  Breakfast was great.  Wonderful experience, highly recommend!!! The hotel is contemporary and in a great location.  My family felt safe and there are many restaurant choices near the hotel.

Nice, clean hotel.  Enjoyed the family suite.  Pool was in the shade most of the day and is small.  No shuttle to Disneyland, but hey, ate what we wanted and actually lost weight...logged 122,000 steps, over 40 miles during our stay.  Shuttle would be nice, on those slightly chilly evenings, to jump on and get back to hotel.  Other than that, great breakfast!!!

The location was ideal, only a 15 mins walk to Disneyland. The rooms were very accommodating to large families. The bathroom was spacious and clean. Breakfast area was very large and served the number of guest sufficiently. The front desk staff was welcoming and very helpful. Overall a very pleasant experience.

I've stayed at over 50 hotels in 2017 and this was by far the best experience. The hotel was exactly as expected; clean and well maintained. But what made the difference was the staff. Outstanding attention to detail. My family and I were greeted everyday by name from the staff. The rooms were refreshed perfectly everyday and the breakfast was hot and fresh.

The room was clean and well cared for - they even made up our baby's pack-and-play.  The beds were very good.  The breakfast was excellent with many items and hot food choices changing each day.  The staff was very pleasant and accommodating to our needs.  Very close to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Make sure your room is not below storage room
Summary: The only complaint that we have is noise. If you are not a morning person and would like to sleep pass 9am, don‚Äôt recommend stay here. Kids running and yelling, maid talking and laughing in the hallway were what we experienced during our stay. Moreover, our room was directly below a storage room, you can hear workers walking around and pushing the strollers since 8am, nonstop!!  We called the front desk and they offered late checkout till 2pm. Great! But we still can‚Äôt get any sleep. They offered again another room next door so we can get a few hours of rest. Good idea but we don‚Äôt want to pack and unpack and then repack again..  The location is great though, staff was easy to talk to, however we won‚Äôt be back due to that above experience  FYI $17 parking fee. Ouch!

Friendly night staff the day staff was rude. The breakfast is great and I would go again. My hotel room was very comfortable however when I looked at my pillow they had red stains on them. Would go again.

Only issue for us was some noise. The walls are thin and our neighbor was very loud on the phone - one time at 5am. If you are going to Disneyland, it is close and breakfast included is a big plus. I would stay there again.

I chose to stay at Hyatt Place because I have had such great experience with them in the past. I chose them over a hotel that was closer to Disney because I wanted so much to stay with this company. I just graduated and it was my birthday week, so I wanted everything for my stay to be perfect. We paid for a high floor king and received one-- although they placed us RIGHT by the elevator. This really needs to be informed at check in... not use just a "wait and see if they get upset" method. When we got there, housekeeping was working in the neighboring rooms and yelling/speaking loudly across the hall to one another for about 45 min-1 hour. No matter what time of day, this disturbs guests. We called the front desk and they were completely uninterested and not at all concerned..

We stayed for 4 days in December so that we could visit Disneyland.  The hotel was clean and very quiet.  We really appreciated the black out shades in the room.  The staff was considerate and friendly.  We were late for breakfast but there was still a very nice variety of food that really started out our day on a good note.  We plan on staying here in the future.

My friend and I stayed in the hotel for over a week and we had an amazing time. The staff was caring and genuine. We were not disappointed by any of the services. The complimentary breakfast was good and varied. I recommend 10/10!

My friend and I stayed at the Hyatt Place for one, brief night before going to Disneyland. The room was spacious, understated and comfortable, especially the bed. The pillows were better than at most hotels. A tall, narrow glass screen was between the bed and the sofa. The corner sofa/love seat was very nice. I would have preferred a real coffee table instead of the large ottoman. The bathroom was a good size but could have used a make-up mirror. Everything was clean and in good condition. It was also very quiet, no street noise or noisy neighbors. The check-in staff was very friendly.

This is a wonderful hotel. The only noise I noticed in our room came from footsteps overhead. The breakfast served is good. The staff is great. The hotel is lovely. Our room was large and included a sectional sofa.

The Hyatt Place met all of our expectations!  I highly recommend this hotel the rooms are very large, bedding is exceptional as well as all the amenities offered. Great place to stay and visit Disneyland.

The hotel was great and the staff was very friendly and accommodating! I will definitely stay here again. The breakfast is awesome too! It is close to Disneyland. The manager Mike was very helpful and got us switched from a king bed to two doubles.

Summary Heading: Wonderful hotel - even more WONDERFUL STAFF!!!
Summary: The staff at this hotel is amazing. I cannot say this enough. Rooms were large, breakfast was really yummy (and not too crowded if you go first thing), and the walk wasn't too bad (it's about .8 miles away from maingate - entrance to Disneyland. California Adventure and Downtown Disney). In the evenings, we caught the free Toy Story shuttle back to the parking lot, which is about a block and a half walk back to the hotel.  We had a few special dinners booked while we were in Disney. One was at the Disneyland Hotel (Goofy's Kitchen) which is at the far end of Downtown Disney (so, add another .4 to the .8) and one was Medieval Times. The hotel helped us arrange a shuttle to the MT dinner, which ended up being $35 each way, but with 8 of us, it worked out best.  The parks are crazy

Went for the PlayStation Experience and the stay was amazing. Will definitely return to hotel if PlayStation Experience returns to Anaheim again next year. Loved everything, room was spacious, staff extra friendly and location was perfect.

Will definitely stay at this hotel again.  Great location and awesome staff! The hotel can add more front desk staff during peak time to help with check-in and departures. The free breakfast was a great addition to the hotel experience.

If you're planning a trip to Disneyland, this hotel should be your first and only accommodation choice.  The rooms are spacious, clean and very comfortable.  Disneyland is a 20-minute walk away, so you may have to take an Uber or taxi if that's too far for you.  But what makes this hotel so special is the staff.  Their customer service skills are impeccable.  I would particularly like to give a shout out to Ashley, who arranged transportation for me to LAX after my original driver did not show up on time.  The breakfast buffet is good, but it can get very busy and difficult to a find seating.  Also the selections available can be a little monotonous after a few days.  Fortunately there are several restaurants including Denny's and IHOP nearby.  Overall, excellent - I'd

This hotel is a very nice place to stay with children for Disneyland.  We had a suite which was reasonably priced.  It was very roomy and gave everyone some space.  The room was very clean and housekeeping had it cleaned up in time for our "nap time" before tacking Disney at night.  It is a little far for a walk to Disneyland.  I would highly recommend this hotel for families.  With breakfast included it was a wonderful experience.

Received a call from the assistant manager two days after hairy tub and hairy bed room complaint. She was very nice and apologized for the hairy room condition. She waived the parking fee for our stay. Very nice that they recognized the hotel's short comings and made a good faith effort to restore guest confidence.

Staff was exceptional , Excellent customer service, very accommodating.   Breakfast buffet was very good however busy so sometimes hard to find seating.   Would most certainly stay there again as well as recommend to others!

The front desk and management staff at the hotel were exceptional.  I would recommend staying there for friends and family.  The lobby and breakfast area remained clean at all times.  I always felt I was the only guest the staff was taking care of.

One of the better stays in this type of hotel with the best all-you-can-eat breakfast included, compared to what you normally get. It's not a 5 start hotel meal but it's really so much better than the average run-of-the-mill stuff you get at most places like this.

Summary Heading: Hotel experience review, start to finish
Summary: Booking the stay was very difficult.  Staff uninformed. Knowledge of property and website by staff poor. Staff not helpful. Hotel staff very rude. The third call for reservations finally connected with person that had answers and knew Hyatt policies and procedures.

We had a great stay at the Hyatt. I give this hotel a 5 star.  The Valet parking staff was very welcoming, and they truly make the first impression. Lots of amenities, and number one friendly staff. Rooms were also cleaned.

Would definitely recommend for a stay if you plan a vacation to Disneyland with family. 20min walk to Disneyland from this hotel. Rooms are always clean. Great customer service. Free Breakfast is served around 7am.

We usuaLly stay over thanksgiving with family it was a nice visit - yet limited staff and minor issues in room and service at the bar.  We love the location of this property to Disneyland and the ease of walking

I traveled here with my son (12) and daughter (7) for a quick trip to DisneyLand, over the Thanksgiving break.  Great Proximity to Disneyland (we walked).  I thought that the parking was reasonable.  The breakfast was convenient and was ready every morning.  My kids really enjoyed staying here.

Summary Heading: Hyatt Place in Anaheim, CA, has it all!
Summary: This is our 2nd stay @ Hyatt Place in Anaheim--it's perfect for familes going to Disneyland, Adults attending conventions, & just plain relaxing!  Great location convenient to Disneyland, convention center, shops, restaurants, etc. Includes a delicious FULL breakfast every day (no extra cost). Other guests come from all over world & very interesting to chat with during breakfast.  Great place to stroll...very safe! Check out Hyatt Place, Anaheim prices  You'll be surprised how reasonable they are & rooms are b-i-g! Judy T, La Crescenta, CA

Check in delayed.  King suite provided no privacy because doors could not be closed. Air conditioner froze one room while the other remained hot. Pillows were hard as a rock. Complementary breakfast was awful.

Hyatt place is always a home for me and my family.I always recommend to stay here especially you are with your family especially young children like my precious grandchildren becouse they have bunkbed for them to enjoy and be so comportable.

Family Thanksgiving vacation to Disneyland utilizing two rooms. The breakfast each morning was great but the services from hotel staff needs improvement. Requested twice to receive a pillow & blanket for pull out couch but never received them. No towels (one night), at poolside, to dry off with until we went in and told them.  Our room was cleaned but not restocked with any clean towels on one occasion. They did not have ART shuttle tickets to buy for the transportation to Disneyland so we had to walk over to the Clarion Hotel and buy them from the kiosk.  On our last day they deactivated our room keys and we couldn't get back into our room to retreive our lugguage.

Not a good choice. No shuttle service to the park. Food was terrible. DO NOT EAT AT THIS PLACE, unless you like FROZED FOOD.  The rooms were ok . The front desk staff were friendly. The bartender was not attentive.

Stayed 5 nights. The hotel isn‚Äôt able to anticipate number of guests hence 4 of 5 days we weren‚Äôt able to get breakfast because they ran out of food. Floors are extremely noisy and hotel is not able to enforce quiet hours between 10pm-8am. They also don‚Äôt enforce pool rules. Dirty cups in the rooms, and people smoking right outside the entrance when kids are around. Again. They skimp on staff, food, water, etc. If you‚Äôre an explorist or globalist there is definitely no value to staying here. The Hyatt House is better down the street. We had to go next door to the Marriot to have breakfast 4/5 days.

Clean rooms,helpful staff,convenient location to theme parks or convention center.There is a parking fee which seems to be the norm anywhere near the park.Complimentary breakfast is included which is great for families (lots of choices).Will stay again.

Summary Heading: Great stay for Disneyland family cacation
Summary: Loved our stay at the Hyatt Place for our family vacation to Disneyland (with 2 kids, ages 10 & 7). Loved the large room with a sofa bed. Decent breakfast. A bit far away to walk to the park but many different transportation options are available.

Summary Heading: Hotel was fine, but many hotels in Anaheim, and I'd choose another next time
Summary: There was nothing really wrong with this hotel, it was just not the best I have stayed in Anaheim and not really worth the price - particularly when there are literally dozens of hotels in such close proximity.  The room was clean, but not as spacious as we expected from the photos. It was still quite nice though, but the decor was dated. Beds comfortable but walls wafer thin. Luckily we were so exhausted from Disneyland each day, we fell asleep regardless of noise We are an active family, so didn't mind the 20 minute walk to Disneyland each day, but others may not - so if you're not keen on walking, stay elsewhere. They do not have their own shuttle and the shuttle they say to catch is not convenient. At breakfast, we came down at 7:30 and could not get a table to sit four of

Summary Heading: CLEANLINESS IS A SATE OF PURITY, CLARITY, AND PRECISION
Summary: One of the best hotels I stayed at with great customer service and rooms well maintained . Staff was extremely helpful and kind.  Service at the restaurant was intuitive to my order was personable , I enjoyed my conversation with the server.

good location with good access to transportation to disney and other attractions in the area all problems were resolved  and enjoyed the pool area and breakfast area and the staff was very friendly and helpful with our needs

We stayed here for 2 nights and while the hotel was great and staff very friendly and helpful we probably should have picked closer to Disneyland. We discovered that a lot of the restaurants we would have visited were closer to Disneyland itself and walked a lot!...bad knee for me and bad hip for hubby so that put us off a bit. We ended up catching a bus just up the street from hotel on the day we went to Disneyland...was $2 each. The hotel itself was clean and comfortable with a great bar. The pool is a shared one with other hotels in the complex so was very busy with lot's of kids. We met some lovely people in the bar one night so that was a great memory for our visit.

OK so I am the first to admit that I usually stay at the Park Hyatt and am a gold level member of the Hyatt Club. I was visiting Anaheim during a major conference, which I was attending.  I was charged an average of US 500++ per night for 5 nights.  The hotel is new, 3yrs old. It is clean, with noisy air conditioning in the room. The front office staff are very friendly.  The hotel is architecturally non discript.  For this room rate the amenities of the hotel fall very short. The hotel advertises a breakfast included in the price. But this is an appalling breakfast consisting of scrambled eggs,hard boiled eggs bread and some dried fruit and some fresh fruit served on melamine crockery and plastic cups!  There is really no after hours bar that serves food of any great variety or

This hotel was clean and convenient to Disneyland.  The breakfast buffet changed selection on a daily basis and was good quality.   The pillows were not very comfortable and the room was not very quiet.  We would consider staying at the same location if the opportunity came along.

They did not hold our king room, even though we called the day of arrival to let them know we were at Disneyland and would have a late check in.....The staff was ok, the room was clean. A very basic property

Not good for Disneyland because they don't have a shuttle.  My daughter and I walked a mile in the dark from where the bus dropped us off.  We got lost and it was dangerous.  Front desk doesn't understand.

great value and location. Breakfast buffet included is a definite bonus! The room came with a pull out couch, which was nice. An easy walk to free shuttle to Disneyland. The bar was minimal and did not have a good selection, and was somewhat pricey.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for Disney and the Convention Center
Summary: Stayed here for the convention center. Nice location and easy to get around by foot. Room was spacious and very clean. Daily service was very efficient. Staff very friendly, breakfast good and the bar/snack restaurant good for a quick bite. Good value for money.

Hotel was updated and very nice. Rooms are standard size but very clean. Close walk to the convention center and Disneyland. Staff was friendly and hotel had a great free breakfast. Can't ask for anything else!!

Summary Heading: Easy walk to convention center, easy access to Disneyland
Summary: This Hyatt Place is relatively representative of the brand, if you're familiar with Place's.  Staff were friendly and helpful.  Rooms were modern and well-maintained.  Micky Mouse statue near the elevators likely to make the kids squeal.  Breakfast is powdered eggs, no fancy breakfast sandwiches like they used to serve.  If you can get a discount weekend deal, it's worth checking the Place out.

Our family stay in Anaheim was very good! The rooms were are always clean and refreshed everyday! Staff was very courteous and the free breakfast made us feel energized all through out the day! A good place to stay with kids.

Not only is this located very close to Disneyland and a wonderful variety of restaurants. I was relieved that the rating are spot on very clean and comfortable especially after 12 hrs of Disneyland we were welcomed with a great to have you back.

Clean spacious rooms. Excellent breakfast. The hotel doesn't provide a shuttle to Disneyland. You can purchase a ART ticket at the desk, or walk about 20 minutes to the park. After a long day at the parks, it was nice to be able to get a late night snack.

I always have Hyatt Place as my 1st choice hotel.    i was able to check in early and max out my 1-day trip to Disneyland w my family .   location is so convenient.  CVS is 2 blocks away. Disneyland is 1-2 miles away.   love this location and HYatt standard.

Room was modern and clean. Check in process online was easy and it was a quick drive to downtown Disney and disneyland. The pool was heated and towels were provided in the pool area. Breakfast was plentiful and good but it gets during peak hours.

We did a one day disney trip for my daughter's birthday. The hotel is not fancy but it is clean and the room we had was well laid out.   The room was the one located next to the elevator and we stayed from Saturday through Tuesday. We did not hear any Disney fireworks (my daughter is afraid) and we did not hear any morning or evening loud noises in the hall.   We got the family room with the bunk bed. The room has a sliding door but the AC was freezing in that room. We like the AC on 72 but with the doors closed we needed extra blankets. Those blankets that were provided were well loved and i found a stain on one. (See photos)  The breakfast included is not great. Fruit and cereal are fine but the eggs and other items were not par with fresh great food.Lower your expectations on

The hotel was very nice, clean, and modern.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  The hotel breakfast was delicious and there was plenty of options to eat.  Hotel was walking distance from the Disneyland entrance.  I would strongly recommend to anyone visiting the area for vacation!

If you are looking for a clean, nice, friendly place to stay this is a great choice. Hyatt main reservations messed up my dates and charges. The front desk made sure to take care of the issue quickly and proactively. I was happy how they handled it. The rooms are clean, comfortable and spacious. The housekeeping was excellent. They used the kids toys on the bed to design something for them. The kids loved it. As for transportation we use Uber and it worked out cheaper for a family of 5 than a bus pass and quicker. Also free breakfast! Enjoy your stay!

Summary Heading: Location great, follow through by staff , not so much.
Summary: As everyone else had stated , the location is great for Disneyland, the convention center and everything else in the area.  Staff for the most part were responsive, but however we had left the hotel super early one day.  No housekeeping number on phone to leave a direct message.  Requested from the front desk if housekeeping could clean our room early since when we returned we had planned on resting a bit before heading out again.  We were gone from the room for 5 hours which seemed ample enough time to have someone clean the room.  When we returned , room was not cleaned.  Called front desk and was informed that they had called housekeeping and left a message.  This was the only snag.  Well, there was one more , when I made the reservations I did not notice there was a 17.00

Checked in at 2am and no issues. Had cold flavored water in lobby , parking underground , good breakfast , good selection and a bar a 20 min walk to Disneyland with 5 yr old who walked it , restaurants near by recommend to get tix at hotel for Disneyland very long lines

Summary Heading: Best value At Anaheim Convention Center
Summary: Outstanding courteous staff and a short walk to the Anaheim Convention Center makes this Hyatt a must choice if you‚Äôre looking for a clean modern spacious room with breakfast included and underground parking.

Summary Heading: Nice stay @ Hyatt Place for family vacation
Summary: Stayed at Hyatt Place for 5 nights for family vacation to Universal Studios and Disneyland.  We had a standard double/queen with pull out cozy corner sleeper.  Would have preferred the suite with kitchen, but was not available when booked.  This hotel is several blocks from Disneyland, and the walk home each evening was a little long, but doable.  There is an option to catch a shuttle bus just around the corner, however with a packed stroller and tired kids, just not feasible to load/unload all that stuff, so we just hoofed it.  Food was good, but not great.  I prefer the hot breakfast @ Hyatt House, however it's nice that it was included in price.  The hotel was clean and the customer service @ front desk was awesome!!  The staff goes above and beyond to make your stay pleasant

a great hotel with fantastic service at affordable price. not one aspect of my stay was below par.  room was clean, bed was super comfy, bathroom was great, amenities were good. complimentary breakfast was very good and guest services was on point.

Great hotel, close to Disneyland.  The staff were superb and went above and beyond whenever we needed assistance.  The breakfast was also a wondeful perk and had a little something for everyone.  The only small downside was the hotel room doors were very heavy and slam behind you, so that did wake me up a few times.  Other than that I would highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Hi Jennifer T,  Thank you for the awesome review and for your kind words. We're so happy that our staff was able to leave a great impression! We apologize regarding our heavy doors and did wake you up few times. I ensure you this will be brought to the attention of the appropriate departments.. We look forward to having you back in the near future.

Summary: We love this hotel.  We have stayed here twice now and will be back I am sure.  Not sure if this hotel has been bought or changed hands or what, but some things were a little different this time.   Rooms are great and clean and staff as always excellent to meet our needs (extra pillows, blankets, towels, etc) quickly. Breakfast could really use a facelift.  Seems that there is no imagination in the kitchen anymore.  Same thing every other day.  Was a little disappointing - although breakfast is very much appreciated before a fun family day at Disneyland, would still like to see the options from a year ago come back.   Pool was fun for the kids and they enjoyed it every day - a little more attention to the cleaning of the hot tub would be nice. It was wonderful to be able to jump

Just back from a 5 night stay at the Hyatt, Anaheim, what a great place to stay. The room was clean and spacious with a great lounge area. The breakfast included was delicious and always a good variety to choose from. The location was amazing, only 3 blocks from Disneyland and very easy to walk, even with a 6 year old we could walk it in 15 mins, and on the days when we were tired from Disney we just hopped on the No 20 bus to the Toy Story parking lot for free and only had about a 3 min walk to the hotel. The pool is quite small but awesome and was a lovely place to hang out after a busy day. Plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby. The staff were superb, friendly, helpful and fun to chat to and nothing was too much trouble. Look forward to staying again. Thanks to all of you at

If the price of this hotel falls in your range, it's a good choice for a Disneyland visit.  The property is about .7 miles from the gates to Disneyland (about 15-20 minutes walks straight down Harbor).  This is a classic Hyatt Place; f you've been to one,  you've been to all.  We are a family of 4 (2 toddlers).  The rooms are plenty spacious for the entire family (including a hotel-provided pack 'n play we needed).  Keep in mind that we leave the room in the am and return after a whole day at Disneyland (so we only just sleep and shower in the room).  The breakfast is fine (eggs, meats, pancakes/waffles, bread, cereal, fruit, yogurt, juices, etc as self-serve buffet).  There seemed to be adequate seating, at least when we were there.  I like the underground parking (plenty of

This hotel is priced pretty well compared to other hotels in the local area which i now know why. The hotel is not well kept, the rooms were boarderline unclearly. I was woken up every morning before 6 am due to a number of different reasons which inclined vacuuming and loud guests/staff.

Amazing service in every way. Nice rooms.    Pool was lovely. As an insomniac when  I get a good night sleep in a hotel (which I did) it makes me want to rate them highly just for that.   Clean.  Comfy.  Some extra touches.  Worth staying there.
Manager Response: Dear MeSharon, Thank you for your perfect rating.  We appreciate your comments and are very happy to see that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay with us.   Thanks again!

Summary: The complementary breakfast was perfect. We were treated with the utmost care, the staff were so helpful ,and helpful. The beds were so comfortable. We enjoyed our room and stay, will be staying here again on our next trip.
Manager Response: Dear H4843OFalejandrav, Thanks for your perfect rating of the Hyatt Place at Anaheim Resort.  We are very pleased to see that your stay was enjoyable and you found everything to your liking.  Please do let us know when we can welcome you back.  Thanks again.

Summary Heading: Long weekend for USFA Fencing at the Convention center
Summary: Room price was more than I wanted to spend, was hoping for closer to $140 or $150.00 per night. It seems like in the area it is either 2 stars for around  $100 per night or you are in this bracket for a better quality hotel.  My bill for  4 nights was $980.00, breakfast is included in the room charge, this includes parking charges and a few late night food charges. Parking is an extra charge but has in and out privileges and is secure. The room was excellent, comfortable beds and I am picky about that. Air conditioning worked well and was not noisy. We had a corner room so not sure if the air conditioning was in a different place than most rooms, but it was wonderful that it did NOT blow directly on the beds. The only issue we had was the diverter on the shower was not working

Overnight stay to go to Disneyland very close to Disneyland parking, mall and restaurants. somewhat decent breakfast, very clean, some blankets old/torn, very friendly staff, good drink variety included breakfast. Very close
Manager Response: Dear tanial236, Thanks for your near perfect rating of the Hyatt Place at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center.  We appreciate your comments and are pleased to see that your stay was enjoyable.  Let us know if we will have another opportunity of welcoming you back soon.

Summary Heading: This would have been a terrible review if it were not for one staff member.
Summary: I have never been treated so horribly by one hotel staff member trying to check me in.  There was a mix up and she told me to go find another hotel at 9 pm after driving 8 hours alone with 2 children.  On exit one member tried making up for a horrible experience.
Manager Response: Dear 691candicec, Sorry that your experience was not what it should have been.  It would be appreciated if you could take a few moments to reach out to our General Manager to share the details and see where the breakdown occurred.  Please call 714-750-4000 and ask to speak with the General Manager. In the meantime please accept our apologies.  Thank you.

Summary: We have a 3 year old daughter so having clean rooms is a MUST! This Hyatt is always so clean (3rd-4th time staying here). We have never had a problem. We are a little disappointed that the 24/7 menu has changed but it's ok. We will stay here again! :)   We had an issue with our rooms.. but the staff & Manager Cory went above and beyond to help us! We are so thankful! Thanks again for another amazing trip to Disneyland!
Manager Response: Hi Bshay424, Thanks for your loyalty to Hyatt Place Anaheim.  We are pleased to see that our hotel is your home away from home.  Glad to see that Cory was able to accommodate your needs to help make your stay enjoyable.  The 24/7 Menu did change and features some tasty new bites.   The Taste of Tuscany Board is really nice as are the Korean Street Tacos.   And thanks for your 5 Star review!!

Summary: Loved the hotel & room. Only disappointment was that we were charged quite a bit for parking being we were already paying for our hotel room & French toast was a little weird but otherwise the bfast incl was great.
Manager Response: Hi holleye70, Thanks for your 5 Star review of the Hyatt Place at Anaheim Resort.  Very happy to see that you enjoyed your stay with us.  The parking fee does entitle our guests to in and out privileges and the underground parking is nice...especially when its blazing hot outside or when it rains.  We will look into the French Toast.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel. Walking distance to Disnelyand.
Summary: Great Hotel and staff. Stayed here during our visit to Disneyland. We had not purchased park tickets yet since we had read you can buy them at the hotel. The hotel staff was so helpful in recommending the exact tickets we needed for our stay and actually saved us quite a bit of money. If you need to buy tickets for the Disney or California Adventure, you can buy them at the front desk.  The hotel is very clean and comfortable. We had a queen suite which was very spacious and allowed us to spread out nicely. There was a sitting area with TV and two queen beds with another TV, so kids could watch their programs and we could watch ours. TV's are hooked up to DirecTV, so it's easy to navigate the channels.   There is a small kitchenette with a wet bar, fridge, coffee-maker, and
Manager Response: Dear dfndr90, Thank you very much for rating us a perfect score.  We are pleased to see that your stay was very enjoyable and that we met your expectations.  And thanks for your review... complete with great tips and details about the hotel.  Let us know when you plan to visit again.  We will look forward to welcoming you back.

Summary: Beautiful property close to Disneyland. Shuttle service to Disneyland is available. Check in is smooth and quick. Rooms are clean and spacious with all necessary amenities. Specially to mention the bunk beds. Staff is friendly. Food is average. Children play area is a bit smaller.  Overall a wonderful stay
Manager Response: Hello atulsharma14, Thank you for your review and comments.  Very nice to see that you enjoyed your stay with us.

Summary Heading: Clean no fuss hotel close to Disneyland
Summary: We came across this hotel after looking at the Cortona Inn and Suites right next door (same carpark). The difference between the two is huge. The Hyatt is new, clean throughout and offers very comfortable, airy rooms. We had a two queen bed room for two adults, a toddler and crawling baby which was sufficient for our needs and we had great sleep quality.  Location wise this is close to Disneyland, but definitely outside of the immediate neighbouring hotels to the Park. Nonetheless we managed fine transporting the kids. There is a CVS/small supermarket approx 6-7 mins walk.  The included breakfast was good, rotating options each day. The staff seemed happy to be there across all areas, and one of the managers, Mike, in particular went out of his way to make sure we were looked
Manager Response: Hi James_Titirangi, Thank you very much for your perfect rating for your stay with us.  We are very pleased to see that your stay was enjoyable and that you found everything to be in order.  Will let Mike know that you appreciated his efforts of looking after you.   Thanks again!

Summary: We did here for a three day vacation to Disneyland. The kids enjoyed the bunkbeds in their room which was very quiet. Front room was not as quiet- you could hear the doors opening and closing outside in the hall.   Everyone enjoyed the breakfast. 15 minute walk to the Disney entrance was easy. At the end of the day, we rode the toy story bus back to the parking lot nearby and then it was an even shorter walk to the hotel
Manager Response: Dear mk28, Thank you for rating us a perfect score for your recent stay with us.  Glad to see that the kids enjoyed the Bunk Beds and that everyone enjoyed the breakfast.  Less the door noise, we are happy to see that your stay was enjoyable.

Summary Heading: Great breakfast and overall. Good quality food and Service.
Summary: Range Free Eggs, vegetarian options, mix of things each day. Good drink options. Coffee available early. Front desk and other staff very friendly and helpful. Wifi worked well. Bed and pillow comfortable, and room service good.
Manager Response: Hello Dwheeler551, Very pleased to see that your stay was most pleasant.  And thanks for your perfect rating of your recent stay.  Nice to see that you enjoyed our new breakfast as well.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for our recent Disney vaca. We got the family room with a king bed and bunk beds. There was plenty of room and we loved having a large couch to lounge on. The free breakfast was good, but not amazing. The hotel bar was nice. We also picked up pizza to eat in the room from the bar. The pool is small and not a reason to stay here. The hotel is about 3 blocks from Disney and close to many restaurants. It was clean and quiet. Id stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear thurst0nr, Thanks for your perfect rating of the Hyatt Place at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center during your recent stay.  Happy to see that you enjoyed your stay with us and found most of the service and facilities to your liking.

Summary Heading: Great hotel near the convention center.
Summary: Great hotel near the convention center.  Stayed for a few days for work and had a good experience.  Great Hyatt Place breakfast every morning.  Walking distance to Disneyland and Downtown Disney.   Rooms were quiet, spacious and clean.
Manager Response: Dear TravelingGuins, Thank you for your perfect rating of the Hyatt Place at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center during your recent stay with us.  Sounds like you had a wonderful time while visiting the Anaheim Resort and that your hotel stay was very pleasant.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay within walking distance to Disney.
Summary: We enjoyed our stay here. We needed a place for 5 people and all their layouts are predictable. We checked in, walked to the park, and walked back at 1 a.m. to sleep. The breakfast is hearty and consistent with the brand. If you're fit then the walk is totally doable. The parking lot was easy to maneuver. It's a good brand that is close to the resort.

Summary Heading: Good location near Disney. Right down the street from Disney Toy Story log.
Summary: Good location. Large clean rooms, WiFi included but an obnoxious $17 parking fee, and an additional $50 credit card hold per stay, for incidentals. What incidentals? I didn‚Äôt notice any room service or minibar. My daughter and I stayed here and would stay again. Very convenient location. Decent free breakfast buffet included as well. Average food quality but a whole lot cheaper than brunch at Cheesecake Factory.

Summary Heading: Treated Like A Queen on my birthday!!! Adi, Ellie, Rose are the best!!!!
Summary: It took me a week to decide on a hotel to stay for my 40th birthday. I've always been concerned about bedbugs and I wanted to find a good deal. The Hyatt Place at Anaheim Turned out to be amazing!!!! I personally checked the beds and they were clean as can be (and I know what to look for). The beds were so comfortable as were the pillows. We had a coffee pot in our room and a mini fridge. The free breakfast every morning was great and I'm vegan!!! Free Wifi too! September is a good time to go to Disneyland! We never used the pool (looks good for little ones and it has a chair for those with disabilities). We walked across the street and took the Toy Story shuttle for free just as others suggested on here. Weekend evenings are a little crazier at Disneyland as far as crowds.Thank

Summary Heading: Great hotel for conventions and parks!
Summary: I checked in 10/8 for a conference.  This is a great hotel as far as location, price and amenities.  5-7 min walk to convention center and 15-20 min walk to parks.  Easy access to restaurants and CVS or Walgreens.    Room is spacious with lots of storage and great beds and AC.  Very clean!!!   Nice sized bath with shampoo and conditioner. Great setup in the room if you have to work while you are here with a large workspace. Free printing and faxing in the lobby.  Great free hot breakfast in the mornings.     All in all great stay.  Would stay here again if back in Anaheim.

Great location (you can walk to Disney and nearby restaurants), spacious and clean rooms (2 double beds plus one sofa bed), good free breakfast (don‚Äôt leave it too late to get a table), free WiFi and Gym, small and slightly shaded pool (but that‚Äôs of no consequence really), friendly staff who go the extra mile to look after you. Would definitely return.

Summary Heading: Don't Expect Your Baby to Sleep Well If You Check In Late
Summary: Rated poor for service. The facilities were pretty nice. But the lip service... not so good.  Arrived for checkin at 8:00pm, and reiterated that I had put a crib on my reservation. The baby was tired and I asked when it would be delivered. The women at the counter both nodded along, and one woman on the phone said, "oh and we'll need another crib for room Y...". But I could tell they were lying and I wasn't going to get my crib.  For the next 3 hours, I continued to check on the status of my crib, and was continually responded to with, "It'll be delivered shortly.". The crib never came and my 1yr old daughter had to sleep in between some pillows on the bed. No biggie, but that pack-n-play would've sure helped us both get more sleep that night.  Called valet the next morning. Was

This hotel is in a relatively good location for walking to the transit and Disneyland shuttles.  It is clean but very basic - so take your own toiletries and shower cap and anything else you would need because only shampoo and conditioner are provided, and they are OK.  Breakfasts are also basic but a good start to the day - three hot foods such as scrambled eggs, small sausages and pancakes.  If you like or need calories, this is the breakfast buffet for you.  The coffee, fruit and juices are good.  An excellent hotel for families only.  For senior or solo travellers, this hotel is not really for you, it is for families with children.  I found it very expensive for the amenities (or lack of) and would only rate if 2 or 2 and a half stars compared to other hotels I have stayed

Everything with our stay was excellent, cleanliness, service, and continental breakfast! Our daughter was recently diagnosed gluten intolerant, so it was a great surprise to see gluten free bread and almond milk available at the breakfast.

Summary Heading: Our Disney home away from home!
Summary: We always stay at the Hyatt Place for our annual (sometimes twice a year) vacation to Disney. Breakfast is a VERY important part of this family's day and without it, we might look at other options. This is a HOT breakfast and its just great before a long day at the parks. The disneyland parking lot is directly across the street and a very easy walk to those free shuttles. CVS is also very close for any necessities you may need; we always go for bottled water and snacks. The rooms are ALWAYS amazingly clean and kept clean throughout our stay, bathrooms equally clean and the beds comfy. Will remain our home away from home for years to come.

I wish I had a good review as the staff at this hotel were above excellent however corporately they are lacking.   Prior to choosing a hotel I had to check if they had gluten-free food with or in the breakfast as my mum is GF. On asking prior to booking they of course said yes however on arrival and eating they had GF toast and no idea about the rest of the food as they cook everything in the same pots and pans so now mum can't eat anything except toast.   Room: nice and modern Bathroom: missing everything except shampoo and conditioner which were sub par at best.   Yes it's only a hotel but I. k ow the Hilton on the corner has all of this and more. I liked Nd ha e used Hyatt for years however other than the awesome staff this place was a 2 star.

WE enjoyed our trip to the Hyatt Place. we have stayed at many hyatt properties, This one isn't the fanciest, but the room was clean and the bunk beds were awesome. The separate spaces for children and Mamas is great. The breakfast was good and well maintained. Staff is fantastic

We stayed at Hyatt Place for our Disneyland trip. The hotel is right across the street from the Toy Story parking lot, so a quick 5 minute walk and we caught the Toy Story shuttle to the park. Our room was clean, comfortable, and well laid out. The breakfast was good and offered a nice variety and all staff members were very friendly!

In spite of some issues on our last stay, we decided to give the Hyatt another try, since we were booking last minute and they had availability at a great price.  The rooms are good sized. Not cramped or difficult to move around in. Our room was a King ADA room with a pull out sofa. Didn't open the pull out but can imagine it is a typical pull out sofa mattress. The King was quite comfortable. Four pillows per bed. There was an extra blanket in the room which was helpful. I have a dislike of the 50 pound "x-ray blanket" duvets they put on the beds. So a reasonable blanket is nice to have.  There is a flat screen tv on the desk / chest of drawers with plenty of channel options, though we spent little time watching tv.   The bathroom had good counter space, plenty of hot water,

Everything from start to finish and everything in between was great at this hotel. We greatly appreciated it! Rooms were modern, clean, and comfortable. The included breakfast was very good with plenty of choices. Would definitely stay here again.

Hotel visit began with the friendly check in at the front desk.  The room was clean and spacious.  Breakfast was included and more than ample.  Location to Disneyland was easy walk.  Can't beat the price, location or staff.  GREAT DEAL

Great, very clean hotel.  Staff were warm and friendly.  It was a little further to Disneyland than we were expecting.  Its about .7 miles and it took us about 15 minutes to get there.  Great stay and would stay again if I can get World of Hyatt program to fix a major fault in their new program that is basically penalizing members such as us, who spend a large amount annually on their Chase Hyatt credit card.

Summary Heading: Hidden Fees and crappy beds but...
Summary: I was disappointed to learn of an untold parking fee ($17) and the beds badly need to be upgraded.  That being said, it is a very nice property, close to everything, and staff is very attentive. Great breakfast buffet and easy check in and out.

We stayed here for our trip to Disneyland, which we found a great deal for only $125 per night. When we arrived, it was very easy to get parking which is good. The parking fee is $16 plus tax which cheap ! We checked in at the front desk and noticed the area was very clean and organized. The customer service was great and very helpful. I really liked our room which had a great view.

Summary Heading: Convenient for Disney.  Would definitely stay again.  Good value for money. ++++
Summary: Convenient for Disney.  Would definitely stay again.  Good value for money. ++++  Great options for restaurants around.  Staff helpful and ordered uber transport very knowledgable.   Breakfast not great but edible

Great hotel, very comfortable. Very friendly staff, every time I went back into the hotel the staff always acknowledged us and made us feel welcome. The location was great for going to Disneyland. It was within walking distance.

We had the suite which was much larger than expected! We had 5 adults and a 9 year old and had plenty of room for everyone. They bathroom was large and comfortable, two tv's was nice with so many people. It was very clean, the beds were comfy, staff was friendly and helpful

Nice place, nice clean room and welcoming staff.  I like clean and it felt clean so that makes me happy.  All the staff were great and they remembered my name which was nice.  The only thing I got caught up on was that they end breakfast pretty early, I think 9:30 or so, although I may be wrong, but get down there a little early otherwise you are outta luck.  Good location to Disney and parkways.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a respite from Disneyland visit
Summary: Second stay at this hotel when visiting events at Disneyland, great rooms, comfy beds and the do not disturb sign works. We did a Halloween party and got in bed at 1 am, really appreciated how quiet the hotel was in the am so we could sleep in.

Stayed here twice when going to Disneyland.   Rooms are spacious and clean.  Love  there are 2 beds and couch.  Accommodates the family that needs 3 separate beds  Breakfast space and foods are excellent.  Shuttle access to Disneyland, go across to Disney Toyland parking lot and take their shuttle.  No brainer, no timing limitations.  Will stay here again.

Good location, easy access, comfortable bed, cleanliness.  Roomy.  Modern fixtures. Environment is quiet.  Breakfast falls short, limited selections especially hot items (no hash brown, potato, bacon, etc.

Summary Heading: Amazing hotel- will be staying here again!
Summary: We absolutely loved staying here. Perfect location and lovely covered parking. Within walking distance to everything! Friendly staff, great breakfast, comfortable beds. Check in and check out was a breeze, hotel is quiet at night.

We went to Disneyland for 3 days and stayed here. The hotel is clean, the staff is wonderful, and the breakfasts were delicious. The walk to Disneyland is a little further than I would have preferred (roughly 20 minutes to the gate) but it was manageable.

Staff were very attentive and knowledgeable with regards to the Disney resort and other attractions. We stayed for 6 nights and felt like we were treated like family.I would stay there on my next visit to Orange County.

I would like to thank you for the great layout of the room and affordable prices. The parking charge of 17 is a little steep and maybe the one of the reasons I would over look this hotel. Number two would be how uncomfortable I was about the bathroom door being plastic and the floor grab. I had stomach pain from being to uncomfortable to relax. The sheets needed to be clean of hair but nothing to gross. Over all its still on my list for the room set up and sleeper couch. Please partner with a fast food burger place.

The location is very convinient. And the parking and access to lobby is also very convinient. Room and facility is also very clean and nice. The staff really welcome the guest. The free breakfast is too good.

The complimentary breakfast was very good, a variety of options was great and the service was nice. The room we stayed has2 queen beds.  When we got into our room it was SO clean! The bathrooms were amazing clean and organize.   We love this hotel!!!!!

Great location close to free shuttles and close to walk if desired. Friendly staff. Free buffet was nice to have. Staff helped with any questions or concerns we had. Nice pool. Room was great. We had King room with bunks and pull out couch in side are.

Excellent hotel for family vacation. The location is perfect, and the rooms are huge enough for family with children. I highly recommend this hotel. The staff are friendly with speedy check in and check out procedure.

Summary Heading: Great Disney Half Marathon weekend stay
Summary: Stayed here for our second time. Rooms are spacious and the breakfast is ok. Location is fantastic as it is within a few hundred yards of Disney entrance. Clean property with a pool and a gym. The bar is nice at night as well.

This is a very nice modern hotel, for a great price. Rooms are updated and a nice complimentary breakfast. We used Uber for transportation to the theme parks and downtown Disney and it is well worth the cost.

I was amazed when the front desk clerk stepped out from behind the desk and handed me my key with a warm hand shake and "welcome to our hotel." That's customer service and you should be proud that you customer facing staff understands that.

We stayed for 3 nights - staff were very friendly and amenable made us feel very welcome. A special thank you to Mike for his prompt action to a small problem - he went over and above to make sure our stay was a good one - very professional and a really nice guy.   Lots of eateries nearby and close to Disney.  Check out Joes ice cream and gelato - always a queue so must be good.  Plenty of shops nearby also including the outlets only 5 mins drive. Great breakfast with plenty to choose however I would recommend you get there early as a bit of a free for all towards to end of service.  Highly recommend you stay!

The hotel was very clean with an updated, modern decor.  The staff was smiling and helpful. We were arriving late so checked in online (I like that we could!). It was quick and easy once we got to the front desk. Breakfast was included and it was good, including fresh fruit and cage free eggs. This hotel is walking distance to convention center and Disneyland.

Great place to stay 1 mile to Disney gate. No shuttle but other buses available we walked .  Walgreens and cvs on way with food wine beer and any thing else   Convention center 1 block away free buffet breakfast. Very clean hotel nice staff

Stayed 5 days for our Disney trip. We had a king bed and also used the pull out couch (I was told it was comfortable) . You are supplied with the minimum amount of ammenities (soap, shampoo, lotion) which were not replaced as used (we had our own anyway so no big deal). No extra anything (blankets, pillows).In room coffee maker was good as well as the coffee. The refrigerator worked ok. Check in was fine. The hotel has no shuttle to Disney but they don't need one. They tell you to walk across the street to the Disney parking lot and just get on the shuttle. They are free and we used them every day and night and it couldn't have been easier. The breakfast was an ordeal every day. They always ran out of plates and utensils and finding a place to sit was crazy. The food was good

I was with a large group for a convention at the Anaheim Center, so needless to say our hotel was pretty slammed and full with other guests also attending the seminar.  I have to say the staff were excellent at getting everyone situated.  Ellie and Roselyn at the front desk were very helpful for our group throughout the week and even the GM Alfredo made sure our stay was good.  I've stayed at many hotels with our group of youth and Hyatt Place took great care of us... Kudos to the staff and leadership at this location!!!  Notable:  Breakfast - was amazing everyday... usually complimentary breakfast is sub-par, not here...this was excellent. Staff - awesome, friendly and very helpful... not just the front desk but everyone. Pool - tiny, don't go here for the pool or hot tub. Room

The hotel was near the Disney theme park, only about a 15 minute walk. The rating of the hotel on trip advisor was clearly over stated and very generous. The property was far below any Hyatt I've stated at. The pool area was tiny and would barely qualify as a pool. Not a Hyatt at all.

our stay was Very Very Good! Great location to get to Disneyland - just cross the street and take the shuttle to and from Disneyland! that's a savings in Disney Parking. Hotel parking will set you back $15. Very Satisfied with my stay and hope to return soon!  Recomended

Mu boyfriend and I stayed here for two nights to celebrate our anniversary. The staff was excellent but the room had a few issues. My two main concerns were that the shower would automatically change water temperatures without being touched. On both occasions the water adjusted itself from warm to very warm to frigid and back again. Secondly, the walls were extremely thin in that I was woken by loud rumbles which I assumed were the upstairs neighbords opening and closing their french doors. I expect some noise from a hotel but this was exceptional.  Some positives we the friendliness of the staff, particularly those we interacted with over breakfast! Their complimentary breakfast is wonderful with a wide selection of quality food! Perfect to start your day. Cleanliness was also

We have not seen this hotel before, although we have driven past it many times. The service, style, cleanliness, and features all fit our needs perfectly and at a price that offered good value. Even parking was very convenient!

We really enjoyed our stay while visiting Disneyland, we will definitely be staying there again. The rooms were comfortable, our son really enjoyed the bunk beds and the staff we're great! Thank you for making this a memorable stay!

Clean and large hotel rooms.  We slept a family of 6 very comfortably.  Pull out couch, bunk beds and queen size bed. The only negative was that there is no laundry on site.  We had to go across the street to another hotel.

I would highly recommend the Hyatt in Anaheim - upon arrival I was welcomed warmly and was given a beautiful clean and spacious room for me and my daughters. Breakfast was wonderful too! I give it 5 **

If you don't have a car, better off staying at another hotel closer to Disneyland and airport shuttle bus stops. Breakfast was well prepared but not quite tasty. Rooms are very clean and spacious. Staff were helpful

My husband forgot to book the hotel and we arrived there with no reservation. The staff was very patience and somehow was able to book us with a very decent price last minute. Even though that we didn't book the next day with them but they still let us park the car there for a whole day for free.  The room is excellent and super clean.

I read many reviews about this hotel and many others, before booking a hotel for a recent trip to Disneyland.  Based on the reviews, this place seemed like a home run.    Let me tell you that I did not experience a home run during my visit, however.  First, the location is not ideal.  Although it's not terribly far from Disneyland, there are a dozen others much better located.  There is no shuttle provided to the park which is not ideal.  Check-in was slow.  Apparently, the young man who was working at the front desk was also the bartender.  As such, he was juggling both which is not good when there is a bachelorette party at the bar.  The common areas were uncomfortably warm.    I reserved a family suite which had a set of bunk beds and a king sized bed.  The room did appear

We stayed for 6 nights and really enjoyed it.  The staff at the front desk were friendly and welcoming. We had a family suite with bunk beds and highly recommend this if staying with kids. Our boys 7 and 8 enjoyed having their own room.  The walk is short for the beginning of the day but long at night when your feet hurt. We would sometimes take the toy story parking shuttle back and walk from there. Breakfast was decent - not the best but not the worse either. They did accidentally charge us for parking but quickly fixed that when questioned.  We would stay again.

be careful here. poor security. had two ipads stolen from room. no security cameras in our room's exterior hall. so far no offer of compensation from hotel. ( we did file police report).  staff not unfriendly, but inexperienced. no room service available. breakfast was pretty good, though.

Stayed there for our first anniversary. Room looked clean. Service was good but my husband started getting rashes right after we left which we found out were due to bed bugs. It was very dissapointing.

We stayed here 4 nights. The hotel itself was nice and clean. Breakfast was decent.  Pool was very small. There was an additional charge of almost $20 a night for parking, which I was surprised with. Our room was right off the elevator, which was very noisy. The room was, for the most part clean, except for the sink, which had some food or something that was not clean. We did not do room cleaning.  We requested towels, which they brought us half of what we needed.  So we called two more times and also requested toilet paper.  Never was delivered.

Summary Heading: Friendly supportive staff at front desk
Summary: Adi went out of her way to provide excellent customer service and exceed expectations above and beyond the call of duty!  Great job Adi! The front desk staff was excellent and very friendly! Convenient location for visits to Disneyland Park.

The staff was unfriendly . not welcoming at all ! the breakfast was dismal at best . The rooms were not the greatest . I could hear every noise all hours of the night from the hallway . I am a loyal Hyatt brand follower but will not stay in this Hyatt again .

Great place to stay. We stayed for4 nights. Everything was so great breakfast was included with so much variety. Staff was very cooperative and friendly. Rooms are spacious with amenities attached. We had a king room with bunk beds which solve problem for families more than 5 people. Disneyland was at walking distance and lot of restaurants and shopping area. Love the stay.

We had an item go missing during our stay. After searching the room high and low we filed a report with the front desk staff. Two days later the front desk staff came into the room, walked directly to the table below the t.v. and somehow found the item. There was absolutely no way for the item to be in the place they claimed to have found it.

Positives: Close to convention center Free breakfast  Negatives: Dirty bathroom upon arrival Front desk unavailable when called from Front desk slow to checkin Dead zone for PoGo  Other hotels are closer to convention center King Suite was small Not worth the cost better options out there

We've stayed here a number of times & consistently had a good experience. This time, the restaurant was consistently overcrowded for breakfast & they ran out of many foods & wouldn't restock them, when there was 35 minutes left of breakfast. The staff was working hard to clean tables, etc. but when the hotel is full, breakfast is a challenge. The quality of the food was just ok this time when usually it's been very good.   One of the days, we returned to our room at 5p, after leaving the hotel at 7:30am. When we were leaving again for the evening, I called& asked for our room to be serviced. The front desk told me we had refused service that morning, which was impossible. I had to argue with the gal to get them to come service our room. Not usual Hyatt service, especially when

Great option for Disneyland goers.  Close to many activities and nice area, can walk around at night without a hastle.  Very clean and service is good.  We stayed just next door at the Marriot.  They both connect to one another.  We enjoyed are stay.  Hot breakfast buffet and Wifi.  Only thing is you have to pay for parking 15$ a day.

We have stopped at the Hyatt for the past four years and would highly recommend this place!  The staff (managed by Andrew) at the OCB Brewhouse are fantastic, in particular Janinaaahh and Erica are really professional, helpful and most of all friendly.  Make sure you visit the hotel OCB brew house for food and beer! You won't be disappointed. We found the food in the hotel better quality and value than the local nearby restaurants.

We stayed two nights here. Room was spacious and room was nice.   One of downside is there is only 2 elevators that run in entire hotel. Disneyland traffic in morning and breakfast time  are insane.   Too many people trying to get down to lobby with small amount of breakfast dining area.  Parking is $17 for self park. No valley service. No one offered to have bags transported from car to room.   No room service, huge bummer!! Had to order delivery both of days. Had to go to front desk to pick it up as elevators only operate via room key.

Summary Heading: .Great hotel stay - LOVED breakfast and the staff!!!
Summary: Enjoyed the hotel.  Pool a bit smaller, but not crowded.  Free breakfast had something for everyone and gluten free options as well!  Nighttime menu a bit limited, but desserts amazing!  Hotel staff went above and beyond.  Looking forward to another Hyatt Place stay!

Nice roomy room with good breakfast in the morning. Breakfast had oatmeal, cereal, brads and pastry and waffles. Beds were comfortable and the pull out sofa helped us accommodate kids. We enjoyed our stay.

Summary Heading: Amazing Adilene at the Front Desk!!!
Summary: We are currently on our first family girls trip in California. From the moment we arrived to the Hyatt Adi has been amazing, helpful beyond her realm of customer service! To be honest everyone from the front desk, cooks, housekeeping and the General Manager are awesome!! The General Manager is super friendly!!!   Breakfast is delicious, I recommend the caramelized bananas with oatmeal!!!   Rooms are clean and spacious for 4 ladies with huge suite cases lol!!!

I had a day to book a hotel for a last minute trip to Disneyland. Hyatt Hotels are my favorite to stay in because I can count on good service, the value of my stay, always clean and can sleep well in the room. I would recommend to look at the Hyatt Place if you want a good value for your money.

We were pleased with the food and the friendliness of staff but not pleased with the late check in when we had requested and early check in, small pool, paper thin walls and poor WiFi connection. Overall felt we overpaid for this hotel.
Manager Response: Please accept our apologies for not meeting your expectations.  These issues are not the norm and we will be addressing this with our team.  Thanks for your comments and again our apologies for the less than satisfactory service you experienced.

Summary: The hotel overall was great. Staff was very helpful as they were patient and answered every question I had. Rooms were clean and comfortable, and breakfast was delicious with different variety every day.
Manager Response: Hello Mauricio, Thank you for your comments about your stay with us.  Pleased to see that you were satisfied and enjoyed your visit.  Let us know if you plan to return again.

Summary: Great place to stay for Convention. Easy access, and 24 hour service is awesome! Clean rooms and kind staff make this a great location for family and friends! We were attending a Convention down the street but the access was easy and I would choose it again!
Manager Response: Thanks for your very nice review.  We are pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us.  Its nice to know that you found our location adjacent to the convention center convenient to get to and from in just minutes.  Should you plan to visit again soon please let us know.

Summary: $17 parking a day, staff could be friendlier, and check in at 4pm- incredibly inconvenient and not flexible at all despite making it very clear we would really appreciate earlier check-in after 20 hours of travelling and no sleep.
Manager Response: Hello David, Thanks for your comments about your stay.  I understand how tired you must have been after a long journey and no sleep.  With so many requests for early check in and a full house there are times when we may be unable to accommodate all the requests we have for early check in.  Housekeeping works as quickly and efficiently as possible to ensure the rooms are clean and fresh for new guests.  I can assure you that our staff would have made every effort to accommodate your request for early check in.  Please accept our apologies for not being able to accommodate your early check in request.

Summary Heading: Free shutttle to parks across the street and GREAT free breakfast too!
Summary: Our family of 6 loved this place! Super comfortable rooms, amazing hospitality and the breakfast options were incredible! We will definitely be staying here again! The hospitality team decorated the kids beds with all of their stuffed animals too. The breakfast options were  exceptional. So much to choose from!
Manager Response: Thanks for your review.  Very happy to see that your stay was enjoyable and that you were satisfied with your hotel choice.    All in all sounds as though you had a great time and a great stay with us.

Summary: It took them forever to even acknowledge me when I came in, they were all over the place; they went into my room and MOVED MY PERSONAL BELONGINGS without my permission! Due to "the fire alarm being defective" after I had already been sleeping in my room for 3 nights with NO CLEANING SERVICE. Dirty stained sheets- looked like blood spots; holes in blankets, dirty and HOT! There was no one at the front desk in the middle of the afternoon!!! Then when they were there they were talking about guests and ignoring those waiting!!!  Way too expensive for the dirty nasty rooms!!!! Find somewhere else to go!!!
Manager Response: Hi, If you don't mind contacting the General Manager of the hotel to provide us with more information about your stay.  Please contact the hotel at 714-750-4000.  It would help us to know more information that will allow us to look into this further.   Thanks!

Summary: Clean (I'm very picky about this and check every corner and linen), modern hotel with well set-up rooms. Ample room for 4 adult women with luggage to get ready. The set up of 2 queen beds with corner couch and ottoman made it so we didn't feel like we were "on top of each other" when getting ready. Beds were comfortable and the free breakfast was appreciated. Not too far for adults to walk to Disney, but even easier to utilize the Toy Story parking lot shuttle that is right across the street, especially when heading back to the hotel at night after a long day of walking. We plan to stay here again on our next Disneyland trip!
Manager Response: Dear Meg, Thanks for such a nice review.  Happy to see that you enjoyed the double queen room with sofa sleeper.  It is nice to have the sofa bed so you can read, relax or snooze without having to climb into a bed.  Nice also to see that you found the hotel to be convenient to shuttle bus service to Disneyland and that you also enjoyed our free hot breakfast.  Let us know when you plan to return so we can look forward to your next visit.

Summary: The Hyatt Place was a great location in relation to the convention center. The hotel was VERY clean, rooms were quite comfortable. There were restaurants within walking distance, although we did not try any of them. I definitely would have used the restaurant, if there was one onsite, and is usually one of the things I look for in a hotel. The bar serves a limited menu though and the food was good. We did not try the breakfast but did grab coffee in the morning and what we saw of other guests eating looked very good. The girl who checked us in had VERY good customer service training.  The rates are pretty pricey for this level of hotel, but it IS right next door to the convention center and across the street from Disneyland, so completely understandable. If not for that I
Manager Response: Hello, Thanks for your comments about the Hyatt Place at Anaheim Resort.  We are pleased to see that your stay was enjoyable and you were satisfied with your stay.  Should you plan to return again soon please let us know.

Summary: Very clean hotel and modern designed rooms! Great staff that truly cares about making your experience the best. They offer free breakfast and also sell Disney tickets at the front desk for easy convenience. Highly recommend Hyatt Place for any Anaheim traveling.
Manager Response: Dear Griffin, Thanks for a very wonderful review of the Hyatt Place at Anaheim Resort.  We are pleased to know that you enjoyed your stay with us.  And thanks for your recommendations!

Summary: Stayed here with my wife for the LuLaRoe Convention. Very convenient. Room was clean and spacious. Very modern. Short walk to Disneyland and the convention center. Free and delicious breakfast. Very courteous personnel.  I just really can't find anything bad to say about this place.

Near Disney. Walk to disneyland is 20 min top. Parking is separate but it's all good. Breakfast is included and really good. Lots of place to eat near this hotel. There is no laundry service at this location but overall it's a great hotel. Corey and Mike at the front desk are doing great job. Keep it up guys!!!

I am so glad I stayed here! The breakfast was so good, worth the price of the room. I would definitely come back. It is about a 15 minute walk from the park. The hotel will let  you park there all day even after checkout, so it saves you money then to drive your rental car to the park and pay to park there as well.

Summary Heading: Hyatt Place in Anaheim NOT a Hyatt
Summary: The room is small with uncomfortable bed, scratchy sheets that caused me to get a rash, loud A/C, and thin walls.  There is no room service but offer a call down service and you pick up your mediocre food in plastic wrap.  We frequently stay at Hyatt Hotels and this does not deserve the Hyatt name.

Summary Heading: If you find yourself in the area - fine place to be
Summary: Was in Southern California for a basketball tournament - the entire team stayed here.  Rooms were large and comfortable with full kitchens.  Some rooms had dishwashers (though ours did not)  The breakfast buffet was real breakfast, not just stale pastries and bad fruit.  There was an omelet station - but be prepared to wait a LONG time.  On Sunday morning they also had a waffle station.  There is a pool (which we did not use - but there was one there)  They had shampoo, conditioner and lotion - all decent quality.  The sleeper sofa was good enough for a teenage boy.  I don't know that I would got to Anaheim/Cypress without a specific reason to be there (ie tournament) but, since we had to be there, the hotel was lovely.  Staff was nice as well.

We stayed for 7 nights and the Staff was incredible.  They always greeted you when you left and greeted you when you came in.  The free buffet breakfast was awesome with something different each day with great variety and they had several people cleaning up and re-filling the breakfast stations.  The staff cleaned the room with fresh towels every day and made our beds.  They also were very pleasant.  Only a 20 minute walk to Disney Parks and a 5 minute walk to the Anaheim Convention Center for the D23 Expo.   There is a big problem though with a plastic vertical divider that is attached to the ceiling.  If people are walking around upstairs or even in your room it sounds like birds flapping their wings.  They need to get rid of those dividers.  Very annoying.  Also, the AC is a

Summary Heading: Friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms, good breakfast
Summary: I was very pleased with our stay this past week for 2 nights. We actually used points (my first time to do so!) and the staff here couldn't have been more helpful or kind! Our room was very clean, spacious, well appointed. We didn't actually spend much time there, but the beds were comfortable and the room was perfect for our needs. The breakfast was great, it wasn't the same each day which we enjoyed the variety.

First off....a big thank you to Adilene and Steve for all of thier help during my week stay.  I always stay at this property in Anaheim when I do business in the area. It is clean, convenient and the staff - great to work with.  Thank you to the Housekeeping Staff for doing such a great job with my room. I will continue to return and Hyatt will always be my home-away-from -home. GREAT JOB!!!!

Friendly staff, excellent location, comfortable room and great value for the area, with a delicious breakfast included each morning! Will definitely stay at Hyatt Place again when visiting the Anaheim area.

Every employee we encountered was great! Friendly, accommodating, professional, chatty. The rooms are beautiful and modern, everything was meticulously clean. I honestly don't have one complaint or one thing I'd change about my stay.

We visited the Hyatt Place with our friends from Switzerland. The hotel was conveniently located and the sue of public transportation was easy. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the breakfast was good and offered many options. The rooms were clean and comfortable, only the air conditioning was overactive.

We were approximately 200 high school students and chaperones traveling from NYS for a convention.  We did not have any issues with rooms, they were always cleaned and ready for us when we got back.  The rooms are all suite type as they have a bed and a large sleeper sofa area.  Bathroom amenities were also very nice.  The breakfast was perfect for our group and there was plenty of it.    The walk to the convention center was easy.  While Disney is a 20-30 minute walk there is a free shuttle across the street from the hotel, the ride was quick and easy.
