There were a few minor setbacks but nothing to ruin the trip.  Breakfast was good, room was cool, clean and updated.  Customer service was above average.  On-site parking at an acceptable rate.  1 complaint- the internet is not secure.

Summary Heading: An above average property, underperforming amenities
Summary: Scroll down for SUPER DETAIL!  tl;dr: If you like clean rooms (I mean, who doesn't, right?) then this is probably the hotel for you. The shuttle situation is great, the housekeeping staff is amazing and the rooms are great. As long as you're okay with a two star breakfast, this is a nice place to stay. It's not the best, but it's priced well and close to the shuttles. 4/5.  Let's talk about every aspect of this hotel in detail.  Check in: I actually screwed up my reservation and had us check in for the day before we were actually arrived. The hotel, with a little sleuthing, found my reservation. A room on the first floor was ready, but we didn't want to stay on the first floor, so we waited for a third floor room.  The room: The room was very quiet. Unbeknownst to me, there was

My husband and his daughters first time ever at Disneyland. It has very close approximation to Disneyland, GPS says 30 min walk but we got there in 20sih (walking with a 7 yr old). Our room had bunk beds, and that was almost her favorite part of our entire vacation, over the beach and all the shopping and Disneyland. I'd stay here again next Disneyland visit in a heart beat. Guess check it was also VERY friendly, we park at the hotel early morning (8:30am) before our checkin time (3pm) but they allowed us to put our bags in the room earlier. Very nice, very accommodating.

This is our second Hyatt Place experience. The one in Waikiki and this one in Anaheim. The Anaheim experience in nearer the convention center is really convenient if you're also going to Disneyland. If you don't want to walk then you can easily get a shuttle right in front of the lobby that will take you there for a small fee: $5 for adults $2.50 for children. Round trip. The rooms are spacious and very clean. Relatively new. Much nicer rooms then the Hyatt Place in Waikiki in my opinion.(but that was a few years back) Friendly checkin staff knew everything about Anaheim so feel free to ask them about the Park or the convention center. And since is primarily a business Hotel there's a convenient coffee shop/bar in the lobby open from 7 to midnight.

Friendly staff and great service! The location is very convinient to restaurants and Disneyland. Lobby area offers many areas to lounge and use their on site smart TV and computers. Pool area was clean and relaxing.

We decided to stay at the Hyatt because I had 2 free nights saved up on my membership. This place never disappoints for business travel and it was just as great for family travel. Close enough to enjoy Disneyland but also close to other Orange County fun spots.

We just arrived in Anaheim yesterday and stayed our first night at Hyatt Place. There was a clerical error on our room rate (almost $600 instead of $135 per night), but the desk manager (Timmy) called this morning and corrected it‚Äîso no harm done. The staff is friendly, the rooms are clean, the underground parking deck is great, and the location for Disneyland is perfect. There's also a Walgreen's on the first floor. But there's room for improvement. The wait for check-in/out can be long (I waited in line for 15 minutes or more this morning), the breakfast buffet is only so-so, and one of the electrical outlets in our room didn't work. Also, the rooms are noisy (we could hear someone running around in the room above us early this morning) and daily housekeeping is by request

Great location if you're planning to visit Disneyland. Also have amazing family suits to create separation for the kiddos when it's bedtime.   Customer service is an issue, however, as it's hard to get in touch with staff and if you go down to the front desk there is a long line of people waiting.   Breakfast is overcrowded with no enough staff to accommodate the amount of traffic for the morning crowds. Also not enough food or plate ware. You except a little more from the Hyatt brand.   This is our second time staying at this location for our Disney trip and the quality for breakfast and customer service has decreased.

I thought the Hyatt Place was clean, comfortable and friendly. The location is great if you're going to Disney or the Convention Center. We even took our students to Angels Stadium and the walk, while a bit long, was not horrible. There are plenty of choices to eat in the immediate vicinity as well. The free breakfast, especially with students, was key. Plenty of choice and plenty of hot, fresh food. On the whole, no complaints from me. I would certainly consider staying here again.

Close to Disneyland and easy access to freeways and many restaurants.  My family enjoyed the stay.  Breakfast buffet could use some improvement by offering hot cooked omelette and waffles.  We will stay in this hotel again.

My family and I, booked a 2 day stay at The Hyatt because we were going to Disneyland from July 3rd to the July 5th. When we got to the hotel we knew it was just amazing. The same day we got there we dropped our stuff off at the hotel and went straight to Disneyland with my family. Long Story short, we got back to the room and as we were all getting ready for bed, a black huge spider came from the back of the bunk beds. My husband killed it of course but my kids were freaking out bad, so the mother that I am, I stayed up all night. I went down in the morning and explained to the manger Adilene who helped me and you know what, that women is nothing but AMAZING. They refunded us a night and gave us another room to sleep in. This has been the best hotel experience ever. Breakfast

the food, and the staff at the dinning room ruined our time, and made it harder to go out and seek breakfast for family of 9 people we were in room 330 / 332 and we checked in on june 24 and checked on june 29, 2017 if you do care.

We checked in using our hyatt visa free nights.  We asked for early check-in, but upon arrival, we had to wait till the normal 3pm check-in.  The staff was SUPER friendly, especially the team lead, who even hooked us up with delicious bloody marys on the house!

From day one service was horrible!  No wifi in the room.  No wonder why it is free.  No room service or guest laundry.  This is more of a motel not a hotel so keep your expectations very low if you stay here.  I would also venture out for breakfast.  Not the best.  Stay was very disappointing.

Excellent room two queen beds a small room divider and then a small sectional sofa that has a full size bed. We had two children and two adults. Very comfortable. Pool area was a little small but adequate.

We booked this hotel for our Disneyland vacation, and it was a great choice. We were upgraded to a room with a bunk bed and pull out couch and king bed. It was very spacious and great for the kids. The only issue was there were ants in the room. At first, I thought it was only on the dresser area and would go away as long as we kept food away but then when walking to Disneyland the next day, I noticed ants crawling on my baby stroller! I was horrified and immediately called the hotel to have the room treated while we were at Disneyland as we planned to spend most of the day away. I also stopped in CVS and like a crazy woman basically inspected and shaked my stroller taking my baby out. Thankfully, she was fine, although I found more ants. It was terrifying and horribly. The

My husband and I checked in on June 25 in the morning knowing that we would not actually get a room until after 3:00 p.m.  We arrived back at the hotel at 11:00 p.m.  We had to wait a half hour to even speak with someone at the front desk.  Then we were told our room was ready but had not been cleared by the supervisor.  The check in clerk went to check on the room.  Upon his return, he went back to waiting on the customers who were there when we arrived.  We waited another half hour (while out eight year old granddaughter wanted to just go to sleep) before the clerk returned to us; telling us that in fact our room had not been cleaned.  He did find a room for us eventually.  When we got to our room (at midnight) (all five of us) only to realize that there were only three

Staff good, room clean and quiet. Bathroom door does not close all the way or lock. Beds good except for pull-out. Breakfast (free) below average, all food is room temperature whether hot or cold, no coffee or tea, juice/milk only. Convenient shuttle to Disney is a 5 min walk.

It started with a quick and easy check in.  It ended with a noon checkout which is a nice extra hour vs. a more common 11:00am checkout.  This allowed the kids to enjoy the pool after a long day at Disney and before our checkout.  Breakfast was incredible, with many options and all super fresh and appetizing.  Rooms were top notch, with all the comforts and convenience expected and beyond.  The staff was genuinely courteous and helpful, and I felt extremely well served by all from the front desk to the breakfast crew and all in between.  Room size and comfort, checkout time and breakfast... all big pluses.  No "real" negatives.  Underground parking is greatly appreciated.  Walking (<1mile) distance to Disney parks and on the way, your choice of restaurants and convenience store.

We stayed at this property for 2 nights on our visit to Disneyland. We were in a suite with bunk beds for our 2 kids and it worked out perfectly for us. The room was clean, the beds were comfortable and the bunk beds were a great benefit in their own room. There was  a sliding french door separating our bedroom from the kids , giving us our privacy. The bathroom was clean and decent sized as well. Would recommend it for families with kids.

We discovered the Hyatt Place through Hotwire and we would highly recommend it to anyone and would certainly stay there again when we go back. We had two rooms for our party of 7 and they were very spacious and they accommodated us with a crib for the baby.

The hotel is great it's located right next to everything!!! On our last day there my wife and I killed three spiders one in the restroom another on the carpet floor and one on my bed sheets!!! When we called the front desk they where very cold in there response they kept insisting that there where no spiders finally I got a hold of a manager and she was unable to help until the next day she said she could send someone to spray the room I said no  because it was late and Because my little girls where sleeping!! I asked to be relocated but the said they had no more rooms available!! The next day we received a small discount for our troubles!! The front desk needs better  customer service training and so dose the night shift manager!!!

Very comfortable, loved the bunk beds and pull out couch separate bedroom. Breakfast was incredible for something included in the price of the room.   Close enough to Disney parks to walk, quick drive, Uber, etc.  Would absolutely consider staying here again next trip out.

My daughter and I visited California for the first time.  Our stay was awesome due to the comforts of the Hyatt Place.  The disney shuttle picks up within walking distance at another location.  The convention center is a short walk away as well.  Everyone at this hotel is awesome and very helpful.

Average Hotel room close to Conference I was attending.  Hotel is within walking distance to Disney, the Convention Center... also close to many shops/food, etc. We had a decent breakfast.  Comfortable bed.  Shower could use some updating.

Would not recommend this hotel for comfort , this our was our second time staying .  The air conditioner was super loud and turned on and off all night , than stopped  working . Bathroom door didn't lock and had 2-3 inch gap so could see in bathroom mirror and vice Versa. Refrigerator was buzzing all night . Beds were average .

I would not stay here again.  Staff is nice but the hotel is not worth it.  For example, came back at 2pm after being out at the Parks all day and housekeeping still has not come to  make up the room.  A well run place would take care of that.    Location on side of Harbor makes accessibility a pain too.    Pillows are rocks and no sundry shop.  Could have stayed at the Hyatt Regency down the street for same money and took a chance on this one because of the free breakfast.    Won't do it again.  Stay at the larger hotels -- you will be happier.

Very nice hotel. Rooms very nicely decorated and clean. Comfortable beds. Great location. I would stay again if in the area. Close to convention center and Disneyland. Free breakfast provided in the morning.

Great service. Easy to park and travel to Disney. Very nice room. Beds could be a little more comfy but got good sleep overall. Breakfast was a good quality and was very welcome before a long day at the theme parks.

Summary Heading: Stayed at Hyatt three times last year. Would not stay at this location again.
Summary: Did online check in after receiving an email stating I could. Never received text saying our room was ready even after posted check in time. Went to hotel later and was told our room was not ready and that's why we never got the text. Said they'd put us in a room that was ready. We Brought all our luggage up to 4th flood to find that housekeeping had the door blocked and they were in room cleaning still. Went back down to tell desk and they moved us to a 5th floor room. Got settled. TV didn't work in master part of family suite. Came to change a cable. Worked a day or two and had to call back and get box replaced which took over an hour. Wasted our vacation time. The front desk staff comes around from behind the counter to hand you your room key. This is just weird. I've never

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel in a Really Good Location
Summary: The Hyatt Place is very similar to most other Hyatt Place's, if you've been to one.  However...the room is a bit smaller than most I've stayed at.  This is an above-average hotel in a really good location.  Hotel:  Pros:  Rooms are large and have everything you need.  Bed is comfortable.  I was working from the hotel room, and the desk was and chair were comfortable.  Cons:  The wifi kind of sucked on the 5th floor.  I never had more than 2 bars the whole time...and a few times I was forced to use my phone as a hotspot to get work done.  Wifi was better out at the pool.  Location:  This is just a few blocks down the street from Disneyland and a very short walk to the convention center.  There are plenty of restaurants around along with many things to do, as this is a tourist

This hotel was clean. In a great location, and had great overall vibe. Rooms Clean, Good Service, and friendly staff. They jab you $35 to park Valet. Starbucks located in lobby. Great for business conventions. Big Hotel!!

Terrible. Female clerks need customer service training. Extremely rude. Told me I requested too many towels when none were intially left in my room. Made me wait 2.5 hrs to check in after advising they had available rooms. Tv didn't work For two days.

We were mostly concerned with finding a hotel that was close enough to Disneyland that we could walk. This hotel gave us that and more. The hotel room was comfortable and quiet and the staff were friendly and helpful. It was so refreshing to stay at a hotel that provided a complimentary breakfast, and it was delicious.

Front desk staff was very unwelcoming. We felt like a burden to them. Rooms were fine. Good location near Disneyland. Breakfast buffet was okay but could have been better. There were not any meat options.

The hotel is very clean and is in a great location.  Breakfast is excellent each day.  Hotel staff are excellent.  Highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Disneyland.  Hotel rooms are very nice and sleep 6 comfortably.

....and that's about it. This hotel had spacious and clean rooms, comfortable beds and a great breakfast buffet. The service, however, was nonexistent. There's no bellhop/staff to help with baggage to your room (the poor parking guy agreed to help us with our luggage), and I asked for a comb on Monday when we arrived, and I had to ask for it repeatedly, three different times, on three different days, and finally got a comb sent to our room on Wednesday. We asked for a quiet room, and were surrounded by door-slamming neighbors. Parking is the usual -- atrociously expensive (but that's to be expected at most hotels near Disney), and the shuttle service? Doesn't exist either. If all you need is a hotel for 10ish hours a day after a full day at Disneyland, to just shower and sleep,

This hotel is conveniently located close to the Disneyland property.  It's  only a mile to walk (about 20 minutes).  Or you can take a shorter walk (about 5 minutes) to the Toy Story lot where the shuttles will take you to the park.  Either way it will take about the same amount of time.  Probably smarter to take the shuttle and keep those feet as fresh as possible.    As for the hotel; I've always been a fan of the Hyatt Place brand.  I appreciate the cleanliness and the complimentary breakfast.  Unfortunately this trip was not their best effort.    First, we had a very noisy room.  We stayed in June so the A/C is running majority of the night.  Every time the it turned on or off it sounded like a Harley being throttled at the foot of the bed. There was also a loud noise that

My family had a wonderful time room was above our expectations.  Breakfast was something different everyday and the staff was very nice.  Peter and Jose thanks for all your help.  This will definitely be our choice again.

This hotel was nice and good location. The only thing I had a problem with was, the area by one of the beds had a slight musty smell, and the the bathroom door is glass and it was very dirty like it hadn't been cleaned in a while.

Not worth the price. Holiday inn has been a better  Stay. Not at all why we would expect from a Hyatt hotel.   Very disappointed.   Noise level of other guest in cooridors and cleaning people and those on the floor above us was very loud and disturbing.

The rooms are spacious and very comfortable.  Additionally the breakfast is great and always fresh.  A tremendous value.  I've stayed at the hotel for both business and family and each time it delivers a high quality experience.

Overall, a great experience.  Issues were the pillows and the isolation of noise from the hallway.  Great location, within comfortable walking distance to the convention center.   For those going to Disney, their parking lot is across from the convention center and is a great way to go to and from the part.  Please note, the parking is expensive.

We stayed at this hotel for our Disneyland trip. We booked it from the hotel website for three nights. My mom is in a wheelchair so we requested a wheelchair accessible room, and we were pleased with what we got. The tub was lower compared to other hotels. The room had a tranquil atmosphere. It was clean and everything was organized. The beds were comfortable and we were pleased with the extra sofa bed that was present. We also liked how the room had a separate section for the sofa and the fridge as well. The bathroom was also quite large. The breakfast was nice. I liked the breakfast area, especially, since it was big and not very crowded. There were two separate identical breakfast counters so that was also nice. The hot food changed daily over the days I stayed so I didn't

Met majority of my needs except no washer and dryers or transit service. Need additional monies for deposit and parking fees.  You have to ask questions if staying for Disney Land and not everything are shared with you.
Manager Response: Dear lula K,  Thank you so much for providing your valuable input. We appreciative you letting us know that majority of your needs were met. We are hoping early next year we will have our washer and dryer facility.  We look forward to your return when you are in the area, and look forward to exceeding your expectations.

Summary: Great location. Easy walk to the park or hop on parking lot shuttle just across the street. Breakfast is great and lots of choices. Good coffee too!  Rooms were good size and comfortable beds. Bathroom was nice with good products and plenty of towels. Water pressure could be more powerful. Had first floor room but didn't hear any traffic or even hallway noises. Will definitely consider thishotel on next Disneyland trip
Manager Response: Dear ChickonMaui, Thank you for sharing your positive comments about your stay with us on Trip Advisor! We are delighted that you enjoyed your experience with us. We apologize about the water pressure and I ensure you this will be brought to the appropriate department. We hope to welcome you back again soon on your next Disneyland trip!

Summary: Kids loved the bunk beds. Convenient location to Disneyland, can either walk or get the ART bus across the street. Walking distance to other restaurants as well. Breakfast is big and typical of Hyatt Place, just with lots more people due to the tourists.  All the quality and benefits of Hyatt Place, just blocks from Disney.

Summary Heading: Our new go-to Disneyland trip hotel!
Summary: We stayed for 4 nights on a recent Disneyland trip.  Unbelievable how amazing the staff was.  Everyone was friendly at the front desk (which was always attended, even late at night) and in the breakfast area.  Rooms were tidy, breakfast had a decent rotation and was always being restocked, and the were beds comfortable. Very easy to walk 5-10 minutes across the street to utilize the free shuttle from the Toy Story parking lot.  There is a pool and hot tub on site, but it was a little underwhelming. Nice that it was available though, and with towels stocked and showers available.
Manager Response: Dear chantellepierce,   Thank you so much for your wonderful review about our hotel and hotel staff! I am so happy that you find our staff totally amazing. Our staff strives to provide excellent service, and it looks like they did a great job! We look forward to your next stay, and providing you with all that you need to make your stay enjoyable!

Summary: Stayed one night. Room and accommodations were very good. As is the norm at Hyatt properties, beds are comfortable, rooms are quiet, TV is larger than average. Breakfast is good, but missing pancakes : (  Will definitely stay with Hyatt again!
Manager Response: Dear V1716TGbillr,  Thank you for sharing your positive comments about your stay with us on Trip Advisor! We are delighted that you enjoyed your experience. We apologize that we don't have pancake that day as we rotate our food. We hope to welcome you back again soon!

Summary: We truly enjoyed our experience at this hotel. Every single staff member was friendly and courteous. One of the front desk managers, Adi, was very accommodating and gave us helpful hints about visiting the park and making the most of our trip. Great breakfast as well.
Manager Response: Dear pandora969,  Thank you for the wonderful review! Nothing makes us happier than reading that you enjoyed your stay.   We'll be sure to recognize our staff for a job well done. We hope to welcome you again soon at Hyatt place at Anaheim Resort / Convention Center.

Summary: We stayed here as a group for a basketball tournament and we were not sure how it would be and the staff was GREAT they went out of the way to help us and accommodate all of our needs as we were traveling with over 30 basketball players!!!!
Manager Response: Dear tessah71,   Thank you for sharing your positive comments about your basket ball group stay with us on Trip Advisor! We are delighted that your group enjoyed their experience with us and we hope to welcome your group back again soon at the Hyatt Place at Anaheim Resort/ Convention Center on your next tournament!

Summary: It was a very good experience, everything was good, but I was very disappointed in the condition of the hot tub, dirty.  The water had not been changed for a long time.  We did get in, but was sorry that we did.
Manager Response: Dear loriep993,   Thank you for sharing your positive comments about your stay with us on Trip Advisor! We are delighted that you enjoyed your experience with us. We apologize about our hot tub. Our maintenance take daily measure to prevent situations like the one you experienced before they arise and unfortunately we fell short based on your review. Our goal is to provide every guest with a comfortable and defect free stay and I ensure you this will be brought to the appropriate department. Please feel free to contact me directly should your travel brings you back to our property and I will personally oversee your accommodation.

Summary: The Hyatt Place brand is the best in class. Everything at this property is perfect. Room is great, breakfast is a cut above and I like that I can get a glass of wine or even order some food to take back to my room. This hotel is well maintained and the staff does a great job of operating with the guest in mind.
Manager Response: Dear davidnP1279RX,   Thank you for taking the time to write this wonderful review and naming us "Best in Class"! We love to read that you enjoyed your stay at our hotel, and I'll be sure to forward your comments to our staff. Again, thank you for the recommendation, and we hope to be able to welcome you again soon here at the Hyatt Place at Anaheim Resort /Convention Center!

Summary: One of the best hotel we stated near the Disneyland. Check-in was very smooth even we arrived 2 hours ahead of the scheduled check-in time (3pm).  Staff was very friendly.  Lobby offer lemon water and apply all day long.  Free breakfast in a very clean and nice dining area.  Room is very big for 6 of us (3 queen beds)
Manager Response: Dear 340evanz,   Thank you so much for providing your valuable input. Your compliments regarding our check in, team members, accommodations, and breakfast are greatly appreciated. We hope to welcome you and you family back soon here at the Hyatt Place Anaheim Resort / Convention Center.

Summary Heading: you would be foolish to stay anywhere else!
Summary: This place is first class, and let me tell you why. When you have employees like Addie who go above and beyond her job description, in returning some clothes that were left in a drawer, well, these guys won me over big! First of all, i was in the dog house with my wife, because I was in charge of taking all the clothes out. So, imagine her surprise when we were at home and none of her nice clothes came home with us. I immediately called in the morning and spoke to Addie, who helped me find my wife's clothes. She then went, during her lunch, to Fed Ex and shipped them that day!! In my opinion, Addie deserves a big fat raise and a weeks paid vacation! You can bet your bottom dollar I'll be back with my family! Gabe A.
Manager Response: Dear Madeline A,  Thank you for the wonderful review! Nothing makes us happier than reading that you enjoyed your stay and we are first class.   We'll be sure to recognize Addie for a job well done. We hope to welcome you again soon at the Hyatt Place Anaheim Resort / Convention Center.

Summary: The beds aren't very comfortable and the walls are thin.   The rooms were clean and spacious. Breakfast was just ok.  Nothing to get excited about.  I will look for a different hotel when going to Disneyland in the future.

Room with bunks is well worth the upgrade (if travelling with kids). Breakfast was as good as advertised. No free shuttle but is only a small walk to Disney parking (and free shuttle there). Would stay again for sure.

The good price was the first thing that got me to this hotel. The front desk staff was extremely helpful and friendly in helping me book my room and in buying tickets to Disneyland. The room was much bigger than expected; two queen beds plus a sitting area with a pull-out bed.

I stayed here for a trip to disneyland and was really impressed. the staff was friendly and made me feel very welcome. The breakfast was yummy and the room was very comfortable. I liked the location because it was so close to disneyland parking. I will definitely be going back.

Excellent location, great parking. Staff was very attentive. The only issue was glass see through bathroom doors. Breakfast was very good and had many selections. Hotel was very clean. Beds were a little hard but not bad. I would recommend staying here and if you are going to Disneyland it's very close by.

Summary Heading: Fit all our needs for large family
Summary: This was a great hotel for s family Disney trip. We stayed five nights in November. The room was nice - two queen beds and a queen sofa sleeper was perfect for a family of four or five. The staff are amazing and very helpful. At checkin, the front desk employee Jamie was wonderful. Jamie really got this trip off to a great start. Jamie went above and beyond to welcome us.   Breakfast is crowded but good. They have soy milk and gluten free bread. The other items are waffles or pancakes, oatmeal, fruit, cold cereal, sausage, eggs, and juice. During peak times the staff is great about bring more food as needed.   The rooms are clean, comfortable, and spacious. The location was good - you are 25 minutes walking distance from Disneyland but only a short uber ride away. We paid $5 to

Summary Heading: This was a great stay for DL
Summary: Take this advice: For Disneyland, stay here and walk across the street into Toy Story lot to shuttle to DL for free (yes it is permitted).  The room was so nice and spaced wonderfully. The beds were great and the hide-a-bed was okay. What can you expect, it's a hide-a-bed! (STELLA!! -Seinfeld reference). Just having it along side 2 queens is a rare advantage. Yes, the sink/vanity is smartly placed out in the room instead of inside the bathroom for maximum time-for-bed efficiency with a big family.  Yes. Yes! Stay here. The breakfast is well above some of the best full breakfasts I've had. Parking is $18. No resort fee.

Summary Heading: Acerage service and pull out sofa umcomfortable.
Summary: Good place, had a little trouble checking in with the guy I had and pull out sofa had a pole stabbing me all night but other 2 beds wete nice and place was neat and tidy. Breakfast average - reccomend getting food elsewhere.

Good proximity to Disneyland and shuttle drop off is convenient.  Parking at the hotel was expensive at $17 per night per car. Shuttle is extra fee. I do not like Hyatts new breakfast menu. It pales in comparison to Embassy Suites.

My wife & I stayed at the Hyatt Place for our third anniversary.  It was our second visit to this hotel, and we returned because we wanted a quick, overnight getaway. What made us return was the clean, spacious, modernly furnished room that is a quick 10 minute walk from Disneyland. The bathroom was very clean, and we also appreciated access to any toiletries or personal items we may have forgotten to bring with us.   We also took advantage of their 24/7 food service when we didn't feel like spending $$$ at Ruth's Chris steakhouse or grabbing a bite at Denny's. Their staff is friendly and accommodating, allowing us to check in early.   If you're looking for a clean, spacious room for a great value that has free wifi, complimentary hot breakfast prepared by a friendly and

This place is close to Disneyland, and is extremely clean and inviting.  The staff was great. I recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Disneyland. I got a really good night's sleep. and really enjoyed the breakfast.

Summary Heading: Great value for the clean and spacious room
Summary: My family and I stayed 2 nights at the Hyatt Place in Anaheim. We had a very happy comfortable stay. The location is ideal for access to the parks and the freeway. The underground parking is clean and spacious with in and out privileges for $!7 + $3 of taxes. A great deal compared to hotel parking in other california cities like SF and San Diego.

I stayed at the Hyatt Place Anaheim Resort/Convention Center during a Disneyland trip with my cousins last December. The rooms are spacious and the beds were super comfy (my cousins fell asleep so fast, haha). The complimentary breakfast is also really good, especially the sausage patties. For convenience's sake, the Toy Story parking lot is like 2 blocks down where you can hop on a free bus to/from Disneyland. Really saves the hassle from driving in or walking a super long way to other hotels!  One thing to note is that there is a Roscoe's House of Chicken and Waffles a few blocks down the other side of the road. Definitely give that spot a try, they are really good!  Overall great place to stay!

I had read the reviews for the Hyatt and read nothing but good things. The real test came when we arrived. The staff was VERY friendly, informative, and caring. Our room was exactly the way is looked online, beds were comfortable, complimentary breakfast was delicious and plentiful! Pool was heated. Our family really enjoyed the stay.

overall was exceptionally well, my kids enjoyed their stay, I enjoyed it as well, room was clean, no interruptions. I'll recommend Hyatt to friends and family, Breakfast was great. Staff were very helpful.

Perfect location to walk to Disneyland or to walk to restaurants and shopping. Shuttle is also available.The breakfast was good. The room was a good size and the room was always neat and clean. I recommend this hotel.

This was our second stay at this hotel for a race weekend. Close enough to get back and forth to Disneyland easily. The shuttle pick-up is very close for the very early race times. The staff was sweet enough to remember us from our previous trip and went out of their way to make our stay very pleasant. Special shout-out to Adilene for being extra nice! Thank you! Our room was clean, quiet, and overall very nice. Plenty of parking and a good early morning hot breakfast.

Clean facility, good breakfast, and great location.  For the price, this hotel is great. Would definitely return and I highly recommend to anyone wanting to stay close to Disneyland or Anaheim stadium.

Rooms where great, and service was terrific. Would be better if they supplied a free Hyatt shuttle from the lobby to the park and back. Other Hyatt hotels had this service except this one. I would recommend this facility more if this service was added. Overall a decent hotel.

Stayed 4 nights while going to Disneyland. The room was clean and spacious. Breakfast was included which wasn't great and we only ate it one morning. Coffee was good. The food on their 24/7 room menu is not worth the price nor is it good. It's about a mile walk to Disneyland with no shuttle available. The walk seemed longer on the return trip üò¢. The front desk staff was friendly and informative.  Parking was $17 per day. Next trip we're staying closer or at a hotel with a shuttle.

Summary Heading: attention to detail and thoughtfulness to the travler/from the general manager to the staff throughout the hotel
Summary: if you are looking for hotel that is interested in a quality stay for its patrons and pays attention to details then this hotel is a great match.  The room has decent amenities for its level.  breakfast is done very well and has good selections.  The swimming pool and hot tub are well maintained as well as the air conditioning in the room.  The room was quiet and well appointed.  We stayed for 3 nights and enjoyed our stay and would stay there again.  the attitude of the staff was  very positive and delightful experience. Thank you Alfredo Sanedrin for putting a good team together for your patrons

Great location vis-a-vis Disneyland.  Modern,  clean, and comfortable.  Nice breakfast available for guests.  We gave always enjoyed staying at Hyatt Place and have never been disappointed at any of their locations.

Family bunk bed rooms are very convenient and the free breakfast is decent.  The walk to Disneyland is about 10 minutes.  The overnight parking is pricey and the pool is small but usable.  Great Hub for short Disney adventures.

The hotel is in a great location for Disney. Either walk the 10-15 mins to the park or go across the road to the public parking and get the courtesy buses.  The room was great especially the separate kids room with their own TV. The breakfast was ordinary. A few reviews rated it. Good for continental but the cooked was very ordinary. Bacon on day one but nothing but fried bread, eggs and fried potato on day 2. Not what we expected and the only downside on what was otherwise great accomodation.

Our room was very clean,  comfortable and spacious. Hotel associates were kind and accommodating. We were close to Disney land and lots of restaurants. We would definitely recommend booking at the Hyatt.

Summary Heading: Not the same as other Hyatt Place
Summary: I have been staying at Hyatt Place for business and vacation for the past year.  This one was disappointing.  I chose it because it was right next to the convention center...however it also attracts for Disneyland.  Kids were running above my head and jumping on the floor above me and I had to call security 3 times after 10:30 pm.  Happened 2 out of 3 nights.  Beware if you like Hyatt Place for business....don;t let the distance to the convention center fool you.

My family and I tried out this Hyatt location during our Disneyland trip last week and we loved the room and buffet style breakfast was great, other than the appetizer size plates lol - the walk was about 10mins to the Disney entrance, not bad at all.
Manager Response: Dear AJM4921PK,   Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review. I am ecstatic that you enjoyed our rooms, buffet style breakfast and the value it offers. Thank you so much for the positive feedback and your kind compliments. We look forward to welcoming you back soon at the Hyatt Place at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center.

Summary Heading: CALIFORNIA DISNEY EXPERIENCE AT HYATT PLACE
Summary: This was a great place to stay,  good walkability to Disney Land and California Adventure.  The room was clean, the bed was very comfortable, and the amenities were very nice. The food in the morning was very delicious.  Would happily stay here again.

We spent 4 x nights here for a 3 day Disneyland visit and stayed in the family room on the 3rd floor. We had a king bed with a set of bunks and a fold out lounge for the third child. The room was clean and comfortable and modern with 2 x TVs. Breakfast was included each morning with a great variety. Only a 20min walk to Disneyland with plenty of restaurants and shops nearby

I stayed with my grandmother and 8 year old daughter. Nothing really noteworthy happened, I just feel I have had much better experiences at other Hyatt properties. I am and will continue to be loyal the Hyatt as a brand; however this was not one of my favorite experiences.

I planned out a family vacation and this hotel was great for our family. We will defenitly come back for another vacation. Hotel cleanliness was outstanding and guest service was perfect the free breakfast is amazing as well .

Typically don't post review however the service provided to us was exceptional from the moment we registered till the time we left.  Hotel was clean, all staff were very welcoming anytime during the day.  Breakfast was plentiful with lots of choices. Would return next time in Anaheim

Close to convention center, by foot and able to use points or anniversary awards, or good value if you choose to pay for it, also close to Walt Disneyland park by short walking. Room is spacious and accommodate family of four.

Summary Heading: Do you have a 'Happy Hour'? We do now!
Summary: Stopped in for a drink in a cool environment and a little bite and the bar was very accommodating. Offered us a reduced price on drinks and a 'cheese plate' that was really more a 'cracker plate'. Nonetheless I have to give these guys credit for trying and being very generous with their 'happy hour'. Thank you.

The place was very clean, staff was great and the complementary breakfast was the best I've had at any other hotel. And I have stayed at many. They had a great variety of hot and cold. The dishes were a little small but had no problem going for seconds.

We stay here frequently and are always very well treated.  Peter and Alley are excellent in treating their guests with extraordinary service.  We have brought guests with us and they were very impressed.

It's very close to the convention center that's why we've stayed here two years in a row and would stay here again. Room is clean and well kept. The breakfast buffet can afford an upgrade a bit. Not enough bread choices.

Summary Heading: Clean and overall nice place to stay
Summary: We were transferred from a neighboring hotel, both hotels handled the process perfectly with no issues.  We were pleasantly surprised, it was clean and new hotel.  The breakfast was good for a free breakfast. Beds were uncomfortable

I had several challenging requests for the staff, and they helped me figure out how to solve every one of them. The front desk manager, Abelene, was exceptional, and went way beyond her job description to make my stay stress-free.  I stay in any hotels, and this is the first time I have felt compelled to review.

Pro's - the hotel was very nice in letting us check in early at 9am after we had been flying for 14 hours with no sleep. Room was very spacious, clean etc with a separate sitting area and plenty of space for luggage. Around 15-20 minute walk to Disneyland. There are also restaurants within walking distance - Cheesecake Factory, California Pizza Kitchen etc as well as a convenience store.  Cons - air con noisy, bed not very comfortable, room noisy in general (was on ground floor). Breakfast is included which is a great bonus however if this is going to sway you in making a decision on hotels don't let you - it was very underwhelming and basic however this could be convenient for families etc

Summary Heading: Stayed one night to visit Disneyland the next morning
Summary: We live about 1.5 hours away but we were going to Disneyland Magic Morning at 7AM Saturday morning so we decided to stay nearby one night so we could get there in time. We checked in around 9PM on Friday (LA traffic), checked out early in the morning and walked to Disneyland (it was maybe a 15 minute walk). I was able to leave my car there until we returned Saturday afternoon and only paid for one day of parking ($17 I think). Booked our stay with Hyatt points (12k per night). It was all pretty easy and convenient. Will definitely stay there again. The room was clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful.  They valet parked my car for free. Maybe next time can try the complimentary breakfast which sounded pretty good (We had to leave before it opened). It was a great

Received a warm welcome. Staff were extremely friendly. Our room was clean as seemed the rest of the hotel to be. This was a Disney-specific family trip and the location was perfect! We didn't take the shuttle once. Even after walking all day, we strolled back to our room at night. The street is reasonably busy so we felt very safe walking. There is a free courtesy shuttle (diagonally) across the road however I'm not sure it's worth it as its so close. A friend recommended we stay there and now we would also do the same :)

The room was very clean and updated. Loved the free breakfast. All the food was good. The staff was very welcoming and helpful. Will definitely be staying here again. Would reccomend this hotel to anyone!!!

I stayed one night on a business trip and choose this location because of price and my loyalty to Hyatt. All the front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and quiet, the bed comfy and the sheets high quality. The bathroom was clean and had everything you could need, with plenty of towels. The location is ideal for Disneyland and that's why just about everyone seemed to be at this hotel. My only complaint is that parking (easy to find a spot and reasonably close to the front door) is $17 per day which is hard to see in the fine print when you make the reservation. I would definitely recommend this for a Disneyland stay or otherwise.

Summary Heading: Great, clean hotel with free breakfast!
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel a couple of times and for the location, price and cleanliness, you cant go wrong.  We would recommend this place to anyone.  The free breakfast is tasty, the rooms are spacious and clean.  Plus, we were able to walk across the street to the Disneyland parking lot and catch the bus to the park for FREE!

This was our first time staying at a Hyatt House hotel. We got a great deal on Hotwire. The place was super clean, staff was great. Bartender was great at the hotel bar. She made the best Michelada. Room was huge and had a extra room with bunk beds, couch and tv. Great place for a family to stay. Walking distance to the Disney Resort.

Stayed here for 4 nights in April to visit the Disneyland resort.   Rooms were clean and  the hotel was quiet.   Breakfast buffet was plentiful, just enough to get you going for your day at the park with many items to choose from. They even had underground parking, with security cameras.  Target just down the street so you could stock up on goodies with lots of Disney souvenirs at a reasonable price.   Many places to eat near by.  They also had a 24/7 cafe within the hotel.  Great staff!! Friendly and helpful.  Evening manager even offered my granddaughter a muffin (from the  Starbucks counter) while we were eating dinner, which we brought in from a nearby eatery.   Also within walking distance to Disneyland resort area, but shuttles are nearby and come often.  This is a good

This is our second time staying here and both times were amazing!  We got our room upgraded for free, and my son got a special treat for his birthday! Breakfast is amazing!  The rooms are clean and enough room for a family of 5 or 6!

Summary Heading: Great option for families visiting Disneyland!
Summary: This is a great, affordable and convenient place to stay while traveling to Disneyland, with family or not!  My family of 4 stayed in the Family Room room with a king bed and bunk beds.  There is a set of sliding doors (not sound proof) that separate the kind bed and bunk beds which was nice for a little privacy at night.  The bathroom was very modern/stylish and there were no issues with water pressure or heat.  The rooms are also equipped with a small fridge, standalone wardrobe + dresser and 2 TVs; one on each side of the sliding doors.  The room was spacious and our nights were pleasant.  Another plus of this hotel is the free continental breakfast.  The food was fresh and tasty with new dishes everyday.  There is a huge variety of pastries, hot food (waffles, eggs, etc.),

This hotel is in the perfect location for Disneyland, Convention Center, etc.  The rooms are very comfortable and I really like the living room area.  The breakfast is really good.  It is probably one of the best hotel breakfasts.  The staff is super nice and very helpful.  I would recommend this hotel for sure!!!!

Summary Heading: Best rooms in town with walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: Couldn't be happier with my choice. Easily the best styled/equipped rooms around Disneyland. Further the nightly rate was 300 cheaper then the Disney properties.  I would recommend to any one either visiting Disney or for a conference.

Great family Hotel,staff very friendly, Adeline at front desk very helpful.Good breakfast  to start your day.10-15 walk to Disneyland.Close to Target and other shops(sneaker factory shop and Value Maxx)

Summary Heading: Highly recommend Hyatt Place in Anaheim
Summary: Great hotel. Friendly and helpful staff. Quality breakfast was a great way to start the day. Rooms were clean and comfortable,  we liked the bunk beds for the kids.  Pool is basic but serves a useful purpose. Great location across from the toy Story parking lot to catch a free shuttle to the front gates of Disneyland.

The rooms are great, the breakfast is good, but the best part is the staff. They go out of the way to ensure you have a great stay. Haven't had this level of service at hotels that are double the price.   Great option for those visiting the Disneyland Resort.

A very family friendly place to stay. Staff were friendly and knowledgable about local places to visit, shop and eat at other than Disneyland. Easy walk to Disneyland. Comfortable rooms. Aim for top floor to reduce noise. Pool on the small side and very busy.

From check in Adilene was fantastic. Friendly and efficient service and an upgrade from the family suite to a more spacious room 2 queen beds with a sofa bed in a large living area. bathroom was large too.  Breakfast was an added bonus and only a 15min walk to Disneyland - Quiet and very clean Great Hotel would stay here again

Summary Heading: Fine, clean, good accommodations with good free breakfast
Summary: Clean older rooms, 20-25 min walk to Disney, small pool, great free breakfast, ok staff, Starbucks coffee at front desk. No shuttle to Disney. Stayed for 3 nights for Disney only. Too far to orange premium outlets to walk. Wish there was a shuttle.

This hotel is quiet, comfy, clean and accommodating. The staff is friendly and attentive. At our last minute request, the staff was able to accommodate us with an adjoining room. Check in/out was very easy.

We stayed in a 1 bedroom, 2 x queen bed room with a full kitchen. Great room with plenty of space for a family.  Free breakfast was handy just get in early otherwise you see people eating in the reception area or taking their food back to their rooms as its so busy.  They need to put on more staff to help with clearing and turning over of the tables but food was good.   Pool was nice to relax after a busy few days. Clean rooms with everything you need in a kitchen and the location is fantastic being so close to Disneyland (10mins away), Walgreens is on premises and very close to the Greenwalk and restaurants.  CVS is across the street and if you walk just a little further Pizza hut is there.   The only frustrating thing for us is we stayed for 5 nights but booked and paid for 6

Summary Heading: Great Place for Families and Business Travel
Summary: Clean, bright surroundings with helpful, friendly staff.  Great place for families going to Disneyland or other local parks.  Breakfast buffet gets you started.  Small meals can be gotten through the lobby staff, as well as cocktails in the lobby bar.  Good value.

LOVED LOVED LOVED this hotel!!!  It was beautiful, clean, modern, spacious, comfortable.  It felt very luxurious and spa-like for a fraction of the price.  The free breakfast was the best breakfast I've ever had at a hotel!

Summary Heading: Overnight stay at Hyatt Place - Anaheim Resort
Summary: I was so pleasantly surprised by the quality of this hotel.  My family and I wanted to avoid the traffic to Disneyland so we booked this hotel for one night.  I booked 2 rooms for our family and in each case the rooms were extremely clean, much larger than expected and both very quiet.  We were able to check in so quickly, in fact they offer online check in but only one of groups did it.  It took less than 2 min to get our room key.  We were within walking distance to Downtown Disney and to the park.  However, if you don't want to walk that far you can just walk about 1/2 mile to the Toy Story Parking Lot and catch a shuttle to Disneyland.  Our buffet breakfast that we had offered a great selection and was very tasty.  The apples and oranges are pre- washed and wrapped in

We only stayed one night but it was enjoyable and comfortable. The pool area was clean and nice.  The room was spacious and included a wonderful breakfast.  Parking was pricey though for a family  hotel.

Stayed here last week for 7 nights as a family of 5, (kids aged 14,11,8) in a family room that had a king bed for us, bunk bed for the two younger ones and a pull out sofa for the 14 yr old.  Staff were very friendly, always greeted us/you as you passed by reception and occasionally asked how our stay was going and whether there was anything we needed.  Room was a good size considering we're a family of 5 with luggage, etc, but well laid out with a modern decor, 2 TV's with plenty of channels and a sliding door between us and the kids to give us some sort of privacy.  Was hard to get the temperature right through your the room, generally on the cold side, but rather that when sleeping than too warm.  Very clean and housekeeping did a great job.  The complimentary breakfast and

Hyatt Place is a wonderful find!  The hotel is not as big as the others which is perfect because it's not as noisy nor crowded. The breakfasts were slightly different each day and they have an array of choices. It's a 5 minute drive to the parks. I would suggest driving to the Mickey & friends parking garage and taking the tram in, which drops you right in front of Downtown Disney. From there it's literally a two minute walk to the parks. And the trams are nonstop so you never wait more then 5 minutes. Hyatt Place rooms are spacious and clean. The hotel is clean. And the staff are friendly and helpful. Highly recommend.

My family and I stayed for 5 nights and loved it  The hotel is very modern, clean and quiet. Staff were wonderful. We love the free breakfast, wifi and computers with printer in the lobby for personal use.

Besides some slow customer service at the front desk, my hotel stay was great. Walking distance to Disneyland and some restaurants nearby.  The breakfast buffet was a great amenity.  My only other complaint was the $17/day parking charge.

Great location, with clean and comfortable rooms. All staff super helpful and friendly, and offered warm welcome upon arrival. Free breakfast offered was fantastic, with great selection.  All items well made, and offer a comfortable very homelike dining area.  Location is great, very close to Disneyland, which was our destination. We'll definitely visit again.

My family and I absolutely loved this hotel.  There were able to check us in early so we had time to rest up before heading to Disneyland for Mickey's Halloween Celebration.  We had the room with the King Size Bed and in another room (separated by sliding door) there were 2 bunk beds.  My kids loved that they had an area of there own and had so much fun sleeping in bunk beds.  They even had their own TV so we didn't have to fight over what to watch.  The kids even had fun shutting the sliding glass door to keep the parents out of their area. It was like their own clubhouse.  The next morning we took full advantage of the free breakfast buffet.  It is about a 15 minute walk to Disneyland.  We recommended the hotel to our friends who stayed in November and they loved it too.  We

We arrived at 3:30 pm, a half hour after advertised check in. It was obvious the hotel was busy with all of the people in town for WonderCon at the Convention Center. We had reserved two adjoining rooms and were advised that one of the rooms was not ready yet, but they would "put a rush on it". We got keys to the room that was ready and dropped our stuff. We left a few members of our family there and headed to the store to buy some snacks.  45 minutes later we checked again. Still not ready, but they would "put a rush on our room". Again at 5:00 we checked. Still not ready, they were promised they would "put a rush on it". Finally, after walking the halls at 5:30 and seeing no one from housekeeping anywhere, I checked again at the front desk and was told now it was ready.

Great location. The staff was very polite and accommodating. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. Breakfast had great selection. The only thing that would make it better was cook to order omelets.

Summary Heading: A good hotel overall, but the service at the front desk could use some improvement
Summary: This hotel is in a convenient location and it's fairly easy to come and go as you please. I noticed that some of the reviews bemoan the quality of the breakfast, but considering that  it's free/included in the price, I think they offer more than plenty of variety. Is it sensational quality? No, but again it's free so one has to temper his/her expectations.Our room was spacious, neat and exceeded my expectations. There was some noise coming from the parking lot at night and construction noise in the morning, but I guess there's not much that can be done about that.   As for improvements, the  attitude/receptiveness of the front desk staff could use some work. When we checked in and checked out, there wasn't a smile to be seen from the front desk staff. A "how was your flight?" or

Had a good 3 day stay at this hotel which is located at very convenient location to Disneyland. overall we enjoyed the stay, and good breakfast, and staff service. The hotel staff helped us find tickets, booking cab service early in the morning at 4am, and providing coffee and snacks at 4am in the morning due to our early checkout... appreciate them.

Summary Heading: Not what I normally get from Hyatt
Summary: The customer service was very poor at checkout. The couch was dirty with big stains, TV in kids room could operate without remote. The food buffet was a nightmare, no plates, no forks, they ran out of food. When I tried to tell the rep Cory about my room and I suggested that maybe they can take care of it before the next customer goes in, he had a complete attitude, never apologized, never asked how my stay was and layed down my receipt and parking ticket on the counter next to him without handing it to me. I normally love Hyatt and is the only hotel I stay, but this particular hotel I will not return to nor would I recommend

Had a business meeting in Anaheim and needed to stay at a hotel clos to my meeting due to not have a rental car. The Hyatt Place was  convenient , clean and excellent service. Will  definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: A realiably comfortable time at Hyatt Place
Summary: We have stayed at Hyatt Place at least 5 or 6 times whenever we visit Disneyland and have enjoyed comfortable, no hassle stays. Although its farther from Disneyland, we feel that the breakfast, underground self parking, and proximity to Toy Story Parking lot make it worth while. We have tried the Homewood Suites across the street but like the Hyatt Place's breakfast better. The rooms are large and comfortable and can easily fit a family of 5. Check in and out is easy. Although check in isnt until 3pm, you can park there in the morning before you check in and then go to the parks while your room is being cleaned. The coffee could be improved a little at breakfast but that is a minor complaint. We will continue to stay at Hyatt Place!

My family stayed two nights at the Hyatt Place for visiting Disneyland and Disney Adventure Park.  The hotel is at a great location - 15-20 minutes walk to the theme parks.  The room is very spacious, clean and quiet.  We slept very well at the hotel.    One of the panic moments during the trip was that I forgot my tablet in the hotel and we were on our way home.  The hotel staff helped find my tablet and Evelyn contacted me and shipped it back to my home via FedEx with very careful packaging.  Really appreciate their service and professionalism even after we checked out.    Will stay there again when we go to Disneyland.

We had a comfortable stay at Hyatt place. The room was nice and clean. Breakfast was good. Lots of different varieties of foods to choose from.  The staffs were helpful.  Close to Disney land. I would definitely come back.

Hotel is very close to both conference centre and Disneyland, rooms are spacious modern and comfortable, offering complementary breakfasts and wifi, would recommend this for business or leisure, parking underground is easy and spacious

My family of 4 got to hotel at 2pm checked in right away! My favorite part: Free & delicious breakfast! Affordable price with a good customer service! Can't beat that! The rooms were both clean and cozy just perfect for my family and I. I highly recommend coming to Hyatt Place because the staff is always friendly and willing to help you with your needs!

Staff did not care, placed in a room next to elevator after requesting a room as tranquil as possible. Room had bubbled and molded ceilings. After telling staff about issues, seemed as if there is nothing wrong with it.

This place is great! Clean, comfortable great service and yummy breakfast! Jamie, Adeleine, Mitchell and Corey were so friendly and great customer service. I will definitely stay here again anf have already recommended it to friends!

Summary Heading: Absolutely fantastic hotel... it's a family gem!!
Summary: We loved everything about this hotel. Not luxurious but very comfortable. The free breakfast is a bonus and the beds and pillows were so comfy. Perfect for travelling families and very spacious. Everything that the hotel provides is the usual Hyatt quality.

So we arrive at 9 am and of course we know how early we are so we ask just to hold our luggage until we come back from the park around 10 pm. I specified that we prefer not to be around kids and realize we're in the land of kids but we don't want to be around any if at all possible. We were assured that we would have an upgraded room. Awesome or so we thought. Our room was on the 5th floor right in front of the elevator, I mean literally 4 steps. If you have ever been to a hotel next to amusement park, the elevator is the the central spot to stop and yell at your kids. Every 5 minutes from 5:30 am- 9:30 am a door would slam shaking the whole building and kids would run down the hall screaming and the parent would be yelling after them. The conversations and arguments would

Location is great.  Walking distance to many restaurants and a CVS pharmacy and Walgreen's pharmacy.  Underground parking is nice.  Staff is very friendly.  Morning breakfast is good, but seating can be limited.

While the room was nice and clean and provided everything it said it would the bathroom was not family friendly.  I was traveling with my 83 year old mother and my 16 year old son so privacy in the bathroom area was needed. The bathroom door was a glass barn door style that didn't close all the way even when it was locked.  There was about an inch or more gap, which meant if you were standing at the mirror you could see into the bath/toilet area. Since the door was glass and didn't close it also didn't block any "bathroom noises."  The room itself was large and spacious, but if we turned on the air conditioning so we were cool in the bedroom area my son on the pullout couch was freezing, because that is were the vent was.  On a positive note the breakfasts were really amazing,

Great friendly staff and complimentary breakfast. Great place to stay and very convenient to the convention center. Will stay here again in the future. A lot of amenities pool, hottub. Parking was easily accessible to quickly get to my daughters cheer competition prior to checking in which was very convenient.

We stayed here for a convention and was very happy. The breakfast was always warm and they had a great variety. The hotel is very modern with updated tech, clean rooms, and very stylish. It is in close distance to the convention center so it was easy to walk to and from each day.

Conveniently located and just a few blocks from Disney Parks and Convention Center. Nice warm breakfast included.  Packages are received without paying extra charges. Maddie at front desk is super helpful and will go the extra mile to aid guests.

Summary Heading: Great room - sad bar and pool
Summary: The rooms are very spacious and have a seating area in addition to the beds.  In the lobby are computers with a free printer.  Breakfast is great and so is the staff.   The bar and pool were sad....both small and lackluster.

Zero globalist recognition when I spend thousands more at Hyatt than I should. Didn't even have a room ready after the standard hotel check in time. Made us miss reservations at Disneyland. I can't recommend this hotel at all. Much better hotels and Hyatt's around the area.

Everything was good, my daughter loved the bunkbeds in our room. We'll definitely be returning to the hotel on our next trip to Disneyland. My husband and I enjoyed having 2 TVs in the hotel room. The rook dividers were convienent and created a 2 room effect.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay near Disney
Summary: Close enough to Disney to walk, although it's about a mile. We took Uber to the park each day and was very easy. Hotel was great. Breakfast in the morning was a big plus. Nice variety of food choices too.

This hotel is a close walk/shuttle ride to Disney and restaurants.  Very convenient for conferences as well. Rooms are spacious and clean. Front desk staff is very helpful. Free wifi and breakfast. Overall very satisfied.

Pros- Clean room  Comfy bed Directv Free breakfast (kinda blah) Cons- Free "high speed" WI-FI was horrible Pool was not heated as stated on website Bathroom lighting & mirror $20 per night parking with all the fees Slow elevators I probably will not stay here again.

I don't like giving reviews to excellent places as it might ruin it by overcrowding the establishment. But this hotel speaks for itself after one visit. We've stayed at many hotels near Disneyland over the past 25 years. This is the top and it beats Sheraton, Hilton, Marriott Crown plaza etc. Room size large, clean and nicely decorated, breakfast selection abundant, staff friendly yet professional. It's also one block away from the Toy Story Disneyland shuttle. Don't take my word for it book this hotel if you've stayed at other hotels near Disneyland and see for yourself. Aloha from Hawaii

Summary Heading: Great Location for Business and Pleasure
Summary: Attended a conference at Anaheim Convention Center and the walk there was very short, there was 2 great steakhouses right down the road, convenience shops and it's a short walk to Disney.  Safe neighborhood/area, convenient and well kept.  Breakfast was amazing every day  and we loved the 24 hour food service.  Pool was small but clean.  Parking was ground level and underground, but around $17 per day.  Housekeeping and hotel staff were friendly, helpful and thorough.  Room was spacious with nice sitting area.  Guests of all ages around us seemed happy and taken care of.  Good place to stay for business alone or family vacation time.  Forgot to do this review sooner-  I could have gotten a free cookie too!

Summary Heading: Well-Managed Property Near Anaheim Convention Center
Summary: Don't know exactly what we paid for this room, as we were part of a 4,000 member convention, however, it is well-managed as evidenced by the fact that the staff tried hard to please us when we end up on their doorstep after a red eye flight from Hawaii at 7:30 in the morning.  They had us settle down with a free breakfast, then came up with several rooms for our party at about 8:30 in the morning.  They probably can't always repeat this feat, but we were very grateful.  This hotel is not the closest to the convention center, as the Hilton and the Marriott are closer, but it's about a block and a half away.  Free breakfasts were very good, and I couldn't find anything to complain about, and I didn't use the exercise room or pool.  Free wi-fi worked fine.

Summary Heading: Awesome staff great hotel underground's parking.
Summary: Perfect location for our visit to Disneyland walking distance, adjoining rooms were great with the grandkids. Breakfast was great with and lots of choices. staff was very welcoming. Underground parking

Our business/pleasure trip to Anaheim coincided with the National Cheerleading competition. Very exciting for those young people, not so much for us when we woke the first night at midnight to squeals of delight and slamming room doors. The next morning, we asked if we could change rooms. Maddie was incredibly helpful and accommodating and in a full hotel was able to move us to a floor, which allowed the balance of our trip to be very restful. On top of this the hotel was lovely, the breakfast delicious and even served a few minutes early on Saturday and Sunday to help get conferences goers, of which we were two, on our way. We loved California and when we return, we will definitely book again at Hyatt Place, Anaheim.

The Hyatt Place has great, quick service and very welcoming staff! The free breakfast is great and convenient, and when my room called for towels at the front desk, they were given to us very quickly! I would love to come here again and greatly recommend!

stayed 2 nights. quality exercise equipment in gym. only one exercise bike but the facility was empty. hot tub worked well. in and out parking was convenient. noises in the hallways and adjacent rooms can easily be heard in the room.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, kid friendly, comfortable
Summary: Short walk to disneyland.  Room had King bed, sleeper sofa, and bunk beds.  Pocket door seperated room in half.  My son loved the bunk bed.  The property was clean and  comfortable.  It was a close walk to Disneyland.  The included breakfast was nice.  Staff was helpful.

Beautiful hotel Great breakfast included in stay.   Food available 24 hours Staff was amazing Will stay here again if we visit again  Rooms were spacious and very clean!  Great family hotel Close to Disneyland

Perfect place if you want value, accessibility and enough room for 3 kids.  I had 4 with me on this trip and it worked out well.  The room set up is unique and very helpful.  The Breakfast was the best ever for a hotel of this type.  Best value I have experienced.

Summary Heading: Extremely friendly and helpful staff, brand new big rooms
Summary: We booked a king size bed room with pull-out sofa. When we realized that it is not suitable for us on the day before we checked in, we called hotel. Hotel front desk staff (Clarissa) was very friendly and accommodating.  We were so grateful to be upgraded to  a double room with pull-out sofa.   When I need to print a few pages, again the front desk staff (a gentleman, didn't get his name) was very helpful. He even went out of his way to help me and other customers's request.    I traveled around the world. This is the best hotel experience. Thank you, Hyatt!

Upon checking in hotel seems nice, once we reach the room we found our bathroom was not cleaned and the toilet seat was loose. The following day after a long trip to Disneyland we came back to our hotel room to find that which had not been serviced by housekeeping. Horse tail staff did not seem too compassionate about our situation.

Perfect place as long as you can sleep through all night door slamming, jumping off beds onto floor in room above you, and screaming and crying children. Convenient for Disneyland and lots of family friendly food around.

When we checked in there was a huge booker on the wall by the king size bed. Also there were gummy candies on the floor by the bunk beds. It took about 1 1/2 hours for someone to come up and clean.  I will never stay here again.

Great place to stay, very clean, comfortable and great breakfast! Close and convenient to Disneyland.  Staff was wonderful. They were very accommodating the beach was only a 20 minute drive. Tons of restaurants around.

As is my usual experience, the Hyatt provides excellent service, is clean, and the free breakfast is always delightful!  We thoroughly enjoyed our trip to Disneyland... the location is incredibly convenient.

Summary Heading: Excellent, Next vacation, We will come back to stay the Hyatt Place. Thanks very much your hospitality
Summary: We appreciate the hospitality of the staff members and the excellent room services. The next vacation, we would like to stay at the Hyatt Place of Anaheim. We would recommend friends and family to book at Hyatt

Summary Heading: Great Value and Felt Right At Home
Summary: We had a party of 11 between 2 rooms. 6 adults, 5 children and a service animal. They were supposed to connect our rooms, my daughter called the day before to make sure that it was done, however, it was not. If this was done, and my daughter's room was ready at check in time, I would have given it an "excellent" review. Aside from that experience, the staff was nice. The hotel was clean. The food was great. The price was superb. Not everyone staying is there for Disney (we did not go to Disney), so, for future purposes, I WOULD like to see the parking fee either lowered or non-existent.

This place has very good staff and is a very enjoyable place to be at. The people are very nice and welcoming. The service is very fast. The rooms are clean and spacious. I would highly recommend this place for anyone!

Summary Heading: First stop on our month holiday in the States
Summary: The rooms are spacious, great having the extra room for the kids on bunks with a pull out couch too if needed which we didnt so handy for extra seating while we watched the odd TV show.  Rooms where clean and tidy, beds where ok, pillows for me personally (I normally bring my own but didnt to the states, but will next time) not great, but we where only here for 4 nights before going to Vegas for 4 nights, so that was ok.  We missed breakfast the first day, as that finishes at 9am, that is ridiculous especially for overseas travellers as we spent 14 hrs getting there so we had to go to IHOP for breakfast, we did do breakfast the next few days, but that is average to say the least, eggs where always cold, the bacon didnt even look like it had been cooked, and personally we didnt

This is a great place! The staff is so friendly helpful. Peter at the front desk was awesome! We were in Anaheim celebrating my daughter's birthday and he went the extra mile to make it a special one! We will be back for sure!

Summary Heading: Nice rooms not so great breakfast
Summary: The rooms are very spacious with a separate seating area that also folds out to a sofa bed. Unfortunately our room was next to an ice machine and people getting ice at 2:30 AM woke me. The breakfast has a nice selection, but the eggs were not warm and the bacon VERY undercooked.
Manager Response: Dear Robininfresno,  Thank you for completing a review of your recent stay at our hotel. I apologize that your experience was anything less than satisfying. Feedback such as yours assists us in improving our service and property. In addition, please know that your comments and issues will be addressed.   It is our hope that you give us another opportunity to serve you. Again, I apologize for the inconvenience during your stay and hope to see you during your next visit. If I can provide any assistance, please contact me directly.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in December. The rooms were clean and tidy. Only did the breakfast once as we found it a complete mad house - not nearly enough seating and the food wasn't great. Apart from that the Beds were comfy and all the staff we dealt with were friendly and efficient. It was a short walk to DL from the hotel.
Manager Response: Dear AU_Wanderer:  Thank you for completing our Guest Survey regarding your recent stay at our hotel. Please know that your feedback is extremely valuable to us and we will utilize your response to make every guest experience the best it can be. I greatly appreciate your kind words and they will be celebrated with the entire team.   If I can be of any assistance to you, please contact me directly. We look forward to being of service to you in the near future.   Best regards,  Alfredo Sanedrin General Manager Hyatt Place at Anaheim

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel at walking distance of Disney
Summary: We had a great stay at this hotel. Excellent service, great rooms and pleasant staff. We will definitely return. Parking was well organized and there are multiple shops nearby. Target is across the streets which was convenient. Thanks for a great stay
Manager Response: Dear Peanut1685:  Thank you very much for your wonderful review! The staff and I truly appreciate that you took the time to share your experience and views. I will make sure to share this with the staff and we hope you are able to return and stay with us again in the future. Guests like you are the reason we love what we do at the Hyatt Place at Anaheim Resort/ Convention Center.

Summary: If you are looking for a great hotel near the Anaheim Convention Center or Disneyland, this property will fill the bill.  Nice rooms, friendly staff and an impressive breakfast that serves a surprising number of families each morning.
Manager Response: Hi Grant R:  Thank you so much for your wonderful review about our hotel and hotel staff! Our staff strives to provide excellent service, and it looks like they did a great job!  I am glad you liked our location and was impressed with our breakfast.We look forward to your next stay, and providing you with all that you need to make your stay enjoyable!   Best regards,  Alfredo Sanedrin General Manager Hyatt Place at Anaheim

Summary: Didn't have the room I reserved months in advance. Pillows and bed were not very comfortable. Breakfast was disappointing. No shuttle to Disneyland. Would not recommend this hotel and I won't be coming back. Overall a disappointing stay
Manager Response: Dear A767ELryana:  Thank you for completing our Guest Survey regarding your recent stay at our hotel. I apologize that your experience was anything less than satisfying. Feedback such as yours assists us in improving our service and property. In addition, please know that your comments and issues will be addressed.   It is our hope that you give us another opportunity to serve you. Again, I apologize for the inconvenience during your stay and hope to see you during your next visit. If I can provide any assistance, please contact me directly.

Summary: Great location for a disneyland trip.  We were able to catch the toy story parking shuttle to Disneyland.  Good breakfast and rooms are nice and spacious.  Would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.
Manager Response: Dear tylersC1361MW:  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review. I am ecstatic that you enjoyed our hotel location being near Disneyland and the value it offers. Thank you so much for the positive feedback and your recommendation to others. We look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Best regards,  Alfredo Sanedrin General Manager Hyatt Place at Anaheim

Summary: Great for a family as some rooms have a fold out couch. Housekeeping is slow to do stayovwe service and the "dinner" options are terrible... do yourself a favor and eat somewhere else for lunch or dinner. Breakfast was better than a continental but not by much. Runny eggs and mediocre pancakes, but at least it's replenished, clean, and staff is friendly. I'd recommend for the family looking for a decent place to stay when going to Disneyland. Average all in all.
Manager Response: Dear Summer C:  Thank you for completing a Trip Advisor review on your recent stay at our hotel. I apologize that your experience was anything less than satisfying. Feedback such as yours assists us in improving our service and property. In addition, please know that your comments and issues will be addressed.   It is our hope that you give us another opportunity to serve you. Again, I apologize for the inconvenience during your stay and hope to see you during your next visit.
