The hotel might be new and spacious but seriously lacking in noise insulation, from both rooms we stayed in I could hear conversations in rooms next to and above me, I could hear all manner of toilet noises and to top it off the air con is truly loud.  Oh, and in the end they even overcharged me for my stay, including higher rates than we

My wife, son and I stayed here for a four-day trip to Disneyland. Always enjoy Hyatt Places. Clean, friendly staff, nice rooms, overall quiet even with all the kids in the hotel. Morning breakfast is free and good, gets a little crazy the later you get down there. Always plenty of food, just hard to get a table and navigate all the people getting food.  It is about a 20 minute walk to Disneyland. Not bad. The street is well lit and lots of people out walking so you feel safe. Food at the hotel is so-so. Some decent restaurants within walking distance.   Would be cool if they put a little Disney theme to the hotel.

Summary Heading: monster hotel amenities with small hotel warmth
Summary: I have attended a conference in Anaheim annually and stayed at various hotels. This is the perfect cross between amenities and convenience all within walking distance of the convention center. great value.

From the room, to the staff and the complimentary breakfast, everything was perfect!  The rooms were very quiet.  The complimentary breakfast was a HUGE spread from pancakes, waffles, eggs, toast, fruit, etc.  The staff were pleasant.  We had absolutely 0 problems or complaints and will stay at this hotel over and over again.

Summary Heading: Comfortable spot for business or family travel
Summary: I visited this hotel for a business trip.  My room was spacious and clean.  The room layout with the mini sofa is very comfortable to kick back and enjoy the room.  Everything in my room was in working order.  I did not have a hair dryer so I called the desk and one was provided almost instantly!  The service was great.  Breakfast was typical for complimentary hotel breakfasts and the coffee bar was appreciated.  There are a few nice outdoor tables to have a peaceful meal.  Parking is underground in a garage.  This is convenient except for arriving alone late in the evening.  For security, the elevators require a key card to get up to guest floors.  This was a nice touch.

the location its great we were visiting the parks and shuttle is a great option, valet parking its expensive, restaurant is a good option to have breakfast, i love the space in the rooms, great to visit with family

big room nice breakfast nice reception,beds are comfortable close to Disneyland and 20 min drive to Knotts berry farms twenty dollars for parking ' restaurants and all you need witin a walking distance. Thank you Hyatt place Laundery in a next by hotel that allow you cause they are partners'washing two dollars drying two dollars

Summary Heading: Good Hotel, Clean and Close to Disneyland
Summary: Good hotel. Would not recommend for small children or large families. We had three young kids and two adults and it felt a little crowded. The refrigerator never worked which made it difficult to store food. A little over a mile walk to Disneyland or very close to a ART stop to take the bus to Disneyland.

Stayed at this Hyatt Place hotel for a convention and very pleased that we did. It‚Äôs immaculately clean and modern, the rooms are very spacious and the service is excellent. Breakfast buffet was a plus. Love the quartz sink countertop which is bacteria-resistant. The front desk staff is very helpful and friendly. Matthew, Adilene and Jaimey were great, as well the two guys who staffed the bar & 24/7 gallery market. Housekeeping was very efficient and kept the rooms clean. We wanted a quiet room and got a corner room, and we couldn‚Äôt be any happier. We always kept ice handy in the ice bucket and the double wall, insulated ice bucket provided in the room kept the ice longer than the typical single layer bucket. I wanted to purchase the ice bucket for use in my home (very handy if

The hotel was exactly what my family & I needed for our vacation to Anaheim, Disneyland. It was clean, walking distance to Disney, provided decent breakfast & most of all has a very welcoming & helpful staff. I would like to thank Adilene Grlleece, Lisa, Christina & Jorden.

Summary Heading: Great location and excellent value for money
Summary: It's been about a year since we (myself, partner and our 6 yo) stayed at this hotel but have just been back to Anaheim and stayed at a number of hotels, so now is a good time to review this hotel since we have plenty of others to compare to.  First up, this hotel is in a great location. It's about a 15 min walk to Disney and you can take an ART shuttle if you want to save your energy for Disney. There's also a CVS about a block away and over the road from the CVS is a set of small takeaway food outlets.   The rooms are tidy, very spacious and the best part of this hotel is the complimentary breakfast. This really sets you up for the day. Perhaps the one slightly negative is the pool area....it's not as exciting as some hotels, but this isn't that big a deal considering all the

We have 4 children, and it can be challenging to find hotel rooms that will fit us all without having to book two rooms. Hyatt place fit the bill perfectly. The staff is friendly. Unfortunately they were having elevator issues our first 2 days here. We were only on the 3rd floor, but lugging a stroller up and down the stairs gets old quickly.   The hotel is new and very clean. Our maid did an outstanding job every day. The hotel has a very modern feel. The beds were ok, not the most comfortable, but I slept fine.  Free breakfast was one of the main reasons we booked here. It was definitely better than your standard continental breakfast. My only complaint would be that I wish they had bacon some days, and the eggs had a funny aftertaste. The dining area fills up quickly if you

Summary Heading: Better Places to Stay for Disneyland
Summary: Hotel was clean and breakfast was decent.  Pillows were flat and uncomfortable.  Elevators were down on more than one occasion.  Hard to navigate up and down 5 flights of stairs with a double stroller and 2 kids.  There are hotels that are closer to Disneyland that are better appointed.

Summary Heading: Good Alternative to Onsite Disney Properties
Summary: We stayed here with our 8 & 5 year-old kids for a Disney weekend.  Great value for such a trip - breakfast was included and the parks were just a mile away, which meant we could walk or take a shuttle and not have to pay for parking at the parks.  Being a hotel next to the convention center, it seemed to mostly cater to business travelers (instead of Disney crowds), which meant that it was quiet at night - helpful when your family is all ready to sleep after a day on your feet.

We had a really nice stay at this hotel for 2 days. The hotel has just been renovated and the furniture is really nice and clean. We stayed in a 2 queen bed room, which had 2 beds and a nice L shaped sofa that could be turned into a bed. The hotel served breakfast, which was a nice basic breakfast with warm servings such as egg, bacon, a selection of doughnuts and pastries, yoghurt, fruit, cereals, juices, etc..   The staff was really friendly.   I would totally go there again.

The hotel room is spacious. Breakfast selection is great. The price is right. The location is good. Best of all, the service! The level of attention to details is impeccable! We have a new bottle of face wash, and we put the cover in the pile of towers. One day we came back at night it was gone. But then the next day we came back from theme park it re-appeared! Speechless! Will definitely come here again.

This has great location for Disneyland and has a lot of eateries around.  It is not a five staff hotel but you are not paying five star prices.  The breakfast has a reasonable range but I don't like how they add vinegar to the bread

Summary Heading: This Hotel is absolutely amazing, A+ rating all the way
Summary: Stayed here for 8 nights with my family and everything was amazing. Rooms were clean. Rooms cleaners were amazing and the breakfast is the best I have seen in a long long time. I would recommend this to anyone.

We did not expect the room to be as spacious for the weekend pay rate. Definitely exceeded our expectations when we arrived to the room. The location was perfect as it is only a minute drive to the Disney parking lot. Would stay here again.

Room and room facilities are excellent. Buffet breakfast was very good .. Lots of choices. Staff is professional and and very pleasant. Ample parking. Very close to Disneyland. Facility is quite new and is kept ver well.

My husband and I stayed here for 6 nights. The staff was exceptional. Very helpful and made us feel at home. The room was very clean and the maid kept it tidy for us. The breakfast was very busy but worth it to have a hot breakfast to get you going in the morning. I highly recommended this hotel for business or vacation.

The room was very quiet, clean and welcoming. The customer service at Hyatt Place Resort/Convention Center was excellent. The food was made to perfection. The free breakfast that is offered was fantastic with lots of choices.

This Hotel is about a 20 minute walk from Disney front door. The staff were very friendly and approachable. The breakfast room was very busy but the staff were working extremely hard to ensure the juices and food were remaining fresh at all times. The only thing this Hotel; lacks is a shuttle to Disney, options are your own transport, walk or local bus. I would stay here agin if in Anaheim, but would see if other Hotels of equivalent price had a shuttle service.

I have stayed at this hotel at least 45 days over the past year - cant do any better in Anaheim !  Front desk staff always welcomes you with a smile. Solid breakfast with quality items included with your room. Rooms are nice and comfortable. Lots of families but I come here for business - works for all of us !  Love this hotel - my go to place in Anaheim.

We stayed just one night here for our first day in Anaheim.  The room was very nice and spacious and we enjoyed a great complimentary breakfast buffet in the morning.  The staff were very pleasant and helpful.  I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are staying off the Disneyland property.

The place is great!!!!!  We had some much fun..it was very clean..the only thing is that they shouldn't charge for parking since we stay in the hotel. And they don't offer valet parking...employees were friendly, i liked!

Hyatt really has figured out the suite/2nd tier properties better than anyone else. Hyatt Places are consistently better than the competition and this property was no exception. Once again, I had a  very good experience. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the breakfast varied and fresh, the wifi strong and consistent, and the rooms clean and stylish.  My only comment is that the rooms on Harbor Blvd can be a little noisy on weekend nights with the traffic. Not intrusive but noticeable. I'd ask for a room that does not face the street.   Overall, a great stay. I wish Hyatt had more locations My main complaint is that I cannot stay in one of their properties everywhere I go.

Summary Heading: Best Hotel to stay on your Disneyland Vacation!
Summary: Decided to take my family to Disneyland, i had accumulated points on my Hyatt Gold Passport membership and i decided to cash them in!!   I called the Hyatt Gold passport reservations line and the friendly customers service agent took a few minutes to make some suggestions and we decided on the Anaheim Hyatt as its the closest quality hotel that is literally strolling distance to Disneyland.    I figured since i had booked this vacation using my accumulated points that i might get a lower level of service, I was wrong!   from the check in to Check out process i have been nothing but impressed with the friendliness, professionalism of the staff.  This hotel charges a daily $16 parking fee for your car, however it was waived since i am a Gold Passport member(if you don't have one

A short (two block?) walk to the convention center.  Clean, new.  Staff friendly and attentive.  Small Bar and limited (but 24/7) menu were great options.  Good free breakfast was convenient to get going in the mornings.  The pool is fine for kids to splash in but don't pack your suit if you are in to doing laps.  Too small.

Summary Heading: Hyatt Place at Anaheim (Close to Disneyland)
Summary: Decided to take the family to Disneyland, i had racked up points on my Hyatt Gold Passport card (Get one if you don't have it) and decided to redeem points for a family vacation to California. It was a great experience from the check in to check out.   the Staff was friendly, and very welcoming, the hotel has a daily $16 parking fee, however they were kind enough to waive the fee being a Gold passport member.    The room was nicely laid out, clean and quite.  the complimentary breakfast buffet has a good selection.   The hotel is a short walking distance to Disneyland and we decided to take a stroll to the park.   All in all this is a very good hotel to stay in and one of the better options for families coming to Disneyland.  you will not be disappointing.

Summary Heading: Continual unauthorised charging of my credit card
Summary: Was charged for 3 rooms for 9 nights when only booked 1. Resulted in my credit card being maxed out before I arrived. Three international phone calls before I left and was assured it was resolved. When I checked in found out it wasnt. Even after 9 days of trying to resolve, still not by the time I left. Upon checkout I finalised my bill (room service charges) in cash. Came home to find the hotel has now charged my credit card with the charges!

Summary Heading: Awesome stay at Hyatt Place Anaheim!
Summary: We cannot say enough about how sincere, kind, and pleasant the staff at this hotel were during our stay.  It seemed like everyone went out of their way to be helpful.  The hotel is modern, clean, quiet and perfect for both families as well as the business/convention traveler.  The location was perfect for a cheer competition we were attending, but we also enjoyed having Morton's and Ruth's Chris Steakhouse right next door.  Thanks for an awesome weekend Hyatt Place!  We will be back!

Booked here to attend a conference at the nearby convention center.  My room was spacious and modern.  Very clean, comfortable beds.  The staff really make this hotel, they are empowered to make decisions and treat you exceptionally well.  I had to wait for a few minutes to pay for my food order and was given 1/2 off and a free bottle of water for my wait.  would definitely recommend this hotel.

Overall the hotel was very nice.  Staff helpful and friendly.  Modern feel and looked very clean.  Only problem was the breakfast.  Lot of options but the main item, the eggs were not good. Tasted like they were powdered eggs and not real eggs.  We were surprised because we have stayed at Hyatt Regency and the breakfast is always fresh and tasty.  Maybe because it us a Hyatt Place they do things different.    Still overall really good hotel

I was very satisfied with my stay. The staff made me feel welcomed and happy. The visit was enjoyable. The room was clean and well kept. I would be happy to return again in the future. The employee who assisted me at check-in made me feel valued as a customer.

After a long flight from Melbourne, Australia and arriving at the hotel at 8.30am, I was pleasantly surprised when the staff allowed us to check in early, obviously our room was available.  From the moment we arrived the service was excellent.  A BIG thank you to Jordan who assisted with all our queries.   Great buffet breakfast to start the day.   Complementary fruit available throughout the day in the foyer.  Who doesn't love free WIFI in their room.  Small, but good clean swimming pool.  Laundry facilities located next door at another hotel, $2 per wash and dry.   Walking distance to Disneyland, Bubba Gump, Johnny Rockets, The Cheesecake Factory, CVS (local convenient store that has all your supplies and pharmaceuticals) and Alamo Hire Car.  Highly recommend this Hotel, we

Stayed here just one night while visiting Disneyland. Impressive customer service: we arrived at 7:30 am and were immediately checked in and offered breakfast even though regular check in is in the afternoon. Hotel was clean and modern, lots of towels at the pool area, staff was super friendly and accommodating. I expected more from breakfast based on other reviews, but at least the coffee was to my liking. Overall great location if going to Disneyland.

I stayed here with my Girl Scout troop for our very last outing after several years together.  We stayed in the King Family Rooms and there was plenty of room, even with 5 of us.  The hotel was clean, comfortable, and friendly.  I would definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: New hotel at very convenient location
Summary: This place is new with new Lifestyle fitness equipment and has good breakfast.  It's new and reasonably prices and have a very convenient and easy to use underground parking and within walking distance to Disneyland this is a decent stay.  But beware because it's catering to Disney crowd there are loud kids and doors slam loud.

Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Attended event at this hotel and stayed two nights. Hotel has been renovated over time, but the rooms did show some wear, specifically in the bathrooms. Overall the lobby and restaurant areas were lovely. While it was a convention center hotel, I did see many families who were traveling staying there as it is a convenient location to Disney! We could see the fireworks at night from the parks.

Stayed at the Hyatt Place for the 2nd time and had another wonderful stay. The King Family room was perfect for our family of 4 (bunk beds for the kids). The rooms were spacious and clean and the staff was always courteous and accommodating to our requests. Hotel is located a short walk from the Disney parks and surrounding restaurants/shops.

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel near to all attractions
Summary: we stayed in Hyatt for 06nights my family really enjoyed specially my two kids the room are spacious we have asked for two queen beds which was enough for two . Morning breakfast is very good every day you have new choices . its is crowded if after 8 in the morning .   Disneyland is walking distance but if you spend all day in Disney then you need a cab to return which cost 7dollar only.  Denny is the closest restaurant and if you are driving all places such as target walmart Anaheim plaza 99cent all are very near. the reception staff is very helpful and greet you every time when you enter hotel. If I travel again to Anaheim I will definitely stay in same hotel and ask for same room 202. shazia kamal azfar

Summary Heading: Great friendly staff and lovely hotel.
Summary: When looking where to stay I was a little confused, this was reasonable with free hot breakfast included. The parking is 16 dollars over night, was easy walking to the Cheesecake Factory. The rooms were lovely and clean, nice bedding and corner sofa. With tea making facilities and great shower and nice toiletries.

I really enjoyed with my family in this hotel. Room size was good friendly staff specialy reception staff, service was very good and walking distance to Disneyland. Food available on walking distance .  Azfar

Summary Heading: Not what I expected in a Hyatt!
Summary: I stay here for 3 nights and I'm glad that I didn't stay any longer. It was nice that it only takes 20 minute walking distance to Disneyland,free complimentary breakfast in the morning,they have a pool but my kids and I didn't even use it because it was pretty small and was share with another hotel close by. I don't even know why they charge guess resort fee for a little pool! I was quite disappointed when I enter my room,there was a funky smell,chip paint,lock to bathroom was broken and the lighting is quite dark.This hotel hasn't been that old, I don't understand why it's run down already.

Summary Heading: Not terrible but not great either.
Summary: Skillet breakfast is greasy and unhealthy. Room furniture needed to be cleaned. For the upscale price, it doesn't deliver.  The good part is that it is within walking distance of Disneyland if you are in good condition.

Hyatt House was a great hotel for a disney trip.  The hotel was very clean, rooms are extra large- ours had 2 queens and a sofa bed, plenty of room for everyone.  You can have food 24/7 and the free breakfast saves a lot of time and money in the park.

The hotel staffs are very helpful. They are very nice and willing to help you. I had to fax many pages of my paper in the last moment at the hotel. Since the loading and fax time was long and I had to leave soon. The front dest staff asked my number and email address and they called and emailed me the result of fax later. I really appreciate that.

We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The room was a good size and we loved the fact that there was a separate area with a large bunk bed for the kids. We also found the staff to be very friendly.   The hotel is about 30 minutes' walk from the main entrance of Disneyland, and we actually enjoyed the stroll back to our hotel in the early evening, so it didn't bother us. (Except for about 2 blocks that appeared a bit shady). It is a good thing is that they have a shuttle that runs from the hotel, right to the gate at Disneyland every 30 minutes until midnight, so you don't have attempt the walk.   We also liked the fact that they offered a "pick-up" service at the restaurant, so you don't have to pay extra fees to get food delivered to your room if you don't feel like it.

It has a very good  complimentary breakfast , very modern and clean room,  just 15 minutes walk from disneyland park, it fits for family and fit in just 1 room .Very quite stay .Looking forward to be back to this hotel again !

Summary Heading: Don't let the simple set-up "fool" you...
Summary: On arriving at the hotel, my first impression was that the reception desk was quite basic and the staff young. It seemed more Best Western than Hyatt but I admit that I was wrong. Every staff we encountered at the hotel were professional, helpful and friendly.   As for the room, it was immaculate. I don't know if it is because the hotel is new or if it was recently refurbished but I couldn't find any fault with any part of the room.  Wifi is free but parking is $16 plus tax per day.  It is roughly a 15 minute walk to Disneyland and conveniently located close to restaurants.  Breakfast is decent, the spread is mostly the same but sufficiently wide.  If you are planning to go to Disneyland and have decided not to stay at one of the Disney hotels, I would highly recommend booking a
Manager Response: Dear Kerwei, Thanks for your wonderful review.  Hyatt Place is a relatively new brand of hotel offered by Hyatt, featuring a level of service that Hyatt is known for with the amenities and services for travelers who may not have the need for banquet rooms or large meeting space.  As a focused service hotel, our hotel is ideal for families, groups and  corporate travelers who appreciate a hotel that is clean, offers convenience and provides comfortable surroundings with service that is tailored to meet every guests needs.  We are pleased to see that you enjoyed your stay with us and look forward to the opportunity of welcoming you again soon.  Thanks!  Hyatt Place Awarded "Highest in Guest Satisfaction Among Upscale Hotel Chains" by J.D. Power in 2015

Summary Heading: Great hotel clean room very spacious
Summary: Great to have here  with my family and  we chose to upgrade our room to 2 queen beds with special features helped by front desk named Adi she really nice and helpful very welcoming places   House keeper are very nice to they clean my room very well  !!! Only my concern is about the breakfast not kids friendly   I hope  next time we go there more varieties of cereal that kids may be love it and i hope they have a hot chocolate and some kids friendly spreads  for kids and most of your guest are children's  so please !update your buffet breakfast !!!but over all my kids are Really happy for The room they don't wanna go home yet hehheeh we definitely. Back to This place again!!
Manager Response: Dear Chef_jhayer, Thanks for your review and comments about hotel.  We appreciate your suggestions about breakfast and will discuss these ideas and others with our team.  Great suggestions!  Should your kids insist that you bring them back to Disneyland, please let us know.  We will gladly welcome you back!  Thanks again!  Hyatt Place Awarded "Highest in Guest Satisfaction Among Upscale Hotel Chains" by J.D. Power in 2015

Summary: I began my reservation with another hotel in the area, and my reservation was cancelled. So, immediately I found this hotel available. So I booked the hotel, and the staff and rooms were more than I expected. Great stay and I will recommend this hotel to anyone.

Summary Heading: Superb value close to convention center
Summary: I stayed for a convention center event of 13,000. This was the best value on paper, confirmed on site. Clean modern room, free hearty breakfast, very friendly staff, very short walk to convention center (or Disney).
Manager Response: Dear Aerocraft67, Thank you for rating us a perfect five!  We appreciate it very much.  Most important though is that you were completely satisfied with your stay.  Very happy to see that you enjoyed our free breakfast and that our location was extremely close and convenient to the venues you visited.  Let us know if you plan to visit again soon!  Thanks again.  Hyatt Place Awarded "Highest in Guest Satisfaction Among Upscale Hotel Chains" by J.D. Power in 2015

Summary: Had an enjoyable stay with grandkids. Staff was helpful, courteous-- not just at the front desk--all staff I came in contact with was always asking how we were enjoying our stay and if we needed anything.
Manager Response: Dear cspennington, Thank YOU so much for giving us a perfect 5!  We are very pleased to see that you and your grandchildren had a wonderful stay with us.  The fact that you recognized our staff for their relentless efforts to ensure that our guests are completely satisfied is a tribute to their determination to ensure that everyone has an enjoyable stay.  We hope that if you plan to return again with your grandchildren, that you let us know.  Perhaps next time, they will bring the grandparents...and wouldn't that be nice.    Thanks again for your perfect score!  Hyatt Place Awarded "Highest in Guest Satisfaction Among Upscale Hotel Chains" by J.D. Power in 2015

Summary: Every little detail about this place was great .. The staff, the help with all Disneyland questions and shuttle info .. The rooms were great and the beds were like heaven after a long day at the parks .. Walk was little far for us to get to Disney but the shuttles made it great
Manager Response: Hi tammy b, Thanks for bestowing a perfect 5 on our Hyatt Place at Anaheim Resort hotel.  We are so pleased that you found our staff to be focused and helpful during your stay.  And those Hyatt Grand Beds...you just cant beat them for a wonderful nights rest!  Glad to hear your found them to be just the right medicine after a fun filled day.  And the ART shuttle is just the right choice for getting to and from Disney or other points in and around the Anaheim Resort.  Thanks again for taking the time to submit your review.  Let us know if you plan to return. Thanks!  Hyatt Place Awarded "Highest in Guest Satisfaction Among Upscale Hotel Chains" by J.D. Power in 2015

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel close to Disney, a couple minor issues nothing major
Summary: Stayed here with my wife and two kids ages 11 and 15 for 4 nights over spring break. This is a very nice, modern hotel on Harbor Blvd. Staff is very friendly and helpful. We walked to Disneyland most days, it's a straight shot, takes about 15 minutes. Felt safe and well lit. It does seem a little long going back at night after you've been in the parks all day. There are three crosswalks you have to go across. We also took taxis, about $11.50 to go from the hotel to the parks as the driver has to turn around twice which takes more time, it's only about $7.50 to go from the parks back to the hotel (again a straight shot) .   Anyway, the hotel has a great breakfast, nice outdoor pool and hot tub but kind of small, and an exercise room that is incredibly small. It has free weights
Manager Response: Hi gldnby, Thank you for your very nice review.  We are happy to see that your stay was enjoyable and that you all had a great stay and a wonderful time visiting the Anaheim Resort.  Another great choice for transportation that is really gaining ground in Anaheim is Lyft and Uber.  These are great choices for going anywhere to or from the hotel.  As for the glass on the bathroom doors, we are working to alleviate the light issue.  Seems as these types of doors have become quite common in new hotels these days and as you alluded, maybe a re-thought is due.  Hope we have the opportunity of welcoming you and your family again soon. Thanks again!! Hyatt Place Awarded "Highest in Guest Satisfaction Among Upscale Hotel Chains" by J.D. Power in 2015

Summary Heading: New hotel, nice location, great staff
Summary: Stayed for a week during spring break.  Breakfast was good and hot, hotel is very clean, kids loved the pool.  Free wi-fi.  Only 2 drawbacks at this point - guest self-serve laundry is in the hotel next door and there was not lotion in the toiletries.  They would give you some if you asked, but it wasn't there in the first place.  We had a room with the sofa bed and our kids - 7 and 9 - did fine.  Mini fridge in the room.  Shower was really hot water.  We walked across the street to Toy Story parking for the shuttle when going to Disney.  We also took a trip to Sea World in San Diego on Sunday - nice, easy (but long) drive.  We went to Universal Studios Hollywood Monday - not so easy (and still long) drive.  Lots of traffic.  All in all, would recommend this hotel and we would
Manager Response: Hello Heidi C, Thank you so much for rating us a perfect 5!  We couldn't be more pleased to see that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay with us.  Please accept our apologies that our laundry room was not available during your stay.  Also just in case for future hotel stays with Hyatt Place, we do offer a service called Odds & Ends that has you covered with those must-have items you can buy, borrow or enjoy for free, including nail polish, a universal cell phone charger, toothpaste and more.  Just check with a Gallery Host and we will gladly assist you with your needs.  Lotion, of course is available for the asking.   Thanks again Heidi, hope to see you and your family again soon on your next visit to the Anaheim Resort!  Hyatt Place Awarded "Highest in Guest Satisfaction Among Upscale Hotel Chains" by J.D. Power in 2015

Summary: Excellent stay, good large breakfast options included (plenty of seating if you are there by 7:30 after 8 it is definitely busier), clean room, very friendly staff and close to Disney (easy buses to take) or a bit of a walk maybe 15-20mins...family suites were great!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We are happy to see that you enjoyed your stay with us and found the hotel to be a superb choice for your Anaheim and Disneyland visit.   Thanks again!

Summary: very good for people going to Disney or having a business trip at the convention center. The breakfast was very good and many choices. The staff is very nice and friendly. Will recommend the place to others.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your review and comments.  We are pleased to see that you enjoyed your stay with us and appreciated our friendly and courteous staff. Thanks again.

Summary: Great room! The room had a separated living room from the bedroom and a close walk to the Disney Shuttle bus.  The room was facing the street, but high enough that the traffic noise was not an issue at night.
Manager Response: Dear guest, We are so pleased to see that you really enjoyed your room.  All of our rooms have a very nice L-shaped Sofa Sleeper and a partition separating the beds.  It really does make for a very comfortable stay.  Let us know if your plans call for another visit to the Anaheim Resort!  Thanks!

Summary Heading: 3 Things I liked because I have toddlers:  Hyatt Place vs. Hilton
Summary: Stayed at the Hilton once and then the Hyatt Place.  I liked the Hyatt Place over Hilton for three reasons.  1.  My room had a pull out bed, which I put the mattress on the floor for them to sleep on.  At the Hilton, the beds in the room were so high, I had concerns about them falling off when sleeping.  2.  Free breakfast buffet included in price of the room.  With kids, this was very nice as meals can add up!  It was cheaper than going to Denny's right across the street.  3.  Easy parking.  Maybe it was the date I stayed, but parking was abundant and quick to walk to vs. at the Hilton, the parking structure was massive and had to park far from the elevator.  Don't get me wrong - the Hilton was nice.  But with young toddlers, I really felt the Hyatt Place was a better place to
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thanks for your review of the Hyatt Place at Anaheim Resort.  Very pleased to see that you found our hotel to be comfortable and accommodating.  Our free hot breakfast is a welcome amenity and a real money saver as you mention.  Happy to know that you enjoyed it.  And thanks for sharing a great tip about parking.  Our garage is so convenient and just a quick elevator ride up to your guest floor.  Should you plan to return soon, please let us know. Thanks again!

Summary: Disappointed by this hotel. The room looks nice and the bed was comfortable. I have stayed at Hyatt Hotels before and this one is lacking. Bad points: something they put on tile floor peals up as you stand on it and coats your feet. The thermostat only allows a 3 degree difference. When the heat/air came on,  very noisy but this was a blessing because the walls are so thin. We literally could hear everything our neighbors were up to including bathroom use. This in turn made us very uncomfortable with any noise we made. Literally whispered and tiptoed around the room. We went to Disneyland resort. This hotel looks close but it is not. They do not offer a shuttle but suggest that you walk down the block and grab public transportation. We ended up driving to Disney parking and

Someone recommended the Hyatt Place to me and I'm glad they did. There is underground parking directly beneath the hotel for $16.00 per night with unlimited in and out privileges. There were no issues finding a spot, it's well lit, and clean.   The lobby is nice. There is seating. It has a small restaurant and bar area where you can order  food and have drinks. You can also call in your food order but must go down to the lobby to pick it up. There are also grab it and go foods available from the case. Breakfast is also served here.   The rooms are a nice size and have two queen beds and a fold out couch that is separated from the beds by about a three foot wide sort of a shoji screen affair. There is a flat screen tv and a lot of channels. The wifi was free and good. There is a
Manager Response: Dear guests, Thanks for your nice review of the Hyatt Place at Anaheim Resort.  Glad to hear that your stay was enjoyable and that you found everything to be convenient and accommodating.  We look forward to welcoming you again soon.

Summary: This hotel was clean, quiet and comfortable. The room was spacious (2 queen beds plus pull out sofa bed). The only thing I didn't like was needing to go down to the front desk and pick up food ordered from their in-house kitchen and for outside food delivery (because of security).  Yes, nice to have that security; however, traveling solo with 3 young kids, it's more convenient to have the room delivery option. Bed was comfortable, the underground parking was clean, and staff was friendly. Definitely would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear skf515, Thank you for taking the time to post your review of the Hyatt Place at Anaheim Resort.  Pleased to see that you took advantage of our 24 hour Market Gallery for your dining enjoyment.  Please accept our apologies that we do not offer room service.  Orders can be placed from your room for pick up in the Guest Gallery.  Its a common practice for outside vendors to deliver to the lobby for our guests security.  We cant emphasize enough the effort we maintain to protect our guests as a normal practice and would like to thank you for your understanding.  We look forward to welcoming you back again soon. Thanks again :)

Summary Heading: Look no further and stay here
Summary: Excellent rooms clean hotel, great parking, good breakfast, coffee Direct TV, and the WiFi was actually worth the effort to use. I'll be back on my next trip to Disneyland. Don't waste time elsewhere.
Manager Response: Dear clayw73, Thanks for your perfect review of the Hyatt Place at Anaheim Resort.  Nice to see that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay with us and found everything to your satisfaction. Please do contact us next time you plan to visit the Anaheim Resort.  Thanks again!

Summary: Take the shuttle to Disneyland and save the hassle, the location is great and the service was impeccable.  Plenty of restaurants around the area to take advantage of, and the parking was safe and protected.
Manager Response: Dear guest, Thanks so much for your nice review of our hotel.  We are pleased to see that your stay was enjoyable and that the service you received met with your satisfaction.  Our staff is devoted to ensuring that all of our guests are well taken care of and your experience is a testament to their efforts.  Thanks for recognizing our team.  They will be quite satisfied knowing that your stay was enjoyable.  Let us know if you plan to return to the Anaheim Resort soon.  Thanks again.

Summary: Only issue with my room (322) was the phone had the message light blinking and yet I couldn't check those messages. I had 2 people come and look at the phone and they couldn't figure it out.  I don't consider this an issue--I don't think I actually had a message, I think the light was faulty. So no worries!
Manager Response: Hello 105jeremy, Thank you for your kind review of the Hyatt Place at Anaheim Resort.  And thank for reaching out to our staff to help figure out the message light issue on your phone. Every issue is met with the desire and effort to quickly resolve it and make it right.  We thank you for allowing us to troubleshoot and fix the phone issue.  Should you plans call to visit us again soon, please let us know.   Thanks again!

Summary Heading: Security officer Terrible... but nice , clean and huge rooms.
Summary: My family and extended family stayed here in Hyatt for two nights with two rooms. Front desk and Housekeeping friendly, rooms were clean and spacious.But the security officer was really terrible and discriminating. This officer was rude that he even threaten my uncle just because he was not dress up. My uncle cannot talk that much thats why when he was asked by this officer what room he is in with a loud voice my uncle cannot utter any words and was trembling. My uncle stayed outside the hotel for several hrs that early morning if my husband didnt go down to checked the parked van we wouldnt know that my uncle was outside waiting for us. Manager didnt apologize  also keeps on saying it was not Hyatts security and it was manage by third party company. He sent apology thru email
Manager Response: Dear guest, Please accept our apologies for the interaction you and your family had with our hotel security.  We have brought this isolated incident to the attention of the guards superiors so that we can avoid these types of misunderstanding from happening in the future.  We welcome guests from all corners of the world and focus on delivering excellent customer service without regard to origin or race.  Our business is hospitality and we will continue to deliver the highest level of courtesy and professionalism to all guests without exception. And thank you for taking the time to share your review.

Summary: Room's walls were too thin. This meant that the noise children which tended to be at this Disney-proximate hotel would blare through the walls in the morning. It would also be nice to have a laundry on premises.
Manager Response: Hi Darren P, Thanks for sharing your comments.  Please accept our apologies for the disturbance you experienced.  At times, children do get excited about their first visit to the Disneyland Resort.  We do ask all of our guests to observe the privacy and comfort of others, especially during night time and early morning hours.  Looks as though these little kids might have been just a bit too excited.  Also, we are working on our guest laundry and in the meantime do offer Valet Service as an option.   We thank you again for your candid comments and look forward to welcoming you back again soon.

Summary: Rooms were clean, staff was courteous and helpful. The only issue, if you can call it that, was parking in that it was a bit confusing since there is another hotel in the same area.  I parked closer to that one, and there were no issues that I know of.  Would stay again.
Manager Response: Dear William G., Thank you for sharing your comments about your recent stay with us.  The perfect score you bestowed on us is most appreciated and more important reflects the level and service we are known for.  We shall look forward to your next visit. Thanks again!

Summary: We have stayed at Hyatts before and are never disappointed. Hotels are clean and this was no exception.  Had to pay for parking but that is common in this area. The nice part was that much of it was covered and it was easy to find a space. You could take the elevator from the parking to your hotel room. Breakfast was included in the price and was delicious. We especially liked the biscuits and gravy. The  scrambled eggs were also good and the coffee was great. They have an outdoor pool which is small but sufficient. Small outdoor patio but not attached to the pool.  Small bar area which was nice if you needed a drink. A bit expensive but probably not any more than other hotel bars.  Staff was friendly.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you so much for your review of the Hyatt Place at Anaheim Resort.  We appreciate the time you took to share your experience.  We are pleased to see that you enjoyed our free breakfast and that you found our underground parking and the rest of our services and amenities to your satisfaction. Let us know if we can welcome you back again soon.  Regards.

Summary Heading: Perfect for families, close to Disneyland!
Summary: Easy checkout!  Fantastic breakfast, varied somewhat day to day so that was great!  For the most part quiet, didn't hear our neighbors, I'm assuming thicker walls than some places Ive been to before.  Courteous staff!  VERY CLEAN, which is very important to me, not just our room, but the whole hotel.  One of the best parts was the security, you need a room key to access the guest floors, so no randoms coming in, which helped ease my paranoid parent mind.  The fitness room had the basic necessities, also included weights, which was important to me, with towels and a water dispenser.  Last but not least, they have a coffee/tea bar in the lobby.  I was battling a minor cold while on vacation, and being able to go downstairs to buy hot tea was awesome and very convenient.
Manager Response: Dear Sarah R, Thank you for a perfect score.  A nice reflection of the service you received while staying as a guest at our Hyatt Place at Anaheim Resort hotel.  Our staff is dedicated to ensuring that our guests are made to feel welcome and help them as much as possible.  Its nice to see that you recognized our efforts to ensure our guests security as well as the services we offer that help to make ones stay just that much more enjoyable.  If your plans call for another visit the Anaheim Resort, please let us know. Thank you for your review.

Summary: Hyatt Place is a average rating for me and that is based not on the room itself but their service and practices. First let me give you the facts; We were in one of their King bed with bunk beds, fold out queen sofa and a desk with chair attached to the wall. With all of that in the room very little walking space is left. When you read the room description and look at the photos you might think the King bed can be a private area as they are sliding doors that separate the 2 rooms. However, when you walk in the bathroom is immediately to your left, go a few steps more and you are at the King. The bunks and the fold out are in the back room so everyone will need to walk through to get to the bathroom.  They do have black out curtains which is nice. King bed was comfortable but the
Manager Response: Dear Fresca12, Thanks for your review.  Sorry to hear that your stay was not as enjoyable as could be expected.  This is quite unusual as most guests seem to enjoy the room with the bunk beds.   Its common practice for hotels to pre-authorize credit cards or debit cards for the anticipated amount of a guests entire stay unless it has been pre-paid in advance of your arrival.  As for the credit/debit card comments, we do accept cash payment upon check-in which would allow us to only authorize your card for any additional charges you might incur during your stay.    Drivers that are picking up or dropping off guests are able to enter the hotel entrance and exit within 30 minutes at no charge.  Guest loading zone is under the porte-cochere in front of the lobby.   Should there be a need to stay longer, we advise the driver to contact the front desk for assistance.  Please accept our apologies for any inconvenience and trust that we will have the opportunity to welcome you back again soon.  Thanks

Summary: Hyatt went above and beyond and made our vacation a special time from breakfast til nightcaps. In room treats provided when staff noticed birthday wishes to our daughter. Staff provided guidance and arranged tickets to Universal Studios on short notice.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thanks so much for your perfect score and review.  We appreciate the time you took to share your comments.  We are very happy to see that you stay was enjoyable and that we were able to help make your daughters birthday celebration just a bit more memorable. Thanks again.

Summary: Great new hotel with clean comfortable rooms free breakfast and wifi and close enough to walk to Disneyland. About .8 miles. Parking is 16 a night. They do not have their own shuttle but  a short walk across the parking lot to catch the Anaheim shuttle.

Summary Heading: One of the best family hotels we have stayed at
Summary: We were so happy with our stay at the Hyatt Place. We felt at home and the kiddos loved the bunk beds and the fact that the door closed to separate the rooms was a plus! We even decided to extend our day on short notice and the lovely staff was more than happy to help. Amazing staff. We will be back. Thank you for making our stay so much more enjoyable and memorable for our girls on there surprise Disney trip!!

Went to Disneyland for 3 days. My stay there was a home away from home. The only inconvenience was the parking space drove a truck and parking was a little too small, plus there was a $16 per day fee.

Attended a week-long conference in Feb 2016, located at convention center, Hilton and Marriott.  Everything is very close together.  Walking time 10 minutes or less to get back and forth.  Many other hotel guests were here for Disneyland, so there were a lot of energetic kids around, but that was a nice change from the stuffiness most convention hotels.:)  I was stunned by how friendly the staff was. Great breakfast and nice options for a quick dinner.  I would take more advantage of the pool and fitness room next time.  It was very nice to have a refrigerator.  A microwave would be another great addition.  Anaheim was a perfect location for the convention and I would definitely choose this hotel again if I return.

Awesome stay, great staff and our housekeeper worked very hard to insure our room was spotless.  I will never stay anywhere else in Anaheim. We were busting Great stay, awesome staff and our housekeeper was the best!

This hotel is pretty good. Furniture might need an update soon. Free breakfast and good food. No room service so I got to carry my food to my room. Free wifi and a good selection of channels. Staff are very friendly.

This Hyatt Place is great! It's the new design, so bathroom is away from the beds and the decor is greys not browns.   We had a two queen room. Unlike some Hyatt Places the room wasn't too tight with two beds. Our room was on the 5th floor facing the Toy Story lot for Disneyland. Speaking of, while we didn't go to the actual parks we did take the 1mi-ish walk to hit Downtown Disney. The hotel is on an ART route so we walked it. Not terrible. I just ignored the people who wanted to handout pamphlets. The darkest part of the walk was the side of DCA. Not a bad walk at all. Not sure I'd want to do it after an entire day at Disneyland though.   The room was clean. The staff was friendly. Housekeeping did a good job. Didn't disturb my things but did their work each day. We

Hyatt is our 'go-to' hotel and having a nice one so close to Disneyland made our stay that much better.  Staff is great, attentive, helpful.....food was very good.  Location was perfect.  Lots of restaurants within a VERY short walking distance.  Spacious rooms, sparkling clean facility!

The room was spacious, nearly luxurious feeling. The staff was incredibly genuine and engaged. Everything was clean and well taken care of. The price was spot on. If you want good quality, comfortable and clean accommodations, and free breakfast to boot, this is the place.

The hotel is walking distance to Disney. They serve free breakfast every morning. Free wi-fi and clean and spacious room. I was there for 3 nights. I asked for high floor room with a view but they assigned me 1st floor room. However that did not bother me. Overall great hotel!

We couldn't be more pleased with this Hyatt Place. From the time we stepped in the door, the staff and ALL personnel were excellent, helpful, very service oriented, and super friendly. Each person greeted us in every encounter throughout our 2 night stay. Though the room was excellent, clean, and very comfortable, it was the staff that was so great. The included breakfast buffet was much better than most, if not all, hotels that include breakfast. The breakfast area was clean, well presented, good selection of food, and again, the staff was always attentive and helpful. Though it's a bit of a walk to Disneyland, it wasn't too bad. I guess that's all a personal preference. We would stay here again in a second if we ever needed to return to Anaheim. Thank you to all the Hyatt

Summary Heading: Hyatt Place a perfect place for the Anaheim Convention
Summary: Hyatt Place is just a perfect size that you don't get too overwhelmed with the crowd especially if you are already attending a convention nearby. It has a cozy atmosphere and excellent breakfast spread. It doesn't come cheap though so you expect topnotch quality of service and a few times, they trip.

Summary Heading: Ideal hotel for a Disneyland overnight stay
Summary: The staff's attention to detail and friendliness exceeded my expectations.  The hotel is modern, conveniently located to Disneyland and the rooms are spacious and clean. The breakfast is nicer than most hotel's "free breakfast".  I would not only stay here again, but would definitely recommend this hotel to any families looking for a hotel stay in the area.
Manager Response: Hi Daryl, Thanks so much for your review of the Hyatt Place at Anaheim Resort.  Its nice to see that you enjoyed your stay with us and that you found everything to your satisfaction.  And thanks for referring your friends and family to stay with us.  Next time you plan a visit, please let us know.   Thanks again!  Hyatt Place Awarded "Highest in Guest Satisfaction Among Upscale Hotel Chains" by J.D. Power in 2015

Summary: This is a newer hotel.  The rooms are very clean, spacious and have wonderful sofas.  There are signs reminding patrons to keep silent hours after 10pm, I believe.  The staff is young and fresh and kind-hearted.  My friend and I have had wonderful experiences with Jordan who is extremely professional in his communication with others (even with shuttle service folks)
Manager Response: Hello Rosemary, Thank you for your review.  We are very pleased to see that you were completely satisfied with your stay.  And thank you for recognizing Jordan and his professional attitude and approach.  He thrives on delivering excellent service and your comments are a testament to his efforts.  Let us know if we can be of service again soon.  Thanks!  Hyatt Place Awarded "Highest in Guest Satisfaction Among Upscale Hotel Chains" by J.D. Power in 2015

Summary: The overall stay was ok, the location was good for Disneyland, staff was friendly except a morning barista she was a bit rude, breakfast buffet was ok not a very big selection or varitey. It was a bit pricey but the hotel was nice and clean, bed and pillow sucked- layout of the rooms made now sense.
Manager Response: Hi Lisa, Thank you for your review and comments.  Always appreciate honest feedback of how we did.  Please accept our apologies if the Barista seemed a bit rude.  We will definitely remind the Baristas to be mindful of their daily interaction with our guests.  Again, we thank you for your comments and feedback.  Hyatt Place Awarded "Highest in Guest Satisfaction Among Upscale Hotel Chains" by J.D. Power in 2015

Summary Heading: make sure your total charge is correct!
Summary: I love that the Hyatt is right around from the convention center, the breakfast is AWESOME! The receptionist personnel is very friendly and welcoming. Super kudos to the young receptionist lady that suggested to leave my travel bag and i would receive a call as soon as my room was ready which i did.
Manager Response: Hello Maria, Thank you for your review and comments regarding your stay with us.  We are very pleased to see that you enjoyed our free a.m. Kitchen Skillet hot breakfast.  It is quite nice and best of all, complimentary.  And thank you for recognizing our young Gallery Host for attending to your needs and her follow-through.  If we can be of service again soon, please let us know. Thanks again!  Hyatt Place Awarded "Highest in Guest Satisfaction Among Upscale Hotel Chains" by J.D. Power in 2015

Summary: Everything about this place was easy.  The parking, the check  in, the location to the convention center, the breakfast, the friendly staff.  Just what you want in a hotel: easy. Loved it and will stay again in a heartbeat.
Manager Response: Dear JosephC5624EE, Thank you so much for your candid review of the Hyatt Place at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center.  We are pleased to know that your stay was thoroughly enjoyable and that you found our amenities, services and staff to be just right.  Should your plans call for another visit to the Anaheim Resort, please let us know. Thanks again!!  Hyatt Place Awarded "Highest in Guest Satisfaction Among Upscale Hotel Chains" by J.D. Power in 2015

Summary: We like the Hyatt brand. We either stay here or Hyatt regency down the street. This location is new and has underground parking. Complimentary breakfast is a plus before we head out to the park. Refrigerator and sofa sleeper also in room.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review and comments.  We have had quite a few guests comment on our underground parking as it makes it so convenient to hop out your car and into the elevator to quickly whisk you to your guest room floor.  It also keeps the car nice and cool when its warm or keep you dry if and when it rains.  And good to note also that all of our rooms feature a Cozy Corner Sofa Sleeper with queen size sofa bed.  A very nice touch for lounging, reading a good book or just watching t.v.  Let us know if you have plans to return to Anaheim.  We would love to welcome you back! Thanks again!  Hyatt Place Awarded "Highest in Guest Satisfaction Among Upscale Hotel Chains" by J.D. Power in 2015

Summary: Staff is so friendly, helpful and engaging that much credit must be given to whoever the manager is that motivates the crew so well.  Jordan at the front desk was exceptionally helpful.  Breakfast was ample and good.  Even those cleaning the tables were smiling and courteous.  Not overly luxurious,  but well laid out, clean, convenient and good size rooms.  Having stayed at the nearby Hilton, Hyatt Regency, and Marriott (we have attended conventions there almost every year for the past 12 years) this one would be our pick from now on.
Manager Response: Hi jlums, Thank you so much for honoring us with the highest rating possible for your stay.  We appreciate your comments and are happy to see that Jordan was helpful during your stay.  He has become quite the star here and its no surprise that you were impressed with his outstanding customer service skills and demeanor.  We are fortunate to have a young man like Jordan to welcome our guests and make them feel at home.  Considering your previous hotel stays, it should be no surprise to learn that Hyatt Place was Awarded "Highest in Guest Satisfaction Among Upscale Hotel Chains" by J.D. Power in 2015.  Quite a nice honor to bestow on us and we are happy to know that Jordan wears this badge proudly.  Thanks again!

Summary: Had no complaints with this hotel. Staff were friendly and professional. Everything was clean and in good repair.  I loved the breakfast in the morning.  It was hot and fresh.  The walk to Disneyland was about a mile but there is also a low cost transit bus that drops right at entrance.

Summary Heading: Family vacation to Disneyland with unexpected issues caused by our hotel experience
Summary: My family stayed in the suite with bunk beds, for 3 nights/4 days for our Disneyland vacation/birthday celebration. Unfortunately our room was next to a hotel staff room that was continuously VERY noisy and therefore inhibited our toddlers from taking their naps during the day; which meant that our park days were cut significantly short (and they were not as energetic as we would have loved for them to be). We were given wrong info about the bus route to take to Disney which delayed us for almost 2 hours and miss early entry and my son's Star Wars sign up (one of the only things he asked for his birthday was to participate in the jedi training). There were other issues that we encountered due to misinformation on elevator access and parking/leaving the parking lot. Breakfast was

Summary Heading: Suprisingly Solid Choice - Somewhere I'd Consider for Fun Too
Summary: I have to admit I have never stayed in a Hyatt Place before this location.  I wasn't there for fun as it was a stop over on my way to some meetings I had to attend.  The hotel was really nice!  They had a great little restaurant on the bottom floor, the staff were always there to accommodate and friendly.  I watched as they made people's day and treated each guest as individually special.  That's something you don't find everywhere and I have stayed in the area before at other properties to go to the theme park.  People use this hotel (as they should) as a place to sleep after a long day of going to Disneyland.  The staff are attentive, there is great value in the quick food options and its a very comfortable 'home' to use as your place to re-charge.  Only drawback - the rooms

Room was clean, comfortable and spacious. Had great breakfasts that were well displayed, delicious and included in the hotel price. Hotel is very close to the convention center and well worth paying a lower price than the Marriott and Hilton which are the on-site conferences hotels - the Hyatt was just a hop, skip and jump over to the Convention Center. Have to pay for parking $16 per day + taxes, which is a negative, but overall great hotel and great experience.

Summary Heading: Perfect size hotel and friendly staff but beware of all the fees!!
Summary: Not knowing anything about the area, we chose this hotel because it was very close to walk to the Convention Center. Just so happens, it was on the main strip to Disneyland and had several places to eat. The easy walk to Disneyland took about 10-8 minutes in case anyone is there to see Disney. The hotel has only 5 floors and is the perfect size. No long elevator waits, free hot breakfast didn't run out of food, rooms were clean, bathrooms were roomy, hallways were quiet, parking lot is under ground and well lit and the staff was the MOST accommodating I have ever met. The only thing I didn't like were all the charges and taxes added onto the bill, which increased the cost of the room by at least $50+ $16.00 + tax for parking per day. I think people should know that they will get

I was in town for a conference at the Convention Center - I had an outstanding experience at the Hyatt Place. So glad I stayed here instead of the larger (and more expensive) conference hotels. Highly recommend this hotel!

Summary Heading: The best hotel near disneyland quiet clean and beautiful
Summary: Been to numorous hotels in anaheim on the disney strip and this by far beats them all for the price and the cleanlyness. Free breakfast but you got to get up really early. Distance from disneyland isnt far you can shuttle or walk if you like.

My Stay at the Hyatt was perfect.  Easy to walk to the Convention Center, lots of restaurants close by and easy walk to Disneyland.   I will definitely return to the Hyatt. Plus, the little restaurant was very convenient at night.

Hyatt place is situated in a good area which makes travelling to the different tourist venues efficient.  The Anaheim Resort Transit ART buses pickup close by, and makes travel around the area inexpensive.  ART tickets can be purchased from the Hotel. The Hotel was clean, and the rooms well cared for.  The breakfast was very good, with plenty of healthy food choices for every taste.

This is the second year we have stayed at this location for the trade show in Jan. I love the free breakfast, location and cleanness of the this hotel. My only complaint  is the pillows, I hate them,(both visits I have thought this) but the bed is soft.

Great place to stay! We were there with 7 people and very comfortable! The breakfast is a great asset and delicious! The beds were comfy and the staff was very friendly! I would highly recommend this to anyone!!!

The room was very clean and spacious. Every employee we came across was extremely helpful. Breakfast was included in our stay, it was really good and plentiful. We will always stay here when visiting Disneyland .

Great location, close to Disney and restaurants. Good breakfast and nice staff. Rooms are a little small but clean and modern. Pool is small but good to take a dip at the end of the day and a nice hot tub. We walked to Disney both days with kids without a problem. 10 minutes.

Summary Heading: Hyatt Place/Anaheim Convention center- a place to unwind after a busy day.
Summary: This hotel was a wonderful oasis of calm in the middle of my busy convention. The staff and service was excellent and very accommodating to my needs. I appreciated the warm breakfast each morning, and 24/7 made to order restaurant service. The fitness room was a little small with only a few cardio machines and the "outdoor" pool was kids size only. But otherwise the facility was excellent, very quiet and comfortable night's sleep.

From the minute we arrived until the minute we left, all staff greeted us with a genuine smile and kindness.  The rooms were spacious and clean.  We came for a conference at the convention center and it was an easy 3 minute walk to get there.

Pros: Great room, quiet room, quick check-in, free parking for my Disneyland Annual Passholder card and close walk to free shuttle into Disneyland Parks from Toy Story parking lot. Good free breakfast included.    Cons: No king-sized beds, hard feather pillows, slightly more expensive than other area hotels, but worth it.

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel and convenient location
Summary: Stayed here to be close to Disneyland and it was very convenient and well kept. Stay was friendly and helpful. Nice underground parking, pool and hot tub. The breakfast each morning was great and a nice perk prior to going to pay the premium at the park.

Great choice for families and anyone who appreciates more square footage in their room. Eco-friendly and super clean. 15 minute walk to Disneyland (shuttle service also available). Plentiful breakfast choices.

The Hyatt Place was conveniently situated in Anaheim. The Staff were probably the most friendly and helpful that we have encountered in our travels.  There was a wonderful breakfast provided each morning, with plenty of choices for every pallet.   The ART bus stop is a short walk through the next door Hotel. We will definitely choose to stay here again on our next visit to Anaheim.

I have nothing but positive things to say about this hotel. The below ground parking was a plus. Kept our car nice and cool during the hot days we were there. Front desk and bar staff were very friendly and greeted us every time we came in. Room was spacious with two double beds and a corner sectional. It was super quiet too. Never heard a peep from any of the neighbors. Even the mini-fridge was quiet, which isn't often the case at other hotels. The free breakfast was well-stocked and tasty. The bar serves food 24 hours a day and it was good and very reasonably priced. You can eat at the tables in the lobby or take it up to your room. The hot tub felt about 104 degrees, which is nice because a lot of hotels keep theirs cooler than my liking. The public transit stop was a short

Once I step in the hotel I feel like I'm in the right place. The lobby is not big but warm and welcome, stuff was very polite and pleasant. The check in went very quick and smooth thanks to Lani. On the way to our room we were greet by very nice housekeeping lady(we were so impressed) I feel bad that I didn't get her name. The room was spacious and clean and bed is very comfortable. I can't say enough about how wonderful of stuff is. Shout out to Lani, Scott and every Hyatt place stuff!!!! Thank you so much.

I booked this hotel as they advertise the "plug and play" feature on their TVs.  Unfortunately, when I tried to use this feature there is no button that could be found on the TVs to change the source/input.  I called the front desk asking for help.  Front desk first informed me they would send somebody to the room to help.  Five minutes later I received a phone call telling me the button does not exist and nobody would be coming to help.  In addition, I stayed in the King Suite and the a.c only circulates in the bunk bed area which makes the king bed area really stuffy.  Lastly, I stayed on the 3rd floor and could hear every foot step from the room above.  My family did not sleep comfortably because of the fluctuations of the room temperature and the footsteps from above.

Family of 5. Had 2 queen beds with pull out sofa.  Staff was nice, breakfast is great in the morning.  Overall great value for the area.  Not walking distance with little kids, but shuttle stops close by.

Great place where a family of 5 fits perfectly without the extra expense of a second room or roll away.  Also has complimentary breakfast, which is another added benefit & an economical way to do Disneyland.

We picked this hotel for three reasons.  1.) Because we recently became Hyatt Rewards members, 2.)  We needed a place close to Disneyland 3.) The parking was a lot cheaper than at other area hotels.   We visited during Valentine's day weekend.    This hotel isn't as glamorous as other Hyatt's I have been to but alas, I guess that what "Place" means.    This isn't a bad thing but if you are looking for luxurious than this isn't that place but it is a good place to stay for the weekend that is nicer than the run of the mill hotels.   The front desk staff encounter were very friendly to deal with and fast to check us in. They acknowledged we were Hyatt members so that was nice.    I really liked the layout of our room. We had requested a king sized bed because our 4 year old

Was a great place to spend a night.  Will consider this location again on future visits.  The complimentary breakfast was very well laid out and accessible by many people at once.  Pool area is small and very close to adjacent hotel so not a great place for lounging but that is only negative.

We were visiting from Chicago and spending a long weekend close to Disneyland.  The hotel itself was very clean.  We were a little disappointed that we made our reservations several weeks ahead of time and when we checked in they said they upgraded us because our room wasn't ready but it was a handicap accessible room which was spacious but didn't have a bathtub or bunk beds. (which our 8 year old son was looking forward to)  They stated we could have the room we originally wanted but not until the next day.  So the next day around noon we were able to move our things  to the room we requested-a king size bed and bunk beds. The breakfast is great.  A lot of food options-eggs, sausage, French toast, pancakes, yogurt, fruit, cereal, toast, muffins, bagels, juice and coffee and a

We had to be here for a dance weekend and the place was packed.  We booked a family suite, which included 2 rooms: a king in main bedroom with TV, safe, and desk - 2nd bedroom/kids room was on the "inside with a huge floor to ceiling window, a bunk bed with double bed on bottom and twin on top.  This worked perfectly for us.  Note:  bathroom is std. size and is located in kids' room.  And by having the adults room next to the entry door, this assures safety and the ability to have an adult run downstairs to get breakfast and bring it back up.  We got a special group rate.  This hotel is down the way from Disneyland and away from the crazy crowds.  Has a Starbux inside that is ridiculously crowded from morning to night.  The restaurants we ate at had good service and food.

The location was perfect, just two blocks from Disney. The staff was very kind and everything was as expected. We have stayed 5 nights with my kids in a double queen room. The room has also a sof√° in which our kids could have slept. The size of the room was ok.  I would definetely come back to this hotel and also recomend it to my friends.

Stayed here for five nights during my business trip. The hotel is nice with a spacious room and comfortable settings. The staffs are very helpful and quick in responding my request. The check-in and check-out were done in a breeze. Looking forward to stay in this hotel again in the future.

The hotel room was clean and new, kids had a bunkbed and room for a crib with sliding doors for privacy. It was about 15 minute walk to disney, which was doable. There was a tiny pool outside, which was perfect for the kids for a disney break.

Summary Heading: Outstanding residence, genuine and good service
Summary: The breakfasts are excellent, the staff is well trained and friendly, the rooms are cleaned with care, the beds and pillows are excellent, and the management is particularly sensitive to their guests needs

Had a fantastic experience at the Hyatt Place, unlike the Hyatt Regency.  Very clean rooms, updated, and roomy. Great breakfast and an overall excellent experience.  I overbooked my stay and they took off the night free of charge - I had booked a rack rate room which was supposed to be non-cancellation, but they waived it for me.  Great staff and cannot say enough good about my stay here.

This was a great place to stay. Room was clean and comfortable. Was walking distance to Disney and eateries. Breakfast buffet was great and staff very friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Summary Heading: GReat Stay for Business Trip Too
Summary: It is not just about Disneyland.  Clean, friendly and quiet hotel perfect for business trips to Northern Orange County and Southern LA county!  Breakfast is great, staff is accommodating and the dinner options abound given the proximity to Disney.  Also, fitness center is well appointed and accessible.

Summary Heading: Good location, clean and modern hotel.
Summary: Good location - 15 minute walk to Disneyland or take the ART bus  from just around the corner! Hotel was clean and modern and had all the facilities we needed. Heated outdoor pool and spa, small(adequate) gym, breakfast was great...a bit more choice than what we'd experienced at other hotels . Our room was a 'family suite', with bunks and a sofa bed and the dividing door was a plus for privacy. Staff at front desk always said "Hi" as you walked in or out and the complementary apples and water in reception was an added plus! Only downside was it was a noisy hotel..could hear people in room above and next door.

I absolutely love this hotel. It is definitely a hidden gem! The rooms are so spacious! The complimentary breakfast in the morning is fabulous. The staff is so kind and friendly. We will definitely be back!

Great service, great experience, great options. I am always pleased every time I stay at Hyatt Place Hotels throughout. For example, Roseville, CA, Downtown Minneapolis, and of course the Anaheim Convention Center locations. I am always looking at Hyatt Place Hotels whenever I travel.

We ended up with a very sick toddler on night two of our three night stay. The hotel staff went above and beyond tending to our needs with extra towels, cleaning supplies, a play and pack, not to leave out that he came and collected our "dirty towels" after a while. It was a really difficult night, made a little easier by the thoughtfulness and understanding of the staff.

Our family stayed at Hyatt Place during our trip to Disneyland in early January. We booked through TripAdvisor and paid for our stay at the time of booking. Now a month later, I am still trying to get a refund from Hyatt which charged us for our stay when we checked out!!! I told Jordan at the front desk the day we left the hotel that we prepaid for our stay and Hyatt still charged my credit card. It has been a frustrating ordeal! The hotel itself is okay. The food is horrible. If you want to order a cheeseburger do not! I was told the burger is pre packaged. Yuck! I have never written a review before in my life but felt the need to let other travelers know what this hotel is all about. Very poor customer service.

Hyatt Place is my favorite chain hotel in its class. I like the rooms, and I like knowing what to expect. My husband and I stayed at this location using Hyatt points for five nights early in July 2015. Our first two days we walked the entire distance to Disneyland and found that to be just a little too far to bear. The lobby sells ART passes, and it was well worth the price. ART stops are very close.  Our room was comfortable and everything that I would expect, including a mini fridge (which we had to plug in - we found that funny).  Breakfast got busy but the staff really hustled to keep everything stocked and clean. There is a major pharmacy very nearby and enough restaurants in walking distance, or that deliver, to make renting a car unnecessary - which is good because

Summary Heading: a place to stay around convention center
Summary: good price value, nice and very clean rooms, friendly staff - and short walking distance to fair ground and restaurants, just around the corner. Disneyland is also close enough for a walk. I stayed there for a whole week and enjoyed it.

Summary Heading: A very comfortable and enjoyable stay
Summary: Compared to the Sheraton that we stayed at on this same block, this place was the Ritz.  Nice big rooms, new, clean, great breakfast.  We go the family room so there were bunkbeds for the kids.  Ample parking, easy check in, friendly staff.  Really great hotel for the Disneyland area. Not the cheapest on the block but OK if you have AAA.

Funny smell in the room, probably new carpet or something. I wish the windows could open, but this is a rarity in most hotels these days. Overall a nice stay. Friendly staff, good breakfast and great location.

Hyatt Place had a wonderful location, barely walking distance from Disneyland and close to many area restaurants and attractions.  Sadly we were only in town for a few days but enjoyed the included breakfast (get there early) and family friendly nature of this hotel.  Recognized as Hyatt Platinum on checkin and given a nice room, really very happy with this Place (apologies for the pun) and would have no issues staying here again.

I was so impressed from start To finish. We got checked in easily and early with no hassle. All the front desk staff was pleasant and even took note that we were celebrating my daughters birthday at Disneyland. My car was parked safely in the parking lot under the hotel and had no issues with parking or getting to and from my car easily since the elevator went directly to the parking lot. The room was spacious and had a cool view from the 5th floor. It was clean and very nice to have a fridge in there to keep our drinks cool. We walked to Disney that morning and took the toy story shuttle across the street back that afternoon to relax. Everything about the hotel is so refreshing. They are always there if you need them if not they are no bother. Very friendly staff and even left

Great location within walking distance to Disneyland. New and clean hotel with helpful staff. Free breakfast good for families. Free wifi and heated outdoor pool and spa. Cannot fault this hotel in any way and would highly recommend for families.  Extremely happy with our stay at a great price.

As a Hyatt Platinum member, this was my first stay at a Hyatt Place. Although I did not expect a Hyatt Place to be on the same level at a Hyatt Regency, I feel there are some things about this location to point out. The front desk staff is great and the lobby is modern and clean. However the hallways and guest rooms appear rather dated. Although clean, the carpet and walls look worn.  What's really driving my "Average" rating is the noise level. I specifically requested a quiet room, and I was given one very near the elevator. A rather boisterous convention crowd was also staying on the same floor, and they were anything but quiet. I was woken up by loud, drunk people in the hall at least 7 times that night. The rooms offer little noise insulation. While I understand the action

The only issue we had was the housekeeping staff was a little stingy with the coffee supplies.  We also hung our towels up to be energy efficient and she left the dirty and still brought clean.  The onsite caf√© was very handy.  The breakfast every morning was excellent.

We stayed 4 nights and after much research on TA we booked Hyatt and couldn't of been happier.  Rooms large, clean and comfy.  Reception great, given early check in as requested after a 12 hours flight from Australia we needed it.
