Summary Heading: second time this year and I'm even more impressed
Summary: stayed here oct 10-12, got two rooms each time I came, always brought someone new the guests that I have brought, have always been pleased with my choice. ten things I love about this hotel  location, and you can catch the art into the park just buy the round trip pass at front desk for a discount, total round trip 5.00  inquire about the senior discount  parking is abundant and safe its 16.00, but hey disney is even more  you can walk to the parkabout 15 min or if you have a scooter, just ride it in like we did  they have a good thing going with DnR mobility scooter great prices, rent from them  hotel clean, clean, clean, they also have water, orange or lime flavored always available for guest  breakfast selection great, delicious many varieties of beverages, this is one of the
Manager Response: Dear J M Mililani, Thank you so much for such as nice review.  You really took the time to share you experience about our new hotel in the Anaheim Resort.  In fact, I don't think we could have said it much better!!  You touched on quite a few of our strong points such as our very nice and free a.m. Kitchen Skillet breakfast buffet, our helpful and friendly staff, spacious and beautiful clean rooms and how close we are to the Disneyland Resort Parks and Convention Center.  So, thanks again for your comments and nice review and we shall look forward to the opportunity of welcoming you back again soon to the Hyatt Place at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center soon!

Summary: The Hyatt Place surprised us as we thought we had booked the Hyatt up the street to be with family, but ours was alot better.  Underground parking and a full-on hot breakfast each morning - the fancy Hyatt charges $24!  Room was great with king on one side, closing japanese-style door in between with sofa and bunk beds on the other side; even a TV for each side.  The one frig was larger then usual and nice and cold for a change; so often hotels have frigs without condensers and they are never really cold!  The room was aesthetically pleasing.  My one complaint might be stiff sack-like pillows; I prefer a more billowy pillow.  All-in-all very convenient and enjoyable.  I'd go back next trip to the area/Disneyland.

A quick 1 mile walk to Disneyland. Quiet, comfortable. Extremely friendly staff, greeted us by name every time we came or left.  Decent but not phenomenal breakfast. Didn't have bacon but I'll survive.  Pool is not heated and is very cold even on 80 degree days.

A nice hotel within easy walk of Disneyland. Stayed in a family suite which was great as the kids had a separate space with own TV. A real pain checking in as we were a day late arriving and I had rung them to advise I would pay for that night and to please hold the room. Arrived and they had given the room out. After mucking around for a fair while it was sorted and we went to our room to find it wasn't what we had booked. There was a bit of arrogance from the manager on the front desk. Eventually it was sorted and room was good. Would have rated it higher if it wasn't for the check in debacle.

Spent a lovely 5 days here on the end of our 3 week trip of the USA. No problems booking in and was very happy with the room we were given on the 3rd floor.  Beds were comfortable and the size of the room great for 2 adults and 1 child. It is a fairly new hotel so everything was in good working order and very clean.  The breakfast was a bonus and was substantial. With either hot or cold breakfast to choose from. Fresh fruit and cereal was also on offer.  It was tasty. On the negative there is no laundry and we had to use the neighboring motels facilities.  So we had to wait with our clothes for 2 hours to go through wash and dry.  Didn't like to leave and come back later. We also requested a wake up call on our first day due to picking up a bus to go to Universal Studios in the

Stayed here prior to a concert at Honda center.  It was mainly to park, taxi to concert and sleep over.  (taxi about 2$0 to honda center with tip).  It's along the hotel corridor of for the mouse park.  Easy and plentiful parking below ground. Quick check-in at front desk with pleasant-professional staff. Lots of families but relatively quiet and peaceful. Large, clean room with standard beds and linens.  A good place for the price.

This is a very nice hotel but their employees were not very competent.We were given the wrong room # with our keys & after spending an exhausting day @ Disneyland kept trying to get into the wrong room,not sure if we were scaring some other guests by repeatedly trying the door.We went to the front desk where they had the wrong name & state & then he figured out the issue the employee laughed & said,"Oh she gave you the wrong room #,here you go"No apologies,nothing

Good Stopover hotel, lovely new rooms with living and kitchenette,  excellent free breakfast and location near anything you want to do in Anaheim.  Easy parking, free WiFi,  friendly staff,  well  done,  we will come back

Close enough to the parks to walk - and a very nice room with helpful staff and a good breakfast.  They don't have a shuttle, but with traffic in Anaheim, I'm not sure that a shuttle would be any faster than walking anyway.

Summary Heading: OK hotel but prefer closer hotels
Summary: We booked this Hyatt since we had some expiring Hyatt points, but we typically stay at Grand Californian Villas (we own Disney Vacation Club) or the hotels right on Harbour Boulevard across from the entrance. The Hyatt is relatively new and included free breakfast. The hotel does not have a shuttle but instead you have to rely on the ART bus system which runs every 20 minutes. After the first day we realized it was cheaper,faster and easier to take a cab or Uber with 4 people.   The hotel is pretty generic, the pool was small and cold, the rooms are decent with a sitting area/couch. Our room was right on Harbour Boulevard which is loud and we frequently heard emergency sirens through the night. The breakfast was decent but mostly starchy options and only sausage all 3 mornings

Though just a brief stay between days at Disney, we were very happy with our stay at the Hyatt Place. Our room was quite spacious and was great for a family of four with two older kids. With two queens plus the pull-out sofa they each had their own bed which made it more comfortable for everyone. The early breakfast was filling and a great start to our day.

After a snafu with centralized reservations, staff at the Anaheim Hyatt Place accommodated my family and I.  We needed a king and bunk beds for our tween kids (boy and girl) which were originally not offered as a choice or an upgrade with our Inspire certificates.  The facility was clean, updated, friendly, spacious, yummy, and close to Disney.  WAY better than expected as we usually go Hilton and have found Hilton to offer more reliable quality in the past.  Hyatt really impressed.  Sis nights were quite enjoyable, and the breakfast was GREAT each day.

We stayed with our two kids 8 and 10 yrs and it was perfect for us. Our room had a nice big king bed with bunks and a couch in the room that was divided by cavity slider doors. The pool and hot tub were brilliant and breakfast had a great selection. Nice and close to the disneyland bus pick up and drop off, but also walking distance.

This hotel has it all - the customer service was phenomenal.  Food for breakfast is a wide variety, fresh and hot.  The room was spacious and comfortable.  We picked this hotel based upon its reputation and were very excited that it lived up to its expectation.

Stayed at The Hyatt Place Anaheim Resort for a 3 day Disneyland trip. Hotel is 1 mile to the park. Or $10 cab fare. The hotel was very quiet and clean. Rooms were what you would expect from Hyatt. Rooms are very roomy and comfortable. Great warm AM breakfast. 24hr dining and full bar also in lobby. We loved the staff. Everyone was so friendly. All the hotel areas were clean and cozy. Pool area was small but nice. We would recommend this hotel for anyone that wants comfort away from but close to the Disney Resort area.

I wished that I could stay at Hyatt Places more often, but they aren't as abundant as other comparable brands.  The staff is always great and they provide the best "free" breakfast of every competitive brands out there.  Nice comfy rooms and beds with spacious bathrooms.  Always a pleasure to stay at one!  Only bad mark is for horrible WiFi speed.

Clean and quiet room and hotel, close to Disneyland and California Adventure. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Clean and pleasing neighborhood.  Safe to walk to the parks, even late at night. Lots of restaurants of all types in the area.

This hotel exceededmost of the 5 stars I have stayed at.  New, large, nicely appointed accommodations.  Included was breakfast which was great...even the eggs (almost never even attempt to eat at buffets) were delicious. Hotel staff went above and beyond.  Service was 5 star.  Will stay here again.

My family and I stayed here for four nights while we visited Disneyland.  I'll start off with the positives.  Hotel is relatively new.  Our room was very clean and decent sized.  And our stay included a complimentary breakfast.  However, we were Hyatt Platinum members and as such, usually receive an upgrade if available.  No one mentioned an upgrade to us during this stay, which was fine.  However, we were given a room on the fifth floor overlooking a parking lot under construction.  Also, it was very noisy at night and as a result I was not able to sleep.  Another drawback is the parking situation.  Parking is NOT included and we were aware of that when we booked our reservation.  However, we went back to the hotel late one night after attending Mickey's Halloween Party, and

In fairness, I have not often had reason to stay overnight in Anaheim, but the Hyatt Place at Anaheim is yet another reason. We liked everything about the place. Good check-in, good room, and a great breakfast. Free parking doesn't hurt either. As Platinum Hyatt members, we get free wi-fi, which was easy to use, and a high floor, which was nice. I think Anaheim may set the standard for Hyatt Place.

Summary Heading: Will be a new Disney-stay fav
Summary: Opened in 2015 this is a great property.  Rooms are nice, clean and well appointed for families.  Stayed at several other properties around Dland, this is new fav.  Breakfast included was really good food - lots of options & plenty of food even though hotel was busy.  5 min or so walk to another hotel that has shuttle over to park (too far to walk with little kid ds, probably 20-25 min walk to gate entrance).

Rooms were very nice , AM breakfast buffet was good lots of room to sit , lobby area was comfortable and had lots of tables and chairs to sit in, the pool was open till 10pm very comfortable beds with a couch in the room
Manager Response: Hello Jack S, Thank you for your review.  Glad to know that you enjoyed your stay with us and that you found our hotel and the services and amenities to your liking.  Should your plans call for another visit to the Anaheim Resort please do not hesitate to contact us.  We will look forward to welcoming you  again. Thank you.

Summary: Good hotel, clean, big bright bedrooms.  Good morning buffet, only con is you could hear people's footsteps above you and no self-serve laundry facilities in the building - was told we could use the laundry facilities next door, but didn't.  Would stay hear again as the kids really enjoyed the room.

Just great and a smooth disney experience. Would recommend and always go here from next time. The hotel was awesome from the request to early check, free morning breakfast and close to disney. all tickets and tours were organized by the front desk at very short notice the staff were amazing. they really cared about your stay and was always there to help. the room was clean and fantastic as well.

Stayed for 3 nights while traveling to Disney.  Convenient location-maybe a 3/4 mile walk or $4 uber ride for the family to Disney (Shuttle available at $5 per day PP unlimited rides) Room was spacious, clean and comfortable.  Complimentary breakfast buffet better than most.  Hotel staff was incredibly friendly and helpful with every request...would definitely recommend.
Manager Response: Hello H745LJkarenm, Thanks so much for your complimentary review of your stay at the Hyatt Place.  We are very pleased to know that you enjoyed your visit to the Anaheim Resort and that your stay with us was very enjoyable.  Our free buffet breakfast is a true value and huge money saver so we are equally pleased to see that you enjoyed your breakfast.  Equally important is to know that our friendly and dedicated staff were helpful in allowing you to have a thoroughly enjoyable stay. Thanks again!

Summary: This room was booked for 4 women off to have a little fun at Disneyland. The hotel was very clean and the elevators secured so that only guests could access the floors with rooms if they had their door cards. We stayed in a double queen room that had a mini-fridge and separate couch area. The room itself was clean and modern, and the bathroom area was huge - which you need with 4 girls getting ready. While the hotel shuttle offered trips to Disney for 5 dollars a person, we opted for Uber/Lyft and it was around 6 dollars. The folks at the front desk were super helpful, and when we got up to our room, we found that we could see the Disney Fireworks show, which was a plus. Breakfast came free with the room, and the bar features things like cereal, bagels, waffles, eggs, sausage,

The whole experience at this hotel was AMAZING! I took my Mom to Disneyland for her birthday and I put my usual bid in for a hotel on Priceline, so I didn't know what to expect. Fortunately, it was a great surprise!   My Mom and I are originally for Orlando, so we've had our fair share of staying at Disney hotels. This hotel's customer service was by far, way better than any Disney hotel we've stay at. Priceline gave me a room with one king size bed, so my mom asked for a room with two beds facing Disneyland, so we could see the fireworks. They were happy to fill our requests with no problem. I also mentioned that it was my Mom's birthday and they gave us a $50 credit to spend at the hotel!  The next day my mom and I were headed back to our room from the parks to change for

The room was clean and the food was great, but that wasn't the best part of this hotel.  The staff went above and beyond to help make my family's stay a good one.  We went to Anaheim to enjoy Disneyland and my husband became ill while we were there, so we stayed 2 days longer than planned.  The staff constantly checked on us to make sure we were ok, as well as gave us free meals (lunch and dinner) to help make our unexpected extended stay better.  They were always smiling, positive and encouraging during what could have been a very difficult time for me and my children. Their attitudes definitely helped keep me sane and if you want staff who truly care, I highly recommend this hotel!

We really enjoyed staying at the Hyatt Place in Anaheim. Great option when traveling with family and kids. Walking distance to the parks, free wifi, the breakfast included in the rate was really good, friendly staff and excellent rooms. totally recommended!

This is hotel is wonderful.  We visited the hotel due to its proximity to Disneyland.  While there, I became very ill and was hospitalized for several days.  The hotel made sure my family was able to stay in the same room while I was hospitalized.  They provided them free meal vouchers.  Time and again they were spectacular providing any service my family required.  They made a very challenging time a measure less so for my family.  This is a wonderful hotel staffed by wonderful people.  The breakfast, rooms, and general hotel experience are very good as well.  I would strongly recommend them!

Great value for money hotel.  Completed in 2014 than what would have been the choice in a new clean design also.  The included breakfast.  PC is also located on the 1st floor.  The next year, when the holiday comes back to the United States staying in this hotel.   One thing is no laundry room .  The United States will travel to long term travel needs were equipped laundry room with laundry would point if good;.  Good hotel, clean and design meet again next year.

My husband and I reserved 3 rooms for our family while visiting Disneyland at the Hyatt Place in Anaheim.  From the time we checked in on Friday and checked out on Sunday we were always greeted with smiling faces from the staff.  The rooms were great as well as the breakfast that is included. The 24/7 restaurant food was good also.  Everyone there was very helpful and professional.  We will be staying there from now on.

We had a great experience at this hotel.  Great staff.  Super clean and modern.  Rooms were great with kids.  Breakfast was a great way to fill the kids up before a day at Disney.  Loved the bunk beds and pull-out couch.  Great hotel!

Great value, good location and very friendly staff. So close to transport and an easy few blocks to Disneyland and the new restaurant complex Gardenwalk. Great value and good breakfast. Safe and clean neighborhood.

We were seriously so impressed with the service at the Hyatt Place in Anaheim. We had a little problem with our first room but they went above and beyond to rectify. The staff was knowledgeable and shared ideas of things to do which were spot on. Scott is a great manager and did everything in his power to help us have a great stay. We will stay here again!

To be honest I wasn't expecting to enjoy my stay as much as I did.  My husband and I went to Disneyland for our anniversary and were only looking for a place to sleep, but our stay was amazing!  Staff was great, room was clean, and the bed was comfortable.

fantastic staff- make the stay that much more enjoyable. rooms had a lot of space. comfortable beds. great tv. bathroom was great and clean. pool is little small but my small children loved it. i would definitely recommend this for any family or business trip. close to food and of course disney.

Hotel was new, warm and welcoming..Staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was very warm with modern decor.Wifi throughout the hotel - Awesome cos it came in etremely handy. And breakfast was amazing... Only downsize was the parking fee that i was hoping was going to be free and the fact that there was no bellman to help with our plenty luggage both times. Overall a great stay and would definietly be going back.  p.s. Stayed in Hyatt Regency same trip and was also a good stay, its safe to stay im now a Hyatt fan:-)!

I stayed here recently for a few days while attending an expo. It was definitely within walking distance to the convention center (about 3 blocks to the front door). The staff was very helpful and professional. The breakfast was good also. The wifi was also very fast. I would definitely stay here again.

My family and I enjoyed our stay at the amazingly clean Hyatt Place. We appreciated that it was not that far from Disneyland, and if you were tired you could use the Disney bus to drop you off at, Woody Parking lot, that is located almost in front of Hyatt Place.  We especially liked their delicious breakfast buffet.  My  husband and I loved their comfortable mattresses. We also liked that their was a sleeper sofa, including the double beds.

Overall, Hyatt Place Anaheim is a nice, clean hotel near the convention center and Disney.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  The included buffet breakfast was good, but the eggs tasted like they were instant.

Had several important deliveries over 2 days...staff competent, courteous and helpful.  Staff knowledgeable about the area and very helpful with planning.  Rooms were spacious and perfect.  Ordered from hotel several food items all were prepared perfectly and priced right

Overall the hotel itself was decent.  The staff was excellent and great to work with.  The hotel could benefit greatly from installing a bathtub option in their rooms instead of just having a shower and my room # 327 had a stale cigarette smell to it which affected my asthma when the AC unit was not running.  All in all I would stay here again, but not with my kids because without a bathtub it's too hard to get them up and ready to go.

We arrived early and were able to be checked into our room straight away.  The room was large and very comfortable.  I had read earlier reviews about outside noises and there were some, to be honest, but nothing really annoying and there are reminders along the public areas about quiet times.  The staff were all lovely and friendly and willing to help where ever they could.    Great location for visiting Disneyland and other nearby attractions.  We will be back.

Our family fit perfectly in the room, our kids love swimming so they enjoyed the pool also. Staff was friendly and helpful, hotel is close enough to Disney so it made it easy for us, we did not have to worry about parking.

First Impression: Clean, modern and very welcoming. We arrived earlier than expected and not only was the front desk very pleasant to speak to but accommodating in they checked us in and offered us breakfast that morning as well.   After getting up to the room and getting cleaned up, we headed to the parks via foot. Although this hotel is in walking distance, it's a haul especially after walking all over the parks and downtown disney too.   Breakfast is included with your stay and is all you can eat. It mainly consist of scrambled eggs, home fires, waffles and bacon or sausage. The sausages reminded me of the links we were fed in the Marines and are not delectable but was fit for human consumption.   Besides the sausage my only complaints for this hotel is the cost of parking, I

This is the first time we have stayed at a Hyatt Place hotel and it was brilliant.  We stayed in a family room with a king bed and two bunk beds.  Room had everything we needed and extremely clean.  Only negative was the air conditioner was a little noisy at night time, but we could live with that.  The hotel staff were very helpful and courteous, especially Taylor (who gave us directions to the closest In-N-Out Burger place).  The A.M Skillet breakfast was good - not quite the same selection as a Grand/Park Hyatt (obviously), but all the basics enough for a family.  It would've been nicer if the crockery wasn't plastic! :-(  Would definitely stay here again and recommend to other families travelling to Anaheim for a Disneyland holiday.

We had a pleasant stay at the Hyatt Place at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center. The room was very spacious and clean. The room can easily fit 5~6 people. We had 2 Queen beds with a soft bed. The Queen beds were comfy. Breakfast was included in our stay. Wifi was good. A 20~25 minutes walk to Disney‚Äôs California Adventure Park.

Hyatt Place at Anaheim is good choice when attending conventions in the area. The hotel is only a easy 5-7 min walk from the convention centre with many great restaurants all within 10-15 min walk. The hotel is modern, our room was spacious and bright. Internet is free and free printing facility in the lobby area. AC works well but a bit noisy. Beds are comfortable and spacious working area, L shaped sofa all makes the room very  pleasant for a few days stay. Breakfast is free but selections are limited. Suggestions are made here for management to consider adding more items and use real eggs rather than egg substitutes. Service was excellent with very attentive front desks staff who always took good care of our needs. Housekeeping service also above par, our room was very clean

Our family of four stayed at the Hyatt Place in a standard room using our annual free night benefit on our Hyatt Visa card. The room was clean and well-appointed, though in a few respects it could have used some minor cosmetic attention. We left to spend two days at Laguna Beach, but returned to spend a paid night at this same Hyatt. We upgraded to a suite, and it was GORGEOUS. It seemed much newer than the standard room we had before, and we were sad to only have time to stay one night! It was well-equipped for a longer stay. Breakfast was good, with a variety of choices. Getting Disney tickets at the front desk was easy, and the staff was very friendly. We would definitely go back to this Hyatt in the future.

We had an excelent stay at Hyatt Place. The room was very well appointed. The breakfast was very good. A 15 minute walk to Adventure Park. Nice area. Many hotels under construction. The only bad thing was the 16 dolars for self parking.

Summary Heading: Lost my laundry and never replied!
Summary: The hotel and room itself was actually fine. The maid service was excellent and efficient.  Where I had a BIG issue was the way I was treated when my brand new pair of dress shorts was lost while doing laundry (personally, I think someone stole them and then doctored the laundry ticket to claim I didn't submit it). When I reported it to the hotel mgmt, they told me that they would follow-up and get back to me. They passed my problem off to the next shift mgmt and they never got back to me.  I'm so hopping mad about it since I feel they've ignored me.  The staff didn't seem to know what to do in this kind of situation.  It felt like this was all new to them.
Manager Response: Dear 71 potc, Thank you sharing your comments about your stay.  We would like to extend to you our most sincere apology for the issue you experienced regarding the laundry service.  If you can please contact the hotel via email or phone we would like to see how we can resolve this in a positive manner.  Our General Manager will look forward to hearing from you very soon.  You can reach our General Manager at the phone number listed on our web site. Thanks again, John

Summary: The family rooms with the bunk beds really are great for families - adults get their own room and our kids loved the bunks.  The breakfasts in the morning were among the best "free" hotel breakfasts I've had and the staff really hustled to keep things clean and fresh.  as other reviews have noted, this is a very new hotel, so everything is in great shape.  There are a couple of design flaws, though.  One, the a/c is only in the kids' room, so if you close the doors, that room gets freezing and the other room gets hot.  Perhaps slatted doors would be a better choice.  Two, there are no power outlets near or on the desk - in fact, there aren't enough power outlets in the whole room for a new hotel. Housekeeping was a bit sloppy, they left some dirty washcloths in the bath; and we

Summary Heading: Spacious Rooms: Clean, modern and a great price
Summary: I chose Hyatt Place because their guest rooms are larger than most hotels.  Our stay came with a free breakfast buffet with a wide variety of foods and beverages. Hyatt Place Anaheim was clean, modern and convenient to Disneyland, the Convention Center and the Honda Center.

Summary Heading: Great Stay for Disney or Convention Center
Summary: This hotel is a decent walk (about a mile) from the park entrance, and even closer to the convention center. The rooms are large and nice for families, the breakfast is great! always good hot food with plenty of choices. There is not a restaurant in this hotel, just a small bar. There are plenty of places to eat close by. There is also a shuttle to disney that leaves from the street out front to Disney parks. We like to take the shuttle sometimes and walk sometimes. We have stayed here several times in the last year.

I stayed here for 3 nights in between transitioning from one apartment to another. The staff was knowledgeable and extremely friendly. The complimentary breakfast in the morning was fantastic, we never had to wait for anything to be replenished - everything was always fully stocked. The front desk supervisor, I missed his name was so extremely eager to help and over-the-top friendly, we really appreciated his kindness. The parking situation is really easy and convenient...The room were wonderful as well - clean, nicely furnished, and with everything you would need to cook all ready for you in the kitchen. Overall, a wonderful stay and we wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Clean, friendly staff, spacious rooms.  Love the free breakfast , free wifi and parking.         My family went to Disneyland & we stayed at Hyatt place. This place is awesome.. Clean, no smelly rooms and spacious. Kids love this place, definitely staying there again soon.

Our family are Disney annual pass holders and visit multiple times a year. We inadvertently booked Hyatt Place instead of the hyatt regency. We absolutely are impressed with the staff. Taylor, Lani, and Jordan made this stay an absolute pleasure. We were celebrating our anniversary with our kids and Taylor went out of his way to send treats for my wife and I, and our girls. Our youngest daughter lost her sponge Bob toy and they went out of their way to find it and hold it for us.  If it wasn't for the staff we would've cancelled our reservation and stayed at the regency. We highly recommend trying the Hyatt Place.  Our room was awesome, affordable, clean, and by far top staff. We will be booking here on every trip going forward.

Summary Heading: Lovely modern hotel very centrally located only few mins from Disney
Summary: Lovely modern hotel very centrally located and only a few mins from Disney resort.   Rooms very well appointed and clean. We had 2 doubles suite including pull out queen sofa bed we used which was good.  Plenty of food choices locally.   Free breakfast included which was a decent quality.  Be prepared if you don't have kids in the morning at breakfast they were everywhere and it was a bit chaotic.  I would recommend this great value hotel if staying in the area for a stop over like us or longer for a Disney visit.

Just got back from an 8 night stay here.  Hotel is very clean and well kept. We stayed here because it is close to Disneyland. Was close to shopping and restaurants as well. Breakfast every morning was scrambled eggs and sausage with mixing of hash browns or other specialties. Also has bread, bagels, english muffins and toasters. Was nice that it was set up as 2 mirrored breakfast stations so there was never much for line ups. We were in a king bed with bunk beds room and it was great with 2 young kids. It has 2 pocket doors that close for privacy. Also has 2 tvs so when kids went to bed, we could still have the tv on. Also little bar fridge was nice for food and beverages. Our little guy sleeps with a teddy and blanket. After we left first morning and came bsck to the room, the

Enjoyed the Hotel, very nice in appearance, great amenities and very clean. Love the breakfast buffet and the pool and as well as the 24 fitness center. The staff  could use better training in my opinion.  They are not upfront about their charges or hold and the maids failed to service our room at all one of the days during out stay

My family and I stayed here for 4 nights and it was pleasant, anyone who knows me understands that I am quiet a fussy person in relation to traveling and hotels. After paying $2085 AUD for our Disney tickets I wanted something clean and simply for our accommodation and the Hyatt place meet my standard. I have three children so it's always hard to find a hotel that can accommodate us all in the one room and Hyatt did that. Hotel was very clean from the entrance to hallways and most importantly the rooms, I've been told I can be OCD but the cleanliness was up to par for me. Breakfast is included with all bookings so it was a bonus considering it was one of the cheapest hotels on the strip, breakfast was tasteful, simple and not too overdone which was refreshing. Staff we always

This hotel was very clean with very professional staff.  It is a short walk to the front gates of Disneyland.  The breakfast in the morning has everything you need and many options for those with allergies.  I will stay here again.

We stayed at the Hyatt Place at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center for three nights. Great buffet breakfast with hot and cold foods including sausages, eggs, fruit, cereal, pastries, yoghurt, juices, tea & coffee. The rooms were clean and tidy with comfortable beds. Easy walking distance to Disneyland. We would definitely stay here again.

As we travel to Disneyland frequently, have a daughter who worked there, etc. we have had the good fortune to stay at most of the nicer hotels in the Anaheim and Garden Grove area.  I am also a Platinum Hyatt Gold Passport member, so I know the Hyatt system.   The Hyatt Place Anaheim Convention Center is seemingly close to the Disney parks.  However, it is not a short walk.  It is a long, hot and traffic filled journey that starts your day off with a not-so-short hike to the parks and adds miles to the day.  The trip home at the end of a long day of exploring the parks is daunting.  This is all without kids.  I wouldn't attempt this with little ones.  A number of hotels that are a few blocks closer actually run shuttles, so that should tell you something.  The hotel is right on

The Hyatt Place is a very good hotel for a trip to the Anaheim/Disney area.  Rooms are spacious and clean and service was friendly and courteous from check-in, housekeeping and breakfast staff.   My family of 5 stayed here for 6 nights in August and we enjoyed our entire stay.  Note:  For those planning on walking to the Disney Parks, it's about a 20-30 min walk.  While we were there Cali was in the midst of a heatwave so the walk was exhausting especially at the end of the night.  We found out that cab (van) fare to/from the hotel to/from the Parks was only was less than $10 which was cheaper and more convenient than transit buses.  Parking is limited however we never found it hard to find a spot after returning from a day of sightseeing at around 10pm.

The hotel was modern, good security to the guest floors, food available 24 hours. The room was comfortable enough.  I slept well enough but my husband, adult son and grandson (who stayed in a family room) did not sleep well at all.  They said the beds were too soft.  But I was surprised by a huge charge to park, and it was not located "right next to the gates to Disneyland" as a website of theirs said.  It was quite a few blocks away, a 10 minute bus ride, even with no stops.   There is a new shuttle bus for all hotels to use.  We could buy tickets at the hotel.  But when I asked for senior tickets, which were greatly discounted, they said I had to buy adult or child.  I showed them the brochure which listed fares and they said I could try another hotel because they didn't know
Manager Response: Dear Manazefa, Thank you for sharing your comments about our brand new hotel in the Anaheim Resort.  Just to share with you know how valuable guest comments are, we discovered that our order sheet for ART tickets did not include the Reduced Fare Ticket and therefore we would customarily order the regular adult and child tickets.  But since you have brought this to our attention, the ART shuttle service representative has provided us with an updated Ticket Order Form that includes the Reduced Fare Tickets so that we will now have these available to folks that qualify for the lower priced ticket.  I did also check our brand web site as well as a very well known online travel web site and both sites do mention our parking policy.  Parking fees in Anaheim Resort area hotels are common amongst most branded hotels (Hyatt, Holiday Inn, etc) and helps to ensure that overnight parking is restricted to hotel guests and not transient parking of visitors that may not be guests of the hotel. Thanks again for bringing your comments to our attention.  Our goal is to welcome each and every guest and to ensure that their stay is enjoyable, memorable and pleasant.

Summary: Conveniently close to Disney, new, clean...great breakfast...great service even when breakfast was packed. Nice cold water with lemons in the lobby.Brkfst and WiFi free...have to pay for parking. Ask about the local ART re 1or3or5day pass .Art takes you right into Disney entrance and may be cheaper and better than $17Disney pking plus waiting time for the tram to/from Disney pking.

Stayed here for 6 nights the room was spacious loved that there was a little sitting area in the room. A/c was perfect for thehot anaheim weather. Breakfast was plentiful and also there was water in the lobby available for guests to drink, which and either lemons or limes in it. Hotel handy to Disney and restaurants will defin stay here again. Staff were very friendly and always willing to help.
Manager Response: Dear KCS72, Thank you for taking the time to share your comments about your stay.  We appreciate all guest comments and are pleased to know that your stay was enjoyable and met with your satisfaction.    We visit New Zealand every year to promote our hotel and our team knows how much we value our Kiwi friends.  Whether its a request for Marmite or a kettle to make good hot tea, our team is always here to help.  Should your plans call for a visit again soon, please let us know. Thanks again!

Summary: Really lovely clean hotel, courteous staff, good value for money.  Great location near theme parks.  Lots to choose from at breakfast time.  Pleasantly surprised by the exceptional quality of this hotel.  Lots of restaurants within walking distance.  Parking charges reasonable.

Summary Heading: Awesome Time at Hyatt Place Anaheim
Summary: What a great find.   I am a Disney Cast Member and I was blown away by the service and cleanliness at this hotel.   It was a great surprise and I have found my new home away from home when visiting the Disneyland Resort.   Room was large and spacious and comfortable.    At the lobby, I met two amazing employees.  Both Madelin and William went above and beyond and were great to talk with.   They were all about exceeding expectations.   They won me over.   :)  Great things to say about this hotel and I will definitely be back.    Thanks for making my stay an incredible one.
Manager Response: Hi Joseph Q, So happy to read your review and see that you were very satisfied with your stay.  And of course, the choice of hotels (Hyatt Place)  you selected for your wonderful visit the Happiest Place On Earth, Disneyland Resort!  If we can help you organize your next visit to the Anaheim Resort, please let us know.  Thanks again and see you back here soon.  John

Summary: The location is good for Disney, short shuttle ride at $5 per person per day, or for larger group park at Disney for $17 total.    Hotel facility was nice, lots of amenities: tennis, basketball, fire pits, pools.  The small deli and Starbucks had great staff and decent value.    We had a two bedroom, two bathroom suite, it needs a face lift and new bed at least in the master.  When we checked in there was still a hair band on the floor and some other garbage.  Not the best cleaning staff.  Half way through our trip the speaker in the master would start making a loud vibration.  Good thing we were there for Disney  and exhausted each night, so we could sleep despite it.    The staff all seemed friendly and helpful.

We're the family that security leads to the exit of the park several hours after closing - mainly due to our indecisiveness when choosing souvenirs of our latest visit to the happiest place on earth. What was great is that we were able to check into the hotel before the park opened, park our car at the hotel, then run down the street and get to the entrance of Disneyland before the "official" opening.  We loved grabbing a cab and getting back to the hotel for the iced citrus water waiting in the lobby before we stumbled into the elevator and found our soft and fluffy pillows and dreams of Tinkerbell riding the Grizzly River Run on a 102 degree day... The breakfast the next morning was amazing and while my kids joked about the size of the pool - i quickly reminded them that they

Summary Heading: Could be better, location is decent
Summary: Not impressed. Expected more from a Hyatt, but this was only ok and not as clean as I would have liked (found left over tissue sitting on window). Location was pretty good, but I was not impressed with the hotel itself. One of the staff actually told us the wrong information which had us board the wrong bus only to have to get off at different hotel and catch a taxi to our location. So, eh to this place.

Stayed here for 1 night with family. Originally booked one room with 2 double beds and pull out sofa. And then my relatives of 5 decided to stay for the night too. Booked another room for them. At first I was quoted a lower price but when the front desk staff was looking for adjacent rooms there was no room available for the lower price. I booked the higher room anyway because we wanted our rooms to be adjacent. Reservation was quick. Cory at the front desk was very helpful and informative. He really made everything easy for us. As we were going up the elevator, I crossed paths with the front desk manager (Wilson is the name I think???) and asked how everything went with our check in. I mentioned to him that we were quoted a lower price at first but it changed because there were

The hotel is what you would expect of the Hyatt brand.  We had a 2 Queen bed room which included a large sitting area.  The bathroom was fine and didn't notice any surrounding noise.  Front desk staff was attentive and the breakfast that was included was great.  Many things to choose from and they were always refilling everything.  There was even a small outdoor seating area, which we enjoyed.  We timed the walk to the park because I had read many different opinions on here about it.  The walk took us 25 minutes exactly from door to door.  You have to cross several very large intersections that give you 30 seconds to cross.  If you have small children, I would suggest putting them in a stroller or you may end up having to carry them.  I don't think the public transportation is

Room was quiet, clean. Beds were very comfortable and the breakfast was a big perk. Close enough to walk if you don't have small kids (about .8 miles away to the security checkpoint of disneyland).  Everyone was very nice at the hotel

We arrived before noon but were greeted by a most charming young man who checked us in and we  were by the pool within thirty minutes.The rooms as you would expect from a Hyatt Place hotel were super.Breakfast was beautifully presented with an extremely large choice and the breakfast staff were so efficient and friendly. This hotel is a short walk from Disneyland.I cannot agree with other reviewers who say it is a long walk.It isn't. Lots of restaurants extremely close as is a major supermarket. This is the Must Stay hotel for Disneyland

Stayed here in October 2014 when the hotel had just opened. Everything from the room to the Staff was just perfect. So for our trip this October I didn't think twice about where to book our room. It's a very convenient location, close to Disneyland and the room itself was very spacious. Excited to be going back in a couple months!

We just got back from a 4 night stay at the Hyatt Place.  It was a great hotel with friendly staff.  We were a party of 4 adults and 2 kids and stayed in a room with the King, double pull out and twin bunk beds.  Plenty of room for all of us, our luggage, 2 carseats and 2 strollers.  The room was clean and everything still seemed fairly new.  Breakfast was pretty basic but nice to have a choice of hot food (eggs, sausage, pancakes etc) and cold. Loved that they had take out cups to take your coffee to go. We walked to Disneyland everyday, which took about 20 minutes at a moderate pace (with kids sitting in strollers). A few small issues with the room:   The carpets were a little on the dirty side, so feet/socks turned black, but we just made sure to wear socks or slippers while

Summary Heading: My stay at the Hyatt Place in Anaheim, CA
Summary: I really enjoyed my stay at the Hyatt Place. The staff were very helpful and courteous. The shuttle was reasonably priced and very convenient. With my wife and two children, we slept comfortable. During breakfast it was a mad house with all the kids running around, but the staff always smiled which would have been very difficult for me. Oh yeah, I forgot to mention that Starbucks is right next door.

We chose this hotel for our Disneyland vacation this August. (Not a great time to go to Disneyland BTW). Everything about the hotel was pretty nice. It's a newer hotel, just under a year old as of the writing of this review. Being so new, there's not much to complain about really. There were only a few things that prevented me from giving it a five star rating.   1) The swimming pool looks like an afterthought on the part of the hotel designers. It's small- really small. And it's situated in a tiny nook at the back to the hotel that receives little to no sunlight during the day. We didn't even bother using it. If this is important to you, then you better book elsewhere.   2) The breakfast was quite good, but for Pete's sake cooks, PLEASE stop watering down the scrambled eggs.

Very clean, helpful staff, excellent location if your going to Disney, its right down the street. Lots of eatery's and stores in the area.Free breakfast is good in the morning, many selections each day.

For our Disneyland part of our vacation we stayed here, and it was the best location.  Found out when we got there the hotel had only been opened for 10 months, and it was sold out every night we were there.  The staff was beyond helpful, we arrive early morning to get to the park early and were extremely help by storing our luggage and inviting us to complementary breakfast (BTW - very good).  We were able to buy our ART (Anaheim Resort Transit) Tickets at the desk, and of course they are a "Good Neighbor Hotel" for Disney, so they had maps and tickets.  And it was a very short walk to the bus stop.   The hotel was perfect, very large rooms, great for families.  We had a room with a King bed, bunk beds and a sofa bed, more room than we needed but I have a boy and a girl and it

Summary Heading: Perfect Hotel, only a  short trip to Disney Land
Summary: Our first trip to Disneyland with our adult son, we didn't know where we should stay our travel agent recommended the Hyatt we were impressed and found the accommodation perfect. Short trip on the shuttle was no problem for us or other families with little children, the drivers always friendly and cheerful. The weather not so good so we missed out on the fireworks, disappointing however we found plenty to do at the hotel.

Went to Disneyland back in May 2015 with our 3 small children and stayed for 4 nights.  This was our favorite Disney hotel by far-we previously have stayed at the Sheraton and Hyatt Regency on our previous Disney trips.  The suite was huge and had a living room area complete with sofa bed.  Loved the buffet breakfast-options changed daily and you can take it up to your room which is convenient when you have small children.  Will definitely stay here again for future Disney trips.

Thank you for allowing us to stay at your hotel...we were originally supposed to stay next door but the upgraded us to your hotel. Nit was nice to have more space for the kids to stretch out with the cozy corner!

We were fortunate enough to stay at this hotel once again for my sons birthday. Upon checking in the front desk agent overheard my son speaking about his birthday and he immediately wished him a Happy Birthday and offered him a treat from their bakery section.  For a 7 year old (and for me) it makes the day extra special. He could have simply ignored the fact that it was my sons birthday, but he decided to acknowledge him. An act like this reminds me I stayed at the right place.  Of course our room was great as always, clean, secure, and convenient to the park, but what makes the hotel special is always going to be its staff., and this hotel obviously hired the right people!

This hotel was awesome. Easy access to the convention center (five minute walk). Used ART to get to Disneyland. Room was perfect size and very comfortable. Ate at the gallery a few times. Pizza and sweets were delicious. Parked on the first day and never moved the car.

Very clean, comfortable, with a professional staff.  Basically everything one expects out of a Hyatt.   Suggestion: Do not try to walk to Disneyland with small children...we did that once, that was enough.

We had trouble getting in to our room after a long day of traveling, they did comp parking and gave a one night discount on room which was nice. The rooms were clean, parking easy, breakfast was just ok. Just a basic place to stay when visiting Disneyland.

I'm very satisfied with the Hyatt Place hotel, it was a great choice for us. We were a group of 6 persons and had a room with two queens and a sofabed. We stayed 7 nights and the service was great. The room was clean, and big enough for us, the bathroom was nice too, the only issue we had was that the fridge wasn't working and the kids food went bad but as soon as I called they replaced it and as a courtesy they waived the parking fees. The breakfast was great. The location is close to Disneyland park.

Summary Heading: I guess this hotel is just okay
Summary: We stayed here over spring break and visited Disneyland. It is a long walk to Disneyland with young kids. I have a 3 year-old and 5 year-old and needless to say, they could not do the walk. Anyways, the hotel itself was okay. We chose this hotel based on reviews. We wanted something large enough to accomodate our family of 6 and that had free breakfast. The breakfast would get very crowded by 8am, and it was a nightmare. The eggs were pretty gross (but they were the powdered kind). Other, than that, if you do not eat pork, there wasn't much else. It would be great if they offered turkey sausage. But, to be fair, they did have cereal, yogurt and bagels. The seating area for breakfast was quite small also, but it was just enough to get us going for the day. The room was clean and

Summary Heading: Great option for a hotel room that sleeps more than 4 people
Summary: We checked in around 11pm on a Saturday in a King family room. This room had a king bed in the front half of the room with two sliding doors that closed off the back half of the room that contained the bunk bed (twin size on top and bottom) and the L-shaped couch that was a sofa sleeper. The doors did offer privacy but did not fully block out sound. There were TVs on both sides of the room. Be sure not to leave your floor without your room key even though someone is in your room to let you in because a key card is needed in order to access the floor by elevator. However, I don't believe the stairs require key card access. The room was in good repair and clean but only had 4 bath towels in a room that slept 6. I went downstairs to the front desk to ask for 2 more towels but

I had called desk a day before our stay and requested joining rooms but was told the rooms are assigned on a first come and they couldn't guarantee the request when we arrived I was happy to see that we did have two joining rooms

Checked in at 2 a.m. and still the staff was friendly and helpful.  This is a newer hotel, so everything worked perfectly, was clean and well stocked.  Great alternative to more expensive locations near Disneyland Resort.

As an avid traveler, I am often hard to please.  This property was spot on.  Room was fantastic.  Staff were beyond friendly.  Super professional and helpful.  Breakfast was fair but it's free so I get over that.  I would definitely stay here again if I was in the area.

Summary Heading: Good for Convention Center or Disney stays
Summary: This hotel looks new, and the room was in great condition. King room had a nice seating area and big bathroom (shower only, no tub). The walls and doors are a bit thin, and one hears the neighbors or people passing by in the halls. The lobby is a bit on the small side, gets crowded quickly at busy check-in hours. The breakfast is quite good, many options, with some healthy (and many hearty) selections, replenished quickly despite the crowds. I was there for the Convention Center (short walk, mostly through parking lots), but most other guests were Disney-bound. The pool is small but adequate. Too bad the rooms don't have balconies - it's California, and I would have liked to sit outside in the late afternoon/early evening to soak it up! Housekeeping and front desk staff were

Pitched up at this hotel having travelled from Pismo Beach, a long drive through LA and the searing heat, pulling into the entrance was instantly taken by how clean and presentable the entrance was. Parked the car in self service car park, made way to reception and was greeted by very friendly and helpful staff. Checkin was swift and easy even though we were a couple of hrs early. Room was outstanding with cracking views over Anaheim and not knowing Disneyland. Porter told us that our room had great views for the Disney firework display each night. Bed was a super king, lush, v comfy lush pillows slept end like a log. Kids had a bunk bed which was amazing. Like a ships cabin bunk bed. Lower bed was size of small double the top bunk was 3/4 size. Kids fought over which bed each

When to this hotel thinking that Hyatt would have better standars than other cheapest or not a chain hotels around... My mistake...? Payed $200 a night, not breakfast included, they charge $25 parking!!! Anyway... As what they charge..I was expected a very nice room, again my mistake... A very average room, not fridge in the room, ugly bathroom with a child size toilet... I'm not joking..., to complete the stay... Bath is similar to a road motel and the lack of maintenance is the really bad part... I complained to front desk and manager... They were very helpful and she make a withdraw of $75 dollars from my bill( breakfast and parking) was an attention but I'm still not happy... Is dishonest to charge $200 a night for a room in that condition. Even though valet took 45 min to

Danielle was the nicest front desk person I've ever met! She remembered me when I would enter the hotel and call me by my last name, she is a class act! She made my stay there wonderful and was very attentive and really stuck with me of my memory of my stay. Even though there were young kids everywhere because Disney is right next door.

Overall, the facilities and rooms were good, ample space, and in good condition; the rooms looked like they were recently renovated.  Staff was pleasant, and welcoming when we arrived as well as when we went to breakfast.  Kitchen staff was very attentive, and always checked on how my family was doing.  The only issue I had was the lack of disclosure and a detailed explanation of how they process their credit card versus debit card transactions.  The team member at the front desk seemed curt and overly assertive to provide an answer versus listening to my wife's questions first, then responding with an answer or provide clarity on how the process works.

Great overall stay of 5 nights for a team traveling with family. Hotel was clean and staff very accommodating. Rooms were perfect for families traveling with children. Breakfast was convenient and a great added value. Fitness room had nice, up to date equipment. Location was all great with many restaurants and attractions nearby as well as easy access to highways.

We had previously lodged at the Doubletree on Harbor--a very good place. But over recent years we've become big fans of the Hyatt Place and Hyatt House brands. (In fact, as I write this I'm at yet another Hyatt Place in Northern California.) Anyway, the property near Disneyland is fantastic. It even still has the new-hotel smell. Checking in took some time but it was quite busy. High season. The staff were very nice and professional and the room was sparkling. A truly great stay. I'll add that the parking fee is not astronomical for the area. One more thing:  you can pay to take a bus for the short ride to Disney (the stop is right near the hotel) or you can walk it--a decent hike. Or...you can walk about 5 minutes to the Disney parking lot and take the free Disney shuttle to

Hotel was very well kept, the staff was great, and the breakfast every morning was very nice. Everything we needed was provided quickly and efficiently. Great location, close to theme parks, restaurants, and within driving distance of the beaches.

Our group of here stayed here to attend the Vidcon conference at the convention center. What a nice place. The staff is professional, and helpful, from the front desk to housekeeping. I loved that housekeeping left tissue and towel art on my cabinet on my second and third days, and having several people working the dining area at breakfast was really smart. Very clean and very comfortable.

Clean, modern, free-breakfast, free-Wi-Fi. Small pool outside. Small paying- parking. Very Nice rooms !!! Good for family, near of disney attractions. Lots of restaurant around. Kindly staff, they sell tickets for Disney but no discount.

Summary Heading: Modern, spacious suites...we loved this hotel.
Summary: Spacious rooms, with comfortable beds and a corner unit sofa to relax on. The suites were modern and very clean. We loved the bathroom. The hotel is relatively close to Disneyland, (about a 15 minute walk), or you can use the hotel shuttle which is $5 a day for adults, $2 for kids. We actually used the Disneyland shuttle from the parking lot across the street. Parking is $14 a day which is reasonable for a hotel near Disneyland. Breakfast and wi-fi is free. Our room, which faced the Clarion hotel, had a great view of the Disneyland fireworks, which was an added bonus. We really liked this hotel a lot and will return.

My family has stayed at several Hyatt Place hotels and this may be the best one yet! The ENTIRE staff was friendly and professional. My family of 4 (2 adults, 2 kids) stayed in room 428 which is a king bed with bunk beds (forgot to verify, but I think the sofa also has a bed for an additional 2 people).  We loved the room.  Two tv's with all the channels you would want, spacious room separated by sliding doors, and a large bathroom area.  If you are a family, the few extra dollars for the larger room is well worth it.  Also, the breakfast area offers great variety and plenty of seating area.  We walked to Disneyland (15 minutes one way) and took a taxi back ($10 including tip).  Great location with plenty of restaurants close by.  Only knock is $14 a night for parking which is

Nice spacious room with many ammenities!  Would definitely stay here again.  Shuttle service made it easy to go back and forth to the Disneyland Park. We had plenty of room for the family with 3 beds, and having 2 televisions in the room was a nice thing to have.

I had a very great experience with Hyatt Place at Anaheim. The hotel is clean and personnel very friendly.  Special thanks to one of the best Sales Coordinators I have met so far, Melissa Lendechy-Ferree. She is a great employee, very helpful!!!

Summary Heading: Excellent except for the awful coffee
Summary: Clean, modern, great hotel.  Breakfast great.  Only issue is the horrible coffee the chain switched to pulling the decent coffee they used to serve.  Coffee snobs will be very upset.   Makes you not want to have the breakfast.

Nice hotel. Very modern room. Comfortable beds. Good free breakfast every morning. We weren't doing much in Anaheim but still chose this hotel. It is right by Disneyland. About 15-20 min to Knott's Berry Farm.

key cards for everything but you have to reset them daily and it sucks when they don't work in the parking garage, plus why have valet parking when they already charge you 16 dollars to park its so you don't have to fight with the elevator in the garage.

Summary Heading: New hotel. Short walk to Disney
Summary: I want to preface this review with the fact that I made the reservation six days before our arrival and almost everything was sold out due to 60th anniversary of Disneyland. I requested a high floor, Disney facing, kid suite. I got a second floor handicapped kid suite. The room was at the end of the hall, so we were hoping that helped with noise, it did not. The first night I had to go out on the hall at 1:30am because there was an extended family and they would prop their doors open with the latch and then run back and forth and let them slam. After the ninth time, I confronted them and it didn't happen again. The fourth night, a pack of elephants moved in above us and were up after midnight and again up before 7am. I blame this on construction, but not how I want to be woken,

We normally stay at the HoJo Anaheim, but their prices were higher than normal.  I'm a Hyatt Gold Passport member, so I called Hyatt Place to check on rates (I rarely make reservations online because I find I can get better deals from the hotel directly).  The manager, Scott, gave us a great deal.  With breakfast included in our already great rate, I decided to give them a try.   The staff was super friendly and everyone (housekeeping, front desk, supervisors ) checked in with us regularly to make sure our stay was comfortable during our two night stay.  The breakfast was decent. It's not fancy at all, but for a family wanting to spend the day in Disneyland, what a great way to start your day!  You have a lot of options to choose from, so even picky eaters should find something

Summary Heading: Great location, friendly staff, spacious room
Summary: Took kids to see Disneyland and stayed in the hotel for two nights.    Its staff is really friendly: always greet you and have warm and direct eye contact when you talk to them.  The room is very spacious for four of us and air-con is good.  Breakfast is full of what we need and foods are always stocked properly and tables and used plates are cleaned quickly.  Location is ideal although it's not on the door step of Disneyland.  Can take a public transportation to the park and pay $5 per adult and $2 for kids.  Plentiful parking space and costs $14 a day.  Not a bad deal.  A tiny thing: the curtain isn't large enough to keep the room dark enough to sleep.  But overall stay is very pleasant and would definitely recommend it to friends and stay in it again on next visit.

Choosing a hotel close to  Disneyland can sometimes be difficult, after reading several reviews of nearby hotels and comparing amenities and costs, the Hyatt was an excellent choice. Room was very good and the breakfast was excellent. Travelling with the family was a great experience. The only thing odd during our stay was that when entering the room for the first time, all drawers were opened and the sofa had all the cushions out with the bed sofa semi open, just like if the housekeeping left the room unfinished. This hotel is located approximately 0.8 mi from the entrance to Disneyland and within walking distance specially if you compare them to other parkings. Hotel does not tell you the cost when you check-in, you have to ask. Cost per day was $14. Freee wifi for multiple

Summary Heading: Modern Hotel with large rooms and good service
Summary: The hotel was modern and the rooms felt new and modern and they were very clean and large, ours had a sofa in a small seating area. Beds and pillows were comfortable. The breakfast was one of the better ones we enjoyed on our 3 week road trip with good choice, however, the seating area could get crowded and so you may have to wait 5 mins to get a table.  No big deal. The service and attention was good for this type of hotel, very friendly. The pool was small and so if you went in high season it may be crowded but it did have a nice Jacuzzi with very nice towels provided. It is very close to Disneyland, however, we stayed there while visiting Knotts Berry Farm which was just up the road.  Summary: Its in the same category as a Holiday Inn Express but this is far superior to any I

Great place to stay! Rooms were very nice and very clean. Contemporary look with an elegant feel. The bathroom lacked shampoos and conditioner and only had a body soap but I'm sure the front desk could accommodate for that. There was a nice free breakfast and also a bar. They valet park your cars and it was a hassle/pain finding the valet guy or somebody with my car keys since the valet worked limited hours and they lock your keys in a box at the front desk. So either the front desk has your car keys or the valet kid does. Overall, great place to stay. Beds were comfy and rooms were clean and very nice which is what matters most!!

Like most of the people staying in Anaheim we were there to go to Disneyland. The rooms are amazing.  The pictures do not do them justice.  New & modern and very clean.  Very much aimed at the family market there was no mini bar items in the fridge and it was a good size.  The room we stayed in had a bunk bed which the kids loved.  To be honest they wouldn't have noticed if we didn't go to Disneyland. The kids room and couch is separated by a sliding door and the kids room even had its own tv.  Breakfast comes included with your stay & it was delicious.   There is no laundry facilities but they allow you to use the laundry at the hotel next door. It's a bit of a walk to Disneyland.  We got a cab to and from most days.  It's about a $8-$10 trip.  But if our kids were a bit older

Walking distance to Disneyland is a bit too much for small children who do not use a stroller. Breakfast had sausage for the two days we were there. The scrambled eggs could have tasted better. Did not offer hash browns or tator tots, kids favorites. Breakfast selection other wise was good. I wish there was a shuttle bus provided by the Hotel to Disneyland, other than  public transportation.

Paid $14 parking plus taxes, but there were not enough parking spaces.  Breakfast was not good and too crowded.  Had to ask for more towel and toilet paper.  Customer service was not courteous and made me feel like I wasn't needed.

Nice functional hotel for the family. The family room is nice (can sleep 6 in total) but it will be even better with 2 bathrooms (rather than 1). Good breakfast in the morning and a small gym is available for guests. You can take the ART buses to Disneyland (bus stop is just outside of the hotel. You can take bus number 1 or 2). Wifi is free. The staff are very helpful. Bring your own yoga mat if you are into yoga (gym is cold though and you space is limited)

Spent a couple nights here. We managed to fit 6 people In One room. Walking distance for us to Disney Land. The room was to our liking everything clean including the bathroom. Breakfast was really good, I've had my choice of breakfast in hotels but this one by far is the best. Over all best stay I'd come back soon.

All the comforts you want are here. The walk to Disneyland is 15-30 minutes depending on pace. Excellent staff great buffet in morning. Did not use the pool or the fitness center. Yes you pay for parking but that is normal for hotels in CA.

This new Hyatt is just minutes on foot from Disneyland. If you prefer to ride the ART shuttle is just outside the Hotel on the main road.  The complimentary breakfast is done right with a great selection fresh items.  Front Desk staff is eager to help and when I had a particular question about a future group stay Ms.Garcia/Sales came to the lobby and was very informative. It seems that for major events Anaheim can sell out several years in advance!  Also Gabriel from maintenance explained how a few things worked so my room stay was all the better.  Finally, the Hyatt bed is the best I have ever slept on! Not too hard, not too soft...just right!

This is a very nice hotel: modern, clean, quiet.  The free wifi was easy to connect to; the morning breakfast had a good variety of foods; and the 24/7 food service was nice also in case you get hungry at night.  The lounge was a great place to relax and eat a meal at the end of a long day.  I would definitely recommend this hotel.  The only thing you have to be aware of is that it doesn't have its own shuttle to Disneyland.  You have to use ART (Anaheim Resort Transit).  It stops about 1/4 of a block away and comes every 20 minutes or so; or you can walk but it's about 2 long blocks away.

This was a clean and friendly hotel with breakfast buffet that was very good and nice facilities. A shuttle ticket can be purchased to take you from the stop on the main street to Disney or very walkable distance from the parks. Parking your vehicle will add on a daily fee but worth the convenience.

Enjoyed the stay for our Disneyland trip.  We had a 2 Qn room with Qn pull-out couch providing enough room for 5 adults to enjoy a comfortable stay.  The staff service was very good.  The hot breakfast offered a tasty selection to start the day.

Hyatt Place has an excellent location, beautiful, clean, large, comfortable rooms (amazing beds- I slept like a baby), and the breakfast (FREE) is AMAZING!  If I return, I will stay at Hyatt Place again- saved us some good $ on breakfast alone.  A couple of downsides: #. The Pool is incredibly small- my teens decided it was so small that it was too boring to attend more than once.#2. The Gym is also incredibly small. #3. Check-in and Check-out for our 3 groups took 30-45min and the bill was no slipped under the door to the room on checkout day as promised.

This hotel was excellent!  From the great staff to the variety offered at breakfast everything was wonderful! Priscilla was a great help with booking tours also!  Myself and a group of students were in Anaheim for a Health Occupation Students of America conference which included business and a few local tours, as well as Disneyland.  I cannot say anything negative about this hotel or the staff.  There were several students staying at the hotel, which slowed internet service, but not a big deal.  I am ready to take my family back for a visit and stay at Hyatt Place!

Staying anyplace as a chaperone with 28 high school students is a challenge but this stay at the Hyatt Place in Aneheim California was the BEST in my 20 years as an advisor. EVERYONE was attentive; the entire property was immaculately clean and well cared for. The food was very good in both selection and taste.  I recommend it to anyone and hope to try other Hyatt's but can only  hope that they are as good as the one in Anaheim.

Issues at check in but once it was resolved everything was very good.  This hotel is very new.  Good location.  Breakfast was included and excellent quality.  Staff was friendly.  Rooms were very nice and spacious.  The entire hotel was clean and well maintained.  I will go back.

A great place to stay for a family of 5, with 3 children, 13, 10 and 8, there was plenty of room for all of us. Service was great, staff were very helpful. It's a 10-15min walk to Disneyland where we had 5 nights of fun. Downside was an average breakfast, but you can't complain when it's complementary  Will stay here again for sure.

As a family of 6 the room served its purpose. It wasn't huge but the fact it was a bedroom and separate lounge with bunks and pullout it worked. It was very clean and well presented. It had a lovely bathroom but the shower was over bath. Staff were very friendly. The pool was a little small and lacked ambience but again it served its purpose. The only real letdown was the food. No healthy alternatives with a lack of choice if you are wanting salads and vegetables.   I am being picky ... But for me the location was a little disappointing as I felt we were staying in the next hotels car park.

Nice place, came with family during Disney trip. Very convenient to walk to the park from the front door of the hotel - 15 minutes on the dot to the main gate with kids. If you walk and have tired kids at the end of the day, there is a taxi line and the cab ride back to the hotel was $8 for my family of four. Ate the breakfast one morning, was ok, not great, but the price was right üòÄ. The pool is small, but nice and has a hot tub. Staff was helpful and friendly. Our room had a small section with bunk beds for the kids. Would stay again with family.

I was extremely happy with our stay at the Hyatt. the room we stayed in was very clean, the bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. I am very picky when it comes to hotels and this hyatt exceeded my expectations. I will always stay at the Hyatt when we're in Anaheim.

I had the opportunity t stay at this property and also the Marriott Anaheim (very close by). The Hyatt Place property is much more family and tourist focused. At a similar price, the Marriott was also filled with families visit Disneyland, but the impression wasn't so overwhelming. It was difficult (impossible) to get seating for breakfast due to the large number of families visiting the breakfast area.

The room with two queen beds and a pull out sofa allowed our family of four to be very comfortable.  The free breakfast and WiFi was a huge plus over other hotels in the immediate vicinity.  Walking to convention center was very easy..

Beautiful, clean hotel close to Disney Parks and restaurants.  Large clean rooms with living rooms big enough for families to spread out after long days together.  Room darkening blinds and "Quiet hours" almost guarantee that you will get a great nights sleep.  Friendly staff, scrumptious breakfast, and 24 hour caf√© if needed.  Pool is small, however our family didn't have time to swim anyway.

Great hotel. Great personable, friendly, & professional staff!  Take really went the extra mile in making my stay there very comfortable & meeting my special requests.  I would seriously consider staying at Hyatt hotels in the future.

Wanted a big room for my family to rest before we went into Disneyland the next morning.  The room I stayed in had 2 Queen size beds and a pull out sofa bed.  There was plenty of space for 4 Adults and 3 Kids.  Breakfast was good, but they were missing the bacon, lol.  Overall I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Good location. Very modern. Loud hallways.
Summary: Pros: Rooms are very modern. Very clean. 15 min walk to Disneyland.  Cons: king beds are all located near the elevator.  And the doors are paper thin. Breakfast starts at 6 so there's lots of hallway noise.

Hyatt Place is the worst hotel in Anaheim. STAY AWAY at all cost!! The only reason I did not give them a zero is because there is no option for it. At 1:00am, the toilet in our room clogged. We immediately notified the front desk only to be told there was nothing they could do for us, as they had no maintenance staff at the hotel or on call. The front desk clerk told us we would have to wait until 7am for the manager. We requested multiple times to have the manager called, but he refused.  The hotel manager apparently can't be bothered after hours. We would simply have to wait as the only staff in the hotel was him. After multiple calls to the front desk, the desk clerk called our room to tell us that he had borrowed a plunger from the hotel next door and we were welcome to come

Summary Heading: Solid hotel, friendly staff but problems with group sales
Summary: The good: convenient location to Disney, clean/new/modern, small but functional pool area, solid complimentary breakfast included, free internet, overall VERY friendly employees at front desk in and in breakfast buffet area  Issues: poor construction (could hear everything in hallway outside room and above/next to us...people walking/talking, toilet flush, shower, etc), tricky HVAC (constantly messing with it as we were all too cold or too hot), some untrained staff (not everyone can make an upgraded coffee drink or serve a cocktail), no shuttle to Disney (too far for young kids to walk), $14 plus tax per day to park, disappointing bunk bed feature in the "family rooms" (very narrow, rickety, too small for pre teens, one thin blanket/no comforters, generally uncomfortable for

Summary Heading: Superb facility; we had a fabulous holiday
Summary: Superb modern facility which is in excellent condition and functional. Delicious breakfast spread and terrific in-room equipment and cleanliness of the highest standard.  Very convenient location for visitors to Disneyland. Very comfortable for families as accommodation is spacious and in a very relaxed environment.

Summary Heading: Dont forget to get a bus pass
Summary: The hotel was great, breakfast was good and hot, there was a different choice every morning. Just remember if going to Disneyland get the bus pass prior to leaving. The staff was friendly and the rooms were nice. There is convenience all around the hotel. They said we could see the fire works from the hotel but we couldn't.

Very nice and clean, I went recently with a few friends and the rooms were great and the breakfast options were amazing. The staff was kind and helpful as well. Disneyland is about 10 minutes away. It was overall a great experience.

I booked this hotel for a quick weekend to check out the Disneyland Diamond Celebration. My husband and I were very impressed with this hotel. Our room was spacious, clean, and comfortable. Breakfast in the morning was delicious. Each staff member we encountered was helpful and extremely friendly. We will definitely stay at this hotel again.

This was my first visit at a Hyatt Place and I truly enjoyed staying there. The complementary buffet breakfast was amazing. The rates were very competitive with hotels that didn't offer the same amenities. Truly a value for all Hyatt passport members!

The best staff ever--friendly and always helpful.We had a great stay--walked to disney-went to the beach-good dining all arou nd.Clean hotel.I would recommend this hotel to family and friends -it is family friendly

Excellent hotel, small and personal.  The hotel is a short walk to conference center.  The buffet breakfast was very good and choice changed from day to day. Will stay at Hyatt Place again. Staff were friendly and always spoke to you.

Very welcoming, new and clean.  Breakfast is served on real plates and cutlery, so you could have a very nice dining experience.  Staff are friendly and attentive.  Business center is very impressive -- there is even a Mac available.  Would highly recommend this hotel!

We stayed at this property for one night and it was great! The room was very clean and modern and the beds were comfortable.  It is so important to have a nice clean and updated room and this room had it!  The only issue I had was that they do not have body wash... I bring my own but it's nice to have that option. Most hotels nowadays have body wash and not bar soap but this isn't a deal breaker. But if you do use body wash just make sure to bring some :-)   The breakfast is really nice and it was busy but there was enough seating so that was great! And they were brining out new food even up to the last min!! So that was also really great service!!   Thank you and we will for sure be back for a longer stay!!

We stayed here over spring break 2015. The rooms were clean -- we had the twin bed and king layout. The only negative is the lack of seating at breakfast. We happened to stay during a cheer competition and it was like going to battle just to get a banana or plate. That said, we would stay again.
