My family and I thoroughly enjoyed our recent stay at the Hyatt Place.  We stayed for a week and visited friends in the area, as well as Disneyland.  The staff is top notch, as are the accommodations!  Keep up the good work!

Just spent a week here on a mix of work and leisure... the hotel works well for both.  Great location and facilities, clean and updated room that is well looked after by the staff and lots of great, healthy food options.  Excellent value for money.

Great stay while in Anaheim, close to Disneyland with a regular shuttle bus. Highlight was the kids suite, the room configuration was spacious and very kid friendly.  Would not recommend the buffet at the downstairs restaurant though, food was very average with 5 star prices. Food was better inside Disneyland! Lots of fast food restaurant on the same road so plenty of choices.  Despite the buffet, I would definitely stay here again for the modern appeal, good location & good service.

The kids suite offered plenty of room for 5 kids and a privacy king bed for us was great! Walls are thin but I wear ear plugs and kids and hubby were wore out so never heard a thing. The buffet breakfast was hot and plenty of choices. Parking was spendy but may compare with other hotels. Best option for getting to Disney.... Walk the 20 min or park at the woody park an ride unless it's just a couple ride the shuttle for 5$ a head. All in all it's a great place !

Rooms were spacious and clean. Hot breakfast every morning from 6:30am-10am. They continuously replenished the food (great way to save money with kids). Easy check-in. I took advantage of the 24/7 gallery and the food and selections were good. The parking was $14.95 a day but it did include in/out privileges. The gym was a little small but had new equipment  (they also provided towels and water inside of the gym). I did take advantage of the gym 2 out of my 4 days there. Overall great hotel and close to Disneyland.

Very happy with our stay here over Memorial Day weekend:  15-20 minute walk to Disneyland gates, surprised to only pay $210/night for room with king bed plus separate room with bunkbeds for kids (sliding doors separate rooms), Morton's steakhouse five minutes away had great appetizers and drinks to "debrief" after day at Disney, free daily breakfast though it got crowded on the holiday weekend, very friendly staff;  only complaint is that the walls are thin;  they have signs about quiet time from maybe 10pm-8am but you could hear the rooms around you when they shut doors, ran showers, flushed toilets, etc.;  but after a day at Disney you're beat anyway; certainly not as convenient as the Grand Californian but not nearly as expensive either

We had a great time in Anaheim.  The hotel is beautiful and the staff are friendly and pleasurable.  Parking is limited, but other than that everything else was perfect.  The complimentary breakfast was delicious and fresh.  I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Anaheim.

I wanted to love this hotel, I stayed at a Hyatt Place near Boston & loved it & was excited to stay at this new one. I'd rate it 3.5 if I could. Pros: room, so much room I loved it, space for all! Small hotel, no matter where your room is it's quite easy to access the lobby. Love 24/7 access to snacks & fresh meals. Staff all seemed both competent & courteous. Pro-Con: breakfast. Pro because there is a large selection, con because it is not very good. I agree with others breakfast is very understaffed, they need to bring on extra morning help. Con: noise. We had extremely noisy neighbors and called the front desk every night. Security arrived a couple minutes later each time but was less effective each night. It was a combination of partiers & no sound proofing around connecting

I had a great stay here for two nights. Complementary bfast was very impressive (buttermilk biscuits with egg, avocado, and cheese). The rooms were large, immaculate with tasteful art. Customer service was excellent. Jordan was incredibly helpful with local insights and helping to secure a shuttle. Very polished and professional!

Summary Heading: Mom celebrating a Sweet Sixteen at Disneyland
Summary: The stay at the Hyatt in Anaheim was an interesting one.  The front staff did not appear as welcoming as one would have hoped given it appeared to have reservations primarily from families attending Disneyland.  My reservation was prepaid, and booked through TripAdvisor so I assumed that the process would have been a seamless one.  However, to make a long story short they charged me again upon check-in for the full stay, which was later refunded.  However, had I not online checked my bank statement this error would have gone unnoticed.  The young lady at the front desk had difficulty finding my reservation inquiring if I had booked through Expedia.  I was told she was a new employee.  I later found out through another employee who came to assist her that when you book through

Offers a clean and comfortable stay. Friendly and inviting. All the amenities we needed were right there. Did not utilize pool or room service, so cannot comment on them. Great location as well. Only complaint is our reservation confirmation did not indicate any parking fee, so we were surprised by that charge on our final bill. Coming from Las Vegas, not used to paying for parking.

Had a great stay. Rooms were clean, bed was really comfortable. We were on 4th floor and it was really quiet and peaceful. I loved the convenience of being able to buy ART shuttle tickets at the hotel and the short walk out the door to catch the shuttle to the Disneland parks. It was a plus! And I really enjoyed the breakfast in the morning. Lots of variety and although it did get busy in breakfast area I never had a problem finding somewhere to sit and eat. Overall staff were very friendly and attentive! Great place to stay.

We had been booked for 8 nights at the Hyatt Regency Orange County, but switched hotels after one night to this Hyatt Place a little closer to the Disney parks. We are very, very happy we switched. Our room is slightly bigger than the king suite we had at the Regency, and there is more storage space. The bathroom is next to the door, which makes the pullout sleeper sofa deeper into the room and right next to the regular beds. We opted for two queens, so we had three beds lined up in row, perfect for our two pre-teen sons and us. The hotel is new so everything seems to work okay, and even though it is filled without about a zillion kids from around the world, our nights were very quiet and we slept perfectly. Our only complaint was that the front desk staff and morning breakfast

Hotel was nice but parking was really expensive, like 25$ a day or something. Please just include it in the cost of the room rather than thinking you are getting a good deal and then tack on extra fees.

My family and I stayed here in the beginning of May. It was great!!! The free breakfast was great. It was the best. It saved us soooo much money!!! They refill it frequently, there is always plenty and it actually taste good. The pool and jacuzzi area were nice. There was a fee for parking, but the wifi was free and it was pretty fast.

I was very satisfied with this hotel and the comfy rooms. The beds had me dreaming sweat dreams.  We drove on our first visit to Disney and actually got caught in traffic for over an hour.  We felt quite silly when we realized how close {less than 15 min walk} we were to the gates of Disney.

Hyatt really delivers on a great, affordable hotel experience that is close to the Disneyland resort. Within 15 minutes walking distance of the park, Hyatt Place delivers a simplistic yet refined stay. We loved the staff and the rooms were clean, neat, and comfortable. The hotel also has one of the most delicious complimentary breakfasts around.

Summary Heading: Suite comfortable, clean but had open bathroom
Summary: We stayed in a suite for a Disneyland trip - two adults and four children ages 15 to 6.  Space of room was great, as was the cleanliness.  Quiet room, so we all slept well.  Our only problem was the room design...the bathroom (half the width of the bedroom) is open so that the sink lights shine directly on the beds.  If your the last one to get ready, you may keep others awake.  Again, this is the suite.  We passed other rooms that seemed to have a door on the bathroom.  Otherwise, classy room, Asian style.  Good kitchenette with everything you need.  We would stay again because my family can sleep through lights :)

We love Hyatt Place because of the extra living room area you get. It's perfect for small kids so they have room to play and eat. The breakfast buffet was great and we rented a car so can't speak to any shuttle service. Parking was very easy and getting to the park was a short 5 minute drive (not including time to park and train to the park). The hotel itself is very clean and service was great but we didn't need to contact anyone for service issues.

Summary Heading: Great Stay for a Disneyland Trip
Summary: I just completed a 3-night stay here.  The room was big, clean and well maintained. I had a 2 queen room with sofa bed. The wifi was pretty fast. All guests get free breakfast. Nothing special to report but they do have 3 hot dishes. The coffee was pretty good which surprised me.  This is a nice property to stay at. The walk to Disneyland isn't bad.

There is a free and very fast Wifi in the room, and the breakfast included. The room has a sofa which can be used as a bed as well. Their beds were comfortable. We arrived early so we have to wait for a room, they put our baggages in storage free of charge. Their were computers at the lounge available for use and you can also use the printer if need be. Although we didn't get the room that we booked we were given similar to what we wanted. There is a swimming pool and spa in the premises. It is close to the bus and walking distance to restaurants. There is a convenient store nearby and if you need to go to a department store like I did, as my camera card was full - Target is a walking distance.

Highly recommend staying here! A couple of blocks from Disneyland! Clean modern rooms, kids loved bunk beds! Breakfast is the best I have had in a hotel and I've stayed in many hotels. I would stay here again! Do keep in mind that parking is extra, living in Chicago this to us is the norm.

We stayed at the Hyatt for one of RunDisney's events.  It was very nice.  The beds were very comfy and the room was spacious with a sleeper sofa available.  We ended up in a room that had an open shower but the shower itself was disappointing due to its stingy spray.  We had to call the front desk regarding noisy neighbors but the hotel took care of the disturbance very quickly.  You have to pay for daily parking and you pay for shuttle service to Disneyland park.  There was a Starbucks in the lobby and a really cute gift shop.  We were able to walk across the street for dinner and there were several other options available besides the one we chose.  We found the location extremely convenient with quick access to the freeway so we'd stay again.

Summary Heading: Excellent Service, Nice Rooms, Friendly Staff
Summary: Room is clean and comfortable- modern, comfortable beds, nice showers, blackout blinds and fridge Staff is attentive and friendly Disney Annual pass holders get free parking!!! Located close enough to Disneyland to walk, but not directly in all the Disney traffic and craziness.  Average breakfast- No waffle maker :( Overall awesome hotel. Will definitely stay again!

Summary Heading: Top location, excellent service, big rooms
Summary: I was there for a few days for a conference. The rooms are huge, private ensuite bathrooms are spacious as well. The service was very good from the reception, to the breakfast, convention. Its at a perfect location to go the beaches or visit disneyland.

Very nice Hyatt hotel with convenient location in Anaheim near major attractions. Our room was very nice/clean with comfortable bed and large screen TV and very fast WIFI (45 Mbs). Excellent included buffet breakfast and ample underground parking @ $16/day.

I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone who is going to Disneyland. We had the double queen special which worked very well with our daughter.  It had two bathroom sinks and the shower/toilet area was separate. There was a large table in one room which worked great for my computer.  I was actually able to work on my computer while the other family members were sleeping.  The daily breakfast  was excellent There was a good selection of items and each day they had one different item. A good variety of juices.   The self parking was great.  There was no issue finding parking. We were able to come and go with no hassle. There is a fee for parking. Overall we were very happy at this hotel and would strongly recommend staying there.

We stayed at this hotel for 8 nights recently, have to say this was one of the best hotel stays I've ever had. The free breakfast is first rate, all sorts of options and the quality was exceptional.   The service was one of the hilights of our stay, all the staff we interacted with were great however 2 names that really come to mind are Cynthia and Jordan.   If I really had to nitpick I'd like to see some sort of shuttle to Disneyland as it is a 10-15 minute walk for little legs after a tiring day at the park however all in all it was a great and  memorable stay.

Hyatt Place at Anaheim is a great place to stay.  The rooms are large and well appointed.  The location is perfect for walking to the convention center, dinner and Disneyland.  Breakfast was very good with a large variety of choices.  The staff was always welcoming and smiling.

Summary Heading: Loved our stay at the Hyatt Place
Summary: Exceptional customer service and value. This contemporary new hotel has it all. Free wifi, Free breakfast buffet (the variety and quality is outstanding) fantastic service, a great size room with separate sitting area, all within a 10 minute walk to Disneyland.

Location was very good but the overall accommodations were excellent.  The rooms were spacious and our twins loved  the extra space.  The rooms were quiet.  Food service was also very good but dinning area gets filled quickly.  When bus load of students arrived, there were no room to sit and eat.  Need to bring food to room but had to make several trips to accomodate the four of us.  Sufficient underground parking but parking fee at $17 @ night was a little high.  There are only four complimentary computers available and was usually occupied by teenagers playing games so suggest brining your tablet.

Summary Heading: Very close to Disney and I love the breakfast
Summary: This hotel is very new and clean. You can walk to the disney shuttle. So convenient. Their breakfast selections are good and also the quality of food. I will recommend and definitely will go back again in the future.

Rooms were great and spacious with a nice view from the fourth floor with a short walk to Disneyland. Other than all the great things about this hotel, one of the employees was very rude. Scott from the front desk answered the telephone when I called to clarify a few things about my stay (which weren't bad by the way). He was short, rude, and honestly very unprofessional the way he talked to a guest. Not to throw anybody under the bus, but Scott's customer service "skills" definitely needs to be reevaluated. Great hotel with comfy beds!

I recommend the Hyatt to anyone who wants to be on an oasis and enjoy a relaxing atmosphere.  After a long busy convention day, the Hyatt was a short walk from the convention center and a joy.  I felt comfortable right away. There was a statue of Mickey Mouse on the first floor and I guess there was many Disney visitors who stayed at the Hyatt but is was amazingly quiet.

I am currently in the room as we speak. This hotel is quickly becoming my favorite hotel!! Am here with my boyfriend and friends and are staying in a king room with bunkbed. My friends daughter LOVES it!!! Room is EXTREMELY clean and there is more than enough space to put your clothes. Bunkbed and king bed is separated by French doors and each room has its own tv! Big 42in tv that swivels! Not many hotel rooms has that! I believe parking is about $15/day but since I am a annual passholder, it's included in my rate. So FREE breakfast, FREE wifi, and FREE parking..front desk/guest service is extremely friendly and quick to respond! Called to ask for more blankets and within 2 minutes someone was knocking on our door! We are strongly considering coming back and using this hotel
Manager Response: Hi Nessia, Very nice to hear that you are thoroughly enjoying your stay and all the comforts of our hotel and your room.  Let us know if we can be of any assistance during your stay.   Take care, John

Summary: Pro: Great hotel for Disneyland visit. It is a bit of a walk but can easily take the Anaheim Resort Transportation (shuttle service shared among hotels). Very helpful and pleasant staff. Very clean.  Con: the hotel does not have laundry room.
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing our hotel and sharing comments about the ART shuttle.  Glad to know that your stay was enjoyable.   Thanks again, John

Summary: This hotel was clean. Rooms were quite spacious. We stayed in a 2 queen plus sofa bed and it fit all of us (2adults & 4 children). The staff were kind, helpful, accommodating, knowledgeable. It is close to Disneyland- it is a walk but doable. The breakfast in the morning was included and delicious. There were eggs, sausage, pancakes or French toast, juices, yogurt, fruit. Good selection My only complaint would be the food for after hours. There is no room service but there is food. There isn't anything to order for children which made it a bit cumbersome when we had hungry troops at odd hours. Would like to see a kids menu added.

Our four days at Hyatt Place were wonderful.. we were previously at the Hilton Convention center and while the staff was exceptionally friendly and wonderful the Hilton itself was sub par.   The building is old and needs work which they were doing while in full convention mode.  Hyatt place offers free in room wifi the Hilton charges.  Hyatt place offers a free skillet breakfast from 6am til 10am and the food is more than passable.  The rooms at the Hyatt place are spacious and so are the bathrooms.  Parking is cheaper than at the Hilton.  The other great thing about Hyatt place is that you have to have a room card to operate the elevator which is a nice added touch of security.  The building is new the beds are great.... everything worked and the staff was awesome.

Summary Heading: Great Place To Stay For Disney
Summary: Great Hyatt experience and first class treatment at this hotel, heated pool and hot tub with large lounge area.  Fifteen minute walk to Disney and a great front end staff, everyone was so professional and courteous and made me feel right at home.  My six year old son loved the bunk bed you provided in our room! Jorden who works in the front was just awesome!  Thanks for all your suggestions at Disney, it really made our day more enjoyable !!  We will definitely be going back.  The only downside was $15 a day parking.

Came here for a birthday celebration with my friends.  This place has the easiest check in and very nice.  Ask if they give any benefits for AAA members and I got a nice discount. Love the beds so comfy I did not want to get up! This place keeps it cleans and very classy. Will be staying here again!! My only gripe is the kitchen skillet morning breakfast is not very vegan / Dairy free friendly.

i love the hotel for their prompt service, wonderful hotel. Rooms are clean and bed is very comfortable. Loved the smores package at night. My daughter loved it. Nice location close to Disneyland. would go back again.

Couldnt have asked for a better hotel. Great proximity to Disneyland less than 15 minute walk. Rather quiet despite being on harbor Blvd... We had two nights were the people next door were being rather loud and obnoxious however reception was quick to respond. Would highly recommend a stay here if you're not wanting to pay the high prices the resort charges.

Great buffet breakfast every day..room had couch area..great for sitting, visiting, eating and drinking...safe in our room was very nice..bathroom lighting excellent..pool area closed early at 10pm and would have been nice to sit in hot tub after returning from Disneyland.California adventure ... Security system for access to floors very good technology..bums sleeping on ground at shuttle bus stop just outside hotel

This was a great hotel to stay at!  New, very clean, and a short walk to Disney!  The breakfast was fantastic with lots of variety from hot skillets to fresh fruit to donuts, you name it-they had it!   The rooms were spacious with very comfortable beds.  We are always pleased with Hyatt hotels and are our preferred choice to stay at.  The only negative comment I have (and it is not directed at the Hotel itself but at the Gold program) is we are Gold members and had enough points to redeem a free night.  When booking through the reservation line there were problems with the system and the lady on the phone told me she was unable to make a reservation using our points but when we got to the Hotel to let them know there were issues with their system and we could redeem our points

Hyatt Place has always been a very consistent brand and this location is no exception.  The rooms were well appointed, beds were very comfortable and the amenities were up to par as well.  The breakfast selection had the largest variety of items from which to choose that I‚Äôve ever seen in a Hyatt Place.  The WiFi worked very well, no issues or complaints.  The staff was very friendly too.  I usually stay at the Regency just down the road and that location is definitely geared more towards business travelers and this one seems to host more of the family/Disney travelers.  I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Very nice new hotel with all the amenities you'd need.  Good location. Good breakfast.  Very friendly staff.    Very nice new hotel with all the amenities you'd need.  Good location. Good breakfast.  Very friendly staff.       Very nice new hotel with all the amenities you'd need.  Good location. Good breakfast.  Very friendly staff.

Summary Heading: Been here a few times, it's a nice property.
Summary: I like this property, have stayed here 3 or 4 times. I find the rooms/suites in the N tower really nice and the lobby is a really nice place to sit and watch people. jThey need facilities open laer and earlier though. They actually kicked us out of the bar at 11:00 on Sat night as they wanted to close. The joint was full. As well, the Starbucks opens too late, they actually had a lienup down there every morning. Business travellers coming from the east time zomes get up early and want a coffee and a paer in the morning, Starbucks should be open 24 hrs. - it's NOT a big complaint, just an observation. Id highly recommend this hotel to both business travellers and families. Great location (just up the street) from Disney, close to the Angels park and the Honda Center for hockey

Hyatt Place isn't Hyatt Regency but it's great quality Hyatt service and look with a more casual feel. The interior design is fresh-classic and well engineered, linens and towels are thick and soothing, and the furniture (especially the bed) is clean and comfortable. And yes, kenetmd sundries (YAY!).

The Hyatt Place at Anaheim was a great experience. All the staff was very friendly, caring ,kind and professional in all aspects. They were also neat in appearance and helpful. I would recommend staying there and enjoying your stay at Anaheim

The Hyatt Place in Anaheim was the best hotel stay I have had in recent memory.  The hotel was clean and in very good condition, the staff was friendly and helpful and the breakfast was a wonderful to start the day.  It was an excellent value and I will stay there again

This is one of the newer Hyatt Place locations, so it has the better layout of the hotel, and the rooms. We stayed here for about a week for a trip to Disneyland. It's about a 15 minute walk to the actual gates in the park. The breakfast is included with the room rate, so it made for an easy morning routine before heading to the parks for the rest of the day. There are also plenty of restaurants and convenience stores between the hotel and Disneyland if you want to stop before or after the day in Disney. The pool and spa are on the smaller side, but when we used them, they were never crowded. Great staff and a great location!

Great hotel at a good price and at a walking distance to Disneyland/Disney California Adventure. Recommend this hotel but make sure to ask for a room that does not have an air-vent in it because those very noisy and can keep you up all night if you're a light sleeper. Staff was great and breakfast buffet was ok, they need more variety for vegetarian/vegan guests.

This was by far one of the nicest hotels we've stayed in (we're a budget minded family with 4 kids). This time was just me, the hubby and the toddler and the hubs was taking classes at the convention center so we decided to stay closer for him. I am VERY glad we chose the Hyatt place. It was clean, the staff was friendly, the breakfast was great! Breakfast included scrambled eggs (both plain and one that rotated- spicy, meaty and veggie) Sausage every day, a "bread" (french toast, pancakes, biscuits and gravy all rotated while we were there) fruit, cottage cheese, vanilla and strawberry yogurts, juice, milk, cereal, bagels, toast...PLENTY for everyone to choose what they wanted. The room was fantastic. It was very quiet and very clean. Beds were firm but not uncomfortable. We
Manager Response: Thank you for such a nice review! We are glad that you tried us out since your were going to the convention center and found out how nice our hotel is. My team and I look forward for you next visit with us! Thanks for all the tips for the readers that may be considering us!

Summary: friendly and attentive staff and clean room....no complaints. the only complaint i have is that i can hear everything that went on in the room next room. i complained to the front desk a few times and nothing was really resolved since i didnt want to change my room.
Manager Response: Dear Yoshi, Thank you for submitting a review on Tripadvisor.  I am glad that you enjoyed your stay except for your neighbors. We have placed signs to the guests to try to respect the amount of noise they make in the rooms, but I know it is sometimes difficult with kids that are excited to go to Disneyland. We do hope you will be back and visit us again soon! Thank you.

Summary: Hyatt place was a very new hotel.  It was modern, functional and clean.  It was walking distance to disney about 15 minutes and was generally a great central location.  Taxi's are expensive so download an uber app to your phone- quick and v.cheap.  No milk in room fridges for making your tea but you could get some from breakfast time.  The kettle in the room is awful, it is not a normal kettle and drips water out slowly.  The staff at reception were friendly however sometimes not very helpful.  On two occasions I queried the time a bus driver would pick us up and asked her to phone to confirm, however on both occasions she dismissed me and said that if it states pick up time not to worry.  On one occasion it was fine, however the other time it was not and we were 2 mins from

We stayed here during the recent Star Wars Celebration VII convention.  It's super close to the convention center, and much quieter than the other hotels near the convention center.  The free breakfast was nice.  If you go to the hotel bar, ask for Priscilla, she's awesome.  Tell her that two stormtroopers highly recommended that she make you one of her excellent margaritas.   The room TV can play videos/music/pics from a USB flash card if you want to bring or view your trip pictures or videos.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We have shared the comment you made about Priscilla as she does make an great Margarita! Thank you for staying with us , and we look forward to your return!

Summary: Didn't disclose parking fees at time of booking, there are other close properties with no such fees. The hotel is clean and the breakfast is a bit sparse in selection compaired to other hotels but it was good food.

My husband, our 3 children and I stayed in a room with a king bed, bunk beds and hide-a-bed.  We were very comfortable & happy with two flat-screen TVs.  The hotel is new and clean, and the staff are all very friendly.  It was a short walk to Disneyland, so there was no need for a shuttle.

Summary Heading: Great Option near Disneyland, not really sure why the bad opinions from other reviewers!
Summary: Really nice new hotel about three big blocks from Disneyland parks entrance. Rooms are large and comfy, we were 4 adults and 2 children and all slept comfortably in one of their two queen beds and sleeper sofa rooms. Breakfast service was great, all of staff were really helpful but Peter really went out of the way to help us. The variety at the breakfast bufett was really good (not many options but really good ones) we had breakfast three days and really enjoyed it, best part they had Gluten Free bread, which is a super plus.  Pool is a nice size but there aren't many loungers, it's in a funny place and doesn't really feel part of the hotel. I thought the parking fee was expensive but I guess this is standard practice throughout disneyland surrounding hotels.

Best stay I've ever had, clean hotel, excellent staff, good food. One of the best hotels in Anaheim, kids really enjoyed the Family Suite and free breakfast, was fresh and tastey, all I can say is perfect stay ! Go see for yourself

Summary Heading: Great stay, but cost of parking may be deal breaker...
Summary: The hotel is clean and quiet.  The size of the rooms is impressive for the area.  Family of 4 was very comfortable.  Swivel television was a nice feature.  The staff is spectacular.  Breakfast was nice.  Parking was expensive, $16+ per day.  That adds up.

It was my 2nd time (same trip) at a Hyatt, I am an official Hyatt fan!  Nice hotel, large clean rooms and bathrooms.  It was relief when you stay somewere and have room!  It was just me and my husband but it was perfect.  We only did two nights for a quick Disney trip.  The bar restaurant was good (even had a side area with kids shows on).  Starbucks on-site, always a plus. There was a $10 shuttle that took you over to the park, making it so easy.  Recommended for a Disney trip.

Great stay for a family of 4 with little ones. We used Expedia to book our one night stay so we would have a nice place to crash at night after our long day at Disneyland. Great price and nice grounds. Really was surprised with our room since it was just a standard King bed room which was very spacious. It was clean and very sleek with nice furnishings. I would definitely stay here again if I needed to stay in this area. We walked from the hotel to Disneyland both days it's about a 15 minute walk not bad at all. Hyatt place hotels are always a great choice. Their customer service was excellent also, they always asked if there was anything we needed when we walked through the lobby and how was our stay when we left. Our stay came with free breakfast which was amazing!! French

Beautiful hotel right around the corner from the Convention Center.  Hotel is very clean and quiet.  Room size is impressive.  Breakfast buffet had a good selection and the coffee was actually good (Seattle's Best)! My only complaint is the price of parking.  Over $16 per day is expensive when you stay 6 days.  Ouch!

I had a great experience in the hotel. I stayed 4 nights and had no complaints. I was with my wife and 2 daughters and we all enjoyed our stay. Breakfast was great. Proximity to Disneyland couldn't have been better. Great location and great service. Would stay here again on my next visit.

Great Hotel! Its been open for only about 6 months so everything seems new and fresh. Lots of the hotels in the Disneyland area are getting tired and dated and its nice to stay somewhere that is new. Its about a 10-15 min walk to the front gate of Disneyland, otherwise you can take ART for $5 if not wanting to walk. Parking is $14 a night, which is pretty standard for the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel. I am glad to heat that you enjoyed your stay with us. We do look forward in your next stay with us. Thank you for choosing Hyatt Place at Anaheim resort Convention Center.

Summary: Stayed for one night with my wife for some business we had in Orange County.  Overall this is a very nice hotel.  First of all, it‚Äôs almost brand new, so the d√©cor and facilities are all very fresh, modern, and pristine. Furthermore, the room and bed were very clean and comfortable.  Highlight had to be the free hot breakfast buffet.  Could not believe the quality and selection considering there was no cost.  Excellent value there.  Also enjoyed the clean and quiet fitness center for a nice run on the treadmill. WiFi worked in the room, although internet load times were a bit slow and inconsistent.  Only slight annoyance in our stay was the parking ‚Äúpass‚Äù situation.  The system they use to let people in/out of the lot seems to be glitchy, as we had trouble with it three times in

Summary Heading: One of the BEST in the Disneyland Area
Summary: I stumbled on this hotel a bit by accident when the nearby Hilton was sold out. I loved almost everything about it. Extra-friendly staff, convenient and tasty food options, a clean and quiet and newly decorated room. Downside: Parking is pricey and the in-room wireless (which was free -- a big bonus) had an inconsistent speed. I liked this place so much that I cancelled a reservation at the Hilton for a coming convention and re-booked here.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are glad to hear that your stay was great, and that you had been  unable to be at the Hilton and stayed with us just by luck. Now you know what we have to offer and we look forward to you staying with us again as you had mentioned that you now favor us over the Hilton!

Summary: This hotel is conveniently located near Disneyland. The room is a good size and clean. Love the sofa. Breakfast was good and there were more breakfast selections than the Hyatt Place LAX. The only thing I wish they have is a Laundry Room like the one they have at Hyatt Place LAX.  We were on a road trip across California both starting and ending in Los Angeles area. We brought too many suitcases and shop too much that we cannot fit in our rental car. We asked the concierge  to keep some of our luggage and boxes while we travel up north. On our return to pick up our stuff, I gave the luggage tag to the staff and the staffs gave us our luggage. What we did not realize until we reach home and cannot find some of our items is that we had forgotten one of our boxes at the hotel. We

What a great place to stay - we were here for a cheer competition and couldn't have been closer to the convention center. Great breakfast, friendly staff,lovely big, well appointed rooms. If anything the pool area is small but definitely workable for our short stay

Overall, my stay was pleasant.  However, we stayed in room 210 and the surrounding rooms made so much noise it kept waking me up in the middle of the night.  I can hear our neighboring rooms holding conversations, using the restroom and shutting their doors!  There was one point during our stay where my 5 year old daughter woke up scared because of a pounding noise that came from the floor above us.  The "free" parking was convenient as was the $10 food & beverage voucher and morning breakfast.  The beds were comfy and Elena did a great job at keeping the room nice and tidy.  The gentleman that sold us our ART passes was very nice and welcoming and Lani that helped check us out was nice as well.

I felt comfy and cosy staying at the Hyatt Place in Anaheim CA. Staff was very pleasant. Breakfast was fun! The room was very clean. Spa was hot. They catered to family. Great restaurants near by. Thank you. I will be returning in the future.

Location of the hotel is perfect for attending a medical conference at the Anaheim Convention Center. Hyatt is nice and new. Breakfast buffet was very good. Fitness Center was open 24/7. Swimming pool was a bit small.

I can always count on Hyatt Place to have a clean, comfortable room for me. I like the free wifi and the breakfast in the morning. The rooms are spacious and my son and I had an enjoyable stay. I would definitely stay at this property again.

I booked this room last minute for a stay-cation to Disneyland (which is pointless since we have annual passes and live 40 mins away) but we wanted to get away from the norm. I was hoping we weren't disappointed since I usually do a lot of research on hotels before booking. We were so happy with the outcome! I got lost on the way to our room and a wonderful housekeeping employee helped me find the room and even helped me with my luggage into the room. Our view wasn't spectacular but we didn't expect much. Rooms were clean and had everything we needed. Bed was comfortable and I'm picky about beds due to my bad back. Loved the free breakfast in the morning, we were expecting a boring "coffee and donut" breakfast. They exceeded our standards! Waffles, eggs, toast, fruit, juices,

This hotel is in great proximity to Disneyland and offers a great room layout if you have children, with a bunkbed "room" VERY clean, great fitness center. Pool is situated poorly but if you're there to do Disney, there usually isn't time!
Manager Response: David, Thank you for your review of our hotel. We are glad that you enjoyed your stay! We look forward to you next visit with us.

Summary: Loved the setup of the room for a family, so easy to just go downstairs for a hot cooked breakfast, lovely staff. two and a half blocks to walk to Disney land, pool was fun for the kids, exercise room easy to use

This was my son's first time to Disneyland and his 5th birthday. We wanted him to have the best experience. We were hoping that they did special amenities for children birthday but they don't. I know of other hotels that put together little packages from the gift shop together and have all the employees sign a birthday card. And by small packages I mean something like a coloring book and crayons. Either way it's still a nice gesture saying happy birthday from the staff to show they care and to thank them for choosing their hotel.  Everything was great. My son enjoyed his first visit and his 5th birthday. We took a cab to get to the park and back a shuttle would still be a great idea. It isn't too far however it is a bit far for little legs. Pool was a bit small but perfect for

Hyatt Place Anaheim couldn't have been better located, as we were attending WonderCon at the convention center, a quick walk away. The room was spacious and clean and seemed very new. A bit loud with all the little kids roaming, but to be expected since Disneyland is so close. Free breakfast buffet was surprisingly delicious. A very nice experience.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to write such a nice review of our hotel. We are glad to hear that your stay was great and that you will be hopefully visiting us again in the future!

Summary: This hotel is a very solid choice if you're staying in the convention center/Disney area.  The rooms are clean, the beds are comfortable, the parking is convenient and reasonable, and the convention center and some dining is within walking distance.  Bonus:  our room had a view of the Disneyland fireworks.

Picked this place sight unseen for a two (then three!) night stay while taking my mother and two kids (one in a wheelchair) to Disneyland for their first trip.  It was everything we hoped for and needed for our budget - easy parking, walk to Disneyland, nightly beer and wine to unwind from day's events, great free breakfast, and beautiful, comfortable rooms.  Amazing staff.  Everything was very accessible and we had a great time!!  Only con would be the pool - at this time of year it was too cold because it doesn't get much sun!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I am glad that you got a chance to stay not only two nights but added a third. Good to hear you enjoyed our beverage service and our friendly staff! Hope to have you come back in the near future!

Summary: The Hyatt Place is close to Disneyland, the ART buses, has great food, and nice service.  They've recently added the ability to buy the ART tickets at the front desk, which makes life even more convenient.  The hotel is clean and quiet too.
Manager Response: Cheryl, So glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. good that you mentioned the ART transportation as we do sell the tickets and it does make it nice to jump on the shuttle that drops you right at the main gate of Disneyland. Hope to see you again in the future!

Summary: we stayed in this hotel just for one night so we were close to Disneyland and we were pleasantly surprised! we are both travel agents and only booked it on impulse scrolling through expedia so were really happy when we arrived. the ladies at the front desk are very helpful, and the room standard itself is fantastic. breakfast was amazing too!  couldnt fault this hotel, would definitely recommend for anyone wanting to stay close to disneyland!

This hotel is very nice. The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. An Asian gal(did not get her name) even told us where to get a great cup of coffee. The breakfast was good but crowded. And the pool was small and shallow but still nice.

We enjoyed our stay this week at the Hyatt Place in Anaheim.  The staff was extremely helpful and friendly.  Having a complimentary breakfast is a great way to begin your day.  We were very pleased with our stay.

Summary Heading: hyatt place hotels always the best with free breakfast
Summary: last year this hotel was being finished so we stayed at the hyatt regency, however we got to book here for two nights march 23-25, and I must say I liked this place alot better for one thing breakfast is included the varieties are plentiful, never could understand why people complain when the breakfast at hyat places ar always free breakfast one morning sausage, eggs, pancake, assorted fruits, juices, milks, hot bev bagels, muffins, assorted pasteries, assorted cereals, breads, oatmeal, jams, jellies, butter, cream cheeese, and other items, another morning waffles you could also take like fruits or bagels we did to eat in the park  another thing I discovered D n R mobility scooter rental they deliver to hotel fully charge I have rented from other places including disney and DnR

Summary Heading: Great Location for the Convention Center and Disney
Summary: There are 3 kinds of Hyatt Place hotels. The old AmerSuite hotels that were converted, the newer buildings that were built about 6 years ago, and the brand new Hyatt Place built over the past year. Thins hotel is the newest generation and it is awesome! Nothing too fancy but super comfortable and functional. This Anaheim location is great for attending an event at the convention center visting Disneyland. Great staff, Great Breakfast, Great Stay....and a value to boot!

New hotel. we stayed here for a convention. It was easy to walk back and forth. The rooms were so spacious. We had two queen beds. The sitting area couch was more like a sectional than the typical sofa bed in hotels. This made the room very long and spacious. I would think it was perfect for a family.  Heard they had bunk beds in some rooms. Full breakfast. Gluten free bread available. Would stay here again. Valet parking 16$ extra.

I had a wonderful experience. I understand this hotel has been open about 6 months. So it is clean and beautiful.  The staff was very friendly, polite and accommodating. They welcome everyone that comes in. Check-in was easy enough and getting extra blankets/towels were timely. I loved that this was a smaller hotel and that catching the elevator didn't have me "waiting for the next one".   The room was clean and comfortable and had a small fridge (so we had groceries delivered). I found it to be roomy enough with two queen beds and an L shaped pull out couch.   The  breakfast had a large selection and was delicious. I walked less than 10 min to get to the convention center. Disney is a quick ARTS ride away.  I would suggest that the Hyatt Place have a shuttle to Disney and to

I was there a few weeks ago with my sister,  who is from the San Juan islands. The staff was super friendly and the room was unbeatable. We had breakfast, (which I will say was amazing for a continental breakfast) every morning before we went to Disneyland. We will for sure be back when we plan our trips to Disneyland in the future. Thanks so much!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel. We are pleased to hear that your stay was so wonderful. I will share with the team that you felt that they were fantastic in their friendly service. We do look forward to your next stay as you mentioned you will be coming back!

Summary Heading: Nice, new hotel near Convention Center and Disneyland
Summary: My husband and I stayed here 3 nights for a convention in Anaheim. The hotel was very close to the convention center and in a safe, convenient location. It is a new property and was very clean and contemporary. The free breakfast was a nice perk, and there was a good variety of food. There is also a Starbucks in the lobby. The rooms are comfortable and spacious. The price was very good as well!

Hotel is fairly new as you can see in the interior... New carpet ...furniture...awesome big double room with a small receiving area...free WiFi...free breakfast buffet and great customer service. What a great find... Its about less than a mile from the Disney resort... It is a little cheaper compared to the ones located across the resort...
Manager Response: Dear Tameia, We are so glad to hear that you felt our hotel to be Cream of the Crop!  I will share with the team your nice comments.  I m sure other travelers will appreciate your comments as well. My team and I look forward to your next stay with us.

Summary: Perfect business hotel within walking distance to all restaurants, convention centre, etc...  Bit pricey as I booked late for a trade show.  Close to Disney, Mighty Ducks hockey arena.  This is NOT the larger Hyatt in Anaheim, it is the 5 floor Hyatt PLACE.  Very clean and modern.

Summary Heading: A good hotel for the price with an excellent location near Disneyland
Summary: Fairly new hotel on the main boulevard just a few long blocks (not NYC blocks) from Disneyland. The wifi was free but the speed was less than one tenth of my AT&T phone so I didn't use it at all.  The breakfast (skillet) was included which seemed to be a great competitive advantage coupled with the wifi.  I used my own mobile phone for data and I could have purchased my own breakfast as well.  They do not have dedicated restaurant employees; their employees check people in, run the coffee bar and put out food, clean tables and replenish glasses and silverware as needed.  The problem is that most people with kids come down for breakfast at the same time so they can head over to Disney.  They run out of eggs, French toast, pancakes and sausage quickly and they are not replensihed
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments on our hotel. We have been working hard to make all our guests stay wonderful. Your comments help us to improve our hotel. We have increased our bandwidth for internet as we found that normally it is fine, but when there are so many guests online it was slowing down a bit so we doubled our bandwidth to be safe. Breakfast does get busy from 8am-9am as that is when most people decide to come down to breakfast. Best option is to come down early to get best seating and avoid the crowds. We hope that you will return and visit us soon. Thank you

Summary: What a wonderful vacation!  Excellent customer service, beautiful clean modern rooms!  Complimentary breakfast every morning before Disneyland was amazing!  The hotel staff always had a smile on their face and was very helpful. SONYA in housekeeping went above and beyond!!  She went out of her way to assist and make our stay extra special.  Thank you and this will be the only hotel we stay at when we visit Disneyland.

We are Hyatt club members and typically stay in Hietts when we travel. The Hyatt Place line is new to us. It is what you could expect from a lower level chain. The good part is that breakfast is included in the rate, which makes it very convenient before heading to Disneyland for the day. The food quality was just passable ‚Äì ‚Äìfine for our five-year-old but not much that pleased mom and dad. Low to no service ‚Äì ‚Äì for example if you wanted to order food it was available to pick up downstairs. The pool area was basically nonexistent. Right next to the parking lot‚Äì ‚Äì it is clear it was an afterthought. This is a shame since it can be quite warm in the summer in Southern California.  In fact, when we come to stay in the warmer months this will probably send us to the Hyatt Regency in

My family and I had to do a quick turnaround trip from AZ to CA to visit family members who recently had surgery.  I used my Hyatt free room rewards to try out the Anaheim Hyatt Resort Convention Center.  Upon arrival, I was greated with warmth and comfort from the staff.  The staff were very busy checking in people but did not lose their patience nor show they may have been overwhelmed.  I also asked if there was a possibility of a room upgrade and was so happy to find out there was.  We went from a 2 queen room to a family room which included a supersize king bed and bunkbeds for the kids.  They were in heaven because they all had their own bed, own tv and could close mom and dad out with a room divider.  That was great for mom and dad too.  The breakfast buffet was very good

Had such a great experience at the new Hyatt Place in Anaheim.  The hotel was lovely - very clear and very comfortable.  So close to everything.  Great bar area and even though we didn't get to take advantage of the pool, it looked beautiful.  Just perfect!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for such a nice review of our property. We are glad to hear that your stay was perfect! Hope to see you soon on your next stay with us!

Summary: We just spent the weekend at this newly opened property and loved it. We selected the Specialty King with Kid's bunk beds. Ideal for families! The kids had their own space; French doors separated the King bed sleeping room for us adults. 2 TV's avoided any arguments about the program selection. Friendly, knowledgeable staff upon check-in, and in the service area. Room service was great and fast; and their onsite bar was accommodating and open until midnight. Breakfast buffet is included in the rate and offered a huge variety of cold and hot choices. Modern feel and with all the amenities you need. Ideal location, 5 minutes from Disneyland.

The rooms are really impressive. Graveyard staff seem to be jack of all trades. William in particular, works front desk and cooks food for the 24 hour cafe. I have worked front office at a different resort for 3+ years and couldn't imagine having this extra duty. He had a great attitude and maybe excellent food. This guy deserves a raise. Keep up the good work William.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to write such a nice review and to give such Praise to William! I will share this with him . I am glad to hear that you understand and have worked in hotels to see the hard work our staff does to please our guests. Thank you again and we look forward to your next stay with us!

Summary: Alow me to preface this review by saying that for YEARS we have always stayed at the Sheration  Garden Grove in Club level and HAD loved it till we stayed here!  The moment we arrived we were surprised by how close the hotel was to Disney parking it was like maybe 2 minutes away. When we arrived we were impressed my the feel and decor plus the front desk person was phenomenal. Once we found our room again we were SURPRISED! Two queen sized beds,huge room, and a sofa sleeper. Plus we had a fridge!  The beds were comfy, the room was spotless, and breakfast was included at no cost! What a great value!  Going forward this Hyatt is our new hotel, even if I have Gold status at Starwood!

This is where we stay every time we are in the area.  It is a short drive to attractions and the rooms and large and comfortable.  I really enjoyed the breakfast and the staff was nice.  The WiFi connected right away although it was a slow.  No big deal, just not going to get a good Netflix connection, but worked well for everything else.

I used  a card in January to book a reservation for three rooms in February and was assured the card would not be charged until services had been rendered. However, the next day the card was charged. When I called the hotel to make a query they said they would credit my account as it was a mistake.  Instead of  crediting my account they charged my account AGAIN! Long story short, my account was CHARGED seven times and a total of over $3300 taken out of my account and after over 30 phone calls (that the manager would not return), a formal complaint filed on my behalf by my bank and 7 days of dealing with employees that could or would not do their job, the issue was finally resolved. When I contacted the main office of Hyatt they did not seem to care too much that this situation

This hotel with modernist architecture is a real jewel in the Hyatt chain.  My daughter, grandchildren and I stayed here during our recent trip to Anaheim and Disneyland.  The staff were friendly and efficient, and provided us with excellent service.  The rooms were spacious and comfortable. Our room had 2 queen beds and a sofabed that suited our needs perfectly. The room had all the amenities we needed.  The hotel is a short distance from the park, we took the bus that stopped just outside the hotel. The kids loved riding the bus and all the people we met were friendly and helpful.  The breakfast buffet was fantastic, the selection was varied and everything was fresh. It provided a great start to our days at Disneyland.  I highly recommend the Hyatt Place for families visiting

We booked on line for our family trip to Disneyland/California Adventure. My husband and I  traveled with our two sons age 16 and 20. We had a room with 2 queen beds and a cozy corner hide a bed.  Having the extra bed was great so our grown children didn't need to share a bed. The room was very clean and comfortable.  The housekeeping staff did a wonderful job cleaning our room each day. The breakfast that is included in the price was very good. Enjoyed a great selection every morning. The front desk staff was very helpful and checked us in early and on our last day, took our luggage to a storage room so we could enjoy our final day at the Disney Parks before leaving for our pm flight back home. Disneyland was a easy 15 minute walk with a 7 eleven, pharmacy,Subway and a pizza
Manager Response: Dear Stephan, Thank you  for your review of our hotel. We are pleased to hear that you would recommend our hotel and gave so much information for other travelers to use. We look forward to your next stay with us !

Summary: very modern hotel with very large rooms. Breakfast included which was good but finished at 9am a bit early when you're on holiday and got very busy, at times it was difficult to find a seat! Pool set in the car park so not great but there if you want. Easy walk to Disney & restaurants. Would recommend
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel. We have extended our breakfast hours to accommodate the people resting in a bit after a long day at Disney. So thank you for your opinion as we do look at ways to improve our services! We hope to have you return to our hotel in the future since you had such a great stay.

Summary: Decided to stay in the OC area for this visit to SoCal since we had a bunch of things planned in the area (Supercross, Ducks game, etc)  And I have to say I was glad with the choice!  The hotel is new, clean.  Rooms are big and well designed.  Staff was courteous and helpful.  The complimentary breakfast was way better then I expected.  Only negative I would say is that it was sometimes kinda noisy with lots of kids running around, but kinda expected that with being so close to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel. We are glad that you enjoyed your stay with us! Looks like you attended several events in the area. Did you get a chance to go to Disneyland? Hope you enjoyed supercross as I attended and it was great! Its nice to share with others that there is so much to do other than just Disneyland within a few miles of our hotel. We look forward to your next stay with us! Maybe ill see you at the Ducks game or Supercross next year.

Summary Heading: Great hotel!  Very pleasant and comfortable!
Summary: Spent a very lovely weekend at this newer Hyatt Place and had a very nice time!  The rooms were very nice and spacious 2 queen bed specialty room, with sofa bed.  It was very comfortable, with large tables, sofa, mini-fridge and great queen-size beds.  Breakfast at the Kitchen Skillet was complimentary, had a nice selection, with a dining area was spacious and comfortable.  The location was close to Disneyland and the ART shuttle was relatively easy to use.  The employee staff was very friendly and accommodating.  Highly recommend!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review of our hotel. We are happy to hear that your stay was so satisfying that you recommended us to others. We look forward to you staying with us again in the future.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel to attend the ASHP Annual Meeting at the Convention Center.  This hotel, which is fairly new is quite convenient for meetings at Anaheim or for going to Disneyland, for it is close to everything.  There are plenty of restaurants and other businesses, close by and transportation is easy. Their rooms are nice and spacious, and their complimentary breakfast, quite complete. Service staff is well trained and courteous, and their lobby set up is adequate.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to post your review. We appreciate your comments and I am sure other guests will use your comments to assist them with their decision. we hope to see you next year at the convention. Thank you.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel Near Disney and Convention Center
Summary: The Hyatt is a decent hotel.  It is in an area where there are literally hotels on every corner.   There are 8 or 10 hotels within a block walk.    So the competition is high.  The Hyatt is a nice hotel.  It is clean and comfortable, and the staff is very helpful and professional.   The rooms are spacious.  They have a safe in the room.  On some rooms have a fridge, so be sure to ask if you require one.  The beds are fluffy and comfortable, with nice pillows.  The bathrooms are somewhat modern.  I have stayed in many hotels in this area, and this one is a good one.   There is plenty to do and eat right near the hotel.  The walk to the convention center is about 20 minutes.  It is about a mile.  Maybe a little less than that.
Manager Response: Thank you for posting your review of our hotel. We are glad that you enjoyed your stay with us. We do have refrigerators in all of our rooms so no need to ask for one. We look forward to yur next stay with us.

Summary: On a business trip to LA, our host chose this hotel for us.  It turned out that it was a very good choice. I can easily rate it best of the three hotels we used during our business trip to the USA.   Wide rooms, comfy sofas, large tables for work, Wifi and everything.  I miss that Bathtubs that you always find in Japanese Hotels, but no other American hotel had bathtubs, so I think it is just the norm.   As the title shows, I highly recommend this hotel due to the loveliness of its staff.  At the registration, the ladies were helpful and patiently accommodated for our requirements (company name and mail and what have you). One of the ladies also noticed that I was wearing a Mikey Mouse necktie; a very lovely touch...  At check in, the rooms were not ready yet, so we let the
Manager Response: Thank you for appreciating our staff as they work so hard to please our guests. I will share this with them as they love to hear that our guests enjoyed there stay . We look forward to your return in the future.

Summary Heading: One of the best hotel experiences I have ever had.
Summary: I can't say enough about what a nice place this was to stay. Room was spacious, had everything I could ask for, including a view of the Disneyland fireworks. Very comfortable beds. Plenty of electrical outlets (for a change). Breakfast was excellent, although the coffee was so strong I actually had to water it down.  Staff was young, very accommodating, well-informed, and eager to please. I know that the hotel and everyone working there are new, but I hope they don't lose their wonderful attitude!  Didn't use the wi-fi, since the room had an Ethernet internet connection, which was fast and reliable. Pool and jacuzzi are well-located just a few steps from a door, so you don't freeze getting out at night. I have stayed at a dozen different hotels when I have been in Anaheim for
Manager Response: Dear Georgie, Thank you for your review of our hotel. We are pleased to hear that you really enjoyed your stay with us and will return in the future. Our staff has been working hard, and I am glad to hear that you appreciate them. We hope to see you soon on your next visit with us!

Summary: I've tried rewording this review a few times, so that it doesn't come across as scathing. All told, this isn't a BAD hotel. It is new with sleek decor, and only about a mile (walking distance if you don't have kids) to the parks. It also has a really really nice workout room with multiple treadmills and other machines that have TVs :)  However, despite being a new hotel, the walls are cheap and paper-thin. And I know that this is Disney and a family destination. There are going to be kids and lots of them. And I know those kids are going to be wound up from all the excitement. I don't blame the kids for being.. kids, but we really couldn't sleep because of the noise and it was after 10pm so called in a noise complaint for the room next to ours. The staff did absolutely nothing.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to write your review and to word it as you said to not make it sound that bad. I apologize for the noise as it is a hotel close to Disneyland and the kids do get excited. I will look into the issue with the staff not responding to your issue as that is important that they take action to calm down noise issues. We have been working on breakfast service as you had mentioned and have improved on efficiency. So thank you for your opinions and comments. We do hope you give us another try in the future!

Summary: My recent stay at the Hyatt Place Anaheim contained many pleasant surprises. First of all, the facility is nearly brand new and attractively decorated. Secondly, the staff was personable, competent and always helpful - top notch! Thirdly, the place is incredibly convenient with close proximity to the Convention Center and Disneyland. The inclusive breakfast buffet offered a good selection of well prepared tasty items, and the all-day free coffee was truly appreciated. Comfortable beds and quiet rooms. Overall, a great stay!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to give us your review of our property. We are so pleased to hear that your stay was great and that you are recommending our hotel to other travelers. We look forward to  your next stay with us!

Summary: We stayed at this hotel Dec 30- Jan 7th with our 2 kids aged 9 and 6.  It's a newer hotel with limited amenities.  The rooms were nice and clean, we got the ones with the bunk beds which the kids loved.  Walls were a bit thin but I didn't mind too much as we aren't light sleepers.  Some pros were the free daily hot breakfast (sausages, eggs, pancakes, cereal, bagels, fruits,etc), and free wifi.  The breakfast area tends to get crowded sometimes and it's hard to find a table to sit and eat at, however you are allowed to take food to your room.  We stayed at the Hyatt Place in Waikiki and same thing but in each room, they provide you with a tray so it's easier to bring the food to your room.  It would've been nice if this one had that too.  Wifi worked for us but It would
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to post your review of our hotel. My staff and I are happy that you liked our hotel, but as you said it is not a full service hotel. We do have the 24/7 food service, but not room service like a full service hotel. For some people that do not need all the items of a full service hotel this works for them. Thank you for your review.

Summary Heading: New, great value, still a Hyatt
Summary: We usually stay at the Hyatt Regency or Disney's Grand Californian, but thought we would try the Hyatt Place since it still is a Hyatt and it was new.  Our room cost for a Saturday was less than half the cost of the Grand Californian and probably larger in size.  The large sitting area with desk was quite nice and 2 separate closets was a surprise.  We were close enough to walk to the park.  The free breakfast was very good.  Will definitely stay here again the next time we are visiting Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for your nice review of our hotel. Sounds like you are a regular to Disney and now a regular at our hotel! We look forward to your return!!

Summary Heading: Great stay for our theme park adventures
Summary: We were one of the first people to stay here back in October and it was everything I expected and more. I loved the 'newest' of everything - so clean and shiny. Of course there were some issues with only being open such a short time  - we had booked a bunk bed room and the bunks hadn't arrived yet - but management quickly offered us two adjoining rooms which gave us so much extra space. The pool was clean and refreshing after the long days at Disney. The free buffet was very convenient and the quality of food was good. I felt we received great value for money and after all we weren't there to spend our time in the hotel - it was all about Disney, Universal, Knotts and Magic mountain!!!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for you review of our hotel. My staff and I are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We hope that you will come back an join us again when you come to California!

Summary: As other reviewers have stated, this hotel is shiny and brand new.  The underground parking garage is nice (at $14 a night plus tax it better be) and we were really impressed by the look of it all.  Our 2 night stay with our 5-year old daughter coincided with my wife running the Disney races and a ton of activity.  The way it was all described, our cozy corner room with a King bed for us and a pull out couch for the kid and lots of space made it all sound perfect.  Well it wasn't: We got to our first assigned room to discover a handicapped shower, no tub.  I called down and said, we are with a kid, who is going to need baths after full days at Disney parks.  He said he would call me back and let me know.  We waited, no call.  I headed down to the desk and was told sorry, they
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our Hotel. We appreciate you taking time to detail out your stay with us and see where improvement is required. We have already taken steps as to the internet issue. As to the bathtubs, it is unfortunate that you did not get one in the first place. I certainly apologize for the lack of customer service as that is not acceptable to us. I certainly hope you give us another try in the future to have a great experience at the hotel as many guest have had a great time at the hotel. Thank you.

Summary Heading: Nice, new, close to Disney and Convention Center
Summary: This is a new hotel on the Harbor Blvd. "hotel strip".  Easy walking distance to both the Convention Center and Disney.  There was a mix of families and business people.  The hotel is new in 2014 so very modern.  As you would expect from a Hyatt, very nicely appointed and comfortable....all rooms are small suites.  The service here was excellent.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating.  The free breakfast buffet was a cut above most of the free breakfast buffets, with eggs, sausages, pancakes or French toast, fruit....very nicely done.  I definitely plan to return to this property and would highly recommend it to anyone wanting to stay in the Disney area for a family vacation, or those attending an event at the Anaheim Convention Center.
Manager Response: Dear Tim, We are so happy to hear that your stay with us was to your satisfaction. We appreciate your comments of how the rooms and service meet your standards. We also look forward to your return as you had mentioned that in your comments. Thank you again!

Summary: This is what you need to know about this hotel:  1. This hotel is newly built and just opened in Oct 2014. -- Therefore: new fixtures, beds, linens, and towels = highest 3 to 3 1/2 star quality available now in area. 2. Free breakfast is actually edible and good with a wide variety of choices. 3. Staff are very nice. 4. Wi-fi in room can be slow / low signal. 5. One of the best quality for the most affordable price to stay with 4 or more kids. 6. You can purchase ART (Anaheim Resort Transit - the bus) tickets at the hotel for transport to Disneyland. 7. You can pick up the ART in front of the hotel next door OR across the street.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your wonderful review of our hotel. It is good to hear that your stay with us was great. Your tips for other travelers was also appreciated. We hope that we will see you in the near future.

Summary Heading: Very Good - New, Clean, Functional & Well Located
Summary: We stayed here in early December 14 and really enjoyed it. Obviously it is new as has been stated before and this as you would expect mean it is modern and clean which it is. Something that hasn't been mentioned much though is that the rooms are of a very good size which is great when travelling with a family or as we were considerable luggage. The room layout is also very functional. We stayed here 4 nights and would recommend to anyone who is looking at a multi night stay in the Disneyland region. It is an easy & flat 10 minute walk to the main gate and in the general area (within 5 mins in any direction) there are several dining choices from fast food to upper end. The breakfast in the hotel is basic but adequate and included. It has a comfortable bar that you can have a
Manager Response: Thank you for your nice review of our hotel. Its good to hear that your stay was wonderful and that you had some great suggestions for other travelers. We hope that you will be visiting us again in the future. I know it must be a long way from Australia!

Summary Heading: Good hotel close to Disney Parks
Summary: We spent New years eve at this hotel, and it was clean and well kept although very much a family hotel and had more of the high tech look. The rooms were fair sized with a king size bed and a sectional sofa that pulled out into a queen size bed. Breakfast was complimentary and as a family hotel it was difficult to get a table, but the turn over was quick. It was more than a mere continental breakfast with eggs, toast etc. and made the rooms a very good value. The only down side was the walls were paper thin and one could hear the TV in other rooms, and with children playing in the hall ways it could get a little loud. It was fair value for the rooms.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel. My team and I are glad to hear that your stay was to your satisfaction. We are working on some signage that we hope guests will try to keep the noise levels down. I know the kids often get excited when they are going to Disneyland, or staying in a hotel. We look forward to your next stay with us.

Summary: Great place...loved the HOT FULL breakfast! Very nice & comfortable for just a little more that the motels in the area...WORTH THE FEW DOLLARS MORE! Hotel seems to be NEW or recently remodeled. WILL DEFINITELY BE BACK!
Manager Response: Dear Dawn, Thank you for taking time to write such a nice review of our hotel. We are glad to hear that your stay was great, and that you will return to stay with us again in the future. We look forward to your next visit with us.

Summary: BUMMER.  Really wanted to enjoy this stay since I hadn't been to Disney in 14 years.  We were put in room 337 - if you get this - MOVE ROOMS.  It was directly outside the elevator which was incredibly loud - especially if you're trying to get sleep before disneyland.    Outside the window - as in, connected to the window, was a flood light that made it impossible to sleep.  The room was soooooo bright - no exaggeration.  We were tucked into bed - and after trying to sleep called down to the front to request the light be shut off.  They couldn't shut off the light off, but offered to switch us rooms - which was nice, however we had already used the towels, had our stuff out, and were in bed.  I guess since it was late, they weren't willing to shut off the light, and we weren't
Manager Response: I am so sorry to hear that your stay was not to your satisfaction. The lights have been adjusted as we do not want our guests to be unhappy and not able to sleep. We hope that you will give us another try in the future as you seemed to enjoy the Food and Beverage service from our hotel and the light shinning into your room was the big issue and has been addressed. Thank you for taking time to write your review and once again our sincere apology for the lights.

Summary: Clean hotel as its new. Breakfast was all right the first 2 days- but after day 3 I couldn't eat the same thing again- breads, eggs, sausage, yogurt and pancake/french toast (the last thing was the only thing that changed from day to day).  No hot chocolate, only teas, coffee and milk.  Housekeeping was always late and although they did a good job with the sheets and bathroom, never removed or cleaned used glasses in the room.  The ART shuttle right outside the hotel, was not every 20 minutes. I addition as its on this side of the road, you have to ride about 20-25 minutes before it finishes stopping at other hotels before it gets to the park. You can walk it, but given that you already have so much walking to do in the park, this is a walk you may want to avoid.  The front desk
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel. Hyatt is looking at more breakfast options as we would like to have some more variety as we do change some items everyday. We await their new menus hopefully soon. Thank you for your comments as we appreciate your feedback as to what we can improve on.

Summary: I found the newest hotel in the Anaheim Resort Area to have the type of luxury living I was expecting to find.  My room was clean and modern.  When I checked in the staff met me with a warm holiday greeting.  The lobby was busy with holiday travelers and everyone seemed to be just as happy as myself to be in the most modern resort hotel in Anaheim.  Thank you to all the staff for making my stay so wonderful during the holidays.   I cant wait to come back to enjoy the poolside cafe.  You are all terrific.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to write such nice comments about our hotel and staff. We hope to see you soon on your next visit with us.

Summary: Needs improvement:  1. Readiness of room. Check in is at 3pm. Got into room close to 5pm. We stayed the day after christmas maybe had to do with that?) 2. Cleanliness of the public bathrooms on the lobby floor. Never seemed to be toilet paper. One morning one stall had feces all over toliet and surrounding area. 3. Front desk staff friendliness was a hit or miss. Some were very nice and accommodating others where were kind of rude and just didn't care. 4. Beds where not all that soft and the bedding was merely white sheets and pillows and a paper thin crochet blanket. Does not measure up the the soft beds and fluffy rich feathered bedding used in the Hyatt Regency rooms. 5. No microwave in the room and wifi was really spotty didn't always connect and made you keep doing the user
Manager Response: Dear Lisa, Thank you for writing about your stay with us. It was quite detailed and I appreciate that you took the time write both the positives and negatives. We strive to always make our guests happy. We are not the Regency, as you mentioned. However our guests still need great customer service and the amenities that we have to offer , although not to the Regency level. So as you said, it is a great hotel, but not the Regency. Thank you for your comments.

Summary: Great experience at hyatt place, very comfortable stay, the rooms are very nice and spacious, modern baths, its a new hotel so every thing clean, freash and new, the staff were so nice, we arrived early and we requested an early check in and we got it, very good breakfast buffet in the morning that comes with the room rates, we enjoyed our stay and i will come back.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking your time to write a review of our hotel. Happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We are glad to hear that you will be returning and we look forward to your next visit with us.

Summary: Overall, this was a good hotel with all the essentials. The room was very spacious and clean and the free wifi and free breakfast were nice to have. Unfortunately, the walls are quite thin so I could hear the neighbors all through the night and anyone walking on the floor above.  Tip: Going to Disneyland? Walk over to the Toy Story parking lot 1 block away) and take the shuttle over to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Erica, Thank you for taking time to post your review of our hotel. It seems that your hotel stay was good except for the noise of your neighbors. We try to let guests know that to respect other guests by keeping the noise level down. I know with kids that is sometimes difficult as they are excited to go to Disneyland. Thank you for also sharing the little tips of going to Disneyland for others to read. We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary Heading: Best Vacation here ever!!! Highly recommended
Summary: We stayed here for two days in mid December 2014 with the sole intention of going to Disneyland and it did not disappoint!  The rooms are exactly like the photos - spacious and comfortable. Housekeeping and all staff in general were so friendly and nice. Clean comfortable rooms and about a 20min walk from Disneyland.   And the breakfast buffet was just delightful! Eggs, sausages, cereals and fresh fruit - all regularly topped up and staff were great at clearing away plates and utensils.  Best Vacation here ever!!! Highly recommended if you want somewhere clean, comfortable and friendly for your stay whilst visiting Disneyland.
