Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to write your review of our hotel. Our team is glad to hear that your stay was the best ever!!  Wow that says it all. I will share this with the staff as they work hard to make every guest stay a great experience. Thank you for your input so that other travelers can make their decisions based on your wonderful stay. Thank you and we look forward in your next visit with us!!

Summary: The hyatt place was a great hotel.  The desk staff were great getting our room ready with our early arrival.  The room was modern and simply done.  The sitting area in the room offered a nice place to relax.  An armoire and closet offered plenty of storage.  The breakfast offered was nice and complete, but I would have preferred more fruit options than cantaloupe and melon, but maybe this was related to December travel.  The coffee offered was Seattle's best and was very very hot; complete with Mugs or to go cups.  The front staff offered bar services in the evening at a reasonable price compared to nearby restaurants or hotel bars.   I would visit this hotel again with no hesitations.  It's about a 10-15 min walk to the Disney gate.

This is an excellent hotel for families going to Disneyland. There is a shuttle ($5/day I believe), but if you book through AAA you can get free parking included with your ticket price and just drive to the park instead. There is a Starbucks in the lobby of the hotel which was great for our Disney mornings. They also have rooms with king beds and a separating wall with a door so your toddler or baby can sleep in a pack-n-play in the "living room" area. It's almost like they have their own room. We always need these types of rooms when traveling as a family.

Summary Heading: Nice room, parking disaster, disinterested manager
Summary: We stayed with Hyatt Place from 10/23-26 while visiting Disneyland.  We are annual pass holders and visit about 4-6 times per year.  Check-in was smooth and our room was fresh and clean.  It felt like there was a lot of storage space, making it easy to have everything put out of the way before housekeeping visited.  Parking went ok the first two nights we were there, but on Saturday 10/25, there were no spaces available when I returned to the underground garage at about 11:30 pm.  I drove around the parking lot, through the adjacent hotels, and finally parked in the check-in driveway to get instructions at the front desk.  At that time, there were several other people waiting for parking as well.  The clerk suggested I park at an adjacent hotel, but I told her I'd been all the
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I am sorry to hear that your stay with us was not to your satisfaction due to the lack of parking. You also mentioned that the manager did not come out to speak with you. I certainly apologize as that is something that should not have happened. I will discuss this with my management team as they should have come out to talk to you. Normally we have plenty of parking spaces, however it sounds like the night you mentioned there were many more cars than available spots. I appreciate your comments as we look at options to avoid this type of situation in the future. Hopefully you will come back and try us again in the future as we improve our hotel.

Summary: My 3 friends and I stayed here the night before a fun filled day at Disneyland. We checked in around 8pm and took a cab to downtown Disney for dinner, very easy! the room was spacious and very clean. the beds were comfortable and we all slept great. We had the hotel breakfast the next morning, excellent for it being complimentary! would highly recommend this hotel!

We have stayed at Hyatt Place in other areas and this location is the nicest we have been to.  To be honest we normally stay down the road at the Hyatt Regency but I won a free night from Hyatt Place on a Twitter contest so we stayed here our last night.  Hotel is new and very clean.  We like the room design and it is very functional.  We only had a small problem with the room not being feather free.  This was on our Hyatt profile but the room was set up with feather bedding and feather pillows.  A quick call to the front desk and they sent someone up right away to change out the bedding!  One thing to note is that if you are traveling with kids this room does not have a bathtub.  They have a very nice shower.   Breakfast was good.  Especially for a breakfast that is included in

Very nice place to stay, i would recommend it and probably stay there again. there were a few minor hiccups because the place is still pretty much brand new, but they were able to fix them very quickly and we didn't have any problem whatsoever. One thing the management might want to look at, there was a very thin, younger woman who looked like she was in charge during the mornings and she zero people skills whatsoever. We came in for breakfast a few minutes before it was supposed to be put away and you could tell she was super pissed that we showed up. She threw down her cleaning stuff and stormed out of the breakfast area. that's why i didn't give it an excellent rating.

We recently spent 4 nights at the Hyatt Place.  As others have said, this hotel has only recently been opened and everything is new and looks really good.  I think a couple of things have been sorted out after receiving bad reviews (no problems now with loud music near the elevators or hard water marks on the glassware).  Although our room was on the main road, I didn't find it very noisy at night. At the moment construction is going on across the street and this may cause some noise in the daytime.  We did have an issue with the "incidentals" fee of $50 a day (x 2 rooms) which was put on our debit card when we checked in.  This tied up $400 when our finances were getting a bit tight at the end of our vacation.  After quite a hassle (including calls to the bank in Australia) it
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to write your review of our hotel. It sounds like you enjoyed your stay, but was unaware of hotel credit  authorizations and the use of debit cards. As ;you said it is only a authorization, however when using a debit card it does place a hold on funds. I tell our guests that a credit card will do the same thing, but its only a hold on credit, and most Credit cards may have higher limit on funds than a debit card. On the second item, yes there is taxes here in the USA and California. So the price of the room and or purchases many time has taxes on top of the price. Glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay other than the tax and credit authorization. Hope you will come visit us again in the future.

Summary: Love the Hyatt Place Anaheim!  Nice, clean and new hotel. Rooms smelled fresh (big deal for me!) and were comfortable and roomy. A/C was quiet and we all slept very well! About a 1 mi. walk to front gate of Disneyland.  Staff was very friendly and accommodating. There were always at least 2 staff at front desk.   Complimentary breakfast was as advertised and always stocked and very clean. Never had a problem finding seating, but we were there during Disneyland's off-peak time. Most early morning diners were convention people.    One drawback, wifi was spotty in the rooms. Tablets wouldn't connect and if they did, it would disconnect soon thereafter. After inquiring with front desk, we were told that there are "wifi issues", but that the wifi "works perfectly in the lobby".

This is a great place to stay if you are looking for convenience, a bargain family stay and not a fancy hotel.  - Free parking in a covered garage with spacious parking spaces. - Breakfast buffet is included with many choices to please everyone (toast, muffins, bagels, scrambled eggs, sausages, waffles, pancakes, fresh fruit, yogurt, oatmeal (little runny), coffee, fruit juice, milk). - Free wifi but the signal is fairly weak.   - Within walking distance to Disneyland... Literally 3 blocks or so. - Rooms are spacious and have new furniture.  Other reviews mention that this is a new hotel, but this looks more like a refurbished hotel.  This is a great bargain for a quick family vacation!  But don't expect posh.... That it is not....  Enjoy!

Summary Heading: Great, new, and affordable for a family trip
Summary: I found the price to be affordable for a three bed room in a newer hotel. Stayed here with 6 people total for 4 nights. Free tasty breakfast, clean new rooms, and ability to have 3 beds in a room. It worked out great for a family vacation at Disneyland. It was a great price, it's obviously a more affordable version of the Hyatt, certainly doesn't compare to the Regency, but if you need no fuss and you're going to be at Disneyland the whole time (not hanging out at the hotel), this is a great option.  It was also great having a TV that just worked. New nice TV, with DirectTV and basic channels, no crappy hotel channel. There are no movies on demand though, but no matter. I wasn't there to watch TV.

This is a brand new property which is nicely decorated. Very slim amenities and it just wasn't for us. Offensively expensive "self parking" fee with slow elevators. Painful. My kids wouldn't eat the free breakfast so we ended up buying breakfast onsite at Disney. If you are looking for modern accomodations with affordable prices but don't mind not having certain amenities then you will be fine. We are hyatt platinum members and we would not stay at this property again. Would like to note that the staff was extremely friendly with the exception of the housekeeping. They refused to take our dirty drinking glasses! Haha, finally found someone who would take them but who uses the same glasses over and over again during a week stay? Just strange.

The staff here treats you like family! Im looking forward to our return since we are now pass holders to Disneyland! We also love the contnetal breakfast its not your plain old breakfast! The rooms are very clean! The staff even moved our room so that we could be connected to my sisters room. Big plus in my familys eyes!!!!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review of our hotel. My staff and I are pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us. We are glad to have accommodated your needs and look forward in your return visit with us in the future.

Summary: Our family of four stayed here for four nights in a Family room/suite with dividing doors to separate the two rooms. The suite is very spacious, new and clean. Loved that there was a big couch and also desk. Kids loved the bunk beds of course. Lots of storage in the room. Free wifi is always a bonus. The kids room only had blinds that we needed to push things up against so they'd keep closed and the carpark lights wouldn't shine through. The airconditioner was quite noisy in the kids room but they were so wiped they were unaffected and we shut the connecting doors so it then wasn't a problem for us.   Free breakfast - who can say no. The staff in the dining/breakfast room were so friendly. There were times it became a bit crowded with no tables in sight for some families and

I recently stayed here with a friend to go to Disneyland.  He is an employee of Hyatt and we usually stay at the Regency, but since this one is closer to the park we decided to try it out.  Well, let's say the proximity of this hotel to the park is DEFINITELY not worth it. We ONLY chose this hotel for the free breakfast and the location. That was a problem because there was NO breakfast... literally.  It ended at 9AM and we went down at 8:15. No bread, no eggs, no yogurt, no fruit, no coffee, no bacon. ALL that was out was oatmeal and cereal. Is this property not aware of it's location? How can you either A. run out of food without restocking or B. not have enough employees to take care of breakfast when you have children and families coming to eat before going to Disneyland?
Manager Response: Dear Brianna,  Sorry to hear that your stay was not to your satisfaction. I am surprised that you had mentioned that we ran out of food. We have not experienced any food outage at all, however there are times as with any self service buffet that items are replaced as they are consumed. It is replenished usually within a minute or two at the most . Breakfast does get busy at times just like any restaurant and as a hotel we strive to make sure that we replenish the food for our guests. I understand that you also felt that our staff was rude and did not attend to your needs as they should have. Our management team has taken steps towards this issue as we cannot have any of our staff be less than friendly and attentive. It seems that you happen to have several issues during your stay with us. I appreciate you bring them to our attention and we will address those issues as they are important to us. Thank you for taking your time to give us your thoughts.

Summary Heading: New hotel that needs some improvement
Summary: We stayed here earlier this month for a week. Upon check-in,  Cynthia at the reception noticed I was having a cold. She offered me DayQuill & Nyquill pills. That was a nice touch. The room was of decent size. And as mentioned by many, there were a lot of TV channels to choose from. My only miffs were the complimentary breakfast and wifi. It was not told to us that the serving ends at 9am sharp. Most of the hotels we go to usually serve breakfast till 10 am. So when we strolled in at 8.50am the next day, we were informed (harshly) that they were already clearing up. So we hurriedly put whatever that's left in the trays and fed the kids. The following day, we came in earlier and the place was full. There was no one to control the crowd or to usher the guests. We ended up sharing a
Manager Response: Thank you fro your review of our hotel. We appreciate your comments regarding our breakfast and the hot water issue. We obviously did not plan the hot water outage, but glad that you were understanding of the situation. Breakfast is a concern as my staff should not be harsh as to advising you of the times of the operation. I certainly apologize for my staff. It seems that most guests try to all come to eat breakfast at 8am to 9 am which creates a rush of last minute diners. However we are looking at ways to hopefully assist in that area. Placing a wait list would help, but I think guests would still be unhappy as they are in a rush to go to Disneyland, or proceed with their day. However your suggestion is one we take as an option. Thank you for your comments. Glad to hear you got to see the fireworks from your room! We look forward in your next visit with us.

Summary: we really enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Place.   The staff was very friendly and gave great service.  Also the rooms are nice and the hotel is only 2 months old.  Breakfast had a great selection with good coffee.   It is about a 15 min walk to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Nice new hotel....but parking can be a bit  of a pain.
Summary: This is a nice new hotel located right next to the Convention Center and the Toy Story parking lot.  The rooms were  a nice size (we got two queen with a big corner pull out couch) and in perfect condition as the hotel was just completed.  Given a choice.....I would certainly opt for the Hyatt regency just down harbor.....but this was a great experience for the price.  My only knocks on the hotel would be the parking (the key cards are a pain and traffic backs up in the AM and out to Harbor) and the "free" breakfast.  The breakfast isn't great....but there are lots of options and it is free...so how can you complain too much.  I'm sure we will be back in the future if the Hyatt Regency is more than $25 additional .
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel. We appreciate your comments as we take our guests comments seriously. We have taken steps to avoid the confusion or slow process of parking exit. We appreciate that you will be coming back to visit us again. Parking will be improved.
